It helps put into words why time outs or having privileges taken away is necessary. Since its the book saying it and not me, my daughter takes it in better.This should not be your one abd only book on good behavior. There are some great ones from Julia cook which show more positive ways for kids to handle situations and use self control.

I bought the board book version thru the Kindle app and while that version was good, this version was better for my daughter as it teaches more empathy than the other. Explains pets have feelings and can get hurt if you are not gentle.I definitely think a 2.5-3 year old can understand this book. The text is short so it's not too long for a toddler to sit through.This has really helped my daughter who was having trouble understanding that let's have feelings, and that what she thinks is normal playing is teasing. It has also helped her remember to ask pet owners before trying to run up and hug little dogs.
Cheaply made and was cracked upon arrival.

I love this paint!!!! I needed to paint some shoes for a costume and I did not expect the paint to go on so well or so smoothly! No streaks, no cracks, very fast drying. To cover black I needed 2 coats and that was it. Dried a perfect matte gray. The shoes look like they were gray to begin with, not painted!! I also used this to cover craft foam and it looks perfect!! I needed a couple more coats to cover the black on the foam but it still looks so good!I didn't use a sealant of any kind abd the paint still looks great. No cracks or flaking off.I am definitely buying this brand again the next time I need paint!!

Sizing runs a touch small but not too badly. I would use juniors sizing rather than women's when trying to choose your size.Not a regular cotton tee, this is some kind of other blend which isn't as soft but still works.Not fitted so it doesn't really show your figure but the looseness is comfy.

I received the wrong size in the mail, but I'm glad because the sizing for this garment is way off. I needed this for a costume I'm making, and I ordered a medium thinking it might be too big but if so I could alter it. I received an extra large and it fits like a size small! There is not a sizing chart so I had no idea.Be careful because you might receive the wrong size!Shipping was very slow but arrived packaged well.

These are PERFECT for a Sandy or gravely playground or the beach! Lightweight fabric keeps the sun off little legs but isn't too thick to get the kiddos all sweaty.Easy to pull up and down for potty trainers, elastic waist is comfy for little wiggleworms.Sizing runs small so I suggest chosing the next size up. My daughter normally wears a 4t, the 5th fits her perfectly and the 6t fits a little loosely but still is wearable.

Such a sweet book about a little girl and her imaginary friend. Soothing and poetic text is perfect for settling down at naptime or bedtime. Illustrations are very whimsical and inspiring for young minds.My 3 year old really enjoyed this book. She has a lot of stuffed animals sge likes to pretend are her real friends or babies or siblings so this was fun for her. Very highly recommended!!

This really works! I left it in for 2 hours and it took almost all the brassy tones out of my bleached hair. I followed up with tigi dumb blonde violet shampoo and clairol shimmer lights purple conditioner and that got all the remaining brassiness. My hair looks great now!I needed 2 bottles for my thick shoulder length hair. I suggest getting 1 more bottle than you think you will need and then if you don't use it you have some for next time.

This is a lifesaver!  And boy does it work!  This comes with a battery for each of the four keyfinder attachments plus one for the transmitter button.You can put this on up to four different sets of keys, or other things you are prone to losing, and this emits a loud beeping sound when you press the button on the transmitter, alerting you to the lost item.  The transmitter has four different color-coded buttons, one for each of the four attachments, so you can select which set of keys you are hunting for.I tested this at a distance from the transmitter and it carries the signal up to at least twenty feet.  So if your keys are lost anywhere in the house you can simply walk from room to room pressing the proper button on the transmitter until you hear the beeping on the keychain.I'm putting the other beepers on a spare pair of reading glasses, on a second set of keys, and attaching the fourth with a rubber band to the remote.  Now if only I can find a way not to lose the transmitter I will be all set.  Love this and it works perfectly.This is one of my rare ten star products.*This was provided to me free in exchange for an unbiased review.

This is a totally refreshing naturally sweetened ginger ale.  I love ginger ale whenever I need a mixer or have an upset stomach. This contains real ginger, which is great for upset stomachs.  I usually drink Canada Dry Ginger Ale and still prefer the taste of that since it's perfection but this is good too.  It's slightly too sweet for my taste however.  As far as being sweetened with a healthier alternative to sugar, I'm no longer sure that is valid.  There are too many unknowns now about how these alternatives to sugar are actually utilized by the body.

I've been looking for a shredder that was a cross cut shredder which was as compact as possible.  This one is amazingly small but does a fantastic job.  Best of all it is fast and quiet.  I just feed in my papers and they are neatly shredded into small pieces that would be almost impossible for any identity thief to put together.  I also love that this is lightweight.This has everything going for it that I had hoped to find.  There are no negatives I can say about this.  It is small, quiet, does a fast job and can be put out of site easily when not in use.I also want to say a word about this brand, Ivation.  I've been delighted to be sent some samples of products that this company makes and it has become my favorite brand of household high tech equipment, such as ice machines.  This is no Chinese junk.  On the contrary, everything this company makes is extremely high quality, dependable, works perfectly and is made to last.  Ivation has set itself apart from the masses of products by making the best products on the market today, and I've seen enough as a reviewer for years to know.*Sample sent for review which in no way influenced my opinion.

.While small, lightweight, and portable, this really is a fantastic little ice making machine.  It is small enough to leave out on my kitchen counter without taking up a lot of space and even looks cute.  I love the little window so I can watch the ice cubes being made.There are many things to love about this machine but my favorite is the way you can choose 3 sizes of ice cubes.  I love the small size best and can fit lots of them into a glass.  I can make a whole bucket of ice in about one hour, or up to  26.5 pounds in 24 hours.This has alerts for when the icemaker is on standby, and when it is finished making ice, as well as when there is not enough water in the bucket to make ice.  And you can set this to turn on automatically.  When it is finished it turns itself off.  This only stores up to 2.5 pounds of ice so you can take out the ice and put it in plastic bags for storage in your freezer and always have enough ice when guests arrive.If the ice is not removed before it melts in the icemaker the water is simply stored in the bucket for the next ice making session.  There are four LED buttons for on, off, and to set the timer for automatic ice making.Since I live in Florida we seem like we always need more ice for our drinks.  Now we won't run out again and won't be running to the store for bags of ice.  This is super convenient.*Received a free sample for a review

Super soft washcloths are beautifully packaged in a way that says they are all natural and organic.  I received these at no cost to write a review on.I have not tried any fabrics made out of 100% bamboo before and was amazed to find that these are even softer than all cotton cloth.  They have a smooth velvety texture that must be felt to be appreciated.  They won't do any exfoliation and do seem a bit delicate.  These would be perfect for a child or baby's soft delicate skin.  These also are great as facial cloths due to the smooth soft texture.  I love to use these to remove my makeup as they are so gentle and are great for my rosacea prone skin.I have not used washcloths at all previously since they always have felt harsh and scratchy even when made of cotton.  These are different.  There is no comparison.  If you want something truly gentle and soft on the skin try these.  The texture is wonderful.*Product was received at no cost for a review.

*I received this free in exchange for an unbiased honest review.Makes ice cubes in six minutesThis is the newest ice maker from Ivation, the leader in portable ice makers.  I don’t run out of ice cubes ever since I got this.  I just pour some water into the container and turn it on and wait six minutes, and have a new batch of ice cubes, perfectly frozen and shaped.There are several things I love about this ice maker, starting with its small compact size.  My counter space is at a premium in my kitchen but this can sit out on the counter and look cute without taking up much room.  It is also reasonably lightweight at 24 pounds.I usually just make a new batch of ice with this every day but when I have guests coming I let this run for twenty four hours so that I have twenty six pounds of ice which I put into my own large plastic bags to store in the freezer to make sure I don’t run out, or sometimes I make double that amount to have on hand in case I have a party.This is so simple I didn’t even need to read the instructions before I first used it.  I poured water into the bucket and turned it on.  The ice cubes came out perfectly and I could see them being made through the window in the top of the lid.  What amazed me was that they didn’t stick together.  Each one was perfectly formed and separate from the rest.When I left some ice in the machine, it melted back into the reservoir and then was turned back into ice the next day when I made more ice.  There is a drain on the bottom to let out water that is unused or the machine can be tilted to pour it outEven though this is so compact and easy to use, it has alerts to let you know when the water level is too low, and also lets you know when the ice bucket is full.  It shut itself off when it was  finished making a bucket of ice.Pros:LED buttons to turn it on and offAlerts for when it needs water and when it is finished making iceMakes 26.5 pounds of ice in 24 hoursOnly about 14 X 13 X 10 inchesSee through window to watch the ice being madeComes with a removable water tank, ice scoop and user manualI love this ice maker and will never again run out of ice, nor will I have to buy ice at the store.

I have recently been through two large bags of dry catfood where Sheba would rather starve than eat it.  The local feral cats are the benefactor's of her picky eating behavior.  This one is different.  She gobbles this up and looks for more.  She has previously shown that she loves anything with duck in it and this has that and turkey, another favorite.I love the fact that this is grain free, unlike just about all dry cat foods.  Sheba is middle aged and is developing quite a poochy belly, being strictly an indoor princess.  Carbs are probably part of the problem so this is a good choice for her.  I also love that this comes in a zip lock bag to keep it fresh.  She loves it and I like it too.  This is a rare find for such a picky female cat.

I was puzzled that the package of six rolls I received did not have any type of large printed label like regular toilet paper packages have.  They have really stripped down the overall presentation of the packaging of this.  This is half the size of a regular package of six rolls of toilet paper and I love this since I can now keep all six rolls under the sink with room to spare.Once I removed a roll from the package I could simply squeeze the roll to make it round again. This is brilliant packaging and I'm surprised they didn't think of this before.  I can imagine from a marketing standpoint that this takes up much less space on store shelves which won't be seen as a good thing as far as product placement in a store, where more shelf space puts a product on display over a larger area.  But from a consumer's standpoint this is pure genius. I'm still not sure why there is no large colorful label but regardless, this is something I would continue to seek out in stores.

Sheba loves her canned Friskies cat food.  It is only the "pate" version she likes, and I have found most cats prefer this texture.  Sheba only licks the gravy off of the little bites of this, like she does with any of the "sliced" textured canned food.  She refuses to eat the morsels.  She even spits them out if one accidentally gets in her mouth as she licks the gravy.My neighbors who have cats have all confirmed that none of their cats like any of the sliced type canned cat food.  So I cannot actually say that this is bad food, only that like all the cat foods with this texture of bites in gravy, they will lick up the gravy and leave the actual bites of cat food.Sheba's preferred dry cat food is Nutro and she is extremely healthy and happy eating the Salmon Adult variety of that.Nutro is an excellent brand.

I am a lover of great documentaries and this is the best of this year.The high school marching bands of New Orleans take it all the way to a new level of greatness.  This is the culture, the reason d'etre, for an entire section of this great city.  These kids live for their chance to play in the marching bands, and be in the Mardi Gras parades.See this remarkable film to understand exactly what this means to New Orleans. I loved and enjoyed every minute and am going to make my reservations for Mardi Gras again this year with a new appreciation for all the hard work and talent that goes into these bands.  If you've never seen the bands of Mardi Gras, see this film.  This is the winner of the best of 2015, and I have predicted the past two years best documentaries accurately.  This deserves to be in theaters.The grand finale, of the whole set of bands playing at a funeral, gave me chills.  This is a must see.

Nexxus has come out with a new line of shampoos and conditioners.  This one is excellent.  My hair is left soft and smooth.This one gives my fine limp hair lots of body and shine.  My hair is usually a mass of frizz but since using this, it looks fantastic.This has protein in it and my fine hair loves this ingredient and responds with amazing fullness.The entire line of Nexxus New York Salon Care products is extremely high tech and my hair has never looked better.

I rubbed this on my feet but it's my face and hands I am most concerned with.  That is where I notice dry skin that needs serious moisture.  So when I saw how rich and creamy this is, and how wonderful this smells, I put some on my face and hands.Wow.  The wrinkles on my skin vanished and were replaced with glowing moisturized pretty skin.This has an earthy herbal scent that is very subtle and I love it.  It smells like an herb garden.  I probably would never buy a foot cream as my feet look good.  But I would definitely buy this to put on my parched facial skin and the backs of my hands.  This is very thick but non greasy.  The tube is nice.I have loved this brand forever.  Every single product I've tried by AHAVA I have loved and this is no exception.  I don't know what exactly is in that Dead Sea mud that my skin loves so much, but it's in every product by this brand and it is a miracle ingredient.  It is healing and perfecting.  This goes on other parts besides feet and I will keep using it as a night cream.  I also love the mud mask by this brand which I am using on a daily basis.  My skin is looking fantastic now.

Our little shnoodle Ringo loves this.  For a dog he can be a picky eater and refuses lots of brands of dry food but this one he loves.  He has been eating this for three weeks and he is bouncy and energetic, and in particular his coat is soft and silky and has lost the course wiriness it had.  He is doing great on this.  He no longer tries to eat the cat's food and instead prefers this one.I love that this has zero grain in it. He does not do well at all when he consumes any grains.  He is regular, happy and healthy and this is obviously a high quality made in the USA dogfood with healthy ingredients.

I love this.  I have skin that reacts to daily foundation wearing with pimples, blackheads and oil.  This has a gentle drying effect on my messy skin. It makes the blackheads almost microscopic instantly, and the pimples seem to dry up with use over just a couple of days.  I really love this.  I'm a fan of mud masks for my problem skin in general.  This one is light but highly effective and best of all, I only need to leave it on for two minutes.  It rinses off very easily, unlike many mud masks.My skin takes on a new texture after I use this.  It feels soft and silky smooth for hours afterwards. Pores become invisible.I have used the brand of soap before and love it.  This is top quality from an Israeli company that infuses all its products with Dead Sea mud.I don't know why but this works wonders.  I want to try all the products from AHAVA.

I love shampoos which are so moisturizing that I don't need to use any conditioner after shampooing and this is one of them.This adds protein, which my fine dry colored hair drinks in and responds to better than any other ingredient.  I see no reason to use any conditioner after this.Whenever I am trying  a new shampoo for the first time I skip any conditioner to see if this makes my wish to not use conditioner come true. This shampoo conditions and smooths my dry frizzy hair better than any I've tried so far.  I did not even have as many tangles when it was wet.Nexxus has come out with some great new shampoos and conditioners lately.  If you have dry, tangle prone, fine damaged frizzy hair definitely try this one.  I will continue to use this as my hair loves it.  No conditioner is needed by my hair after using this one.

This is the second product I've tried now from the new Nexxus Oil Infinite line of products.  This holds true to the positive results I have gotten from the other product.  My hair is left silky without the usual mass of frizz and tangles after shampooing with this.I gave this shampoo the true test; I did not use any conditioner at all after I shammpooed with this. And I can report that simply switching to using this shampoo made my hair silky, shiny and full of body.  I almost do not need a conditioner when I use this.  Who knew that simply adding a touch of the right oil to a shampoo would work a miracle for my hair?My hair is so dry and frizzy it does not even hang down to my shoulders, but instead stands out in a mass of frizz from my head and looks dull and parched, and is very difficult to comb when wet.  Now it hangs straight down in a shiny mass of silk.I have tried innumerable shampoos over the past few years in the Amazon Vine program and this is definitely up there in the top three.  If you have dry frizzy untamable hair give this a try, along with the other products in the Nexxus Oil Infinite line.  I love these.

I'm a long time user of Moroccan Oil since my hair is always very dry and frizzy due to home coloring, sun, wind and swimming in pools frequently.  I like this even better.I do not usually like strong scented products but this one is an exception.  I can smell it on my hair for hours after I apply it and I love it.  It is a light musky scent and probably the first musk scent I've ever liked.  It is sublime. There is some rum and a hint of patchouli in there too.This smooth and silkens and slightly straightens my hair.  It is an oil but not heavy.  Instead of my hair sticking out in a bushy mass of frizz, after this is hangs straight down almost with a soft shiny glow.  It looks like perfection.  I like to put this on my dry hair, and I use more than a few drops.  I like to shampoo at least every other day or more, so I don't worry about any oily buildup of this.Would I buy this even though it costs a lot?  You bet I would.  This is one of my rare ten star products.

This is a creamy white lotion that has a delicious scent of musky coconut.  After you bathe and cleanse your body, you then apply this and rub it around and rinse it off.  I found that it rinses away cleanly and does not make my shower or tub slippery at all.  I do not use this lavishly but instead have found that about two teaspoonfuls will cover most of my body.  I then allow the shower to rinse it off and my skin is noticeably softer and smoother.This smells delicious, and it is a big economical bottle.  My one gripe is that this has to stand on it's somewhat unstable cap, upside down.  It is prone to falling over this way.  Otherwise I like this very much and I found that applying moisturizer in the shower, when I'm wet, is much easier and faster than doing it afterwards.  I also love this as a shave cream when shaving my legs.  I recommend this.

This brush was a needed accessory for my makeup brush collection.  This has a very long handle and the spoolie end is substantial.  It grabs ahold of my unruly brows and I can hold each hair almost straight up with this and then trim them to a uniform length.I then apply some hairspray on a cotton ball to hold them in the desired position.  Then I use the little straight edge angled brush on the other end of this to apply the perfect shade of eyeshadow, a pale brownish taupe.  And voila, perfect looking brows, each hair standing in the correct position.  I like using eyeshadow for my brows since I have never found the ideal shade of brow makeup.  And it's subtle.The pros of this deluxe brow brush are:long easy to hold handlesubstantial, thick well made spoolie-brushperfect soft small angle brush to apply eye makeup and brow makeupIf you have used the inferior, smaller type of spoolie brush on your brows, get this one and throw that one away.  This really gets a good grip and each and every hair and holds it firmly while I trim them.  My brows have never looked as perfect as they do now.  I even have a supersharp pencil I use to fill in the thin areas.  It's easy with my magnifying mirror and this brush.  No set of makeup brushes is complete without a fantastic brow brush and this is it.

This sands the callouses off my feet easily and it's fun to use.  A small wheel turns rapidly and there is a gentle sandpaper type roller that simply sands off the callouses and dead skin from my feet.  A fine white dust which is the dead skin forms as I use this so it is recommended to use this over a towel.This is fast and gentle and in under five minutes my feet were smooth and callous free. This came with batteries and a small case and is neatly packages and was sent quickly.  This is a lot of fun to use and can be used on elbows also.  It also can be used in the shower.  There is no reason to have callouses anymore and feet look and feel better when they are smooth and callous free.  This is a great tool for pedicures.

I've been a long time user of Tresemme conditioners, for the past few years now.  Tresemme conditioners remove all the frizz from my incredibly frizzy, dry hair.  Occassionally I will skip using them and only use shampoo and it's always a disaster.  My hair is very find, color processed, fly away, dry, damaged and a complete wreck.I've also used Fekkai conditioners lately and they are also good but require several minutes to really work.  I don't leave the Tresemme conditioners in my hair more than a minute and they work beautifully.This is thick, and gives my hair gorgeous body and fullness more so than the others.  I still use It's a Ten after I leave the shower for that incredible shine.  But this removes the frizz so well and my hair falls into place and is very full and thick looking after I blow it out.  Also, this is a huge tube.  It will last a long time.Benefits:Hair looks and feels much thickerNo frizz on my usually frizzy head at allHuge tubeNo scentLeaves hair soft and smooth and full of life and bodyThis is without a doubt a great conditioner.  After Fekkai conditioners and It's a Ten leave in treatment, it's my favorite.

What a great magnifying glass this is.  I use this mainly for reading tiny print, which is on packages, and credit cards.  It is a very handy item to have around the house.  And with a little button to push to shine a bright light on what I am magnifying, this has allowed me to get a splinter out of my daughter's finger that was almost invisible but quite painful for her.This is ideal as a reading magnifier if you often read books with very small print, since this is very large, and very lightweight.  The lens is acrylic, making it incredibly light.  There is also no frame around the lens so that nothing gets blocked.  This is not a magnifying glass that will increase the size immensely, but the 2X magnification is perfect for reading.  This also has a very small area that magnifies a lot more and I was able to see that the tiny bump on my arm is indeed a very tiny wart with this.  What really clinched it for me was that light that is extremely bright, and shines right on whatever I am magnifying.  Without that and it would have forever remained a mystery what that bump was.I recommend this if you ever have trouble seeing very tiny print, or simply want a very handy large shatterproof magnifying glass.  You don't know how handy this thing is until you have one.  Then you wonder how you ever lived without it.

You simply can't go wrong with anything this company Nutro makes.  I've fed my big Manx Sheba Nutro Max Cat dry food her entire life and she will not touch anything else.  She is big and the picture of health now at eight years old.So it was with pleasure that I gave our Schnoodle Ringo this Nutro dog food.  He is not overweight, but we put some out for him to try and he wolfed it down as he does with any of the Nutro dog foods we have tested on him recently.  This has healthy ingredients and is listed, along with other Nutro pet foods, on lists of the healthiest brands of pet foods if you do some internet research on this subject. If I had an obese dog I would not hesitate to give him or her this food.  Nutro is number one in our house.

It is a novel idea to make chips out of black beans and these would be ok with some onion dip on them but think about what black beans taste like.  They do not have a lot of flavor and are bland.  So are these almost black chips.  These are crispy and have good crunch, a somewhat hard crunch, and I can taste the salt, other than that texture, the flavor wasn't anything that would make me buy these. I think it's a great idea to make chips out of a healthy product such as black beans.  And with some sour cream or onion dip these would be an ok carrier for that.On their own, these are nothing special, unless you just must have something crunchy and salty, and don't want the usual corn or potato chips and see this as a healthier alternative.

I've been a fan of Nutro cat food as long as I've had Sheba, my giant Manx calico, which is about eight years.  It's been her primary food and she has never stopped growing the entire time I've had her from a four week old kitten, which is typical of her breed. She is now huge and gorgeous.  Her fur is incredible and she is the picture of health.  She refuses any other dry food but Nutro.Now our Schnoodle Ringo has taken a liking to his new Nutro Adult Wholesome Essential Dog Food with Chicken.  His constant itching and scratching at himself has stopped finally since he has been on this and he is bright eyed and energetic more than usual since switching him to this. Apparently he had developed a food allergy to his previous kibble but this has cured him and he is much happier and never scratches and bites at himself like he used to since eating only this food.I've researched dog foods on the internet and Nutro dog foods are consistently rated as very high quality in comparison to most other dog foods.  And the price is competitive with lesser quality foods, particularly in the thirty pound bags.  We will keep our precious Ringo on this food.  He loves it and is not allergic to it.  He seems to be very healthy and happy on it.

This is a large machine which comes with a large variety of blades, all tucked neatly into a big storage container.  The thing that sets this apart the most from my trusty Cuisinart processor is that dicing blade.  It's great when I make my soups and salads.I always felt bad when I needed a different blade for my other expensive food processor and had to spend a lot of money on it, and also buy the container to keep those extra blades in.  This requires no further purchases of either blades or the storage bin for them.This is plenty powerful and does everything you could want a food processor to do.  If there is one problem with it, it is the size of both the processor itself and the storage bin, but with all those blades and accessories that are included with this a large storage container is a necessity.This has two bowls, a smaller one and a larger one, and a lid is included for the smaller one to store the food in after it's processed.  They've really included everything here.Black and Decker has been coming out with lots of excellent kitchen appliances lately, and I've tried several and found them all top quality, better than the competition, such as the small convection ovens that are half the price and work better than the expensive brands they are competing with.  This is the same.  This does it all, work as well or better, and is one third the price or even less if you add in all those accessories that are included.If you need a food processor this is the one to get in my opinion.And from now on if I need any type of countertop appliance in my kitchen Black and Decker will be the brand I choose, based on what I've seen of their recent kitchen offerings.

My cat Sheba has only eaten Nutro dry cat food her entire life and will not touch any other brand. She is the picture of glowing health.  So now we have our Schnoodle Ringo on this Nutro Limited Ingredient dog food in an effort to help him with his relentless itching which is most likely a food allergy.He is not itching as much since eating only this food, although I have been reading it can take up to two months for the itch allergic response to stop completely.  He loves this food and is his usualy happy healthy energetic self on this.  It seems to be very crunching and instead of gobbling and swallowing this whole as he does with almost everything he eats, he slows down and really chews and crunches this up before swallowing it.  We feel this is probably a good thing.So far he likes this and we like this brand.  We have read this is one of the top brands and our cat Sheba is a glowing testimonial of the quality of the Nutro pet foods.  We will keep itchy Ringo on only this for a while as he is doing well on it.

This is actually more of a powder for the entire face than a blush, once you apply it and see the lack of any type of obvious pigments in the formula.I have lily white skin and these do not add any sort of color to my skin that is apparent. I do like how finely milled the powder is, and the soft feeling of it on my skin. It adds a barely there tone and although I have three different shades, none of the three do much of anything in the way of adding color.If you need a nude face powder, these would be great for that, but if you are looking for something that adds any color or blush to your skin keep looking. These won't do that.EDIT: Wow!  I was so wrong.  I've been using these colors and found that I simply cannot live without the Luminous shade of this.  I have never used any face powder in my life before since I always wanted a dewy moist finish on my skin.  Well let me tell you--this makes my skin perfect, glowy and simply gorgeous in the Luminous shade.  I can't believe the perfection of my skin when I liberally dust this one over my entire face.  It still has a dewy look but it glows and is flawless.  This even conceals shadows under eyes and evens out the skintones and valleys so the entire face looks radient and even.  I want to stock on on this particular shade.  I also use the Bronze shade on my eyelids for the most subtle but gorgeous eyeshadow.  These are not going to add much if any color.  Subtle is the word here.  But if you want perfect looking skin get these, especially Luminous.

The box of this dog food I got has two 4 pound bags of food in it but I understand that now they are selling it in one bag. These are clear sturdy bags inside a box, and each bag has what looks just like bright green sawdust in it. The instructions on the box say to mix about one cup of this meal with about 1.5 to 2 cups of water.The result of mixing this green powder with water is a soup that smells strongly of dried fish. There are small pieces of what appear to be bites of fish floating in the soup, and Ringo, our schnoodle, loved it. He went crazy for this stinky fish soup. Our cat Sheba also found it to her liking, although this is sold as a dog food.This is not a solid food. It is more of a powder you mix with water to make a soup, or possibly with less water, a mush. This is too loose a food product for us to want to feed it exclusively to our beloved little Ringo, but we are going to give this to him in portions of a half cup to a cup a day, mixed with water, since he loves it so much and it apparently is very nutritious, being made of dehydrated fish and some dried vegetables. We feel it is an excellent food product and will supplement his, and our cat Sheba's, diet very well. It will be his afternoon treat before his daily run at the dog park.

This made my hair dull, dry, brittle and dull.  It actually did the opposite of what a good blow dry spray should do, and it smells very strongly of cheap perfume when it first comes out of the pump bottle.  I am throwing mine away since I have better hair products.  I love the other recent Tresemme products I've gotten but this is one I dislike.  It made my hair look terrible.

To put dawn detergent into a roll or paper towels so that they suds up and really remove grime and grease with no need for an additional cleaning product is a no brainer.  These have Dawn dishwashing liquid infused in them and they really do a great job not just on pots and pans but in the sink, bathtub, non stick cooking surfaces, grill hoods, utensils, in the car, on the windows and lots of places.  My only gripe is the cost, around $3.50 per roll at this writing.  These are extra large rolls.  I used a couple to clean out a really grimey bathtub and sink and it was easy and fun to use these.  I love them but the price so far is too much since you can just put some Dawn on a paper towel but for the convenience and if price is no object, these are great.

These were like marshmallow candy bars, with some white marshmallowy stuff and nuts  and cranberries mixed in.  This was much more candybar-like than any other protein bar I've tried.  It is delicious.  I'm not sure I want my protein bar to be so good I eat half the box in one sitting.  I had to check and double check again the ingredients to be sure they were healthy and they are, although I still can't wrap my head around the idea that something so gooey and candy like is actually a protein bar.If you, unlike me, are not tempted to overindulge when you have a whole box of gooey sweet protein bars that taste like delicious candy, then get these.  They are not as filling as some I've had but they are probably the best tasting.  I am snacking on fruit these days but if I wanted a treat, this would be it.

I usually like to make my own mac and cheese using separate cheddar cheese to go on the pasta, mixed with a little milk on the stove to melt it together.  I was eager to see what gluten free mac and cheese would be like and it is delicious.  While I am not on a gluten free diet, this would be wonderful to add to the diets of those who are on such a diet.  And this is organic, and I am now always using organic dairy products so that would be reason enough to switch to this.  It's a fairly small package and it about two small servings.  It takes great and can be made in the microwave for a quick snack.

I love the size, small, and the way it looks.  This is a pretty attractive little clock.First the good things about it:*small and attractive---the one I got is rectangular, not the square one in the picture, and I prefer the rectangular shape*not only shows the time and date, but the temperature in either farenheit or celcius*can stay plugged into the USB port of my computer, or as I have it now, with the USB cord it comes with plugged into a wall outlet adapter*the alarm can be set on either 5 days to go off, or 7 days, allowing you to not have it wake you on weekends*can run on the internal rechargeable battery, although I have not tested how long it will stay on with only battery powerNow the less than good things about it:*cannot be plugged into a wall outlet unless you have the type of adapter which allows you to plug USB plugs into the wall*It took some time to get the date and time set up, many buttons on the back to test out*If the battery runs out you will have to set it up all over again*And the MAIN PROBLEM WITH THIS IS-- it is very hard to read the time due to the dark grey background and black numbers, unless you push the button on top to activate the light.For some people who want zero light in their bedroom at night, this feature of having a dark unreadable screen might be an advantage, but it is almost impossible to see the time unless you reach over and push the button on top to make the screen light up.Overall I do like this and find it a nice clock, as long as it is very close to my bed so I can see the time since from a distance it is impossible due to the dark numbers on a dark screen.  For that reason alone I would not buy it but since I was sent this for testing purposes it is ok.*Sample was sent to me for a review and testing.

I was disappointed to find when I unboxed this that this had a huge blank strip down the middle of the screen.  It appears that I might have gotten one that had previously been purchased and returned but I'm not sure.  The keyboard, which is of major importance to me in any laptop, was very good, with the key pressure and distance between keys to be a perfect touch typing experience.This was lightweight and responsive and I would have loved it had there not been that big missing pixel strip down the middle. Not sure how this could have possibly passed quality control!  It looked as if it may have been dropped hard as  the box was a bit dented on one corner.  I have owned Dell's in the past and loved each and every one of them for their bright perfect screens, great keyboards, and most of all their amazing reliability over almost any other brand.  They worked for ten years or more in the past for me.This will not stop me from purchasing more Dell's.  I love them.

The most picky eater cat in the world went totally nuts for this.  I gave her one morsel of it not expecting any reaction except her usual upturned nose but she took one whiff and gobbled like she was starving and this fat cat is definitely not starving.  She loves this stuff!Now I have tried at least a dozen different catfoods as well as dozens of people foods on Sheba, and she will ONLY eat two brands, Friskies canned cat food and Maxicat, which must be the salmon flavor, none other than that one.  Not once has she ever eaten anything else except a little yogurt now and then.She loved this so much she will be getting this in addition to her other two preferred foods every day from now on.  This has what she craves obviously, which is protein. She won't even eat chicken bites or fresh fish of any kind, but she loves this.They have a new customer now in me, Sheba's slave.

This is very crunchy with almonds, not too sweet, and some chewy cheery pieces make this very good tasting.  It has a great chewy-crunchy texture and you really almost have to force yourself to eat an entire bar in one sitting it is so filling.  After eating one I feel absolutely stuffed.  I have never eaten this standard sized protein bar before that had such a filling effect.  This is a great mid afternoon snack therefore for anyone on a diet.The ingredients are all healthful. There are five bars per box, and this comes in a box of six boxes for a total of 30 protein bars.  Each bar has ten grams of protein.  I have always loved Cliff Bars, and still prefer the taste of those, but those are sweeter and more like candy bars compared to these.  These are to fill you up until dinner time.  I really love these for that reason and can see this becoming a regular daily part of my weight loss effort.  I will continue to buy these.

I am using this in a bedroom that is 12 X 15 feet.  It pulls dampness out of the air and we empty the container that collects water about once per week.  We are selling our home here in humid south Florida and we no longer live there, so to save on electricity we keep the air conditioner set on 86 degrees, which is ok except for the extreme humidity, which can cause mold to begin to grow.  This makes a very noticeable difference in the dampest room which is one of the bedrooms.  The air stays dry and fresh smelling in there.We have a smaller version of this same dehumidifier by Ivation in a large closet and it also does a fine job of keeping it dry.  Since these use much less electricity than the central air conditioning system does, we can keep that turned up, while not worrying about mold and dampness.I have been testing and reviewing Ivations products for a long time and have been impressed by all of them.  Ivation stands out as being a very quality conscious company with perfect quality control, excellent packaging and shipping, products that exceed my expectations, reliability, attractiveness, and ease of use.This little mid-sized dehumidifier from Ivation is exactly right for our medium sized bedroom so don't think this only can be used in a closet.  This also will work in a bedroom or office and do a great job.  I also love the fact that it is almost completely silent.*Thank you Ivation for sending me this for testing and review--love it.

I use this in my essential oil mister and it smells like I'm in a big basket of oranges.  I also love how this orange scented essential oil has the power to eliminate our ant problem within 24 hours.  I wish more people knew about this trick.  Ants cannot tolerate the smell of oranges for a minute and disappear when it is in the air.I can't say this is a calming scent although it smells delicious.  It actually seems to give me energy and clears my thinking.  It's a great scent in the early morning to wake up to.  This is a potent oil and one of the better essential oils I've smelled.  Some lately are not very strong or smell watered down but not this one.  This smells concentrated and is wonderful.

These are very well packaged in a sturdy attractive case.  They have mirror fronts which not only look very cool but do a great job of blocking the sun.  I can see perfectly out of these under water and they don't fog up like many I've had.The best thing about these is the way they prevent even one drop of water from getting into the inside of them, but also these are incredibly comfortable. These have two very soft rubber flanges around each eye piece that cup each eye comfortably feel great.  Some goggles can be very uncomfortable but due to the softness of each of the surrounding rubber flanges, these hug my eyes without causing pain or discomfort.The strap that goes around my head is also unusually comfortable, also being soft rubber that is very stretchy.  I didn't even have to adjust it the first time I put it on. It simply stretched out to fit perfectly, and I have a large head size.These are great goggles that I received free in exchange for testing and review purposes.They are excellent.

I have long, thick, wavy hair.  I got this hoping it could be a more cost effective substitute for the DevaCurl products I have been using.  This is good in that it does define my waves, but I find I still prefer the Deva Curl in that it seems easier to wash out of my hair with the gentler conditioning washes I use, keeps my hair less frizzy and still soft looking and to the touch.  Though I would use this in a pinch.

I got this to replace a 10 year old Grohe faucet in my guest bathroom.  Thankfully, we had recently installed a new faucet in the kitchen so we were already familiar with the process of switching out a faucet and were able to do this without calling a plumber.  We found this to be slightly easier in terms of installation since the other faucet had a touchless sensor feature that involved installing a new outlet.  We thought it was appropriate for a couple of minimally skilled DIY’ers to do in a couple hours.But more than anything else I love the look and function of this product.  My biggest peeve with a lot of faucets is that they feel and look cheap.  This is the EXACT opposite of that.  The design and chrome finish are really pretty and operating this the metal feels substantial and like it is built to last.  The one concern I had was whether this would look too modern in my more transitional home (Condo originally built in 1919, but updated) but I thought it looked great and really gave my sink an upgrade.  My towel rack, hand towel ring and toilet paper holder are all the Ashbury line in polished chrome from Restoration Hardware and I was originally concerned that the more roundish look of the fixtures from this line and the more square look of the faucet wouldn’t mesh but they look great together.  (I’ve come to like that it coordinates and ‘goes’ without being matchy matchy.)I also find this operates perfectly with a nice flow and no leaks.I’d recommend!

I'm not gluten free, but I have a great co-worker who is and it makes me less inclined to bring baked goods into the office because I like to bring things she can enjoy.  Accordingly, this mix got me excited.  I love that the ingredient list is simple and without hard to understand ingredients.  Essentially, this replaces the flour, sugar, and leaveners and also includes some vanilla extract for taste.  This does mean you need to add substantial fresh ingredients (heavy cream, butter, eggs) to complete the recipe.  If you're looking for a recipe that requires little additional fresh ingredients or if you have a gluten free flour blend you already love and have great success substituting in scone recipes, this likely isn't the product for you.  But as someone who generally cooks with gluten but likes to cook gluten free occasionally for my co-worker, it's a great option.  I also love that you can switch up the mix-ins to try different flavors with one mix.  Just make sure whatever you add is gluten-free.I will also say I'm not sure these are the product for the beginning baker.  Cutting in the butter and getting the right texture can take a little bit of practice.  I do think it is easier if you work with frozen butter, which I typically do.I was also thrilled with the results.  I love the taste of millet flour and bake with it on my own even when I'm not trying to be gluten free so I thought these tasted great and are proof that gluten free products have come a long way over the years.  The texture does seem a bit different than the typical scones I'm used to, but it's close enough that these are still pretty satisfying.Would recommend

I'm absolutely smitten with this polish.  I've been a long time fan of Essie.  I love the formula.  It's a bit thinner than most I use which I find makes it easier to apply evenly and with a good topcoat (I'm currently using and loving Seche Vite) and a good base coat (I use Essie) I get a long wear out of my mani.  But what really gets me with this polish is the color.  While I think the picture is pretty true to color, the shimmer is even more pretty in person.  It's a lovely purple with a light teal shimmer that is subtle, but absolutely stunning at the right angle and in the right light.  Paired with the matte finish it reminds me a lot of the look of more indie polishes, but at an affordable price.  I love, love, love this.  The purple feels very fall appropriate but the subtle shimmer is nice for those of us who don't like to go completely neutral and still love a surprising pop of color.

At first I wasn't sure how I felt about a mud cream, but I've had great experiences with the AHAVA brand, so I decided to give this a try.  This is a  rich, moisturizing cream that is perfect for dry feet. I like to sloth off roughness with a pumice stone and a foot scrub and then follow with this lotion. I also like that it has a soft, pleasant scent and isn't greasy.

I love the tactile feel of writing on a pad, but also appreciate the convenience of writing on a tablet so you can more easily access your notes later.  The Wacom Bamboo Spark is amazing because it blends the best of both worlds.  I love that you physically take notes with an actual pen that feels more comfortable and natural than styluses (which I've previously purchased but never really used for that reason) but then with a push of a button it digitally captures them so you can access them later.It comes with the Bamboo Spark pen, 30 page notepad, 2 replacement ink cartridges, nib removal tool, USB cable, and quick start guide.So far, I've found a lot to love about this gadget.  I love that the pocket is perfect not just for storing my iPhone but business cards and small papers.  I also love that if you're not connected to your device the Bamboo Spark can hold up to 100 pages.  I love that it is lightweight and small so it's not a hassle to carry it to meetings or travel with it.  I also wasn't sure how often I would really digitally store my notes, but I've been surprised at how many times it has come in handy.  It is more convenient when someone asks me to share notes from a meeting or when I'm sketching out a rough idea of what I want something to look like for our designers.  My only want would have been more options for case colors and patterns, but this is a nice neutral case that is very professional.I love this!ETA 10/9/15: I wanted to update this review as I've continued to get more experience with this product.  I continue to LOVE the functionality.  It's continued to be very handy and I find myself using it a lot for both professional and personal use.  My only nit is I think the software might be in need of an update.  It is supposed to sync automatically in the background, but it seems to be hit or miss whether it does this and I often have to repair the device which is making this a tad less convenient.  Hoping they can remedy this issue because otherwise I'm in love.

These are a great pair of cross-trainers.  They are comfortable, seem very breathable, and fit true to size.  The picture also seems to accurately depict the colors - very vibrant blue with a bright yellow/green accent.  Time will tell how well they hold up, but I've always had great experiences with Puma shoes in the past so I have every reason they will wear well over time and continue to provide great support and cushioning.

I have less experience with Burt's Bees than other reviewers, but still found myself pleasantly surprised by this lotion.  I have skin that is chronically dry after 2 rounds of accutane and still somewhat acne-prone (though much less so before the accutane).  Accordingly, I'm picky about my lotion.  I need something sufficiently hydrating, but also something that won't break me out.  This lotion fits the bill.  It feels pretty lightweight, relatively speaking, yet is hydrating, absorbs quickly, and doesn't seem to aggravate my acne.  I also like the scent.  It's subtle and pleasant, yet not so strong that it becomes noxious.  I'm a fan!

Dry shampoos have been incredibly popular for women, so it only makes sense that men have an option as well.  I was a little skeptical about how effective this would be, but it really does a good job of refreshing my man's hair later in the day or even the next day.  It does a good job of dealing with oil around the scalp and reviving your style.  And best of all, he actually wants to use is regularly and sees the value in it, which tends to only happen when he really likes a product and thinks it works.

I have long color treated blonde hair that is wavy and coarse (type 2C for you curly girls).  In the past couple years I've been embracing my natural wave more, using DevaCurl products to cleanse and style my hair.  The routine has definitely made a huge difference.  My waves are more defined, my hair feels softer, and I get compliments on my wavy hair days.  Having my wavy hair under control I've now been curious about salt-infused sprays meant to give hair more of that beachy, windswept look.  So far I've tried a few products like Oribe Après Beach Wave and Shine Spray, Bumble and Bumble Surf Spray, and Bumble and Bumble Shampoo and Conditioner, and of course, this Sea Mineral Infusion Texturizing Sea Salt Spray.I've been playing around with these different products and different approaches for awhile (i.e. using these salt-infused sprays on their own, using them with my other wave/curl styling products, etc.).  I've come to the conclusion that at least among the brands I've tried, Suave included, I don't really care for what any of these sprays do on their own.  As a standalone product, I just don't love what any of them do for my hair.  It's possible there is a miracle sea salt-infused spray out there that will perform better that I haven't tried yet, but given that I've tried multiple brands at a range of price points, I'm thinking this type of product just isn't a holy grail for me on it's own.That said, I have had better results when I try this spray with my other products.  I'm much happier when I use my Devacurl Light Defining Gel and Styling Cream and give my hair a few generous sprays with this product after.  It seems to give my hair a little more texture and help with defining my waves.  That said, after all this testing I'm convinced this product is probably not meant for my hair type.  Since my hair is on the coarse side naturally it always looks a bit more textured and windswept without any help from products so I'm not sure the results are dramatic enough with any brand to convince me I need this product.Overall, this is an interesting product, but I'm not sure it's meant for my hair type

These body pads are meant to help treat body acne and do seem to work for that purpose.  Essentially, after cleaning the skin (I use Glytone Exfoliating Body wash as recommended by my dermatologist) you rub the pad over your acne prone or effective areas.  It does seem to do a nice job of helping heal and prevent breakouts without over drying the skin.  I especially appreciate that there are no ingredients that damage your clothing, like benzoyl peroxide since I'm usually in a hurry and throw on clothing or pajamas after using these.That said, there are a couple of caveats worth stating about the product.  First, these are only effective if your acne responds to the active ingredients.  If you skin is typically not responsive to salicylic acid and gycolic acid, these likely won't help you.  I know this is common sense but for years I was guilty of trying may products that all used the same active ingredients and finding myself confused that none of them worked.  It wasn't until I explored other active ingredients (largely prescription products) that I saw better results.  I also wish these came with a tool to help make application easier.  One of the biggest reasons I've always struggled to use topical treatments consistently for body acne is that most of my acne clusters in the middle of the back, which I find hard to reach.  For creams you can use a back lotion applicator, but I haven't found anything that aids with using pads.  Obviously if your acne is in more easily reachable places this is not an issue, but was for me based on my acne lotion.Other than that, I do like these pads and would recommend them to people whose body acne is responsive to  salicylic acid and gycolic acid.

Like some of other reviewers, I'm still not 100% sure why Cetaphil needs a lotion specific for men.  On one level I get it since many lotions have a very perfume-y smell that even as a woman I don't care for.  But as a long time Cetaphil user I've always found their products to be relatively unscented and perfectly gender neutral.  That said, I recognize that the fear of a perfume-y lotion is so strong that a 'for men' product is an easy cue when you're shopping the aisle that the lotion isn't going to leave you smelling like a flower patch, which this lotion doesn't.  Though some 'for men' products have more of a musky, cologne smell, and this doesn't have that either since it is unscented.That discussion aside, this is a great lotion for those who have sensitive or acne prone skin.  It moistures and provides some sun protection (though not enough, say, for a day at the beach since most people don't apply nearly as much lotion as they do sunscreen and this isn't meant to be water resistant) without clogging pores or irritating skin.  It's definitely meant for someone with normal or oily skin though so if your skin is dry or very dry you may not find this gives you enough moisture.Overall, I think this a nice lotion for those (male or female) who have sensitive and/or acne-prone skin and want a suitable lotion that also provides some SPF.

I had a feeling these were going to be a huge hit with my dog because while he likes a wide range of types and brands of treats, jerky-type treats tend to be his favorite.  So even though I had no pervious experience with Prairie Dog, I was excited to order these for my 22-pound Cockapoo.True to my expectations, he loves these.  A single piece of jerky is a little large for him to manage on his own, but thankfully these are easier to break into smaller pieces more appropriate for small and medium size dogs.  He's very excited to be offered these and wolfs them down quickly.  He seems to find them very palatable and also easy to eat (the latter is rarely a concern, but sometimes the more cookie like treats are hard to break up unless I use a knife and if they are too big, he seems to struggle to eat them).I like that the smell isn't unpleasant and pungent like some dog treats and that they aren't extremely crumbly.  The latter is selfishly a nice feature for me because it means I don't find crumbs of treats everywhere and don't mind if he eats them on the rug and other places where I would prefer dog treat crumbs don't get left behind.I thought these were great treats and would definitely by them again.

I had my eye on this faucet for awhile but hesitated because I worried installation might be more hassle than it's worth and that the faucet might not perform as expected (If you've ever had a bad experience with a sensor faucet in a public restroom you know my worry).  Accordingly, I did exhaustive research exploring many brands and types of faucets, but nothing else seemed to have the combination of esthetics and functionality I was looking for like this faucet so eventually even with all the worry I bought it anyway.I'm so glad I did.  First, the installation was nowhere near as bad as I expected.  It did require putting in an additional outlet, but it was an easy enough task for an intermediate DIY'er to take on.  This was installed at the same time as a new sink and garbage disposal and the rest of the installation was straight forward and without hiccups.  The directions were straight forward and easy to understand.And now that it is installed I absolutely love it.  The design of this faucet gave my kitchen a much needed upgrade.  I worried it might be too modern for the aesthetics of my condo, which are more transitional, but I was wrong.  It blends in perfectly and looks and feels high end.  I especially love that the pull out portion of the faucet is stainless steel since so many I was encountering were plastic with a faux stainless finish and looked cheap.  (Not to mention my old faucet was this way and the finish flaked off over time and looked worn.)The touchless feature also works flawlessly.  I was worried there might be false triggers, but so far the sensor seems to be ideally located so that doesn't happen.  I also wasn't sure if I would actually use the touchless feature but I find myself taking advantage of it several times a day.  I love it when I'm cooking and have messy hands that I need to watch and I also find it helpful when I'm washing dishes because I can more easily turn the water off between rinsing individual pieces so I waste less.  It's also handy when I fill a big pot with water and need to turn the water off when my hands are full.  I expected to use it when my hands were dirty, but hadn't imagined the other scenarios so I'm happy about the other ways I am finding this to be helpful.Beyond the functionality of the sensor, I like a lot of other aspects of this faucet.  The water pressure both during normal mode and when using the sprayer are perfect.  The sprayer pulls out smoothly.  I also haven't had any issues with it leaking out of the base or any other component.Overall my only regret is that I waited so long to get this because now that it is installed I absolutely love it.

I was curious to try this because it's a new brand for me.  It's worth noting that this doesn't seem to be related to PHYTO the haircare line, they seem to be completely unrelated brands as far as I can tell.  The deferentiating characteristic of this product vs. other exfoliating products seems to be that it is made from largely natural ingredients, a huge plus for those who prefer natural skincare in general or those specifically seeking to avoid microbeads.I applied it after washing my face and massaged it into my skin for a couple of minutes.  It has a more natural, light cinnamon smell to it.  This was a welcome surprise compared to other products that can be pungent smelling or heavily perfumed.  The texture is very creamy.  It has small particles in it to help exfoliate your face but they feel less abrasive than other face exfoliators I've tried.  It does a good job of sloughing off dead skin without irritating my skin.  I find this to be a little more gentle than Laura Mercier Face Polish and much more gentle than Kate Somerville ExfoliKate.The results are also great.  It leaves your skin feeling soft and smooth and looking healthy.  That said, I'm not sure I saw or felt a huge difference in my skin vs. other exfoliating products.  I've used many and they all seem to generate similar results, at least when comparing department store and boutique brands.  I do think you will definitely notice a difference if you haven't previously been exfoliating but I'm not sure this provides noticeably different results than other exfoliants.

I have also owned two other Blu-Ray players from Panasonic (one of which I've had for nearly two years) and have been very pleased with the quality and reliability over time so I got this with high ingoing expectations and it delivered.  I find it easy to set up, operate, and has good picture quality.  I also haven't had any of the issues with locking up randomly as a previous reviewer mentioned nor have I had that with any of the Panasonic Blu-Ray players I've owned.  Not sure if they got a lemon or if I've been exceptionally lucky, but I've never had an issues with any of my players locking up or experiencing any glitches or other issues.Would recommend

I resisted picking up this book for a long time because I don't identify as a religious person and as such, find a lot of books that reference God in the title to be (understandably) not really meant for someone like me.  However, I was struggling with the kind of food issues this book focuses on and having seen the book referenced in many other books and sites related to disordered eating I decided to pick it up from the library.  I figured if worst came to worst I could put it down midway through and return it to the library, without being out a cent.  Thankfully, my worries were unfounded and I got so much value out of the whole book.I think the author might be limiting her audience by calling out God so strongly in the title (and frankly disappointing those who expect a religiously-based text).  Her definition of god is so broad and her references to god so few and far between that I would never have noticed them had the title not called them out.  To me this is really less of a religiously-guided approach to food as it is about cultivating a healthier relationship with food.  That focus is what made this book so inspiring to me.  So many books focus on what we're supposed to be eating, not why we might have our current habits or the complex emotional context that often comes into play.  It's a big reason for me why so many diets seem overly simplistic and why it is so easy to fail and relapse into bad behaviors long term.  A lot of it reads like therapy-speak so I can see why to some people it might seem hokey, but I do think if you're willing to be open minded and do some introspection it can be really, really helpful.  I also think that some of the lessons seem deceptively obvious or straightforward, but can still be illuminating or challenging to put into practice.The only thing I didn't really care for is that the narrative structure of the book heavily references Roth's time leading therapy sessions and I found this became a bit boring and repetitive over time.  However, because Roth has such an approachable and nonjudgmental (though still challenging) way of presenting information, I was willing to deal with this.Overall I think this is an excellent read for anyone who is struggling to implement healthier habits and who has an inkling there is more to it than just knowing what to eat or how to move one's body.

I've been considering going back to grad school but have been very nervous about the quant portion of the GMAT exam since my career uses little more than basic statistic skills and math has never been my strong suit (my last math class was Calculus for Social Science majors in college and I haven't taken an additional class since).This book makes it abundantly clear upfront that it is not for everyone (or at least, as it qualifies, it's not meant for everyone right away).  It's really designed for someone who got a raw score of at least 47 on the quant section of either the Manhattan Prep or the GMATPrep practice CATs, for those who have already worked through the five math-focused Manhattan Prep Strategy guides, or those who are already comfortable with the core principles of these topics.  If these don't apply to you, you're better off starting with a more general guide and then going here for additional practice to get a higher score.  At least based on my background, I found these recommendations to be pretty accurate.  Perhaps if I had a stronger math background I could have jumped into this book right away, but at least for me it required more general math test prep first.The goal of the book is to prepare test takers for the most challenging math problems on the GMAT, which they define as being problems that have topical nuances or obscure principles, or those that have complex structures.  Given this focus it makes sense why the book requires you to start with a foundation of knowledge before working up to these type of problems.  Make no mistake, these problems are hard, at least for someone with my background.  But I did appreciate that the book does a good job of breaking problems down and making them as easy to understand as possible.  Given the kind of material they are dealing with, I'm not sure they could make it more straight forward or easier to understand than they do.  I also like that they really are teaching you to solve the problems, not giving you cheats or shortcuts.  If that is what you are looking for you will likely be disappointed as this book expects you to put in the hard work to figure out how to solve these kind of problems successfully.Other than the book itself, I like that this gives you access to online resources for a year (after you register) including six full length practice exas GMAT advanced quant question banks, and five free interact lessons.  This seems to be pretty par for the course these days and frankly, I'm surprised when any text book or prep book doesn't come with online features to reinforce learning, but it's still appreciated.Overall, I like this book for learning how to solve the more advanced quant questions on the GMAT.  It's definitely meant for a very specific audience and will disappoint those who expect to jump into it with no previous GMAT prep background, but it does what it sets out to do well.

I am very prone to hand dryness so these days I'm rarely without a tube of hand cream in my purse.  Currently Caudalie's Hand and Nail Cream has been my favorite so I was curious to see how this would compare.  As described, this tube is the perfect size for an everyday purse or hand bag or for traveling.  When I first applied this, I wasn't sure I liked it as it initially felt greasier than my Caudalie hand cream and I worried it would leave my fingers slippery.  My fears, however, were unfounded as this really does absorb quickly and makes skin feel soft and hydrated without leaving much, if any residue behind.  It's a great choice if you want to be able to quickly put on hand cream and go about your day.  In my case that meant take a bar workout class and I had no problems with my finger sliding on the bar or the weights.  I also appreciate that the hydration lasts.  Sometimes when I apply drugstore hand creams it feels like I need to constantly reapply because my hands start feeling dry again quite quickly, but with this I seem to be able to go a couple hours before I need to apply again.The one thing I did not care for at all was the smell.  To be far, I'm quite picky about fragrances and tend to either love or hate something with little in-between.  Unfortunately the scent here is a dislike for me.  It strikes me as very floral and for some reason with every sniff of it, it reminded me of old lady perfume.  Because I like the benefits it's something I'm able to get over, but comparatively Caudalie's nail and hand cream smells better to me (even though I find the scent of some of their products to be unbearable or noxious, that particular one by Caudalie is fine by me).  The hard thing with scents is it is, of course, a matter of taste and what is unappealing to someone can be a signature scent for another.  If you're like me and picky about scent it's probably worth seeing if you can try this out somewhere before you buy to see whether it's for you.Overall though I'm really impressed with the feel and benefits of this hand cream.  If you don't mind the smell, it's an effective choice.

This is my third Blu-Ray Disk Player and the second one I own from Panasonic (I also own the LG BP620 3D Blu-Ray Player with Built-In Wi-Fi - Black and Panasonic DMP-BDT230 Smart Wi-Fi 3D Blu-Ray Player (2013 Model)).  Both of those Blu-Ray players, as well as this one, for context, have been and are being used with LG Smart TV's.  Having gotten previous Blu-Ray Players in 2012 and 2013 it's pretty evident that these players have gotten smaller and more affordable over time which is great for anyone just entering the market or anyone who wants to get the player for a bedroom or other space in the house.Having had really great experiences with my Panasonic DMP-BDT230 Smart Wi-Fi 3D Blu-Ray Player I had high in-going expectations for this player and it delivers.  The interface is really easy to navigate and as others have said, playing Blu-Ray discs and DVDs is really only part of the experience, you can also get access to online video content through services like Amazon prime video and Netflix.  We found connecting to and navigating through these services to be just as intuitive and reliable as our experiences with other Blu-Ray players as well as our experience accessing the content through our Playstation.  I also appreciate that overall this Blu-Ray player runs very reliably.  We don't have issues with it dropping the network connection or freezing or skipping when playing Blu-Ray discs or DVDs, which I appreciate.  I also expect the longevity to be good since I've had zero problems with my Panasonic DMP-BD93 Smart Network Blu-Ray Disc Player in the two years I've had it.Really the only thing missing here is 3D, but I have to say, I don't miss it.  I got it with my previous TVs and Blu-Ray players just in case I wanted it, but it's a feature that in the 3 years since I got my first 3D smart TV I've never really used.  I played with it in the beginning to impress friends, but since then it's just not something I use.  If you have children or love the 3D experience you might feel differently, but I don't find I need it.Overall, I'm impressed with this Blu-Ray player.  It lives up to my expectations of Panasonic quality and gives me the functionality I want.

I live in a remote rural area and although it's not a high crime area, I am away from home often. The ability to watch over the internet what's going on outside my home is reassuring. (To be honest though, so far what I have seen is mostly deer, wild turkeys and one black bear, who seem to sense when no one is home and sniff around the house!) The Q-See company has brought down the price of multi camera security systems to a level the average homeowner can afford. Although some of their systems are commercial and cost thousands, I have a four camera Q-See which was only about $500 including a disk drive to record surveillance.This dome camera is an upgrade or alternative to a basic camera. It is a very wide angle camera, plus a bank of near infrared LED light sources which illuminate a large area outdoors. This infrared light is visible to the sensors but not to the human eye, so individuals (or deer) being surveilled are not aware they are lit up. Also it records very high res images, 2688 x 1520. It's basically a plug in replacement for one of the simpler cameras that came with my system.It works. The high res wide angle outdoor night scenes lit up by infrared are very striking and detailed and there is not much going on out there that you will not see. They claim the IR works to a distance of 80 feet but I actually get pretty good pictures farther than that. It's amazing how far these systems have come in recent years with newer sensors, so far superior to the closed circuit TV of 20 years ago.Recommended

I gave this to my girlfriend to test; she is concerned her skin is ageing. (Actually, she is a beauty.) Her report:Skincare companies are always telling us "what dermatologists recommend." I've asked and what they really seem to recommend, to protect skin from aging, is to stay out of the sun! That's the main thing. The primary ingredient here is a solid coverage sunscreen which is likely to be protective if used consistently every day. Sunscreens generally have two drawbacks though; they are dense and don't smell very good - the actual block agents can't be made without a certain smell of their own. L'Oreal has done a good job here of submerging the native sunblock scent - it is certainly more pleasant than Banana Boat. Finally this is in a base of quality creme which presents a moisture barrier and actually does not easily dissolve in water. I think L'Oreal has done a good job here on getting the functionality within something pleasant to use.This is a good formulation if one understands it is not a cosmetic but a medically correct sunblock to be protective of the real threats to sensitive skin.

There is a lot of medical evidence that sitting like a sack of flour in front of a computer all day is really bad for health. Unfortunately this is how I earn a living. This product is a kind of high tech woopie-cushion which is supposed to keep one's sitting position a bit off balance so that one needs to constantly shift around and readjust a little, which is at least slightly more active. It is basically a plastic balloon, and there is a needle to reinflate it. Let's hope the seam never bursts due to some enthusiastic bounce.It doesn't work well with my upholstered desk chair but seems better with a hard wooden chair. Note it does raise my seat height by a couple of inches. I need to use this for a while to be sure but my initial reaction is positive - it does seem to keep me a bit off balance and thereby somewhat more active during computer hours.

Anyone who has been around a lab or precision workshop is familiar with Kimwipes which are made from wood fiber and used to clean optics or precision mechanisms, whenever it's not acceptable to leave fibers behind as with ordinary paper towels.These Kimtex wipers are one step more high tech. These are not wood fiber or paper fiber but post-consumer polypropylene and work very well for cleaning up chemical spills, solvents, oils. Tough but soft and scratch free. If you don't know exactly the chemical makeup of your surface, or think it may be strongly acidic or basic, these are your best bet, very benign.I just used these with alcohol pads to clean up a 50 year old collector's camera. Did a nice job.
Tia Carrere is so lovely. At the peak of her beauty in this otherwise forgettable movie. That's it. That's my review.

These are made of very sturdy exterior materials - canvas and leather, but the interior lining is cotton fuzz which is likely to wear out more quickly. The gloves end up rather large and stiff and will not be good for fine work but rather situations which require solid protection, such as moving fire wood inside a burning wood stove. For finer chores I prefer deerskin gloves which are thinner and softer but still a bit tough.Good heavy duty gloves for the right application but I'm taking off a star for the insubstantial cotton insulation.

These paper towels can beat up your paper towels. This is not your wimpy household stuff but a box of 12 800' rolls of 8 inch wide, very tough material such as you might find in the bathroom of a truckstop. Industrial quality; you can tell right when you lift up the carton of 12. Excellent for the workshop where mopping up is more than washing hands. Most householders would not normally buy these but it's a good idea to consider - the price is about the same as the lowest quantity price for basic paper towels but the paper is much more substantial.

Olympus along with Sony have pretty much cornered the market on small voice recorders. One problem is they put out so many models - more than 20 from Olympus - it is hard to know which to choose. I keep a voice recorder in my truck, an Olympus DP-311, to take notes as I drive. To use it safely it must be easy to read and ideally have its own light source in the display. Another problem - too complicated. I chose the DP-311 because it's simpler than others, and has larger buttons -- Olympus says this model is for "elderly" users, thanks.
