Harry Treadaway stars in Penny Dreadful, which sounds far less impressive, but is actually another one of the best shows on television, even if not as many people realize it. Despite the reference to 'The Cabin in the Woods', and despite the fact that this film takes place in an actual Cabin in the Woods, the two have little else in common (except their previously mentioned unpredictability). 'Honeymoon' director and co-writer Leigh Janiak has made a fine debut film, especially with a four-person cast, and a budget not much higher than that of an off-Broadway play. I had to skip some of the excruciatingly sappy dialogue in the beginning, which was the most horrifying aspect of the film for me; but it does serve a narrative function, since they ARE honeymooners-in-love, and the passion the couple feel for one another makes the disturbing events that follow all the more strange, sad and sickening. [74/100]

Blood Meridian is unquestionably the best novel ever written by anyone, anytime, anywhere, about anything. More important than the Bible multiplied by the Philosophiae Naturalis Principia Mathematica, it's like a heaping tablespoon of Faulkner drizzled over The Killer Angels.[These assertions were tested using: a 1st edition; a centrifuge; gas chromatograph and mass spectrometer; a fingernail from the writing hand of a literary critic from the New York Times Book Review; the blood of the world's most erudite chicken -- whom I had personally educated using the standard method involving audiobooks and telepathy; Satanic Death Rituals, although my attempts to resurrect Cormac McCarthy ran aground when I discovered he was still alive; a homemade voodoo curse I assembled using spare parts from the Necronomicon and Cat Fancy magazine; and most importantly, frozen yogurt. In the end, I found that actually reading the book worked almost as well.]

Blood Meridian is unquestionably the best novel ever written by anyone, anytime, anywhere, about anything. More important than the Bible multiplied by the Philosophiae Naturalis Principia Mathematica, it's like a heaping tablespoon of Faulkner drizzled over The Killer Angels.[These assertions were tested using: a 1st edition; a centrifuge; gas chromatograph and mass spectrometer; a fingernail from the writing hand of a literary critic from the New York Times Book Review; the blood of the world's most erudite chicken -- whom I had personally educated using the standard method involving audiobooks and telepathy; Satanic Death Rituals, although my attempts to resurrect Cormac McCarthy ran aground when I discovered he was still alive; a homemade voodoo curse I assembled using spare parts from the Necronomicon and Cat Fancy magazine; and most importantly, frozen yogurt. In the end, I found that actually reading the book worked almost as well.]

I was able to find one of the incredibly popular Zero Tolerance 0562CF Hinderer Slicers a month or two back. Ever since the carbon fiber version of the 0562, which also has a beautiful, two-tone Bohler M390 blade, won the Blade Show 2014 Award for 'Best American-Made Knife of the Year', anticipation and demand have been very high. It's been selling out everywhere it turns up over-night, and the regular 0562 isn't much easier to find. This is the heavy-use edition, compared to the 0562CF. The G-10 is a tiny bit heavier - about 0.1 oz - than the carbon fiber, but it doesn't get scuffed up the same way. I prefer ZT's smoother, textured G-10 over the type Spyderco favors, which is like an emory-board. And the stone-washed blade hides scratches nicely, unless they're very long or deep.Elmax isn't as sought after as M390, but both are super-premium steels. I prefer Elmax to many of the Crucible steels, now that the heat treatment complaints that surfaced a couple years have been resolved. Similar accusations pop up all the time in the knife forums -- Chris Reeve, his CPM S35VN heat treats, and the Sebenza even took some flack. But Elmax is very close to it's big brother M390; both are extremely high carbon -- compared to a non-stainless high-carbon like 1095, which has 0.95%, Elmax has 1.80% and M390 has 2.00%; both are very high-chromium and corrosion resistant; Elmax has 18%, and M390 has 20%. Most stainless steels have between 13 and 15% chromium. The only reason I was determined to find the 0562CF, instead of the 0562, was because I already owned the 0561, which has G-10 and Elmax. The M390 and carbon fiber made it different enough to justify the purchase.Everything else is identical. This is a crazy smooth knife, thanks to the KVT ball bearing pivot system, with a perfect detent. It fires out like a rocket -- the best Hinderer flipper ever made, much better than the Hinderer XM-18 and XM-24 midtechs and customs, which still run on washers instead of bearings. They may cost two or three times as much, but they're no better than the ZT 0562/0562CF series (or the equally impressive, slightly larger ZT 0560 and 0561). The titanium is beautifully stonewashed, and the frame-lock has a lock-bar insert to prevent galling, as well as a 'lock-bar stabilizer'. The XM customs and midtechs are great knives, the real deal, even if they require a bit of wrist snap to flip open. But if you don't want to spend 600$, the ZT 0562 and 0562CF are two of the best folders on the market.

'The Burrowers' is a narrative collision of Larry McMurtry's uncompromising, entertaining tales of the American Frontier, and the inventive, troglodytic monstrosities of Neil Marshall's film, 'The Descent'. This is high-caliber historical horror, a sub-genre with very few notable examples; but Dan Simmons has mastered the material in literary form with novels like 'The Terror' and 'Drood'. This relatively unknown 2008 release written and directed by J.T. Petty is one of the most original, exciting, and terrifying horror films of the last few years, despite being largely ignored.'The Burrowers' takes place in the Dakota Territory in 1879. When a caravan of Irish Immigrants is attacked and the survivors are believed taken by Native Americans, a search party sets out after them. Clancy Brown and William Mapother play hardened Indian fighters, and David Busse plays the young Irishman with personal reasons for finding the missing settlers.They soon learn that the killers they're tracking aren't Native American, and in fact, aren't even human. Nightmarish creatures the Ute call 'Burrowers' once fed on the great herds of Buffalo that traversed the plains. Now that the Buffalo have been wiped out by white hunters, they have adapted to feed on the ever-increasing numbers of European settlers moving westward. Petty has envisioned horrific creatures that are fast and silent and rarely seen, nocturnal 'burrowers' who move under the cover of the grass and hunt in packs. They immobilize their prey with a toxin and bury them alive, allowing the poison to partially liquefy tissues without killing them. When they can finally eat their half-digested meal, the person is paralyzed but conscious, aware of every hellish, excruciating moment.The brutality of the film is both shocking and historically appropriate, and the plot moves with a harsh, natural momentum that is very unpredictable. The characters have all the inconsistencies and contradictions of the real world, and the absolute hopelessness and mercilessness that afflicts the plains is as much a creation of man as it is these terrifying monstrosities. I think the bleak authenticity of the film turned off some viewers, as much as the violence. It's not perfect, by any means, but the iMDB rating of 5.8/10 is far too low, making 'The Burrowers' one of the most underappreciated horror films of the decade. [82/100]

[One particular bababook, anyway...]This clever little Australian film never threatens to fall into the pit of mediocrity where all Hollywood formula-horror rots away, deftly catching itself after every minor misstep. The powerful visuals of the titular bababook, by Alex Juhasz, are recreated convincingly -- but sparingly, evidence of directorial maturity and restraint -- with CGI. The design and macabre tone of the story within the story feels remarkably familiar, like you've read it before; 'The Babadook' is equal parts Edward Gorey, Dr. Seuss, Tim Burton and Neil Gaiman, with a bit of Maurice Sendak. I was almost certain I'd confronted the book myself, albeit with less traumatic results.Writer-director Jennifer Kent leaves the Babadook where it's power is always in the ascendant: the shadows. Top hats and black raven wing-tips hint at horrors within horrors, and the nightmares she unveils just point you toward something so much worse. At its core, this is an allegorical tale about loss, guilt, blame, and suffering. It's about the nasty thoughts that fester and swell in the cellar of the mind, the thoughts that can become dangerous if we let them.The two actors who made this film work so well were Essie Davis and Noah Wiseman. Wiseman, a boy of 8 or so, is incredible. Kent knew what she was getting herself into with this film, giving 40 minutes of screen-time to an 8-year-old. She obviously had faith in her own ability to work with kids, and to find the right boy for the job. I don't think it's a 'Sixth Sense'-level performance, but it's pretty impressive. Davis deserves even higher praise, putting her heart and soul into a small production that might have languished in obscurity. She's a very talented actress... and if this were an American film, she wouldn't have been given an audition. It would have been Kiera Knightley, or Jessica Chastain, both great actresses, but... it wouldn't have been the same.. Again, great story and performances, highly recommended.P.S.: 'If it's in a word/Or it's in a look/You can't get rid/Of the Babadook' -- in a slightly amazing convergence of creepy Australian death-book films and sub-par computing technology, after posting this review, I moved on to the many wondrous online-carnivals-of-the-mind that sparkle like diamonds in the cyber-desert. I noticed through my Quaalude-fog that a few bits and bytes were ghosting through on every page, and I kid you not, it was just two words: 'the Babadook'. It wasn't just bleeding through my internet browser, it was on my desktop. And no matter what I tried, I couldn't 'get rid of the Babadook'. Scary. Or at least annoying, since a restart worked. I wish I wasn't an atheist... then I could have taken it as proof of life beyond... well, something vaguely spiritual, I guess; instead, it's just a sign that my glitchy laptop is getting glitchier. Damn that Babadook. And darn his evil, gangly dog-minion, the Marmadook.

With his most recent project, an art installation for Mass MoCA titled 'Filthy Lucre', Waterston takes his artistic genius in new directions, creating a dark psychic mirror of the infamous Peacock Room created by James McNeill Whistler. A very close approximation of the original, this Peacock Room imagines the context that's missing from the Leyland project as a corrosive radiation. The bitterness and anger that Whistler made so public, enraged that Leyland wouldn't pay any more than half the sum he demanded after completing the Peacock Room without getting the owners assent, has ravaged the decadent Victorian beauty.Waterston's gifts have never been clearer than they are in this excellent monograph, published by Charta. His work prior to 'Representing the Invisible', collected in his self-titled monograph from St. Ann's press, shows the artist at the edge of a breakthrough. Still relying on figurative elements, the nascent strains of pure abstraction are not embraced with the same confidence he demonstrates. It may represent a stage of transition, but the results are beautiful, nonetheless.'Representing the Invisible' is Waterston after the revelation. Although it's typically listed as a softcover, the edition I own is a hardcover. At around 140 or 150 pages, it's not impressive in terms of dimensions or page-count, but it uses thick, high-quality paper-stock, is sturdily bound and well-designed. Out of 350+ monographs, however, it's one of my favorites, one I come back to time and again. Waterston's excitement and inspiration is evident on every mysterious canvas; revelatory images of things we've never seen, could never name; 11 dimensional reality, translated in 4, represented in 2.

The Peacock Room was a decorative art project that a very wealthy patron named Leyland commissioned James McNeill Whistler to create while the owner was going to be away for a few months. Meant to serve as a place to house his collection of Chinese porcelain and paintings by Whistler himself, Leyland was surprised to learn that the modest assignment he had envisioned, a few days work at best, had suddenly become a massive reworking of the entire room. Expensive leather wall-coverings and mahogany shelves had been painted over in blue, with gilt illustrative flourishes everywhere. Whistler then proceeded to give Leyland a very large bill, far more than had been agreed upon, for unsolicited work. Leyland was not happy about the liberties the artist had taken, but agreed to pay half.What followed was a bitter campaign of slurs and insults, most of them originating from Whistler. He had been in financial trouble, and obviously saw 'The Peacock Room' as a way to alleviate those troubles. The room is still a popular exhibit today, and is every bit as beautiful, lavish and decadent as it was a century ago. If you didn't know the ugliness that surrounded its creation, the room itself certainly offers no clues.Darren Waterston decided to create the Peacock Room's dark, psychic twin -- an experiment in homage, fused with an interpretation of historical and psychological context. He reimagines it as a place where all the anger, jealously and bitterness manifests as a corrosive radiation, eating away at the decadent beauty of the work. Leyland's porcelain lies in pieces, and the shelves are broken and twisted, wounds afflict the painted and gilded surfaces like leprosy. The title, 'Filthy Lucre', is taken from one of Whistler's vitriolic screeds.This exhibition catalog (also entitled 'Filthy Lucre'), published by frequent collaborators Skira and Rizzoli, is 9.75" x 11.75" and 130 pages long. Using a thick, glossy stock, sturdily bound, and attractively designed and laid out, this is a handsome hardcover, and one worthy of Waterston's vision. I've followed his career as a painter for the last few years, and his brilliantly executed abstract compositions are incredibly unique. Only Ali Banisadr produces a similar blend of abstraction and vague figuration that possesses his level of intelligence and technical skill. For a more comprehensive examination of Waterston's art, I recommend the hardcover monograph released by Charta a few years ago, 'Darren Waterston: Representing the Invisible'; it collects many of his most beautiful and moving works, large-scale oils that suggest the birth of the universe, hydrogen nebulas, the spaces between atoms, a sunset glimpsed through the waning storms of sulfuric acid on Venus. For fans of Waterston and Whistler, this is absolutely fascinating work. Art that ties itself contextually to the history, style, subject matter, and methods of the past is always what draws me in, and this is a prime example.

This has worked for hundreds of film-makers! The Latest Hits: Sinister! Insidious! Annabelle! The Possession! Ouija! Finders Keepers! The Classics: Poltergeist! Child's Play! The Ring!You will need:- 1 troubled and/or recently separated couple with at least 1 son/daughter between 5 and 8 years old.- A move into a new house. The parent should say something to the effect of: "Things are going to be better here, I promise. Just give it a chance okay?"- At least 3 violently murdered prior owners, which, for some reason, the new owners know nothing about.How to proceed:- 'The Imaginary Friend': A ghost/demon/Lovecraftian death-god/dead telepathic girl w/cursed videotape/Leprechaun/dybbuk box/possessed doll should immediately make friends with the child, who -- instead of being appropriately terrified, like any normal kid -- will calmly report the creepy s**t her 'imaginary friend' says to her. The course events take will depend on the supernatural threat in question.- 'We Need To Talk About Your Daughter...': Trouble at school is a must. Either the child is teased, and ends up screaming, or the child is preternaturally quiet. The teacher will calmly and earnestly express worry, and then tell a disturbing story about the child's behavior, or present drawings. The drawings are always of dead people, or predict the future, or depict a menacing figure identified as the 'imaginary friend'.- 'The Expert': Regardless what manner of threat is looming, one parent will then seek out the 'expert' (expert number 1... a second expert is often necessary): a priest, a psychic, a paranormal investigator, or a child psychiatrist; the course events take will depend on which expert is brought in. Proceed to the appropriate chapter, as determined by specific 'threat' and 'expert'. NOTE: There is an inversely proportionate relationship between the expert's level of scientific certainty and his/her likelihood of surviving to see the end credits. A scientist can only cheat death by overcoming his/her quaint, old-fashioned insistence on evidence, and embracing the superstitious yokel within.- 'The Forrest Gump': Usually this ties in to the 'Microfiche Montage', or it replaces it. Examination of photographs from various unconnected crimes scenes, etc., reveals a really old person/entity, or an object, or a symbol (in 'Sinister' the monstrous demon-thing made a pointless super-secret cameo in each of the Super-8 film-reels it left behind, detectable only by freeze-frame; as was the case in 'The Ring', where a fly from the paused videotape suddenly becomes real, the demon whose image is frozen on the makeshift projection screen turns to meet the protagonist's gaze... scary).Of Evil Dolls & Child Psychiatrists:- 'The Evil Doll': is usually inhabited by the soul of a killer; in 'Child's Play' it was a run-of-the-mill armed robber killed in a toy store; in 'Annabelle' it was a Manson family-type Satanist killed in the family home. It could also be home to a demon, or have a curse attached to it.- 'The Bad Penny': Only one parent suspects the truth (in the beginning), and should throw the doll away or destroy it; their suspicions are confirmed when the doll reappears in the child's bed, unharmed (works just as well with books, i.e. 'The Babadook'; or evil puzzle-boxes; etc.)- 'The Hand-shaped Bruise': The child psychiatrist should discover mysterious bruises, and accuse the parent(s) of abusing their child. The expert should end up dead (especially if the parent has tried to confide with them about their fears, only to have them dismissed in a condescending way), either in their office, or more typically, after arriving unannounced at the family home to further investigate.- 'The Haunted Headspace': The child will become creepier and emotionally distant.- 'The Microfiche Montage': The 'research scene' comes before the climax, sometimes followed by a 'secondary expert' (If expert number 1 had a scientific background, expert number 2 will be a 'believer'). The parent should do an internet search, if the film has a contemporary setting. It can be supplemented by a trip to the library (or a hall of records, or police case files, or psychiatric records -- which might include a suspenseful break-in or impersonation); the newspaper archives, micro-film and micro-fiche will reveal the buried secrets, and provide the details necessary to defeating the evil doll. Dead languages work wonders on dead things, apparently; Latin is the way to go, but Aramaic is also good.

[NOTE: We all loved 'The Big Lebowski'. I'm not positive, but I think this is a different movie. It's got a different title, different actors, and they seem to be saying different things. Most of them aren't as funny. Even if you can get past a disappointment like that, you still might hate this movie.]For a Thomas Pynchon fan like myself, 'Inherent Vice' was shocking. The rich intellectual payoffs, cleverly cryptic humor and subtle satire was amazingly accessible. I didn't have to wade through super-dense prose of the kind that dances around the accretion disk and balances precariously above the event horizon, stretching space-time thin as one approaches the singularity generating Gravity's Rainbow -- escape velocity is frighteningly close to the speed of light, and transitioning from the spatial coordinates of Pynchon's story relative to Earth normal is like travelling into the future, breaking free of Gravity's pull to find that 25 hours have passed between paragraphs... plotlines traverse narrative wormholes to seemingly random points in time and space. Compared to his 1974 National Book Award-winning classic, 'Inherent Vice' almost qualified as a... 'page-turner'. Like Norman Mailer's 'Tough Guys Don't Dance', Denis Johnson's 'Angels', 'Jesus Son' and 'Already Dead', and Cormac McCarthy's 'No Country For Old Men', Pynchon was testing his literary prowess against some tough hombres -- Dashiell Hammett, Raymond Chandler, and Jim Thompson, the unholy trinity of crime fiction and Noir-Lit; and in particular, L.A. Noir.The adaptation of 'No Country for Old Men' was an anomaly, a rare celestial phenomenon. America's greatest living writer, Cormac McCarthy, provided a transcendent novel of Borderland-Noir that was seemingly made to be adapted by Joel and Ethan Coen, America's greatest living film-makers.'Inherent Vice' is another rare example of perfect stellar and planetary alignment. Paul Thomas Anderson created a late millennial classic with 'Boogie Nights'; but his 2007 adaptation of the Upton Sinclair novel 'There Will be Blood', was a masterpiece... in the spirit of strange coincidences, 'There Will Be Blood' lost the Best Picture Oscar to 'No Country For Old Men', and Anderson lost out to the Coen's for Best Director and Best Adapted Screenplay. His previous film, 'The Master' was another huge cinematic achievement, a very subtle satire and character study that examined a Scientology-like belief system, and the Hubbard-clone guru behind it all.So now, with `Inherent Vice', America's second best writer-director-auteur has adapted a work of crime-fiction by America's second best novelist. Not that numbers like that ever mean or say anything beyond the person handing them out. This film has the feel of 'The Big Sleep' if Chandler had been a hippie, a joyously, purposely convoluted tale of strange literal and philosophical bedfellows. While I read 'Inherent Vice', I had a problem that comes up very rarely, in that I was unable to cast Doc Sportello from my database. In another strange symmetry, the same rare problem came up as I read McCarthy's sparse descriptions of Anton Chigurh. Neither Joaquin Phoenix nor Javier Bardem seemed like good casting choices when I learned of them; but by the time the credits rolled, both men had become those characters forever more. Phoenix is brilliant as Sportello, resisting the urge to channel the literally undead soul of Jeff 'Lebowski' Bridges. And Llewelyn Moss himself, Josh Brolin, is the hilariously ambitious `Renaissance Cop', Bigfoot Bjornsen.`Inherent Vice' is comic Noir, played straight for the most part, but with an ingeniously serpentine, Chandleresque plot.Doc's former love, Shasta, turns up after a long silence and ask him for a favor. She wants Doc to use his DA's office connection -- his part-time girlfriend, Penny -- to make sure her new man, a rich, Jewish real-estate developer called Mickey Wolfman -- who surrounds himself with Nazi bikers -- doesn't get ripped off by his wife and HER lover. Doc reluctantly but professionally agrees. Business gets busier when an OG Crip hires him to seek out a prison pal named Glen from the Aryan Brotherhood, to collect money owed him from their joint-business in Chino. It seems like another unlikely alliance, AND it just so happens that Glen is one of the Nazi bikers working for Shasta's beau, Mickey Wolfman.First though, Doc visits the Wolfman estate, undercover, to meet the imposing Mrs. Wolfman, and her big, blond, Teutonic gigolo. Posing as a bank official trying to return money (when does that ever happen?), Mrs. Wolfman takes the bait, and hands over the `necessary documents' he requests. Doc now has a place to start on this scam investigation. Wandering through the Wolfman estate, the sexy Mexican maid shows him Mickey's tie collection, all embroidered with detailed nude likenesses of his many lovers. The maid points herself out... and helpfully points out Shasta too.When his search for this biker named Glenn leads him to a brothel, Doc gets beaver-sapped. He wakes up somewhere else, surrounded by cops, lying next to a murdered corpse - as it turns out, it's Glen, the Nazi biker he was hired to find. It looks bad, but Bigfoot is playing it cute, and kicks him loose for suspicious reasons. Bigfoot has connections no detective should have with Wolfman, even donning an afro to star in the TV spots about the latest condo development project. Another client is waiting when he gets back, a toothless but attractive twenty-something former-junkie-turned-mom, played by Jena Malone. She sends him off to find a supposedly dead Junkie jazz-man played by Owen Wilson... Doc is warned by the friendly girl from the brothel (where he was knocked out and framed for the death of Mickey Wolfman's Nazi biker pal) that the jazz junkie is connected to a cryptic threat she calls `The Golden Fang'... An ominous sobriquet for someone who may be choreographing all these unlikely confluences.That may have sounded like it contained many spoilers, but it did not; that craziness is just the beginning of Paul Thomas Anderson's latest masterpiece. The director and author recreate the disjointed atmosphere that may or may not have pervaded 1970 Los Angeles. Pynchon takes the free love philosophy and LSD paranoia to the absurdities of its logical conclusion. A Jewish landbaron makes himself a Nazi king-pin; Black Panthers plot with the Aryan Brotherhood. Cops cavort with gangsters, and beat up Hippies for a couple joints. A burnt-out hippie P.I. named Doc sleeps with an assistant D.A. named Penny. Everyone f**ks everyone, except the person they're married to.This is film perfection, of a kind that drives some people from the theater in disgust. If you ask them about it, they never admit that it was the perfection that triggered their fight or flight reflex, but it was. You might have to spend a few minutes getting to the bottom of the complex psychological factors at work, but the truth is its own reward. In my own personal experience, some unenlightened movie-goers take it as a personal insult when you explain to them that they actually liked a film they insist they hated, and that they're only lying to hide their sexual attraction to butterflies. It's crazy to think that in 2015, people still take offence when you address them as lying butterfly molesters. Caterpillars, that's a different matter entirely. Running after people who flee cinematic perfection might seem like a strange pursuit, but when its all done, if my jaw hasn't been broken by a vicious beating, it makes me smile. Anyway...This is also the best book-to-big screen adaptation I've seen since `No Country For Old Men'. Speaking of which, Josh Brolin is great as Bigfoot, capturing his sly intelligence and over-confidence. But Joaquin Phoenix once again proves he's on another level, acting the hell out of this beast. It's only January, but this will definitely be near the top of my 10 best films of 2015.P.S.: It'll be interesting to see if anyone picks up the proverbial gauntlet Anderson's thrown down. While he definitely cherry-picked the Pynchon novel best suited for film, it wasn't easy to translate some of the novel's subtlest humor and satire, but he did it, and he did it well. Maybe Tyrone Slothrop, 'sexual V-2 rocket anticipator' -- and very bad one-night-stand -- will make it to the big screen. Or maybe not.

This denim jacket is awesome. It has weight to it, but it's not bulky like a man's denim jacket. There always seems to be a problem in this arena - it's always too thick or too thin - but Wrangler has this in the Goldilocks zone - it's just right. I wear an XL in most items, but I cannot get this buttoned together - it runs just a wee bit small. Despite this, it looks great on. No one would know I couldn't button it unless they saw me attempting to do so. The material is both denim and stretchy - so it moves with you when you're putting on your seat belt or doing just about anything else. I really dig this jacket - and now I have an extra motivation to lose a few pounds so I can button this thing!

Ok - I am officially impressed by this handheld mic. It has a standard XLR input at the bottom of the mic to make it compatible with any professional equipment. The included adapter allows you easily plug the mic into your iPhone, iPad or other smart device with a 3.5mm input jack. I tested the microphone at distances of 1", 2", 4", 6" and 12" from my mouth as I spoke on video. The quality is amazing - especially for a modestly priced unit. I had another similarly priced microphone at work that was abysmal. This mic does not have noise canceling - so if you use it out in the field, you will pick up ambient sound and noises - even conversations in the background... but the person holding the mic will be the prominent, bold sound/voice on your recording.  This is not a directional shotgun mic, so you will definitely need a fairly quiet environment if you want to conduct an interview or even just pontificate on our own without distracting background noise, but that is to be expected with this type of mic. No app needed. No batteries. It just works. The unit comes with a faux leather zip bag for carrying and a mic holder that can mount on a mic stand.

As the October weather brings interesting barometric changes in our part of Texas, so come the joint pains. As I get older, these pains get more gnawing and while I get significant relief from Aleve, it's not something I want to take every day due to the way it taxes liver function. I have been seeking out natural remedies for my minor maladies and my doctor mentioned Turmeric as an anti-inflammatory. I was delighted to read that Ubervita's version of turmeric is GMO-free. After days of waking up, feeling like my hands had been run over with steam-rollers, the tumeric has been a source of relief for my aching joints. I've only taken it for a couple of days and am enjoying the relief and that it's natural. Ubervita packs the turmeric with fruit of black pepper, which boosts the way turmeric is absorbed into the body. This trumps just using turmeric as a seasoning. Ubervita has some really good supplements... and these babies are in easy-to-swallow capsules.

I'm a Mac user, but I'm married to a major PC geek. He does Windows support where he works, helping users with Windows 7 and 8, knowing that Windows 10 will be coming to the organization soon. He already has Windows 10 set up at home and has learned a lot from his own research, but he has found this Windows 10 Bible very useful. His assessment, and mine as well, is that this is a solid reference book for any level. Even a complete newbie to the platform and a non-geek can find what they're looking for in this large volume. The book is thick and heavy - loaded with screenshots and examples. The index is thick and thorough. This is a great go-to manual for all things Windows 10.

I have never been diagnosed with celiac disease, but as I've gotten older, I have had a far more delicate tummy than I've ever had. The simplest, 'harmless' foods will sometimes tear me up. A coworker of mine, who has been told she definitely does not have celiac disease, started a gluten-free lifestyle and she swears it has changed her life. She says her gastric upset is down to nearly zero. Her gluten-free lifestyle is pretty expensive, though - and right now, completely impractical for me... so I decided to try these enzymes by Jarrow before each meal. What a difference. I cannot tell you how many times I've had to excuse myself from a staff meeting at work because my innards felt like they were going to unfold right there - and for now, those emergency exits are far less frequent thanks to these enzymes. So - am I gluten intolerant? I don't think so, necessarily, but I've definitely become more sensitive the past few years. I'd like to blame GMO foods, but since such foods are never labeled, it's hard to know that that is indeed the culprit. Either way, these Jarro-Zymes sure do seem to help. I was scared to try something new that could negatively affect the work day, so I experimented during the weekend and saw good results and am now starting to take the enzymes before lunch at work. So far, so good.

These easy-to-swallow capsules (three cheers for not being horse pills!!) work great in knocking out a UTI. The past few years, it seems all I have to do is be awake, or not drink enough water and I turn into my mom's cat - boom - a urinary tract infection - or at least discomfort leading up to one. As I had the hints of another UTI, I took just one of these as directed on the label (once, 3 times a day) and by the time my 2nd dose was due, I had already felt almost complete relief. I took a second and third dose that day just to make sure I knocked that sucker out completely - but I was very impressed with the speed at which I felt relief. Granted, I took my first dose at the first inkling of an issue - but these supplements by Ubervita are not *just* cranberry fruit extract. They have other extracts - of dandelion root, bromelain and others known for their ability to increase bladder and urinary tract health. All the other cranberry supplements I have used in the past were just that - cranberry. Ubervita's supplements are so much more, and I got a much faster result. These are going to be my go-to babies from now on!

Love, love, love these Rubis tweezers. I've had a facial hair problem for over 35 years and I have a few stubborn spots where there is no telling what is going to sprout out. Either a super fine hair I can barely see, or some type of walrus whisker that is as thick as rebar and appears to have roots going to my jaw bone. Regardless of the length, thickness, texture or how deeply rooted these stray hairs happen to be, I can grab the hairs firmly and remove them, root and all, with these super precise tweezers. Lesser quality tweezers meet most people's needs except for when extreme precision is required. The finish on these tweezers is a feat in modern manufacturing. I've also used these tweezers to remove fine splinters - and again, just the best tweezers I have ever used.

In a word: WOW. I have never been disappointed in a Bose product and this is no exception. We had a very satisfactory sound system with our JBL subwoofer and other speakers, but in comparison, it was like we were listening to 2 cans and some string when compared to the Bose.Set up did take a couple of hours. We have a 10-year-old HDTV. It is HD, but it's also a CRT - and we have a mix of older and some newer equipment that took some fiddling to make everything jibe.The unit has no physical buttons on it - so this is not a remote you want to let get lost in your cushions or be a chew toy for your dog. The remote is required to use the soundbar.We tried piping in some music via Pandora and the quality was excellent, across several different genres/styles of music. No rattle or hum - just beautiful, crisp, yummy sound.We saw the season intro to "The Walking Dead" with the Soundbar and enjoyed a whole new level of sound thanks to Bose technology. From gunshots, explosions, honking horns to gurgling zombies, the sound was all around us. A horn honking in the distance sounded like a horn honking in distance - not just a faint horn on a speaker. This is not a true surround sound system, but the experience is in no way diminished when watching a movie. The soundbar has a very small footprint. It's mounted on our wall and looks beautiful, like part of the design of the room.The whole system is both beautiful to look at as well as to listen to. The free SoundTouch app allows you to stream music from your favorite iDevice via Bluetooth, so you're not just stuck with the ports on the back as far as input is concerned.This is definitely the best sound system we have ever owned and we also love the minimalistic, unobtrusive design.

Love this thing. I know it was intended for carrying lipstick or lip balm, but I use this to carry some precision tweezers. I've had facial hair problem for 35 years and once in a while, a hair will decide to sprout right while I'm at work and I always like to have tweezers easily on hand. The zipper never slips or opens on its own. The lobster-claw like hook also stays closed unless you choose to disengage it from your keychain, zipper pull or anything else you might have it hooked to.

This is a nice grippy case. It is an interesting feeling case - it is not overly rigid, yet it is not flimsy and doesn't just let the phone pop out of the case. If you are particular about the color phone you've chose and want to show it off, this Speck case lets you do that. The case has just enough side padding to give some protection around the edges without adding a ton of size - and it definitely makes it easier to grip the case. All the ports are accessible even to 3rd party cords that are sometimes a bit larger on the ends than Apple's cords. The buttons are still easy to use with this case. All around winner.

Artichoke leaf extract is good for bile production to help detox the body, which is why I got these supplements. Like most heavy people, I have an enlarged liver. I know this from the doctor's observations when I had my gastric sleeve procedure. These supplements worked a little too well for me, ironically, so I have had to stop taking them. I am apparently very sensitive to artichoke and I suffered with increased acid reflux at night for the week I was taking these and intense headaches and eventually overwhelming sadness for no reason. These are all byproducts of the liver going into overdrive. I think if I kept taking them, things would improve, but I am just too much of a wimp to continue. The headaches were crippling and the sense of malaise I had last night was overwhelming and came out of nowhere. The only thing in my life that has changed was these supplements, so after hours of online research, I have figured out that these supplements are indeed working, but I am too sensitive to the ingredients to continue taking them. I first had the epiphany this morning as I reached for this bottle to take my daily dose and I skipped taking the pills to do the aforementioned online research instead.These puppies definitely work. I think it's like getting rid of candida - you can suffer as the candida dies, but the suffering is worth it once you kill off the yeast overgrowth... so if you're having issues with your liver and gall bladder, these supplements are definitely worth a try... I just had to tap out early. I'd love to hear from other people who have tried these to see how long the symptoms might last - I'd love to try them again if I knew the side effects were fairly short term. Again, I don't believe the side effects I was experiencing were from the supplements themselves, rather from the detox that the supplements were helping to cause.

My father-in-law is an avid golfer and took me to a nearby course to check out these irons. My golfing experience has been previously limited to Putt-Putt, so you cannot get more green than me. My father-in-law is far from pro-level, but he has been playing for over 40 years and has quite the collection of clubs. I went in with a semi-formal golf lesson and he tried the clubs as well so he could give me his take.Both my father-in-law and I found these very easy to grip. He wears gloves, I do not, but I did compare the use of these irons with his older set of cheaper irons and there is a definite different feel all the way around. They feel solid and well balanced through the entire swing. I am a poor judge of performance, since I am so new at this, but my father-in-law made a lot of comments regarding the use and performance of these clubs.My father-in-law has been using the same set of clubs for about 8 years and was happy with them until he tried these irons. He said that he was getting another 10 yards out of the same swing nearly every time. They're a little lighter than his clubs, but in no way are they 'too' light. He said the clubs were more forgiving because there was more area on the business end of the club to hit the ball with. He also mentioned that with the slightest adjustment to hi stroke, he was able to make the balls fly straighter and with his regular irons.

This paddle is lots of fun. I am not a professional player, but I do love table tennis and I'm perhaps a little better than the average home player (at least I am in my own mind!). I can definitely feel a weight balance improvement over some of the cheaper rackets I have. It's easy to hold in the hand and the balance is really nice. I find it much easier to create a spin with my back swing with this STIGA Supreme model and there is very little vibration, so I'm not as fatigued after several rounds. Really well made.

I'm pretty impressed with how soft this has made my hair. My hair is naturally curly and dry and even when I put Moroccan oil on it and flat ironing my hair, it only lasts for a few hours before the electrified frizzies start showing up at the top of my head. So far, even hours after using it, my hair is soft to the touch and not one stray frizzy hair. This is without using oil or a flat iron, too. Just the TRESemme shampoo and nothing else. I can tell you, the label is true to its name - it is moisture rich. I cannot stop touching my hair!

I am very impressed with this beautiful, sturdy gear closet / cabinet. It's versatile so that it can meet your needs and is beautiful enough to be in your home, not just your garage. The hanging rod height is adjustable, as is shelf placement, so whether you're hanging a winter coat or a shop light, you can adjust to the right height for your needs.The tread plate design is very stylish. The black trim with the fire engine type tread plate design will work with almost any decor - whether it goes in your man/lady cave or garage or barn, it will fit in nicely with such neutral black and silver colors. I like that it's easy to add casters, making rearrangement of this and future Gladiator cabinets all the more easy to accomplish.The shipping weight is just under 150 lbs, so you may need assistance getting it into your house or garage. Assembly, however, is an easy feat for just about anyone. The ingenious 'tab and loop' design allows for very quick assembly - so you will go from delivery to use in about 20 minutes.I really dig this gear closet cabinet!

This is the perfect cable to carry in my laptop bag so I can charge my phone. It takes up very little room, doesn't tangle, and is the exact length I need to have my iPhone right next to my laptop as it's charging. Too much cable means I can accidentally get snagged on it, sending the laptop or iPhone (or both!) flying. Belkin makes really nice gizmos and this cable is no exception. I really like the metallic ends. Unlike Apple's white cables, these don't get dingy right away, and the cable is stiff - it is designed not to tangle or fray, which is the number one problem w/ iPhone cables today. As long as the cable is powered before plugging into the phone or iPad, there is no annoying pop-up saying the cord/accessory is not certified. Personally, I think Apple should remove these annoying pop-ups. Instead, there should possibly be a symbol over the battery w/ a question mark so that you don't have to dismiss a dialog because you got a 3rd party cable. It's just not consumer friendly, and not Belkin's fault. Their cable works just fine... works great, actually. Zero complaints.

This is a beautiful piece of equipment. Sounds cheesy, but the case itself is beautifully textured in design and the unit is remarkably light weight - doesn't even seem like it could be a real piece of electronics. As a Blu-Ray player, this thing is awesome. The menu is very easy to use and the playback is great. If it were solely a Blu-Ray device, it would get 5 stars for playability and user interface. Win-win. It fails in the Netflix department, however. We are heavy Netflix users. We get Blu-Ray discs in the mail and frequently binge-watch shows, especially when we're between seasons. This LG unit freezes up a lot during Netflix playback. At first, we thought maybe it was buffering - but no - it completely freezes and becomes unresponsive to the point we have to unplug it and plug it back in. This happened on several occasions. We had hoped this would be the replacement for the Sanyo unit we have in our living room due to the line of sight remote being very finicky... but this thing is unusable for us due to the problems it has with Netflix, so we gave it to the kids so they could watch Blu-Ray discs and DVDs.

I got this for my friend who lives in Oceanside, California. She loves water sports, including snorkeling. It's still a little cold out on the water, but she gave it a go as soon as this kit from Phantom Aquatics arrived. She went to La Jolla to try out the snorkel and fins and had a great time.The mask fit her face very well and snugly and the fins gave her great propulsion and ease of movement in the water. She said it was the best snorkeling equipment she's ever used and is impressed with the solid construction of all the materials. She said putting on the mask and adjusting it was a breeze.The snorkel is the dry type and it can clip to the mask.The mesh bag is a nice addition and easy way to carry the gear from the beach back to the car.

I got these for my aunt and she is very impressed with them. She rarely has leaks, but she will sometimes get the sudden urge to go and it will be sudden and without warning and she simply cannot make it to the restroom in time. This started about a year ago and it started turning her into a bit of a shut-in, because she was terrified of having an accident in public.She had tried adult diapers before, but wasn't comfortable wearing them - she said they made her hot and uncomfortable - and there's  a whole psychological element to wearing diapers as an adult, anyway.Now that she's used these for a few days, she's far more confident and is making extended outings. She had to take a medication that kinda knocked her out and she was wearing one of these bladder control pads when she fell asleep. When she woke up a few hours later, she realized she had completely emptied her bladder while she was asleep. She was dry, rash free, and nothing got on her pajama bottoms or the bed.She was floored that a small, discreet pad like this could absorb that much - and since that incident was a one time extreme event, she's very confident that the Prevail pads will be more than sufficient for her as she runs errands, goes shopping, etc. She keeps a couple of spare pads in her purse, just in case. She likes the small size and can confidently wear pants without anything bulging anywhere.

My nephew owns a number of instruments, including a 3 5-string electric basses and he was anxious to try out the strings. He likes a variety of strings for each instrument as some performances call for different effects.After he strung his bass with these light/medium strings and played a bit, he had this feedback:1. The strings were well wound within in the package - they did not fling out or flail around.2. He noted that there was no fraying on either end.3. The sound is rich and full. He said that some lesser brands, you can tell by ear which are the heavier gauge strings and which ones aren't.4. He usually uses a string lubricant on his strings, but says he doesn't need the string lube on these strings due to the nano-web coating.5. He said the lighter strings gave enough play to lessen fatigue. He has some need for some pieces to have even lighter strings, but said that these definitely have their place in selection of instruments and stringing options.6. He noted the strings were simply shinier than what he was used to - really radiant, 'new' look to them he doesn't see in most brands.He was pleased with the action, sound and even the appearance of the strings.He is very pleased with the strings and said he will be using this brand from now on.

Unique and multlayered setting in this ring. It has a 3D appearance. The ruby colored and peridot colored stones go well together. The stones are sparkling with a excellent cut. The surface of this ring is about the size of a quarter.  The open shank is lovely.  The metal has a smokey platinum look to it. Very lovely and good quality.  You won't see this ring coming and going. It is very uniquely styled. Thanks Yazilind

2.7 oz is a large size bottle. This is a spray Parfum.  La Perla is a beautiful fragrance. It has a scent all it's own. Unique, It  doesn't smell like any other fragrance out there.. It's a sexy rich scent that is just very slightly fruity. It's not really sweet though.  It subtle but packs a senory punch. I've gotten these comment: "what is your perfume? . " what are you wearing?". "Oh, you smell good" . I first discovered this parfum while working at Neiman's. I was given samples for selling the La Perla lingerie. It's French and it smells so good....delicious. Another good thing. you won't smell yourself coming and going..  La Perla is more widely known for it's expensive lingerie, The asking price for this large size bottle is outstanding. A real deal.If wanting a unique signature fragrance, I highly recommend La Perla. They make another fragrance, but this one is the Original. . The other one is powdery with citrus undertones.  I love this one. It's my absolutely favorite scent.

I purchsed the brown color. It is really a tan/caramel color. It matches the signature Dooney and Bourke leather trim on that is on so many of their handbags.  This wallet is nice quality leather, but not quite as substantial as it appears in photo.  The leather has a glaze.  The wallet is nicely stitched, has a flap closure that snaps together and a small embossing of the designer name(notice photo). The color in  the wallet is not blotchy as photographed. It's a even saturation of color.  It's close to 8" in length.The zipper is goldtone with an attached metal tab for easy zipping and unzipping. Zippers work smoothly and with ease. Inside.the front of portion of this wallet are 14 slots for credit cards, one slot for a photo ID, and a couple of sections for a few bills. This area is done in the glazed leather. The zippered portion of this wallet has another  zippered area to hold coins. Nice touch; that zipper also a little tab for ease of use. This area of the wallet is lined with a heavier weight satin fabric in a beautiful cocoa brown (in the brown color).  I believe the satin is dyed to coordinate with the wallet's color, whatever it may be. Beside the coin compartment, there are 2 areas to hold many dollar bills. This part of the wallet can easily hold a 6" smart phone.The only thing I would have preferred is.... when opening, the area was the glazed leather, instead it's sueded. Also, the opening flap is is sueded on it's reverse side; however,  this is a excellent wallet at a great price point.  I have a few Dooney and Bourke handbags and this wallet works with all of them. Again it is the perfect match for their standard leather trim. If you own Dooneys, there's no need to buy a lot of different wallets. The brown color is perfect.

This are beautiful stylish earrings. The plating is done very well...looks like 14k. The stones are beautiful and sparkling. The design is unique and the closure works well. The are about the size of a penny and the east/west design is attractive. They look much more expensive than the actual cost.  I'm pleased with the company.  They sell qualilty jewelry that looks precious. Thanks Yazilind

Really big and bulky looking. It doesn't look or feel like leather. That's not to say it isn't, but it doesn't look like it. What I really didn't like is the attachable shoulder strap. It doesn't attach correctly. It twisted and it is very cheap looking.

The cast of characters are so good in this series. Great acting.  All are well adapted from the book...very believable.  They all have the personalities described in the books.  Nancy is as mature as she seems in the books. The problem is the storylines are not developed. It ends just as story gets interesting. There is absolutely no development of a mystery.With this series, we get a  Nancy and the gang we can really relate to....but no mysteries. It's too bad, because this could have been a really good series. This needed to be an hour show.

I'll keep this review short and to the point. The filtered water taste outstanding!  There is really a difference in the taste of clean water.  Better than any bottled water I've tried....and I've tried most of 'em.  Super easy to set up; remove the lid, take filter out of package, pop into it's slot, add cold water and replace lid. It takes less than 5 minutes for the 18 cups of water to go through the filter. This dispenser and the pitcher both use the same replacement filters. Filters last approximately 2 months according to Mfg. Our fellow reviewer, Smith, says they last a lot longer. I certainly going to try his suggestions.  Thanks Brita, Reviewer Smith and Amazon.

Embossed leather wallet has beautiful tool work detailed in the flowers and leaves. The flowers are roses. I purchased the grey. In that color the background is deep beige taupe with painted grey flowers. Some of the leaves are painted a deeper greyThe leather is sturdy and durable. It's soft, but very structured leather.  The zipper is excellent quality and works beautifully...no tugging, catching, or pulling. The zipper fabric is dyed to match the background of the wallet. The zipper itself is gold tone and the hardware on this wallet is also gold tone and has a heart attached. The metal on the heart is very solid and has a crystal embedded into it.The inside is deep enough to hold a 5" phone. This wallet has 5 compartments for dollar bills, A zippered coin compartment and 8 credit card slots. The size is perfect for credit card. Deep enough and wide enough. The card slots are leather and the zippered coin compartment is fabric....also dyed to match the exterior background.  There are inside pockets on either side of the credit card slots. These pockets will hold a few bills. The other 3 compartments for bills, will hold many dollars.  Great price for a quality wallet...looks much more expensive than it cost. The list price is accurate.  Thanks, Amazon

Quite unique. Beautifully gold filled hands holding the tiny gems. I purchased the red. It looks like ruby. These are small earring. The workmanship in the hands are great.... detailed precision of the fingers adds to their beauty. The backing are good quality and substantial as shown. Thanks, Yazilind

My fellow reviewer is so right. These are quality earrings. Nothing flimsy and cheap about the quality or workmanship. Beautiful stones and excellent gold plating. These are about 1/2" in length and 3/8" in width. The back of earrings has a lovely filigree design, so earring can also be worn in reverse with only the gold showing.The earrings will close securely, but it may be necessary to move the post slightly upward. I found I had to move the post on one of my earrings for them to close. The posts are very sturdy and able to be moved, without any concern of them breaking. Actually, the posts are so sturdy, it's a little difficult to move them. I highly recommend. No need to spend lots of money, if wanting a beautiful pair of earrings. These are gorgeous and good quality. Much prettier than a similar style in average quality diamond.

These shoes are very nice quality in material and sturdy construction.  Not leather, but certainly has the look and feel of good quality leather.  Easy to clean and comfortable to wear. The side zip makes for easy on and off with no laces to come untied while wearing.The shoes fit true to size and width. There isn't typical arch support; however, the heel area of these shoes are slightly built up in the interior. This gives some support for the arches. The Black color has a very nice sheen to it. The quilting features really adds to the attractiveness of these shoes.  Nice durable sole add to the quality. Lighter weight on the feet. These are an all around great quality, attractive, and comfortable shoes in a variety of colors. I purchased the black, red and caramel colors. The red is a true brick red, (not lipstick).  Very pleased.

Gorgeous Earrings. This are lovely sparkling earrings. The stones have a beautiful cut, they are good quality and sparkling...all of them. They are bead set and the workmanship is as good as  fine jewelry. There's  detail work on the back of the setting.  The plating is done very well and will hold up.  This post is located in the center. These earrings have "bullet" backings.  They are about the size of a dime.I love jewelry and usually don't go for costume jewelry. For these prices and the unusual styles they carry, I couldn't resist. I'm glad I didn't  Yazilind sells some beautiful quality jewelry. My expectations have been far exceeded.  Besides the quality, they sell uniquely designed jewlery.  I have purchased several pieces from them and am pleased with all of it. They are other sellers from China selling very inexpensive jewelry. I have ordered some from them, but Yazilind has consistently the best quality hands down and the best delivery times.Delivery was speedy. I received well before the estimated date.  I couldn't be more pleased with this seller.  Thanks, Yazilind

These are nice looking and comfortable. Lite arch support.  Not as substantial as they look in the photo.  The reviewers images are more accurate. They are a good decent shoe  that washes well and are lightweight.

This is a beautifully styled handbag. It has a double zip closure. Opens wide because it has gussets on each side. The lining is the traditional red cotton. This Dooney has a phone pocket and a snap closure pocket on one side. On the other side is a zippered pocket and an open pocket. I know this brand and this is most certainly the real deal. It comes with it's registration and identifying serial numbers. The price is about 50 bucks less than purchasing in store or from QVC.Actually QVC is selling at least one Dooney and Bourke handbag that is described as leather, but it isn't. I know.  I bought it and returned it. It was vinyl with a PVC shoulder strap and a resin(plastic) red lining. 298.00...no joke. Really tacky. With this company, you may not be able to get all the available colors in each style and they don't have all the current styles, but the prices are great. Free shipping, too.  Thanks, I Love Dooney and of course, Amazon.

This bra fits true to size. The straps are comfortable enough for me, but they are not padded; however, they are made of a thicker material.  The mesh panel does not come up near the clavicles, but it does cover any cleavage. It's important to note, the cups have no stretch in them,,,none. It is important to get the proper cup size. I find the band fits true to size.  The over the shoulder strap will show in the front when wearing  some sleeveless tops, but the front has the appearance of a camisole, so it doesn't look like the bra strap is showing. It looks like you have a cami underneath your top.  In the back, the bra hooks lower and the straps are narrower.  So,  it looks like a cami in the front and sort of a racerback style from the back. While wearing, I feel very supported and "held together". My breast don't bounce around in this bra. This is a supportive and comfortable bra towear.  It gives good shaping as long as the proper cup size is worn.  If cups are too small, the breast will look smashed together. I really like this bra. I like the way  it shapes my breast and holds them up. Also, the like the feeling of not having to "adjust" my bra when wearing.  I can bend over, jump around, twist, etc....and this bra stays put.

This cardigan is overpriced. The quality is just average. The button holes will fray. They're not stitched nicely.  It is 100 percent cotton, lightweight for a summer cardigan. I'm 5"5. This cardigan fall to my lover hip. It has a little banding around the sleeves and hemline.  I'm keeping it. This will suit my purpose, but it's not worth more than 20 bucks. Woman Within is slowing inching up to Land's End prices, but too many of their items are lacking good quality. For instance some of their cotton tees are almost 3 times as much as they were a couple of years ago, but the quality of the cotton has decreased. I bought some beautiful quality  V neck cotton tees from Land's End. I got 3 for a litte over 30.00 and the quality of cotton is fantastic...nice weight, shaped,  no shrinkage, etc...

This phone is okay. The sound quality is not very good, at times. Especially when using the extensions. At times, I notice a lot of "breaking up"  I was a little disappointed in that. I bought this phone to replace my previous, poor sound quality, phone.The features on the phone are good....the talking caller ID and built in answering machine, large keypad on base unit, speed dial, locator, and built in phonebook. l

One of the most beautiful quality cz engagement rings I've seen. Nothing chintzy looking about the setting. The stone is beautiful It's a round solitaire set in 4 prongs that are substantial  giving the stone a squared appearance. With the way it's set, this looks to be about 1/3cttw. even though this is actually 20 points. If wanting a slightly larger stone, they do carry a 25 point solitaire in this same style for 13 bucks.. The shank of the setting has a combination of brushed and polished metal. I like solitaire rings and this one would definitely make a fine engagement ring. No one but you would know it isn't diamond and a 10. ring at that.I recommend to anyone who has limited funds or doesn't wear diamond, and likes smaller stones.  This company makes this ring and all their solitaires available in silver, 14k, diamond, cz, and often moissanite  To see selections,  note code listed under "estimated shipping date" right beneath the product photo. They offer a large selection of sizes to provide an exact fit.

So Pretty and striking. This set is well made.. I think any of the color choices offered will be stunning. This set looks so fresh for Spring/Summer. It will amp up any outfit. The enameling is done well, the stones are good quality. The adjustable chains looks good. I think it will adjust up to 20"..maybe 22"  The earring come with plastic backs. I changed those to metal ones that I own. Very, very good price point for this set. If purchased in the US, this set would easily cost 5 or 6 times what the purchase price is.

The ring is pretty and very dainty. It's not a substantially made as it appears in the photo. The hands and detailing work along the band is "flatter" than it appears in the photo. It looks as inexpensive as it cost. I returned the ring, because the stone fell out about a week after I purchased it.

These are even prettier than photographed. They're round, but have a slight oval appearance on the ears. The quality and workmanship is excellent. The weight of the metal, the closing mechanisms and polish of the plating are all quality workmanship. The stones are very pretty, well cut, and sparkling. The gold filled plating looks like 14k, It's done very well. They're beautiful quality earrings.  Larger than a huggie hoop, these are about 3/4" in length.Yazilind has beautiful quality costume jewelry, that looks like precious jewelry.  The prices are outrageously low for the quality.  I think It's because the dollar is much stronger than the Chinese currency??  I just know love their jewelry. Originally, I purchased on a whim and have since bought several pieces and am pleased with all my purchases.

This earrings are lovely. The gold plating is done very well and the stone sparkle beautifully. In length, they are about 3/4".  They definitely aren't huggie hoops.I needed to adjust the posts to get earrings to close properly. I had to move the post downward. The posts are sturdy enough to move  without the risk of  breaking. At the end of the post is a built in hook.  This allows the posts to hook into the back of the earrings very securely..notice photo. I don't usually go for costume jewelry, but for these prices, I purchased several pieces from this company. I like every piece I've gotten from them. They are good quality, sturdy metal, beautiful stones and it looks as if the plating will hold up well. In appearance, these look much more expensive that what they cost.

Beautiful Quality Earrings. I purchased the green and red. They really look like emerald and ruby.  The setting is nice and heavy, but not too weighty.  It's a little over an 1/2" in length.  I highly recommend.  The only thing I would change....I wish bar that goes into the ear was shorter. I don't have meaty earlobes, so I use a post to keep earrings from sliding.

The table and the bench are solid and of good quality,  but the surface scratches too easily on the table.  The chair are just junk. I purchased this set about a year ago and I replaced the chairs with sturdier ones. The screws in the chairs become loose, because the screws are located in a position that is difficult to even tighten well during assembly.  My chairs fell apart, and the finish comes off too easily.  The chairs are also quite small. in height and in the seat width.  Don't be too heavy and sit in on of these chairs, unless wanting to end up on the floor. The cherrywood cclor is very attractive...It looks black with a hint of red undertone.I purchased this set to  use as a space filler. We don't sit down have have daily meals in these chairs and they are still falling apart. I would not recommend this set. I ended up spending  another 200 bucks to replace the chairs. I could have gotten a nicer quality set for the 500. we ended up spending with replacing the chairs

Really bad fit. These shoes are especially wide around the ankles. They are huge, even though I ordered my regular size. In order to wear them for work, I had to put on two pairs of socks. Too bad the fit is so poor. The leather is decent and the zipper is a good feature if wanting to avoid laces, but they are designed to be as wide at the ankle area,  as they are are the widest part of the foot. I wouldn't recommend these, not even for people that have thicker ankles. They are poorly designed.  I use for house slippers now.

I wear a 42ddd and these are a perfect fit for me. They help eliminate back fat because they are very smooth. fitting. The band doesn't roll, neither is it too tight. It has a full cup coverge and no uniboob look.  These are very flattering.  I find them very easy to pull over my head, but they could be stepped into. They are no hooks or any "hardware" on these bras.  .The fabric is nice quality and has a nice weight.  Since my breast are heavy, I took the shoulder strap area in about an inch to shorten the straps. With that adjustment these bras offer just the right amount of support for my lifestyle. I wear them for any occasion. These are my regular bras.These are so comfortable.to wear. Perfect for hot weather, too. The only thing I didn't like was the removable padding. They don't stay in place while wearing, but they could be sewn into the bra if nipple coverage is an issue. The padding is just thick enough to eliminate the nipples showing through clothing.

These are great looking nails. They look just as good as Salon nails. The tab attached to the nails makes them easy to apply. These nails have a nice sheen to the finish...just like the Salon French Manicure. The nails are square shaped and pliable....not thick either. If wanting an oval shaped nail, these file easily, and unlike the Salon Gel French Manicure, the white tips are not compromised from the filing. I find they last about 10 days and I wash dishes, use bleach and mop without using gloves.I wear them regularly. I'm a Clinical Massage Therapist and we can't have any "white" of the nail showing...so we don't scratch our patients while massaging. I have a long nail bed, so the real short length gives me the illusion of having some nail length, when I actually don't.  What I like most about these is they don't damage my nails the way the Salon Gel Nails did.

Way Overpriced.  Get at you local supermarket if you can. There are 4.99 in Chicago. for the 6oz bag. Actually 4.99 is plenty to pay for 6oz of cookies. That said, these are super thin and super crunchy. The have buttery goodness in every bite.. If you like thin crispy cookies made without preservatives and artificial ingredients, you make like these.I prefer the "Salted Peanut Butter" flavor, instead of these. The chocolate taste is very mild and these cookies are too sweet for my taste. . The first ingredient is brown cane sugar. The peanut butter flavor list sugar as the first ingredient too,but the salted peanuts in those cookies balance the sweet taste.  The thin, crispy, crunchy texture is very satisfying.

These actually look like one very glittery diamond in each earring, instead of clusters. The setting is done much better that other cluster earrings I've seen. I bought a pair from QVC, more expensive than these,that clearly looked like a cluster of stones.  It is very difficult to distinguish the individual stones. The diamonds are very well set on a 10k metal plate and then the plate is set into a prong setting. The shape is more princess cut than round, but the diamonds are more glittery than a typical princess cut stone. The color is clear, without yellow or dark tinged stones.  The clarity is as stated, but in such small stones the overall appearance is brilliant, glittery and sparkling.I got at a 30 percent discount, which was great for me, but even at the regular price these are a good deal. We get the beauty, sparkle and the look of a pair of 3/4cttw diamond earrings that has 100 facets, These earrings are light weight and the posts are sturdy. The butterfly backs are a good size. The earrings don't droop. These nestle into the ear. they don't protrude. I recommend them if you want the "look" without spending a lot of bucks

Touch screen phone with no button to press.  Nice large number and letters to use when calling and texting. Very user friendly. Best phone I've gotten at this price.  Actually, I paid twice as much for a T-Mobile phone that wasn't a touch screen and wasn't user friendly and I wasn't able to access the internet. You can with this phone. The camera takes very clear pictures, even in poor lighting. The triple minutes are a bonus.  You can transfer your current number to this phone.  Activation is simple. The phone comes with 10 minutes to start. The reception on my phone is good. It's better than my previous T-Mobile phone. I couldn't even use that phone in my house.  I had to go outside to get reception. No problems using this one inside. The phone is streamline and measures about 3" by 5". Tracfone has various plans. For 19,99, I got 180 minutes that need to be used within the next 5 months. Minutes do carry over if more are purchased before the current minutes expire. Tracfone also offers monthly plans starting at 9.99. Monthly plans can be cancelled at anytime. This is a good phone whether it is to be used just occasionally for people that just want a phone for when they really need it, and it's a good phone for people that use the phone often, but do not want a contract.

Partially seasoned. These skillets need additional seasoning for their full cooking potential. Easy to do. Instead of baking the skillets for hours, just stir  fry  foods in them 2 or 3 times with oil. No special kind of oil is needed. Whatever is normally used  for frying or stir frying will work just fine. The skillet arrives with a greyish black color.  After frying in it just once, the skillet will turn completely black and gets better with each subsequent use.Excellent quality cast iron.  I purchased the 15".  It huge.  Not so great for frying meat. It's too big to heat evenly. It's so much bigger than the burners on my stove. I use it for pizza. This size will hold enough cornbread batter to feed half an army.

Excellent quality waterproof mascara that is build-able.  It doesn't clump or cause lashes to stick together. I have fine lashes and this mascara thickens and lengthens them. Easy to apply and it doesn't take but a couple of coats to see a real difference.  Makes the lashes look natural, instead of looking like caked on mascara.  I tried fake lashes that were applied at a salon....hated 'em.  Felt like heavy hoods on my eyelids.  This mascara is an excellent alternative to salon lashes.This mascara will give fuller thicker lashes with a formula that doesn't flake and will stay on, until taken off;  Feels light and non irritating.  Easily removed with oil or makeup remover. Waterproof formula is great for hot weather, and those who like to apply a little makeup when going to the gym. You won't sweat this off.UPDATE;  I received some mascara by "Make Up Forever", as a gift. I love that mascara! It really gives NATURAL looking volume to skimpy lashes. It's the best I used.

I've purchased tees from Woman Within for a few years. The quality of this cotton tee isn't very good. I purchased the white. The color isn't a bright white, but  more of a dull, ice cube white. While the tee is stitched together nicely. The cotton is thin and wrinkles easily.  It's "tired" looking after a couple of hours of wearing. It looks cheap.  Unfortunately, the price has increased from last year, too.  They were 6.99.  I won't purchase these in the future.I bought some really nice quality 100 percent cotton tees, in a similar style, from Target.  The white is bright and their color tees are vibrant.  I purchased 2 for 16 bucks.  The cotton is super smooth and beautiful quality.

This bracelet watch is so beautiful The glass beads are colorful and vibrant. The larger pieces are have free form shapes and are beautifully glazed pieces of glass.  It has a lobster claw clasp and many wrist sizes can wear this.  This will comfortably fit  5 1/2" to 8 1/2" wrists.  Even without the timepiece, this is a gorgeous bracelet.  The watch on this bracelet is very simple and understated. It falls nicely on the wrist.  The face is about the size of a nickel. Worth more than the inexpensive price. I would have easily paid 20 bucks for the bracelet alone.  It ships from China.  I received a couple of weeks earlier than estimated.I ordered several of these inexpensive timepieces. All priced under 10.  This style is my favorite.

This trike has no brakes, but you don't need 'em. On this smaller framed adult trike, back peddling and dropping the feet to the ground is enough to stop. The feet can easily touch the ground while seated....no need to stand. I purchased for my Mom.  She's 5"2.  I'm 5"5.  Neither of us have a problem stopping or controlling this trike. It's truly designed like a child's tricycle....just on a larger scale.  With the heavy duty wheels that almost look like tires, this bike doesn't pick up a lot of speed.  It can ride over rougher terrain. It's stable and secure.  Previously, I purchase a Schwinn trike with a basket.  I returned it. That one was 24", very unstable and hard to control, and cumbersome. It was also very heavy.  I'm strong, but needed help taking it up the stairs. This one weighs about 40 pounds. It's not too cumbersome. It has an attractive bright blue finish and a very comfortable, wide, padded seat.

This bra runs small.  In most other bras, I wear a 40DD. The 42DDD is the size for me in this bra.  While the fabric gives and is not stiff, there is no stretch in the cups. The cups are not lined but the nipples don't show through this fabric. While there is no "padding", the fabric is not that thin stretchy type.  This bra delivers on it's "back and side smoothing" claims. It does a great job of smoothing those areas. This bra offers great support, and uplift. No underwire needed. No uniboobs. It gives a really nice shaping to the breast.  The smooth and seamless cups are my favorite type of bra to wear. It gives a smooth look under clothing. The straps are wider, but not really padded; however, I find this bra comfortable  to wear all day,The DDD"s have 4 hooks in the back and,  4 areas, instead of the typical 3 ...to adjust the band. This is one of those bras that gives a very secure feel when wearing.  The best way to describe; you'll feel "all in", secure and supported.  I feel supported all the way around; cups, sides, back and shoulders. No falling straps, riding up in the back and no tugging the bra back into to place during the day. Once on, nothing is falling, riding up or jiggling. The bra is set into place and stays that way until taken off.  Can certainly be used as workout  bra, but unlike typical sports bras, the  "V" is deep enough to wear lower cut tops and show our cleavage when desired.  It doesn't look like a harness.  It is a great fitting bra.  I purchased 3 and appreciate the fit of this bra so much, I'm actually going to hand wash them as the manufacturer suggest.

They have changed the packaging..... and the formula.  I used to love this stuff.  If ordering this product, you will receive the new product in it's new packaging. Amazon needs to update the photo. This new formula includes a wide spectrum sunscreen. That sounds really good, but this new formula is so oily. I mean it's just downright greasy on the face. I wouldn't even recommend for someone with dry skin. Dry skin needs moisture not grease. Further, it doesn't cover imperfections and dark circles as well as the old formula. I used to use this one product as a foundation and under eye concealer. It did a great job.  If wanting to cover darkness from scars and really dark circles, this formula won't do it. It will lighten, but not cover. It also transfers very easily. What a waste of my 31 bucks.  A disappointment too, because now I have to find a new foundation...and concealer.

This is really a wristlet, not a fully functioning wallet, no room for a checkbook and displaying photos. This is ideal if not wanting to carry a purse.  It's big enough to carry a smart phone, credit cards, lipstick, dollar bills, and coins.It is stitched together nicely, but it is "stitched together" literally. The zipper is attached rather crudely, but the stitching is done neatly  It looks handmade and artisan crafted.  The hardware  is sturdy and so is the detachable wrist strap.  The  zipper is nicely sized and it zips and unzips smoothly.  This is not a "wallet" that can take overstuffing.  It won't hold up to being overstuffed.This is made of nice quality material. It appears like the Dooney and Bourke pebble leather in both the thickness and appearance.  I liked it well enough to order 3 in different colors.  If wanting a more traditional and excellent quality non leather wallet, I recommend purchasing the Mundi brand.
