They sell great quality wallets that are big enough to hold photos, plenty of credit and business cards. lots of coins, cash, checkbook, and a smart phone. The price is about 20 bucks.This is a great wallet for those that don't carry a lot, like that artisan look,  enjoy rich intense colors, and that pebble leather look and feel.

This dress is designed into a textured weave knit. It is heavier weight, This polyester/spandex fabric is too hot for summer weather. The cutouts are on both sides of the waist.  The skirty flounce of this dress has elastic all around the waistline to create the shirring. The dress runs small.  I purchased the XL. It's equivalent to a size 12.  For an average height woman this is knee length.There are a few things I don't like about this dress,  The material looks and feels too heavy for the sex appeal of the cutouts.  It looks like the type of dress that could use a belt and blazer....and be worn to work in the Fall and Winter. I don't like the look of all that elastic shirring at the waist. The  dress looks better with a belt, but the belt covers some of the cutout area.  Instead of this heavy fabric, a nice smooth cotton knit would've been a better choice for this style. Lastly, the bottom of the bra shows through the cutouts. I don't recommend. It's not balanced. The cutouts have sex appeal, but the fabric is matronly and staid.

I purchased the Blue Floral. It's a nice sized wallet that measures about 7" in the width and 5" in the length. It has 9 slots for credit cards, Two  clear plastic covered slots for drivers license or photo ID's.  Four clear plastic covered slots for pictures.  There's an area for the checkbook, 4 areas to place dollar bills and 2 zippered compartment for coins...one is conveniently located on the outside of this wallet.  The zippers have tabs attached, so no matter how long your fingernails, you'll have no problems unzipping this wallet's compartments. Differing from the solid colors, the  Blue Floral doesn't look like leather.  It's a glazed fabric....similar to the fabric of the traditional Gucci  handbags. The glaze has a sheen to it. The inside of this wallet has nice fabric lining, not that cheap plastic.  The top flap has a choice of 2 snaps to choose from for closure.  This is a nice added feature. Even a  "packed" wallet will easily snap close.  The wallet is stitched together nicely. This is very good quality at a great price.I purchased this wallet to go with my turquoise handbag and even though the color is not as photographed,  I am still very pleased with this wallet. The Blue Floral is a deeper blue than photographed. In the photo it appears to have a turquoise background. The background is actually marine blue or a light navy color.  The flowers are turquoise, with a hint of white. The leaves of the flowers are an attractive green and the leaves are detailed.  The color of the lining is marine blue

These earrings are small, approximately 1/4" or 6mm.  They don't appear to be 8mm as stated.  The length and the width are the same dimension.  The flower design is attractive. The silver is excellent quality. Highly polished, smooth, and unplated. The stones are inlaid into the metal. Skill was required to inlay the stones into the metal, without the use of prongs. The little chips have very good clarity, very good cut, and very good color, but I don't believe they're diamond. A diamond of this size (a pin head), with this cut and clarity, certainly won't have wow factor, but  will shoot out fire when the light hits them. If diamond's clarity is of just average quality, with a good cut, it is going to interact with light; bend the light and disperse "fire".  It will disperse fire even if the diamond has a yellow tinge, as long as the clarity is decent and the cut of the stone is good. There is no fire coming from these stones.  Still, these stones are pretty and do add  hints of sparkle, and have color that matches the sparkling, icy luster of the silver very well. Whether they're diamond or not, the stones are an excellent compliment to these earrings.The earrings are made sturdy, with sturdy posts located at top of earrings.  The backs are securely fitting. The quality of workmanship is good. These smooth textured earrings are good for children and anyone that enjoys wearing small earrings.  They  look nice in second piercings, too. They lie flush to the ears. Even though they are small, they look very distinctive and attractive on the ears; the silver really sparkles. Sabrina sells beautiful quality silver jewelry.

They give a strong diamond presence for little money. I've been on fence about these earrings for a year. I thought the settings would be flat, with easily identifiable diamond chips.  I was wrong.  Photo can't do them justice.They have sparkle and have plenty of fire.  Unexpected at this price point. These appear to be about 1 cttw. I am not exaggerating. They're 1/2" in length. Very attractive on the ears. The diamonds cascade just below the earlobes.\ The small diamonds are each set in a "miracle" plate. but distinguishing the stones from it's silver plate is impossible with the naked eye. The eyes only see what appears to be decent size diamonds set in a grape-like 3D cluster, not really a zigzag. They have depth. I have never seen a  better setting to maximize the stones. Each diamond is inlaid into the center of a diamond cut plate.  Then each plate is prong set into the finding. The diamond cutting causes the plates to really sparkle and each of the 14 diamonds shoot out fire. Further, the little diamonds have good clarity, good cut, and decent color.  The results is the "miracle" illusion. The mix of the diamond and the metal gives the an ice cube color that has that slightly grey undertone....but definitely not grey tinged. These are beautiful diamond earrings that sparkle under most lighting..sun, office, store, restaurant, low lights, etc... They sparkle so much, it's as if they're dancing with the lights. They arrive in Amazon's generic gift box....a navy velvet pouch contained within a navy board box.The posts are sturdy and backings fit securely and the earrings are well made.  The sterling is well plated and appears like white gold.  I'm  glad I finally purchased these. The best way to clean is with a drop of dish liquid in hot water and a soft bristle toothbrush; and periodically polishing the stones with Element's Sunshine polish cloth.

These do a decent job of cleaning, but they are not authentic Sunshine Polishing Cloths. If you want a superior cloth that will thoroughly clean tiny crevices and really "dirty" metals in short order...this isn't it.  Try "Elements Sunshine Polishing Cloths". Those are the real deal. Authentic Sunshine cloths are denser, have more cleaning product contained within the cloth and turn absolutely black after using. Unlike these, they continue to still clean well, after they have blackened. They remove tarnish so well, you actually need to use gloves. If not, your hands will become very dirty.I've been buying Sunshine cloths for a few years, since I wear a lot of unplated silver jewelry. When I saw this trio at their asking price, I immediately purchased thinking I was getting a great deal. I got what I paid for. These  work fine for average cleaning jobs, but if you want a superior cleaning cloth, try the Elements. Trust me on this one.

The brown is color of champagne. The cut on the stones is beautiful. The stones have lots of sparkle. The half bezel design really looks attractive on the ears. The silver is highly polished. They have a martini type setting; allowing them to lie flush to the ears.  For their size, these have some weight to them. The settings is cast from solid silver. The backs are larger and fit very snugly. I don't think they're plated, but if they are, it a lite plating.Don't let the price fool you. These are well made, attractive, solid silver earrings, with beautifully cut and sparkling stones. They are small. The size is more consistent with 4mm, instead of 6mm. I purchased for my second piercings and I love 'em. The silver bezel gives more interest than a simple basket set stud. As of this review, these earrings are also available with pink and purple stones.  They arrive in a petite red board box with a red ribbon.

The quality of the diamonds looks surprisingly good. I purchased these earrings based on the reviews. Thank you. These are beautiful. All the diamonds are clear and sparkling. No hint of yellow or dark carbon color in the stones. 1/10cttw is not a large diamond weight, but these diamonds, set in the highly polished silver, gives a lot of sparkle and shine to the earrings. This silver appears not to have plating. They have some weight to them. The backs are larger and fit securely. In diameter, the earrings are about the size of a dime. The knot isn't a pronounced 3D ball shape. They look more flatter shaped than rounded, like braided bread ....if that analogy makes sense. These studs don't protrude away or hang down from the ear lobes. The sit upright on the ears very nicely.  The post is located in the center.The earrings arrive in a black suede lined jewelry box that is contained within a black heavyweight board box that's lined in turquoise blue. It's a really nice presentation if giving as a gift. Delivery was swift. Great quality earrings at a great price. Diamond jewelry is getting so expensive. I'm glad I was able to get these. Thanks Amazon.

This does an excellent job of defining curls. The most effective "buttery type" product I've used for "tight" curl definition in my wash and go style. The following day, the curls were still defined and tight, but that's is something I only want ocassionally. The pudding is rich, dense, very creamy, lilac colored and has the smell of fresh grapes.  After using,  my hair was left soft, shiny and loaded with curls. I didn't experience harden hair or flaking. Neither did I pile in on.  I also use "ORS Curls Unleashed Creme". The Curls Unleashed leaves hair defined, but with looser, stretched out, curls.  I prefer the looser curl definition. I tested this product out on it's own...without any additions, but when using creamy curl defining products, I transfer to a larger container and add castor oil, olive oil, and aloe vera juice. The combinaton really does my hair good.  It seals the cuticles and leaves hair curly, soft, shiny, moisturized, able to absorb better into hair, and dry quicker than just using the puddings/creams alone. I like Miss Jessie's pudding, especially the scent, but I do feel it's overpriced and  wouldn't buy  again, until I start doing a lot of twistout styles.  I get excellent result using the aloe/oils mixture with the "ORS" and "Shea Moisture" curling cremes. I've tried many different brands of curling creme/butters/pudding, etc..I find most work basically the same on my hair. The main difference with Miss Jessie's is a tighter curl pattern, which I don't necessarily want, but this may be a great product for a twistout, bantu knot, braid out and a tightly curled wash and go.  I definitely believe this product will help those styles  hold longer. Miss Jessie's did really coat my hair. I couldn't cowash it out. I had to shampoo.

These are ridiculously oversized.  I purchased his usual size, but they were much too big.  He's 5'10" They were way too long....about 7" too long. The "jersey" fabric is the weight of a tee shirt. The man I bought them for doesn't like them.  I was expecting a heavier weight jersey fabric.  These were a bad purchase for me, but for a tall person looking for lightweight, summer "knock around" or exercise pants, these may fill the bill.  They do have side pockets and a draw string waist. Sizing down is probably best.

Great quality and workmanship. Not really huggies, these are a little over a 1/2" in length. The width is approximately 1/4".  Double rows of fully faceted stones sparkle beautifully...about 1/2cttw.  The shape of these are  geometric inspired. In the photo, the center stones looks highlighted or bigger than the rest, but in actuality they aren't. All the stones are about 2mm each; all uniformly channel set.  The platinum plating is  gorgeously done.  They're smooth and rich looking earrings.  These were cast from solid silver. The earrings can be worn in reverse.  The back  has lovely filigree work cut into the metal.  Very comfortable to wear.The hinges opens freely and the closures snap securely.  These are those kind of earrings that have me asking myself....why spend the money on diamond for a similar style?  The stones are beautiful, the silver is beautifully done, and the quality of workmanship in these earrings couldn't be better if set with diamond. My hat's off to Sabrina Silver. Beautifully done earrings. I highly recommend. Can be worn with any attire.

This coin purse is about the size of an index card. The bottom is approximately 1 1/2" wide and the coin purse can stand upright.  It's big enough to hold 5 dollars in coins, or a few coins, a few folded bills, credit card, and ID. It opens wide for easy access and snaps close securely.  It's made from simulated leather and it looks like leather.  It's not shiny or plastic looking. The coin purse is slightly padded. The inside is lined with fabric. The stitching is done wery well and the overall constuction is nicely done.  Not the most expensively made coin purse, but certainly well worth the asking price, and one that will wear well if not over stuffed.I purchased the Orange Zebra and the design is detailed, on both the front and back of coin purse. The oolors are rich and vivid. It's really cute and just the kind of snap shut coin purse I was looking for. I like it and will purchase the matching wallet.

Simply designed. This necklace is approximately 1" in length.  On the front, the metal doesn't really show. It's all about the stones. The quality of workmanship is good, but the stones are just average.  That's why I don't like this pendant better.  The silver is well plated. The chain is fine like mesh, but strong and it's very suitable for the size of pendant.  The bale on the pendant is large enough for a thicker chain, omega, or ribbon, if that's desired.  The chain has a lovely sparkle.Initially, I loved this pendant and purchased for Mother's Day gifts. Recently, I've noticed the sparkle has diminished on my mom's pendant. I examined under the loupe. The stones aren't that nice. The cut on the stones is average. They look cloudy and darker than typical good quality CZ. They still sparkle somewhat, but there's no fire in the stones. She's only had this pendant 2 weeks and doesn't wear while showering. I expected stones to maintain their beauty longer. I wish these were Swarovski crystals, instead of the CZ. I knew I was ordering CZ, but I thought with the name Swarovski, they would be really nice quality.  I'm disappointed. Purchased 3 of these.

These are cute little ladybugs.  They're made of higly polished and rhodium plated silver. The body has a spray of 5 inlaid CZ stones. They're very tiny and don't give off much fire or brilliance, but the stones do add a little sparkle and gleam to the already sparkling silver. The butterfly backs are good quality and fit earrings snugly. The inside of the bug's belly is hollowed out and not plated. Still, the earrings are sturdy and were made from a solid piece of silver. They're 1/2" in diameter. The posts are located on the top of the earrings. The earrings fall slightly below the ear lobe.These are good earrings for a tween, teen, or anyone that loves and collects ladybugs.

Simply styled earrings with clean lines. The silver is great quality, beautifully finished, and unplated. Good quality silver doesn't need all the plating. It's beauteous is it's own right.  These are handmade. The simplicity of style and those clean, well defined, lines of the square gives an elegant look. They are solid siver, but comfortable. The earrings are just under 1/2" in length. Their width is a little over a 1/4". Small, but noticeable.  The snap bar closures locks into place with a definite click. The hinges are freely moving for easy access when putting on.Sabrina Silver sells really nice, high quality, solid silver jewlery. The workmanship is excellent on each pair of earrings I purchased. The locking mechanisms all function properly. Even their very inexpensive earrings are well crafted with secure closures.  With these mid priced earrings, the silver quality, workmanship, look and feel of the earrings are all excellent to outstanding. One glance is all it takes to know you're wearing quality jewelry. Thanks.

More of a small hoop than a huggie. The silver is beautiful quality, unplated, finished and highly polished. The silver is solid and has a substantial weight for their size. The earrings have a thickness of approximately 1/4".  They are very comfortable to wear.There have beautifully cut oval stones in the center of each earrings. The stones are approximately 1 carat each.  The stones lay flush with the metal. The stones are not glued on or sitting in prongs. An Artisan cut the metal to accommodate the beautiful stones and inlaid them completely in the metal. The surface is smooth.  Prongs are holding the "underbelly" of the stones inside the earrings. It's unusual to find hoops with one nice sized stone set in this manner. These are handmade.  That's why these earring are relatively pricey.The hinge opens easily to allow for ease in putting on. The closure is secure. It works properly and the posts lock, snapping very securely, into place.  The inside of the earrings have circular tool work grooved into the metal. I would have preferred the insides of earrings without tool work, finished and highly polished. If they were, I'd given 5 stars.

The V shape is very flattering. The earrings hang nicely on the ears.  The silver is rhodium plated and these are  inside/outside hoop earrings. These earrings have stones on the front, inside the earrings,  and they sparkle on the  back, too. Beautifully cut stones that are about 1/10cttw each. The stones are channel set and done well.  Good quality and workmanship. They're made of solid silver. The earrings are 1" in length.  Comfortable to wear. The hinge opens completely, putting on and taking off is easily done. They snap close securely, but I would have preferred the "latch" type closure for these. Even though they close well, I wouldn't feel comfortable sleeping in these earring, because when opened, they do completely open.  The post is a slightly thicker than photographed.  These can be worn with any attire from jeans to "dress up".

Uniquely styled, beautiful, refined looking earrings. These earrings have good silver presence, but they aren't bold. These look elegant and of good quality. If wanting more "pop" than  small earrings offers, but not too much boldness...these are those earrings. The polish and finish are excellent. They're  unplated. They have a little weight to them, but are comfortable to wear. The closing mechanism works properly and securely. The earrings are handmade and they look special. They're a little over an 1 1/4" in length. Very attractive on the ears.

These small earrings, 3/4", are made of solid silver. They have a good weight for small earrings. The silver quality and polished finish are beautiful. These are unplated, and look like white gold.Yeah, they do. This is some beautiful silver. The closure works well and secures the earrings. Previously I purchased 2 pairs of earrings with this type of closing mechanism...from other companies.  Had to return both. Neither worked properly. This closure is different from the norm. The bar and hinge  both lock into place.The look great on the ears. The oval faces forward.  They're about the size of a nickel.

The cat's eye round disks are opaque gray. It's a smooth and attractive stone.  Each disk is about the size of a penny. The entire length of earrings are a little over an inch. The silver is plated with rhodium and and highly polished. It solid, too.  The backs fit snugly and are a substantial size. These earrings  are lite and comfortable on the ear. For dangle earrings,  they don't have a lot of excessive movement.  The stones are well secured by the vertical silver bars. Two things I would have liked better; vertical silver bars on back of disks. On the back, silver only cups the very top and bottom edges of the disks,  Just enough to secure and stablize.  On one of my earrings, the vertical silver bar is slightly off center.  I'm not bothered enough to return them, but quality control could have been better. (My regualar seller for silver jewelry is "Sabrina Silver". I gotten used to excellent workmanship).  Putting those issues aside, these are well made earrings.  The silver metal,  with the grey stones,  looks striking.

Great fitting summer-weight oxford shirt. The fit is very flattering. It's not a big shirt, but comfortably roomy. It tapers sightly at the waistline. Giving a really nice shape, even if waistline isn't particularly defined. It's long and lean...not boxy fitting.  The length is 30"  This shirt looks good buttoned up or left open over a tank top. The fabric is soft and cool. The collar is understated and comfortable around the neck. The sleeves are slightly fuller with a slightly, longer length, short sleeve. The colors are very soft. It doesn't wrinkle excessively. Nice quality. It looks cool and crisp.

Excellent quality silver; smooth, highly polished, and reflective. They are unplated. That means the inside isn't plated either. The inside is "raw" silver. The suface of these earrings have an exceptionally beautiful polish. They are so smooth and pristine.  No porosity, no scratches either. Not even under the loupe. The silver looks like satin. It has a luster.  I haven't seen silver quality this nice in a long while. They look artisan crafted or handmade.  These are some beautiful silver earrings.Approximately 3/4" in length, 1/2" in width, They're elegant, chic, and comfortable on the ears. These are bolder huggie hoops, but by it's name,  "huggie hoops" are smaller earrings.  They can be worn for any ocassion.  These are go anywhere in style earrings. Attractive V shape is so flattering. The snap bar closure functions properly. Closes securely with a distinct snap,  and the hinge opens easily to allow for ease of putting on.Since purchasing a few pieces of their jewelry, I'm so pleased with Sabrina"s silver quality and workmanship. I wouldn't buy silver jewelry anywhere else. Silver prices are rapidly climbing; and in reflections of that, a lot of the silver jewelry has beocme "lite" on the metal. Sabrina Silver still has that good, solid, substantial silver jewelry that I like.Smooth transaction and fast delivery. This is an excellent seller here. Thanks.

5+ stars and all the way gorgeous.  Excellent quality earrings!  Highly polished, solid silver, beautiful platinum finish, brilliantly sparkling  princess cut stones, in a channel setting.  They're 1" hoops. The thickness of metal is almost 2/8". The stones covers the front half of the earrings. Just as shown, they do extend past the under curve of the circle. The entire front of earrings are covered with sparkling beauties. The back has the highly polished platinum finish. The closure snaps snugly and securely shut.  These are substantial and comfortable to wear.  These feel and "look" like quality. Great pair of earrings. My expectations are exceeded. With earrings like these, who needs diamond hoops? Can't go wrong with these earrings.  They are gorgeous. Transaction was smooth and delivery was very fast. Thank you Sabrina Silver.

I am very pleased with this eye anti-wrinkle moisturizer. I have only been using it for about a week and a half, but I have seen significant results since using it. After using this moisturizer, I have noticed the eye "areas" to feel smoother and look rejuvenated. The last anti-wrinkle moisturizer I tried did not show me similar results, and I used the expensive product for 2 months. The moisturizer is lightweight, non-greasy, and absorbs into my skin immediately after application. This eye moisturizer is better priced than other moisturizers because it shows satisfying results without breaking the bank. I recommend anyone in search of a new anti-wrinkle eye moisturizer to give this one a shot.  In just the short time that I have been using it, I feel better about the appearance of my eyes.

This is the keyboard that I had always wanted, but I was not able to find one because no company made a bluetooth keyboard that supported multiple devices. Because, often times, I multitask with my computer, tablet, and phone at the same time and having multiple keyboard on the desktop is messy and it takes up too much space. So I always wanted a bluetooth keyboard that I could connect several devices at once. Well, that keyboard is finally here.The overall design is pleasing. The rounded keys are nice and new to me (honestly, I’ve never seen one before) and the board is shaped like the new apple bluetooth keyboard. The keyboard is heavy and requires two AAA batteries, but I actually prefer the heavier weighted keyboard.Upon receiving, I connected my Ubuntu laptop, ipad, and Macbook to this keyboard easily without an issue. The keyboard also paired with my other devices (Chromebox, appleTV, and Android tablet) flawlessly without complications on a separate pairing trials. Only three devices can be pre-paired at once, but it was easy enough to override the pre-paired setting to do a new pairing for a different device as well as needed.Using this keyboard is wonderfully comfortable and convenient. The keyboard remembers the last paired device and wakes the device up by pressing any keys. Then it connects within 2 seconds to the device and works as expected as a bluetooth keyboard. There are also many function keys that work well with my iPad, and mac, such as home button and multi window button (F5). The media control keys (play, ff, pre, and volume keys) are also worked well across the different OS platforms. However, the only device I had trouble reconnecting was my Chromebox. Pairing was successful, but once the chrome OS falls asleep, the keyboard doesn’t make reconnection. I assume this are more on the chrome OS issues rather than the keyboard itself because I don’t have the same issue on any other devices.Overall, this is the ultimate bluetooth keyboard for all the devices I use everyday. Switching between the devices is easy as pressing a button and works well as expected, (except Chromebox.) Special function keys feature that work with different devices is useful. I found, however, the most beneficial feature of this keyboard is the easy three device BT connection support. Ultimately, it saves money and space.

These chocolates are absolutely exquisite and decadent! First, the packing is lovely, so if one decides to select this set as a gift (for whatever reason—birthday, anniversary, valentine’s, or just because), the receiver will certainly be impressed. As a warning, opening the box itself takes time, as it is carefully wrapped. Be prepared to take a minute or two before you open of the trove of delightful chocolates. This selection of chocolates includes 25 pieces of dedicated crafted chocolates, 11 pairs (corner chocolates are two pairs) plus one solo chocolate. Read full description to see all varieties, which include nuts, caramel filling, and swiss creme. As for the taste, each piece of chocolate offers a unique taste to one’s palate. I am not a chocolate connoisseur, but I am frank when I say these chocolates are fine and exceptionally delicious. Oftentimes when one purchases a box of chocolates including so much variety, each piece of candy is far too sweet, but these are not. The quality of these chocolates is high, but I likely rate the quality as high because I simply love good chocolate.  I am not about to compare this set to any other because I am confident that whoever purchases this satisfying box of chocolates will not be disappointed.

Where do I begin with this box of assorted candy? First, this set includes mini Hershey’s chocolate, Kit-Kat, Almond Joy, and Reese’s—a fine variety for those with preferences, if you ask me. To open the box, one simply pulls out cardboard from the perforated section, and what pops out is like a tray, which gives the box and appearance of a cardboard dispenser, which is convenient (and genius!).Now imagine all of its uses: 1) you will not be home on Halloween night, so you place a sign on the box and trick or treaters take one (or two, or three) of their choice. 2) you are hosting an event at home and your guests can choose a candy (or two, or three) of their choice as often as they want. 3) you can take the box to your office and offer to patrons, patients, students, co-workers, etc. 4) you can have it at home for personal use (yum!), 5) the possibilities are endless.The price for this box and all its contents is a good deal. For the amount of candy and hassle free selecting, this is a great buy for any occasion you choose. Since I have typed this review, I have consumed four Reese’s, and I am not sure I can stop anytime soon. Enjoy this excellent set!

This Jack Links jerky pack was OK. I have tried other flavors from JL, and I prefer other flavors over this one. For one, I like “beef” jerky more than pork. In my opinion, this pork jerky was too chewy and needed more flavor. Although this jerky is Korean BBQ flavored, I thought the seasoning could have been stronger, and I was somewhat disappointed. If you are interested in simply trying out a new flavor of jerky, this pack will do, but if you are a hard core jerky consumer, you can at least give this jerky a try and decide on your own. If you are familiar with Korean cuisine, do not expect to taste authentic Korean BBQ flavor, because you will be disappointed. Overall, this jerky is not bad to try, but this pack is not my top choice.

I purchased several Chromebooks and Chromeboxes last year for my family members and parents. I was happy with those Asus, HP, and Acer branded Chrome OS computers. This is my first Toshiba Chromebook, and I am undoubtably impressed: wow!This Chromebook came with the battery 20% full, and it took about 1.5 hour to fully recharge. The build quality is superb. The screen quality is just the best I’ve seen among Chromebooks. The screen is the part that every owner will look at all the times when computing, and I think, it is one of the most important pieces of hardware. This Chromebook features IPS full HD (1080p) screen unlike some other low priced Chromebooks. It is super bright (at 100% brightness level) and crystal clear and sharp. Colors looked very accurate; it didn’t need any calibration. The hinges are sturdy and tight, it held the screen very well at any angle, and wasn’t shaky at all. Keyboard (backlit) is also one of the best I’ve tried; it was very comfortable even for long document typing. Also, the quick and accurate responsiveness of the trackpad is just wonderful.The built in webcam and speaker works seamlessly and both video and sound quality is far better than any other Chromebooks I’ve tried. If Google Hangout is not you like me, then Skype is your phone. Overall, this is the best Chrombook I’ve ever tried. It almost feels like a one thousand dollar Macbook Air in many ways. The Chrome OS runs super light and fast, and it even comes with some nice perks such as two years of 100GB cloud storage (which is essential) and two month free streaming music service. As you may know by now, the Chrome OS has its limits and might not suit everyone, yet, I think it’s fantastic move from Windows and Mac (unless Windows/Mac apps necessary). A not-too-expensive wifi printer will serve well for the printing needs, and the common tasks such as word processing and photo organizing/editing can be done with many web based services. Over $300 for a Chromebook might sound expensive compared to others, but for the hardware quality, speed, and integration is well worth, in my opinion. I will choose this again over some similarly priced clunky 2 in 1 windows laptop/tablet or low end windows laptop. In the end, I will appreciate the simplicity and the lightness of both hardware and software without the worries of malwares and viruses.

I’ve been using Manfrotto tripods and monopods for various shooting occasions for over ten years, and through experience with those tripods, I know I can trust this new one as well.The construction is still very nice and solid. All the locks and legs are flawless and function well as expected. However, the best feature of this tripod is the orientation adjustable center column. The center column is not just height adjustable but also horizontally adjustable. This sliding center column is especially useful when shooting something overhead or when the camera is needed to be offset from the legs' position. I actually saw someone by chance using this feature at a state park last weekend (see attached photo) and thought that's another good use of this kit. However, the center column is not the only flexible one. The legs are also flexible in terms of angle settings, and combined with the 90 degree center column and the ball head, this kit can offer almost limitless possible angles if one needed.I personally prefer ball heads over 3 ways, and the one in this kit is the perfect option. It locks and hold the loads well, but at the same time, it's easy and simple to change angles when necessary. Also, the mounting plate is more convenient to attach and detach compare to other brands' system.The overall size and weight of this kit is medium. It is not too big and not too small, and not too heavy and not so light. It's good enough size to carry around and to use outdoors and indoors setting on the fly. On some extreme angles and occasions, I would just put some sand bags over the legs if necessary. However, I think the tripod and the ball head together are still not that light (5 lbs) to carry over my shoulder on a long distance trip or hike. It is still lighter than my camera setting though. If the light weight is your absolute criteria, then much more expensive carbon fiber legs will do.Overall, this is one those a must-have as a photographer regardless of level of skills. Rock solid structure, yet flexible angle setting, and the cobination with the famous ball head make this kit  just wonderful. I know there are rather affordable options for both tripod and ball head in similar size, but I honestly think this is the better value in the long run.

I prefer not to use any chemicals when I clean, but when I do, I dare not use my bare hands; therefore, these gloves have been a lifesaver. First, these gloves protect your hands regardless of the task. I only use these gloves for cleaning, so I cannot evaluate these gloves for any other use, and I won’t pretend to do so. Second, these gloves are snug. Some people prefer loose-fitting gloves; if you are one of those people, there are not for you. Third, these gloves do rip, but they do not rip immediately. I work with liquid and sponges, but I would imagine if I were use these gloves while scrubbing pots and a Brillo stainless steel sponge, these gloves would likely break within minutes, depending on the offense of the grime stuck to a pot. So far, I am happy with these gloves. I do not have issues with allergies or rashes, but I do urge those with sensitive skin to “test” these gloves prior to using them. Overall, I am content with these gloves for personal use, but I would imagine dentists, doctors, nurses, and other trades which require employees to use gloves would be satisfied with the quality. The bottom line is that the product delivers what it promises, protection to one’s hands.

In the past, remote controlled car toys faced the same problem during the race or play: the car got out of control. The car got out of control not because the toys were defective of anything, but because it was just hard to control to get it to stay on the track. When this annoyance occurs, kids get frustrated and quit playing. Well, the Real FX Racing set solved that problem by making the car unit senses the track so it can stay on the track. It is like playing the video racing game with real life toy set.There are two sets of cars and remote controllers and tracks in the box. No batteries were included, so you would have to prepare 6 AA and 6 AAA batteries. I already had many of rechargeable AA and AAA batteries at home, and I would recommend to get the rechargeable ones ( http://amzn.com/B007B9NXAC ). Except the fact that I had to supply my own batteries, using these common AA and AAA sized batteries is nice because they last longer and are easy to get. Unlike some li-ion built in R/C toys I have (lasts merely 10 min.), this is way more practical. Once the batteries were in, the cars and the controllers were paired easily and quickly.Next comes building the track. Tracks are thin plastic material with some special coating on so the cars can sense to stay on the track. It was easy to build, but it took longer than 2 minutes at first hand. The tracks seemed durable and worked well on the uneven floors as well. After some trials, my son and I figured out many different track models we could build. Although the set came with 20 pieces of track sections, and we could build many different shapes and sizes of tracks, we realized that we wanted and needed more track sections in order to build the tracks we wanted. Currently, it doesn’t seem as if they are selling the track sections separately, but in the future, I hope they do.Lastly, playing with the toy was fun. It’s absolutely fun doing racing. My son loves how his car can stay on the track. Also, there are sound effects and virtual effects (oil spills, tire blow..etc.) that enhance the racing game more like a real video game. The system tracks lab time and keeps the record automatically; we didn’t have to follow who is winning or not, we just had to focus on the race. However, the cars wouldn’t stay on the track 100% of the time. If the speed is too high at the corners, it would go out of the track by the centrifugal force. I don’t know if the company made the system that way intentionally, so we know reducing the speed at the corners is necessary, but full speed on the corners pushes the car out of the track. Now my son knows that he has to reduce the speed to make a nice cornering. Overall, this is a real fun racing game system that is not frustrating. Building our own tracks is engaging and fun. The battery lasts long, and we could play hour long races. And the cars that stay on the track is smart. The virtual effects and many sound effects are well integrated with the game; it makes the racing even more fun. Ultimately, this is a great alternative to the dominant screen time kids spend these days (mostly doing video games) and a nice way to get kids stimulated and  involved while playing something fun. I like the set as a parent, and my son loves it as well.

0:40 Mins This is a basic action cam with the standard functions and features. The pros I found from this action cam are the light weight, night vision recording capability, and the waterproofing without housing. The design is uniquely different from others; the cam can be mounted on easily or not so easily using the included tripod adapter or wrist band adapter. Whether to mount it on the helmet or wrist, the biggest benefit of this cam is the light weight. Sometimes action cams with the case and mount adapters weigh more than the camera, and wearing around 200g of gear on the head could be uncomfortable during activities. This action cam, for example, only weighs 45g, and it feels uber light. Sony's AS100 action cam weighs 90g, and its waterproof housing is 70g. If my activity matters with the total weight of the cam, this is the way to go. Also, this action cam has another unique feature that others don't offer: Night Mode. This action cam can shoot at night (0 lux) with the included IR lens although I have to supply IR light ( http://amzn.com/B00T43DJUM ). I am sure this might be a really useful feature for evening/night activities.The cons I found during my testing were grainy video quality, occasional crash, and the short battery life. When I compared side by side with the GoPro footage (3+S @1080p30), the footage from A1 was slightly brighter but with some grainy-ness. The overall image quality was not any better or worse than GoPro's except the graininess. However, several times, the cam crashed while using and became unresponsive. I could not turn off and restart so I let the battery get exhausted. Later, I found I could use the tiny reset button that could restart the cam when crashed. To be precise, the cam crashed twice (separate shooting events) when connected to my phone's app via wifi and once connected to my Mac as web cam. I tried to see if there's a way to update the firmware via app, but I have had no luck yet. I think it's just a software issue, and Panasonic can fix it easily with the firmware update in the future. One last thing is the short battery life. This cam can record for about 20 minutes continuously and that's quite short in my opinion. Considering the size and the design of the cam, I understand the limitations, but I really wish the recording time is little longer than 20 minutes. Luckily, an external battery pack can be used to extend the battery life on the go.Overall, I would recommend this action cam to those who care about a camera's  "light" weight most. The small form factor and the design is quite nice and easy to be mounted on the body parts and objects. Also the case-less waterproof body is great feature to get some fun shots during the water activity.  Yet, no action cams are perfect, and this one is not an exception. It lacks some features such as GPS, non removable battery, stabilization, and interval (time lapse) mode. It would be nice if this cam had all these features built in, but without all those, it might do well, if you just want really lightweight basic action cam.

This Nuyu fitness tracker is a less expensive, less stylish than others. Since I have never owned a fitness tracker (except Garmin 220), I am reviewing this product based on my experience only with this tracker. If you are looking to find a review which specifically details the similarities and differences between this tracker and another, say the FitBit, you may want to read someone else's review.As the product description states, the Nuyu tracks time, steps, calories burned, distance, percent to goal, and sleep. Before using this tracker, I downloaded the App to begin using it. Installing and setting up my information took less than five minutes. Each day I sync my daily activity to view my results, which display steps, distance, sleep, and weight. I can view the records monthly, weekly, and daily and it shows bar graph for a quick visual comparison.I have to say the accuracy of this unit is roughly 85%. There's no way for me to scientifically track if this device is really accurate, but I know my routines and I have some idea how much I step and sleep everyday. And for me, 85% accuracy is good enough because there's no device that can do 100% rate everyday. ( Nike recently is getting sued (class action) for their Fuelband not being as accurate as they advertised.) With that in mind, I am satisfied with this tracker. The design might not be so edgy, but it does its job and it's affordable compared to others. Also, I like the fact it uses tiny lithium battery instead of rechargeable one. I don't have to take it off every so often to recharge and that is one less thing I have to take care of.

Using my existing dead bolt (or should I say turning my existing dead bolt into smart lock) as a smart lock is a great idea, but there’s an issue. The compatibility. Unfortunately, it was not easy for me to install this smart lock although it appears to be compatible according to the instruction page(on the app). The issue I encountered was the size (length of the pin) of the existing spindle and the adapter that came in the box. Basically, my spindle part was not long enough to reach the adapter (or the adapter was not long enough to reach the spindle part), so I had to DIY a piece of metal that’s long enough to reach the short adapter. Also, I noticed that the head of the two main bolts from the existing deadbolt was not wide enough to hold the main unit (the holes on the main unit is wider than the size of the head of the bolts), so I had to supply appropriate washers. Finding the right size of washers was cumbersome because the bolt holes are too close to the spindle hole. I eventually cut the tip of the metal washers. Eventually I installed the lock successfully after one long cumbersome hour.The next step was to download the app, create account, and sync the lock and the app. This process was easy and quick. The lock was working fine with the app and I was able to lock / unlock from my phone as advertised, and I could also assign my spouse's phone to work with the lock.My favorite feature from this smart lock is the ‘hands free’ function. Enabling this function allows the app to track my location (phone) and it unlocks the lock when I come back home from outside. I don’t have to take out my phone and open the app to unlock the lock. It is very convenient feature when my hands are full. However, I found that if the activation range was too small, it did not work accordingly. Also, if the activation range is too big, it might drain the battery on my phone. I found that for the 'hands free' function to work properly, the app needs to track my location all the times, and once I went out of the range I set, the function didn't work even if I came back within the tracking range.Overall, this smart lock is ok. I think it was good idea to use existing deadbolt, but the compatibility can be an issue for some. This smart lock works fines as intended, and I liked the options I can add on to this unit. It could have been great if the Smart-Reader was included in the set though (sold separately). While physical unit works ok, however, the app needs to be redesigned or needs much more improvement. The app is buggy, slow, and keeps losing the login credentials even though I enabled 'auto-login' for quick access. The level of integration and user interface between hardware and software is critical factor among these internet of things these days. And I think this smart lock and the app can be better in the future if on going product (including the app) improvement is made.

This light works ok. It's affordable and it does its job for both photo and video when the lighting is needed. However, the built quality is somewhat poor as many other reviewers pointed out. The mounting part is not strong enough to support the panel + battery 's weight, it can break really easily. Also, the ball joint can not be tightened securely to hold its position. No matter how tight I lock the joint, it still moves around. It was around $20 when I bought this, and for the money, it's ok. It's been useful for me for various tasks (not just photo and video), yet I wish this came with a better hot shoe mounting.

Since our Nest thermostat installation last year, I wanted to replace our old smoke detector as well. However, I found that many reviews weren’t that good on the 1st generation Nest Protect. So I waited for the 2nd generation to come out and see how much improvement developers put on the hardware. And the wait was worth it.The installation took under 10 minutes. I scanned the bar code on the Nest Protect from the Nest app. It went through initializing, connecting to local WIFI, and testing process, and then it was quickly ready to go on the wall. My old smoke detector had a bigger backplate on the wall, but it was just easy to remove the old one and put the Nest backplate on the same spot.The problem with my decade old smoke detector was that is was too sensitive and often caused false alarms when we cooked (or maybe the position of the smoke detector was too close to the kitchen; regardless, my old smoke detector had to go). The most annoying part was that there was no way to control the alarm once it went off. Well, now, with the Protect 2.0, I get no more false alarm, period! I enjoy cooking and often times I make "smoky" dishes, which makes my kitchen smoky. However, this hasn’t been triggered full alarm. I got a yellow ring pulse, sort of like pre warning prior to setting the full alarm, and it worked well for me. I could control (hush) the warning / alarm on my phone. I didn’t have to climb on the chair to get the batteries out or try to fan the unit with newspapers.This 2nd generation Protect is, I found, very stable and reliable in terms of network-ability and steam/smoke/CO detecting. It does its core function well, but what it can do when connected to the network and internet is just amazing. My place is relatively small, so I won’t need more than one Protect, but if more than one is connected, the units can communicate and alert each other in case of an emergency. I even thought that having this installed at my elderly parents home would be a great idea. The ability of remote access / control is opening many possibility of using the Protect.The app is also reliable. The Nest updated (major) its app some time ago, and it’s only getting better monitoring and controlling the Thermostat and Protect. I think the app is as important as the physical devices among the internet of things. Many different smart devices these days have poor app implementation regardless how brilliant their physical devices are, such as smart lock, light bulb, sensor, and etc. The Nest app has been 100% functional and reliable for me. The app and the units are always stable together. It’s easy and simple and user friendly.Overall, this 2nd generation Protect is way to go. I’ve never had 1st generation so I never experienced the drawbacks of the product, but this newer one has been just perfect for me. The built quality and the level of material quality are high. The integration of the app and the device is one of the top amongst others.

I already have a bigger sized SSD as a main drive in my MBP, so I tried to put this one as a second SSD into the superdrive slot. I used this caddy ( http://amzn.com/B0058AH2US ), and the fitting was fine. However, the SSD wasn’t writable. I suspect it was the EFI firmware that’s not compatible or not supporting the SSD through the Superdrive slot. The system link speed was 6 gigabit, according to the system report, but I could not get the SSD to work properly.The SSD is fine. It has no issues or errors at all when connected through thunderbolt adapter or USB 3 adapter; it was my computer not supporting the SSD in the Superdrive slot. When I tested with a regular mechanical hard drive with the caddy, it worked fine. (So it wasn’t the caddy that has an issue.)So I decided to use this SSD as a portable external SSD. I had a 2.5” Seagate case that can be used with either thunderbolt or USB adapter. The SSD seems solid, and it worked well with the adapters I have. However, the speed was somewhat disappointing. The Blackmagic speed test showed this one was about half the speed of my main SSD. It is still faster than a regular mechanical hard drive, but the speed I get from this one is rather slow compared to today's standard. Luckily, the price is affordable and PNY memories and drives are not too bad these days. I have been using PNY memories(CF, SD, microSD) and never had issues. Yet, instead of using this one as a main boot drive, it is good enough for me to use as a second or external, in my opinion. It is light to carry and quiet to leave on.

This toy is an excellent toy for babies between the ages of 12 through 36months. First, the theme of this toy is adorable. Babies learn about music,dialogue, shapes, letters, colors, and fruits. Children not only sharpentheir fine motor skills but also have an early exposure to role playing(eating and preparing food). This toy is not necessarily unusual compared toother Little Tikes toys available on the market. However, the theme alone isunique, and the toy is smaller than many or the larger play sets parentspurchase for their children. This set, also, is an easier option tobring along on a road trip compared to other bigger toys which serve asimilar purpose: spark creativity and offer a good amount of playtime. Overall, this is a nice set for the babies under 2-3 yrs old.

This ball is perfect for little ones and older ones.Upon inflating this ball (according to the instructions), my eight year-old son was excited because he was familiar with the ball, as he had used the same brand/ball in his P.E. at school. Therefore, his transition to using this ball was smooth, and he put it to use immediately. The ball stays firm for a long time and it bounces high with a lightweight child on it. In addition to all the fun exercises my son enjoys on this ball, I have utilized it for my own yoga exercises as well. Mostly, I lie on my back on the ball and do crunches, but I am careful when using it because I know it was designed for children. Since I inflated it about three weeks ago, I have not needed to replenish the air. I cannot recall how many exercise balls I have owned in the past that require refilling a few weeks after intense use, but this ball is still going strong, especially after my son has been using it for nonstop bouncing. Overall, this ball is great and ideal for active children. If an adult is lightweight enough, she may be able to enjoy it as well.

This Nerf gun is great for a number of reasons. First, this Nerf gun is girl-themed and its darts are neatly designed. Although girls can still enjoy any Nerf gun, this gun is even better. Also, although the Rebelle line is very cool too, this gun is a great starter gun before moving on the the other guns in the Rebelle line. The gun is light, shoots far, and allows for many hours of shooting fun. My 7 year old niece loves the “message” feature, which even attracted my almost 9-year old son. Overall, this is a stylish, neat Nerf gun, and I am certain girls and boys alike will enjoy playing with it.

These capsule worked fine with my Pixie, but I did not like how the cremas formed, and I did not like the taste. There's some fruity (maybe berry) aroma and taste in the first couple of sips, but after that, it just tastes somewhat flat, just like regular coffee. Personally, I like bold and reach flavor, and this one tasted more like a medium roast Dunkin Donuts for me. Tasting food and drink relies on personal preference, and I don't want to judge only based on my taste, but,  also,bmy wife did not like the taste as well.Overall, the capsules work with my Pixie, but there are plenty of options in the original Nespresso capsule line. For 20~30 cents or so more per capsule, I rather get the original aluminum capsules from Nespresso. By the way, these capsules came individually wrapped in a plastic like a expensive chocolate, and there are 10 capsules in a big box. The capsules are plastic and there are pre punctured holes on the bottom. I did not taste any plastic, but I still didn't like the idea of hot water passing thru the plastic casing. These capsules are certainly economical and worth trying a box for some, nonetheless.

We played with the balls in our backyard without knowing if the balls would work well on the lawn, and they did. The eight bocce balls and a pallino ball rolled well on the grass, and we had a fun time. I realized I did not have to have a bocce court to play. This set can be played on any surface and these resin balls seem very durable for any ground surfaces.The built quality of the balls and the wooden case is excellent. There's a premium feel to it, and it doesn't look cheap. The wooden case is especially well made, and it seems really heavy duty for carrying the heavy bocce balls. I also liked the bottle opener on the side.Overall, this is a nice bocce set for families, friends, and kids playing casually. My kid and the neighborhood kids also had fun playing this set in the back yard and the kids were also impressed with the quality of the balls. They especially liked the variety of colors. It was easy for them to identify theirs and others during the game.

First, price.This phone was on pre-release sale ($100) for about a week before its official sales launch day. A couple of weeks before this pre sale, ZenFone 2 was released for $200. I thought that was a good price for what was offered. I don’t think so anymore. It’s just amazing how they can make a smartphone with this specs and sell it for $100. I wonder what it costs to manufacture a smartphone these days and how much markups some companies put when they release their flagship phones like G4, S6, 6Plus, Nexus6. It would be nonsensical to compare this phone to those flagship phones, but it is not a secret that much of the retail price is covering the marketing cost. So I assume BLU’s crazy priced phones are possible due to the reduced marketing or lack of marketing.Second, hardware.So how does the $100 phone function? As described, this phone has very capable hardware specs for today’s standard: 5” IPS screen with Corning Gorilla Glass3, Snapdragon410 @ 1.2 GHz with 1GB ram. 4GLTE, and 13MP rear camera. The overall build quality is surprisingly excellent. It’s thinner and lighter than iPhone 5S yet has a larger 5” screen. The back cover comes off for accessing sim and microSD card slots, but the battery is not removable. Who carries extra battery these days anyway? The edges are seamless and the buttons are not wobbly. The design is very sleek. It doesn’t look or feel like a cheap phone at all. In fact, it feels really solid and comfortable in my hand. The speaker is on the lower portion of the back cover, and to my surprise, it is loud and clear. Call quality is also good; I didn’t notice any issues with the voice call quality on both ends. How about battery? Again, I was surprised to see the battery lasted all day long without recharging. I consider myself an average smartphone user: taking snapshots, videos, Instagramming, watching youtube videos here and there, mostly web browsing, texting, driving with Waze while listening to Spotify streaming, and tracking my running with Nike+ app. And after all this smartphone usage, the battery still had about 30% of power left. That was after 14h 22m usage after! While I was watching video for 15+ minutes, I felt the phone got warm just slightly, but I do not think that this observation is abnormal for smartphones.The camera is one of the most considering factor in smartphone shopping these days, and this phone has a good one. I don’t count the number of pixels, but the picture quality tells itself, and it is pretty good. What’s most impressive to me is the video quality. The capability of shooting a full 1080P video in low light situation was just amazing. It was crystal clear and sharp. And the result was just wow. The onboard storage is only 8GB, but I supplied with 64GB microSD (http://www.amazon.com/SanDisk-Memory-Adapter--SDSDQUAN-064G-G4A-Version/dp/B00M55C1I2/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1435074772&sr=8-1&keywords=microsd+64), I could shoot almost 10 hours of video without worrying about the space running out. (Video recording is limited to 10 minutes long (continuous) and it takes 0.98GB of space, fyi)Third, software.Currently the phone has Android 4.4 Kitkat, but I believe sometime in July, update to 5.0 Lollipop will be available. Is having the Kitkat a drawback? Absolutely not. I’ve read many complaints about ZenFone2 having too many bloatware. This one kept the preinstalled apps to a minimum.  It came with Google apps package installed along with the essential apps such as Sim toolkit, media apps, opera browser, and what not. I was glad this phone came light and clean (app wise) from the factory.I’ve been using and testing this phone for several days now, and most of the time, the phone runs well and acts accordingly. The 1.2 GHz might feel little slow at times, but I didn’t have any issues with the apps I use everyday. I found it was helpful to control the number of apps running in the background. Touch screen is always responsive as it should be.Lastly, the downside.This is a dual sim phone, a great feature for people who want two numbers in one device (or to have separate data and voice service). However, due to the internal design flaw, I could only use either nanoSim or microSD card. I couldn’t put both cards at the same time because that’s how the slot is designed. I had to sacrifice nanoSim slot for microSD card. For me having a 64GB extra storage space is better than having a dual sim. I also had to use nanoSim adapter (http://www.amazon.com/iCoolkit-Micro-Standard-Adapter-iPhone/dp/B009AB557I/ref=sr_1_12?ie=UTF8&qid=1435077206&sr=8-12&keywords=nano+sim+adapter ) because the other sim slot is for micro Sim, and I only had a nanoSim card. I really wished all three slots were independent so I could use two different sim cards and microSD card as well. But oh well, I can’t have it all.Another thing I’d like to mention is the screen auto brightness feature. I am not sure if this caused by the ambient light sensor (hardware) or software issue, but I noticed the brightness level fluctuated up and down irregularly under the same constant lighting condition. This happened only a couple of times so far, maybe once a day, but I couldn’t figure out what is causing this. I suspect my LED bulbs in the room for now. And most of the time, the auto brightness works well. I will update this review if the issue persists.Overall, this is probably the best smart phone under $150 you can find as of 2015 June. There are several Chinese brands that offer similar specs around same price range, but none of them support 4G LTE connection. I get around 5 Mbps down and 6 Mbps up with only 2~3 bars on Cricket (LTE) network where I am now. This might not be the fastest and snappiest phone in 2015’s standard, but I am happy with the phone speed and network speed I get for $35/mon (unlimited voice/text, 2.5GB LTE data). In the long run, this phone is a mighty money saver for the non-contract plans!

I’ve been using inexpensive Skilsaw 5480 model from time to time for projects, and it’s been working well. Now with this newer model Skilsaw, I am improving my skills, specifically my time working on a project, accuracy,and cleanness from its 15 Amp motor. The overall built quality is nice and sturdy. The size is slightly bigger than my older model, but this new one actually lighter in weight. I liked the shoe, which is also slightly longer and wider than my other one. As described in the product detail page, this model has magnesium guards (both upper and lower and the shoe) and that’s what makes this one a little lighter than others.I’ve cut some 2x12s to make a simple table with this saw, and it was quick, easy, and clean. It cut very clean with minimum muscular effort. Also, it was more comfortable than the other one because they changed the position of the left hand grip. The grip itself is also wider than the other one. Markings for depth and bevel angle are big and bold.Overall, this is a nice upgrade from the economy model. This is lighter yet sturdier and more comfortable. Whether I cut lumber or plywood, it does very clean (with some masking tape or painter’s tape on plywood) job and the result is very satisfactory.

0:47 Mins This charge/sync cable works well as expected with all the iDevices that have lightning port in my house. I haven't experienced a single issue with Belkin cables and chargers over many years of usage, and this cable is no exception. I really like the `gold' color although my iPhone is not gold; the gold cable seems distinguished among the usual and mundane white charge/sync cables laying around the house. The overall built quality is excellent like any other Belkin accessory. The braided cord and the aluminum casing on both ends give me less tangling experience and the premium feel.One last thing I like about this one over regular Apple cable (3.3 ft), is this one is almost a foot longer. There were many times I wished that the charge cable was slightly longer so it could reach the outlet. This slightly extended length gives me a little more flexibility in the situation where 3 feet is not enough. Overall, Belkin cables has been reliable choice for me and always worked well as expected. Sometimes cables like this seems pricy, but I found Apple online store has this for $30 (more expensive!) and other brands' MFi cables are not that cheap either.

As an uber-organized parent, I cannot live without Sharpies.This particular pack includes some neat bright colors, but one should notexpect the colors to scream out loudly. Aside for the pack's unique colors,these Sharpies are unlike all other ultra-fine Sharpies. The tips is not"ultra" fine, but it is fine enough to make consumers happy. Although theproduct's description does say these markers do not bleed, they do when youare working with textbooks, particularly those with Bible paper. Personally,I do not use Sharpies to annotate my textbooks (especially with thin pages),but one might be disappointed if he/she purchased this pack (or those ofother colors) solely for annotating textbooks. On the other hand, notetaking on thicker paper is no issue. These markers are also ideal for use onposters boards as well. These markers also work on plastic, glass, ceramic,and metal. Overall, these 5 assorted fine tip markers are lively and bright and make a niceaddition to one's constantly growing colorful Sharpie collection.

This Nerf water gun is our second, and we love it far more than my son’s first generation water gun. My son loves this gun for a few reasons. First, he can attach it directly to a water hose. What child would not be thrilled with this feature? He can also disconnect the hose when the gun is full, which is convenient when running around and playing. Secondly, since the gun can hold a lot of water, a child does not have to fill the gun as consistently (even if from a child’s perspective, the gun is empty quickly because he/she will not stop shooting)! Unfilled, the gun is light, but once filled, the gun feels rather heavy after a few fillings. My son does not seem to mind the weight too much. As other Nerf products, the plastic is durable. On day two of playing with the gun, he accidentally dropped it on the driveway a few feet from the ground, but fortunately, the gun did not break or chip. I am not sure how many more drops the gun can take, but he is not eager to demonstrate its durability quite yet. I will update if breaking/chipping occurs if/when necessary to do so. The gun squirts a large amount of water and will do some serious soaking to those who accidentally get in the way of a fun-filled water gun challenge. This toy is perfect to play anywhere outdoors and in the backyard. My 8 year old has yet to complain about this water gun. Overall, this is a perfect toy to use anytime, especially right now that the temperature ate extremely high.

The box came clean and the packaging had all the parts packed meticulously. Setting this dual mount up was really easy and simple; I followed the enclosed instructions and took only about ten minutes. The bottom mounting part (foot?) was well designed to support various desk thickness and heavy weight support, and I think that is the most important point of monitor mounting. Often times, whether it’s a monitor mount or tablet mount, I saw a poorly designed mounting foot which resulted in damaging the desk or monitor (or tablet), in addition to continuously falling/sliding from where it was mounted. As for this dual mount system, I tried it with my two 23” monitors, and I found the purpose was very well served. Having this ‘branching out’ type design saves space on the desk and makes everything neat and clean. The cables and wires could be hidden under the arms and that makes the whole desk look much simple. Another purpose is having freely adjustable viewing angles. This dual mounting system lets me adjust the height I want, angle I want, and the portrait/landscape mode I want without any hassle. I often switch between landscape mode and portrait mode, and I love how I can just rotate the screen without unscrewing any bolts in the back of the screen.Lastly, the sturdiness and strong built quality is just super. This dual mount is not cheaply designed and the quality seems solid. Also, the price is reasonable and competitive compare to others, in my opinion. AmazonBasics products are known for ‘quality products at reasonable prices’ and my past experience with other AmazonBasics items were always within or over my expectations.

This Nerf gun is quite compact and light compare to the usual Nerf guns. For the kids, the size and the weight of the gun is a big deal because, if it’s too big and heavy, kids’ hands and arms get tired quickly. This gun is more like a pistol (without the extra attachment) and shoots one bullet at a time, but my son preferred this one actually against the others which load many  bullets at once. Cocking might be a bit too stiff for little kids, but as the product is recommended for 8+ yr, my son didn’t have a problem cocking by himself.Overall, this is another well functioning Nerf gun. The quality seems durable and shoots straight and fast just like any other Nerf gun.

The packaging and the product inside, at first glance, were pretty nice. Every piece inside was wrapped and packed neatly and accordingly.Installing took 70 minutes for me without any help from cutting the dry wall out to finish hanging the 55” TV. I did not like the idea that I had to cut out the dry wall because I minded exposing insulating materials(fiber glass) inside the wall. And during the cutting process, that is what happened exactly. I ended up putting some tape over the insulating material for now, but I hope I don’t lose any heat in the winter through the cut. If you put this mount on the hollow wall, this won’t be an issue at all, but even with the insulation inside the wall, I had no problem putting in the mount. I watched the installation video first, then followed instruction that came in the box. Putting all the pieces together and screwing bolts and nuts was an easy process. I had to use the extension brackets because my 55” TV has VESA 600x600, and the brackets and the main back metal piece fit very well. One thing I noticed was all the bolts and nuts and the metal pieces were not cheap. They seemed high-quality bolts and nuts. Metal pieces are really heavy and seemed solid and not easily bendable. I worried a bit before to hanging my heavy TV with any mounts, because the TV is unusually heavier than other 55” class LED TVs. But the moment I hung the TV, it was just solid and nothing felt lose or wobbly.The finished result was, “Wow, That’s nice~!” according to my son. That was pleasing comment to hear from my son.Overall, I am really satisfied with this mount. This is not the usual cheap mount. This is high quality, heavy duty with visually pleasing result. My really heavy 55” TV is now beautifully mounted on the wall, and it looks and feels very secure. The mount itself is slightly pricey in my opinion, but considering the quality and durability, I think it’s worth it, especially if you want to mount expensive larger screen TV. The only hard part during the installation was cleaning all the palm and finger prints on the TV screen, fyi.

First, this set of jerky is awesome—tasty, tender, and throng-pleasing. Each pack is a different type of meat and flavor—Real Turkey Jerky: Original Recipe, Real Chicken Jerky: Honey Barbecue, and Real Steak Jerky: Original and Chipotle Cracked Pepper (my favorite). If one is a fan of jerky, depending on how much you spend on a package, one knows often times the texture is chewy and sometimes even difficult to break down in his/her mouth—some brands require some serious masticating patience. However, the texture of any of these jerky (regardless of flavor) is succulent and flavorful. If one is sensitive to spice, the only flavor I do caution one to try is the steak jerky chipotle cracked pepper, which does have a kick of heat and will mildly provoke one’s sensitive palate.  Otherwise, the flavoring for the other jerkies are pleasing and delicious! I cannot imagine any jerky enthusiast disliking any of the options available in this set. Overall, this set is worth your money and attention! This assortment of jerkies will not disappoint any buyer or his/her guests, and it would make a great any-occasions snack or housewarming gift! Enjoy!

The delivered box (from UPS) was somewhat beat up and heavy (over 70 pounds), but luckily all the materials inside were not damaged except the assembly instruction paper being torn. However, the assembly proccess was easy, straight forward, and did not take long at all. All I needed was a screw driver (drill driver made the job so much easier) and a small wrench from start to finish. It took little over 30 minutes for me, and the result looked great.The fabric cover that came with the frame fit well; it just needed some stretches with muscle to reach the velcro strips inside the frame. With the stainless steal legs and the clean while cover, the frame looked really nice, classic, and clean. However, the real benefit of this frame is the weight and the sturdiness. This frame is not like the cheap frames that can be bent and broken easily. It feels very solid, and it supports good weight on top.Overall, considering the factors such as; easy of assembly, classic design, and the sturdiness, this bed frame is satisfactory. I think the price could be more competitive, but since it includes free shipping on this 78 lbs heavy box, I guess it’s not too bad.

These curtains were undoubtedly made for my living room. First, I want to make the point that I am not an expert of fabrics or curtain styles. I needed a set of curtains to match the earth tones of my living room—oak wood furniture pieces, dark chocolate upholstery, and creme-toned wall. Green was the ideal color for my curtains, and although I was hesitant that the green tea would be far too bright for my taste, I was relieved to be wrong upon sporting them on my window. Also, I was not necessarily looking for curtains to block light from my living room, but it did not hurt that these curtains did just that. ((I would like to admit, however, that although these curtains do block light, they do not necessarily block in great depth.)) Mostly, I was interested in having a nice, simple set of curtains to complement my living room, and these are perfect! The design is unique, nothing fancy, and the weight, considering the length of each curtain, is rather light. I did not have to alter these curtains whatsoever. I simply slid the grommets into curtain rod on each side, and my living room was complete! Please receive this review from someone who was looking for an easy solution to decorate her living room. These curtains worked for me, but they may not necessarily make everyone happy.

I received a variety of Special K cereal: Original, Fruit & Yogurt, and Red Berries. I was excited to have these individual cups because my family and I are always "on the go," and these cereals come in handy, especially when we can simply buy a pint of milk for all three of us when we travel and fill these babies up and eat "stress free." My family is familiar with all three cereal favors, as we often purchase Special K, so I have no complaints about the taste of any of these. Of the three, Original is the plainest and least sweet, so if one prefers a sweeter option, one might prefer choosing the other two over Original. The contents per cup is mostly satisfying, but I have found that for me, there is too much cereal to finish. If one is a “light" eater or likes to have something to eat in addition to cereal (fresh fruit, yogurt, etc.), one might find him/herself stuffed rather quickly. If one has just finished an intense morning workout or is very hungry, one will not mind the amount to finish. Overall, this pack is convenient, tasty, and well priced. My only gripe, however, is that the carb content for Original versus the flavored options is significantly different. Since I am a health nut I tend to resort to Original as the carb count is 26g versus 65 for the other two (ouch!). I wish you a happy breakfast, whether you prefer the plainest or sweetest taste.

The recliner box was huge and delivered by a local freight service, but the box made it through my front door, which I imagined wouldn't, as the box was quite wide. After unboxing, all I had to do was putt the back support of the recliner, and that was it. I thought it might require some bolts screwing and what not, but there was really nothing to assemble but putt the back part. It only took a minute to put together with a help of one pair of extra hands.The design is, I have to say, very classic. The earthy tone can go with almost any interior tone,  and it blends well especially with my sandy colored wall and darker floor. The upholstering seemed meticulously well done with the distinguishing big stitches. There is no uneven stitches or loose threads. The cushions are big and fluffy all the way from the sitting part to the top head rest part. Arm resting is also big, comfortable, and cushiony. The cushions are rather soft, and it is perfect for the ones with the soft cushion preference. The leathery fabric is just like faux leather. It feels and looks like real leather, but I was surprised it's not real leather. I don't know if this is some kind of new material, but I like that there's no dust or lint coming out from the chair and still feels soft and leathery.The most important aspect of choosing a recliner is probably the comfortableness. The first night on this recliner, I fell asleep within an hour. The next day, my wife fell asleep sooner than I had the day before. We nicknamed this recliner 'sleepingchair.' I would not recommend this for reading as one can fall asleep easily. I might not be crazy about the rocking function, but it's included and very functional. For about a month long usage of this recliner, the reclining frame construction seems robust and durable. I did not notice any unevenness or malfunctioning during reclining back and forth and folding back and forth.Overall, this highly comfortable recliner is highly recommended. The level of comfortableness of this recliner is over 90% in my opinion, and it's highly functional as a rocking recliner as well. When reclined, it is not too stiff, not too soft, I felt really comfortable whether watching a movie, reading a book (beware of falling asleep if you are extra tired), or just having a conversation. Lastly, this recliner will accommodate anyone who wishes to give it a try; the chair is certainly not small.

I see more and more accessory makers are adapting magnetic solution for the mounting, and Lifeproof is not an exception. The difference is that along with the magnetic part, this adapter is designed for use with other LifeActiv accessories such as bike mount and belt clip. And to be able to do that  Lifeproof came up with a well-designed adapter that is not too thick and still has strong plate/magnet for magnetic support. This adapter is designed to use with the Lifeproof case, I think, but it still works well with other cases or the phone surface itself.
