Also, the adapter works pretty well with the original mountek holder and Techmatte holder. It would probably work with any other holder that is magnetic. What I found on this adapter is that its holding power is stronger than others and it gave a very sturdy grip on the mount.Overall, this adapter is strong and well made. What I am most benefiting from this is the convenience of how quickly I can attach and detach my phone with only one hand effortlessly. I have been using other magnetic mounts at home, office, and in the car, and I would not probably go back to any other type of mounts and holsters until I find it fantastically innovative. The product photos and descriptions on the Amazon page is slightly confusing (I could not tell whether the adapter comes with the case or not), but this item is the adapter only, fyi.

I bought several of these bulbs with the Hub 5 months ago, and I can say it’s been working great without any major issues. I scheduled two bulbs to turn on overnight outside during the winter months and other bulbs for indoor use. The bulbs worked great as scheduled even in the coldest northeast winter nights. Turning on and off and dimming the bulbs from my phone and tablet worked seamlessly and never malfunctioned except the times the Hub went offline.This bulb is rated 800 lumen and consumes around 12 Watts/hour. That’s 2 Watts more than 600 lumen philips Hue bulb and 800 lumen philips slim style led bulb.This bulb is not supported by the Robot (from the Wink App) or IFTTT features yet, but I wish I could do some fun and automatic things in the future, including voice command control. Overall, this bulb is very functional as intended and the price is ok for the connected bulb.

I bought this monitor at a local store for a project. I took the plastic casing apart to get the panel out, and was surprised that it was LG panel inside. The monitor has been on for about two weeks now continuously, and I found no issues such as light bleeding, dead pixels, or smudges.Colors and default color temperature are very good, I did not have to adjust anything. Images and texts are sharp and crispy, and the brightness is excellent as well. I decreased the brightness to about 40% to conserve energy usage, and it consumes only 14.8 Watts/hour. That's equivalent to one CFL bulb (60W) turned on (or less) and I calculated it would only cost me $3/year for 8 hours of usage a day.This is very very energy efficient led monitor with LG panel inside. The monitor stand and OSD are mediocre, yet the colors/contrast/brightness and viewing angle (IPS LED panel) is excellent.

This is simply the most beautiful iphone case I’ve ever seen. It fits perfectly, not so loose, not so tight; it’s just a perfect fit. The built quality is excellent. It looks as if the leather skin was glued on the plastic casing meticulously and seamlessly, especially on the corners. I could not find out whether this is real leather either on the product box or description page, but by the smell of it, I am pretty sure it’s real leather. (It smells just like my real leather wallet and belt). So how do I like it on my phone? I love the feel and look. I always wished Apple made leather surfaced iPhone or iPad or even a Macbook cases, like Samsung did on their Chromebook. It just feels better, different, and luxurious when leather is applied on things. Maybe I can DIY on my MBP.Overall, this is the most simple, functional, and beautiful leather case I could find. It is rather pricy, yet it is better than any other overpriced plastic cases by other brands. Fyi, this case comes with a screen protector film and a screen cleaning cloth which come in handy from time to time.

This replacement head fitted on my old delta faucet. I had to put one of the adapters that came together, and installing was easy and quick. Both spray and stream mode worked well as designed, and the button to switch the modes was easy to press every time. It did not require too much pressure to press the button, and I liked that kind of smooth and easy button.The built quality is OK. I received the plastic (chrome) version, but it looks nice. The product is well designed, and the size is not too small not too big; it goes well with our existing faucet. It is comfortable to pull out and hold the head.It only feels slightly cheap when I grab and use the head, but it functions well as designed.Fyi, there is a warning label that came in the package, saying "This product contains a chemical know to the State of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm" for this plastic / chrome version head. I don't know if the other version has the same warning label, but I wonder what kind of chemical that is and also what it means by 'contains'. I don't know if that means the water coming out of this head will be affected, or simply just saying this head is made of the materials that contain a harmful chemical. Whether I like it or not, almost all plastic products have some degree of harmful chemicals, in my non scientific opinion, and nothing is chemical free.

I bought this TV (2015 model) at Target recently, and it has been working well. It only weighs about 20 pounds, so it was easy to carry and to assemble (two legs). The TV was all set after connecting some media boxes and cable and took only about 10 minute. This is a 2015 model, and the design has not changed much from last year’s model, but I really like the design. The thin and metallic look bezel (still plastic) is trendy and simple; all thick black bezel looks like a thing of the past. The 2.2 inches of thiness is about half of the thickness from my 55" sammy LED TV, and it makes easy and elegant to hang on the wall. FYI, if one wanted to wall mount, this TV has vesa 400 x 400 mm and comes with a pair of wall mount space for the upper holes.The factory default color setting was quite good; I did not have to adjust anything to calibrate the colors and what not. This is my third LED TV from LG (various sizes and models I’ve purchased in the past several years), and I always found that the color setting was very natural and accurate. In contrast, other brands’ LED TVs I’ve owned needed some color adjustment to make it look more natural. However, if one prefers different color presets (vivid, APS, cinema, game, expert1 and 2) are available in the menu.) I just prefer the standard color setting. On this TV, movies and TV shows look very nice. The picture quality is super clear and sharp; it's pleasuring to watch things in good HD quality. And of course, a nice set of extra speakers would help gaining more pleasure since the built in speakers are 'built in' speakers.One thing I'd like to mention in this review is the yellowish tint on the right hand side of the screen. It is very subtle and minimal, and I don't think it's noticeable for a normal consumer, but because I am sensitive to color accuracy, I picked out on a white background. However, during daily TV watching, this was not be noticeable at all, and mine did not show any light bleeding or dead pixels.Overall, I like this very basic LED TV. It's not a 'smart' model, but a Roku, Fire TV, Chromecast, or Apple TV are always better than 'smart' TV, in my opinion. Picture quality is what’s impressive, and it clearly stood out among other LED TVs when I looked side by side at the store. However, the biggest pro for me on this one is the low energy consumption. I set the Energy Saving mode at medium and my P3 meter measured 29 Watts/hour. That’s probably 10 times less than what Plasma TVs used to consumed in the past. Less than 30 watts/hour is pretty impressive, and the screen is still not too dim. Now I don’t feel too guilty watching a TV too long.

This patriotic throw blanket is warm and a perfect size for all members of the family. The design is meaningful and makes one 'cover' with pride. The bottom of the blanket is faux wool while the flag is polyester but with a silky, plushy feel. This throw blanket is not only ideal for keeping warm but also fitting for decorative purposes on a piece of furniture, wall, or window. Also, I would imagine this piece to be an excellent prop for photographers, especially shooting subjects and families (imagine a sleeping baby on it!).The bottom line is that this blanket is very warm regardless of preferred use. I live in the Northeast, and winter is still harassing spring temperatures, so having an extra blanket is necessary at our household. While I use this blanket, I do not need an additional blanket, as I normally do. This blanket alone warms up quickly, and its soft and cozy texture makes it difficult for one to part from it.I would caution for those considering using this blanket for outdoor decorative purposes to take precaution with the all-white bottom of the blanket. Mine is in a spotless environment, but I would imagine washing out dark stains would not be easy if it got dirty. The flag is also susceptible to getting dirty, as the stars and stripes are also white.Overall, this blanket is beautiful and useful for all reasons I mentioned and beyond!

The fan works perfectly with any USB ports on the computer or phone charger. Since I am not a big fan of strong fan blowing, this low powered USB fan is just perfect for gentle breeze cooling. I like how it is so quite and simple to operate. The power control knob worked as expected and the fan speed varied by the control. The overall size is rather big being a USB powered fan, but compared to the ones that have small blades, this one feels like a real fan. The included USB wall adapter comes handy when charging other devices when the fan is not in use as well. Overall, it feels cheap, but works well for me.

I have many different brands of colognes, and among them, white musk scent was always my favorite. Like any other human sense related products, colognes are very personal because of one’s preferences, but I found new favorite. I am not a big fan of strong scent or cologne and this one is not punchy. This white polo scent is very familiar and famous, yet not too strong at first, but it lasts longer than others I have tried. The scent is somewhat gentle for me, and I like it that way with longer lasting endurance. Imitations often have similar scent at a low price, but only last an hour or so. This one is from Amazon and for sure an authentic Lacoste, and the pure scent lasts pretty much all day and night freshly.

Recently, I had a chance to film kids' musical recitals. With this 22WL model, I couldn't have it done any more perfectly. I was maybe more than 80 feet away at the back of the hall with my cameras, and I could not afford to go back and forth to the stage to control/monitor audio recording. This new WIFi model was just perfect for my need. I preset the recorder close to the stage, and then I was able to monitor and control the recordings in the back on my iPhone. Using the WIFI connection drained the battery little faster than I expected, but a small smartphone battery pack also could have been used if wanted, for peace in mind. There was a slight lag, maybe 0.3~0.5 second between the unit and the app, but it was perfectly doable for me. I mainly used instrument (accoustic) recording preset and some interview so far, and of course, the recording quality is very satisfactory. My camera with a shotgun on top recorded some good audios in the past, but that is not as good as this one anymore, unless it’s for ambient sound. It’s always better to get closer to the source for both images and sounds.Prior to the recent event filming, I found Tascam had an firmware updates ready for this unit and I went ahead and downloaded and updated. Updating the firmware was easy and took only a couple of minutes. With the original firmware that came with the unit, I had some issues controlling via app. When I tested the unit before the firmware update, streaming wasn’t reliable and the app acted out. However, firmware update solved the streaming issue, and the app now communicates better with the recorder.Overall, I found this model is perfect for a remote setup as well as portable recording. The unit is rather big in size for my small hands, but if I setup on a gorilla pod, size doesn’t really matter. Preset scenes and functionality is one of the best along with its recoding quality in the class and this new model now supports wifi connectivity for more controllability. The recently updated app works reliably and responsively well on my iPhone for now, and the WIFI range is also good in open space. I think, however, the app (iOS version) still needs more polishing and enhancing with some additional features such as maintaining cellular data connection while the app is connected via WIFI. I also wish it supported realtime streaming for monitoring and checking the sound. There are some small things like 'streaming' option being 'off' by default (every time I restart the recorder,) but I am sure this can be updated easily in the future for more user friendly ways. At the end of day, what matters is the great sound quality this recorder can record.

I hesitated on this piece because I thought it was a huge pumpkin colored pendant that my grandma could have owned in the past, but I was completely wrong. This necklace is very subtle and beautiful. It is small in size and elegant in color. This is not my grandma’s necklace anymore, but rather it is pettish and classy piece. The style is somewhat classic, yet I still think there’s a bit of modern simplicity as a whole piece. The lace (or chain) is thin and light; it almost feels like silk lace. And the pendant is solid and secure.Overall, I love this piece. Once worn, it looks much different from the image on the product page. It look much more beautiful on the actual human skin, and the subtle color changing on the one’s skin tone is just simply gorgeous. Fortunately, we have an almost matching earring set that can go beautifully with this piece, so I am very happy. In my opinion, the color of the pendant is so subtle, it can go with any tone of skin and dress, dark to light, light to dark.

This keyboard and touchpad combo is perfect for HTPC in my living room. The distance between the dongle and the keyboard is around 10 feet and it works flawlessly. However, if there's an object or obstacle in between, I noticed the connection got interrupted. All the keys and the touchpad functioned well with my windows 8.1 setup. Also, the keyboard works well with my Macbook. I had no problem waking up the mac from sleep or putting it back to sleep. The keys are soft and typing is easy on my hands with this, but I found the size of touchpad is somewhat small.I am happy with this keyboard and touchpad combo overall. The price was great when on sale and the reliability is greater than some off brand bluetooth keyboards. I paired this keyboard to my htpc and it works very well, but I also found that this could be a regular wired keyboard or BT keyboard alternative.

I want to make two things clear before I begin my review: I am not a professional stylist (nor pretend to be), and this styler is the second I have owned; therefore, I am merely reviewing this amazing product based on a perspective that may be limited to those who need a full comparison between this styler and other competitive brands.I have wild, uncontrollable wavy hair. In fact, I cannot JUST wear my hair down without any styling, so I need some sort of straightener or styler to help control my long hair when I do not have it up in a bun or ponytail. For this reason, I had to buy a straightener several years ago when I decided to let my hair grow. Until I received this ghd styler, I had no idea what I was missing. The previousstraightener I owned I bought at Target; I just needed the thing to make my hair straight. Although the device took a long time to do its job, I was satisfied with the mediocre results because I could let my hair down. However, when my ghd periwinkle beauty arrived in the mail, and I utilized it for the first time, I finally understood why price and brand are important when making such investments for hair devices.First, upon using this device, I was impressed with its packaging. If you are giving this styler as a gift to someone, the box itself is lovely. The styler comes with a nice storage case. Your styler is definitely pampered when you are not operating it. The styler comes with very basic instructions, and it offers no styling tips. The cord is 9FT long, which is convenient for those who have some distance between plug and mirror, and the “neck” (where the cord connects to the styler) moves (swivels) freely along with your hand. Before use, one simply plugs the device into the outlet, and the styler will prompt the user when it is hot enough to begin styling; I wait for about 15~20 seconds. After, the styler flattens hair in no time! I am used to taking 2-3 minutes per section of my head to straighten my hair; this styler takes between 30-45 seconds per section, with much better results. Since I am only interested in making my hair straight, I am extraordinary pleased with this beautiful styler. I have not stopped using this styler since I received it.Whether there are other brands that are better, I cannot know. I am sure this is a great tool for styling creatively as well as straightening. Yet, once you own it, you will want to look up styling tutorials on YouTube to make better use of it, as I began to do after using it.  If I were a professional stylist, I am certain I would love this styler. Price and brand do matter, and now I understand why ghd has such a good reputation.

The pillow arrived in a nice vinyl case that can be used for traveling if one wanted. Upon opening the case, some smell (brand new memory form smell, I suppose) dispersed, and it wasn't pleasant. I inspected the pillow quickly, and I found the quality of this pillow was visually excellent though. After covering the pillow with a freshly washed pillowcase, the original form smell was almost undetectable.Now I have slept on this pillow several nights, and I am very satisfied with the quality of the pillow and the comfort I got. This is my first memory form pillow and never had one in the past; now I am thinking of replacing all of my pillows to memory form. Although I like firmer and harder pillows, at first, I thought this pillow was a little too firm and boxy. But then my initial impression diminished after the second night. The pillow is rather firm, yet it is providing me the comfort I need over night, and it stays cool. The pillow is somewhat boxy, yet it is soft and comfortable. Whether I toss it around or not, it fully supports my head position firmly, and it is very comfortable. My worry about this pillow being a boxy disappeared once I rested my head and tried to feel the comfort level. Also, once the pillowcase is on, I couldn't really tell the difference by looking at it next to a regular cotton pillow with the same pillowcase. However, the big difference between the two is the supported firmness and coolness through the night.Overall, I found this memory form pillow is more comfortable for me than my cotton pillows. This pillow is firm, and at the same time it is soft. It's not that high, not that low, not too soft, not too hard. The price isn't too bad compared to some name brands' cotton pillows (that will shrink its thickness by half in a couple of months sometimes). I haven't had this memory form pillow to see if it loses its thickness eventually or stains itself with my sweat, but for now, this is the most satisfying initial impression for me so far.

The sim card did not work initially, so I just had to call the Red Pocket CS and it worked immediately.Since the one 5 minute phone call, this sim card has been working well with my ATT version iPad Air. The mobile data ($5 for 512MB and $10 for 1GB for 30 days) is not too bad and I only need to pay when I need mobile data (no contract). The description shows 4G, but I get LTE signal on my iPad most of the times (depends on the location), and the speed is satisfactory where I use the device. Red Pocket uses T-Mobile towers so the signal strength and connection might be spotty sometimes, but it works with my iPad within my budget.

This eye shadow compact is colorful and long-lasting. Although the compact includes specific instructions to wear each color at once, one can wear each color solo with lovely results. I received classic nude (#60), and I could not have asked for a more appropriate set, since nudes complement my olive complexion. These colors do not wear off easily. I applied the eye shadow at 7:15 A.M., and it was still going strong at 5:00. Lastly, this product is kind to my eye needs. My eyes are very sensitive, which has prevented me from purchasing just any brand. I have always trusted Neutrogena for this reason, because the brand offers quality products for every person. Lastly, although I do believe the item is somewhat pricy, I undoubtedly know the set is worth it. Another bonus, since my using this set, nobody had ever noticed my eyeshadow at work (not that I expect anyone to do so), but it was nice receiving compliments not only for the shades but also for the subtle presentation on my eyes. I definitely recommend!

What I like about this shower caddy is the material. It’s clean, light, but solid. It’s been hanging for about a month now, and I haven’t noticed any rust on any parts. As the name of this caddy claims, it doesn’t seem it will rust anytime soon. In the past, no matter how expensive stainless steal shower caddies I hung, they all ended up rusting. I have not tried an aluminium shower caddy before, but this one seems decent.What I don’t like about this caddy is the shortness of the ‘hanging’ part. The ‘neck’ is too short, and the shampoo and body wash bottles I placed are too high. For a tall person or low shower head, this might work well, but for those who are not tall with the high shower head, this could be inconvenient to reach the bottles.Overall, this shower caddy is a decent product. Since everybody’s height and the position of the shower head are different, this caddy won’t satisfy all, but for some, it can be a very nice shower caddy. If you have a shower head that’s not too high might work best to hang this nice shower caddy.

0:25 Mins I already had the Wink HUB and some Link bulbs installed at home, and this was my new addition to the Wink HUB. Installing these sensors was easy and simple. I pulled the battery sticker, attached, and then activated the Tripper on the app. It took less than 5 minutes, and everything worked perfectly as expected. The size of the main sensor is somewhat wide and big, so I found it was not easy to attach to the door with moldings. An additional (thicker) adhesive pad might solve the issue though.From what I learned, the Wink HUB and the app might not be perfect, but it seems the Wink team is constantly trying to improve their product and software to make work better with many other products. For now, this Tripper sensors are working very well with the both Wink HUB and the app, and I am happy that I got this budget home security done D.I.Y. so easily. I might get a couple more for the windows.

I have two rooms that are far away from the router thus get barely minimum wifi signal. The weak signal in those two rooms mean slow speed. From time to time, watching a video clip from youtube or netflix means suffering in buffering. This powerline kit, however, solved the issue painlessly. I’ve never had powerline network extender devices, so I read the installation guide prior to connecting the kit to my home network. But, there was nothing that had to be done but plug into the power outlet and connect the ethernet cables. The internet connection worked immediately on my computer, and it was pleasantly fast. I checked the link speed, and it was showing 100 Mbp/s with the ‘Pick A Plug’ LED light showing between amber and green.Overall, I am very satisfied with this Powerline Network Extender Set. This is a true ‘plug and play’ type of network extender that simply works without any issues or complicated installation. Also, the built in extra outlet is very useful on both adapters, and I found these are very energy efficient (consumes only 1.7 Watts/h). Highly recommended!

I want to preface this review by saying that I have owned many choppers and slicers since I find these items essential to my kitchen. I have owned brands from KitchenAid to Sunbeam, and I know which brands work best for me. With that in mind, I also give gadgets and applicanes a chance regardless of brand, because I have learned that sometimes a less expensive item might work well whereas a more expensive item may not, as the brand is what costs people money and not so much the product. Therefore, I am reviewing this Freshwater product with an open mind, as I have not owned any other product by this brand.First off, the quality of this product is OK. The plastic pieces do not seem very study, and upon use, one might likely believe that the plastic parts will not last long, unless one is careful at each use. I can easily foresee an accidental drop cracking one or more of the pieces of this set. However, with regular care, this product will work just fine! On the plus side, which is important to me: this product is BPA free!!As for the use of this slicer, it really works as it should. I have used the slicer for onions, zucchini, apples, etc., and I have not had any issues. I love the storage container, which makes storing and cleaning up easy. The same goes for the chopper, which works well. The blades are solid and easy to replace.For washing, I recommend simply using warm water and a dab of soap. Although the product page states that the items are dishwasher top rack safe, I recommend hand washing the items, which is painless. (Some blades are very sharp, so be careful)Overall, I recommend this product, and I have had no issues with any of the pieces. This kit has many different parts for different functionalities, so I had to spend some time to get used to this kit. Once I got comfortable, I spent less time slicing and chopping in my kitchen. So for me, this kit is a timesaver. I cannot predict each piece lasting years, but it is a nice, convenient starter set for anyone.

This light is a bright yet dimmable and energy-efficient LED flood light. I personally have never heard of the brand 'Muller Licht', but I assume it's a German brand manufacturing in China. The product description claims that this bulb is engineered in Germany, but according to the product packaging, the bulb is made in China (just like any other bulbs).The bulb is very big and very bright. Due to the size of the bulb, this light is perfect for outdoor flood lighting, yet I happened to have a huge light stand (dimmable) for my living room, so I decided to put the bulb in there. The light stand I have with the bulb paired well with the full dimming capability. I also noticed that there is no buzzing noise, unlike my other bulb that made noise when dimmed. This bulb consumed only 1 watts/h at the lowest dimming and 15.3 watts/h at full brightness. I like how this bulb uses so little energy  (when in use) and its dimming capability, but there's one thing I want to mention as well. I don't know if I simply received a refurbished bulb or not, but the bulb did not look like it was brand new when I opened the sealed package. (The completely sealed, hard plastic packaging was brand new.) There are many visible scratches, black smudges, uneven / rough edges where 2 plastic casings glued together, and some fingerprints. The product works fantastic, but the overall finish of the bulb looks like very much 'used' in a rough environment. If the bulb I received was 'refurbished' or 'remanufactured' then all the scuff and smudges I mentioned is understandable; if this is the standard when they manufacture a brand new bulb, then I am disappointed with their QC process. Overall, I would give 5 stars, minus one because of the bad QC.

There must be a reason why Google bought Nest Labs for 3.2 Billion. My opinion on why Google bought Nest Labs (in cash) is because they foresee the household smart devices market as blue ocean, and it was sparked by this thermostat and led by Nest Labs. I am slowly and carefully adapting these household smart devices, and this time, followed by my Philips Hue set up in my home, this thermostat is the second device I am adopting.Installation took about 15 minutes, and it was just simple and easy. I watched the installation video on the web and followed the guide. Basically, all I needed to install this was my hand and a included screwdriver. Then, set up also was breezy and done on the device within 10 minutes. During the setup, I had no issue or problem connecting to my secured home wifi, and from testing to first usage went smooth as expected.So this is just a WIFI connected thermostat and what’s the big deal? I don’t have to crawl out of my warm and cozy bed in the middle night. I can monitor home temperature and control the thermostat wherever and whenever I want. It learns our temp setting pattern after a month or so, so I don’t have to do it myself. And it generally helps me save the energy, and it’s just so easy and convenient.My nest thermostat is still learning our heating behavior, yet everything so far has been just working great. Connection to my WIFI is stable, the app on my phone and my iPad are responsive. Updates are all done and all the sensors are pretty accurate.Overall, I am really happy with this thermostat. It made my life easier and helps me monitor home energy consumption. The product’s hardware quality and design is just exquisite and elegant considering being a household thermostat. Everything just works as expected in a beautiful way. And now I know what I’m going to buy next; Nest Protect Smoke Plus Carbon Monoxide. http://www.amazon.com/Nest-Protect-Monoxide-Battery-S2001BW/dp/B00KLUY4M4/ref=sr_1_1?s=hi&ie=UTF8&qid=1418413968&sr=1-1&keywords=Nest

This is a newly introduced learning tool from Leapfrog that’s compatible with its new LeapTV system. This Dance and Learn is one of the few cartridges currently available for LeapTV system, and I and my kid found this one to be great fun. He first just thought this was just another game, but without knowing, he got involved in learning vocabularies, alphabets, phonics, and compound words easily and quickly. He was just busy having fun dancing, wiggling, shaking arms, and bouncing, yet all these physical activities programed to work with teaching the basic reading skills. There are basically 9 different dance games that also involve learning in 3 different modes (+ Free Play mode). Up to four kids can play together, and the controller is not needed to play this Dance and Learn title (one controller is still needed to navigate and execute the game). Parent guidance and supervision was somewhat necessary at the beginning, but once my kid played a couple of times, he figured out how to navigate and play by himself without me.Overall, this is a really fun game and learning tool for kids under 7. The title description suggests kids age between 4-7, but I think 3 year old will and can have fun as well if played.The LeapTV and this game title works somewhat like the Wii system, but the fundamental difference is that, with this one, kids can see themselves on the TV screen as they play and dance. The key to having fun with this title is to have a well lit room and have a right distance from the camera, I found. After putting an extra light next to the tv set, it worked much better because the camera could see my kid better in better lighting. The space doesn’t have to be huge; actually, a small space with the camera and the child’s distance around 5 feet worked best for us.Overall, this is a wonderful game that enhances kids’ physical and learning skills. I found the title and the leapTV system are very much kid appropriate/friendly, and I do recommend this system for parents  looking to introduce children to educational gaming.

This cable syncs and charges my iPhone 5s, iPhone 6 plus, and iPad Air without any issues. It worked well with all of my usb chargers, usb ports on my computer, and including the car charger. This charge and sync cable is made for idevices and is almost identical to Apple’s, except this one being 1 foot longer. A longer cable might not be necessary for in car use, but almost always useful for me at home and in the office. Apple’s original 3 ft cable is always seemed too short, and I wished many time it being longer in the past.There are many cheap lightning cables available, but I would recommend getting something better like this one. Knockoffs can damage the device, and I wouldn’t bet my expensive devices paired with the cheap cables. This cable comes with a 2 year limited warranty, fyi. I don’t know if that covers the device as well, but at least, if anything happens to the cable, it’s covered for 2 years. So twisting, folding, and shoving into my pant pockets or backpack are of no concern.

This is a nice quality iPad case for Air 2 model. The product description shows ‘for iPad Air 2 / iPad Air’ , but this case does not fit in to original Air model. It seems as if this case made only for Air 2 and Belkin made a mistake advertising it can fit both models. I tried hard to fit my Air, and it was just impossible to put the Air inside. Besides the misleading compatibility issue, this would work well with the newest iPad Air 2. The case is not too heavy considering being a folio case, and it only weighs 0.78 lbs. The quality is durable and well made; this kind of case is one that can last many years. Overall, I like Belkin cases for my tablets and phones. They make quality cases that can protect my devices. This one also could have been a nice folio case that could protect my iPad Air and work as multi viewing angle stand if it fitted my Air as the company advertised.

Even though this colander is HUGE, and I have a small kitchen, I still love it!!! Since this colander has a 5 quart capacity and offers extendable legs, which are the products two best features, I can do everything I want with it. I am a baker and pickler over the weekends; therefore, washing and ensuring my fruits and vegetables easily drain after washing, is one of the biggest advantages two owning this amazing colander. This colander is also a lifesaver for draining large amounts of pasta/noodles, which is my second need for it. Although this colander is dishwasher safe, I recommend hand washing it, as it does not take much labor to clean it after each use. This colander also serves for an easy way to dry plastic/wooden utensils after washing dishes if you have the space for it. The quality of the product is super: the plastic is strong, sturdy, and offers slip-free moments in the sink. Before one decides that the product is too bulky or big for his/her small kitchen, think twice, as this colander has many uses and will tailor to his/her needs. Lastly, this colander is OXO, which is a common brand in my kitchen, and I have yet to complain about each OXO item I have. OXO delivers a quality product for one’s daily kitchen tasks! Great buy!

The initial pairing of this bluetooth keyboard case to my iPad air was successful, and the connection remained paired unless I tried to pair with different device. One attempt to a different device messed the whole BT pairing; I had a hard time re-pairing to any of my devices. After many failed attempts to pair, I was able to pair again to my iPad. Once it's paired, it works the way a BT keyboard works. When the keyboard is idle, it disconnects, and waking up the keyboard by pressing any keys reconnects to my iPad within a second or two.The overall quality and material choice is great, but the design is not. This case is heavy (1.35 lbs) and bulky; it is in fact, heavier than my iPad Air (1.05 lbs). Belkin has made better BT keyboard cases for iPads in the past, and it seems as if they rushed to put this one on the market for the iPad Air 2 model.Overall, this is my least favorite bluetooth keyboard from Belkin. I prefer Belkin Thin Type to this one for my iPad Air. If you have an iPad air 2 and are looking for a bluetooth keyboard case, I don't think I can recommend this one. The description says this case would fit iPad air and air 2 models, but I could not even fit my Air into this case. The keyboard functions well once paired to only one device, but my overall opinion is that the keyboard is poorly designed and priced somewhat high.

I have loyally used Juice Beauty since 2008. Every product—moisturizer, cleanser, toner, mask, serum, lip moisturizer, etc.—has left my skin feeling and looking exceptional. Their SPF 30 Sport Moisturizer is no different. After applying the moisturizer, my skin feels smooth and protected. Many of the JB moisturizers I have used in the past, especially those with sun protection, including this sport moisturizer, are thick in texture and leave almost a white finish on my face, which is not a product everyone person can wear, as everyone has a different tone of skin. However, with some gentle reinforcement onto your face, the white tint will minimize. (I understand some individuals do not favor the thick, white finish, but I have made it work for me). I also appreciate that once applied to my skin, I feel satisfied that is does not easily rub off onto clothes (through changing sessions). Lastly, when I simply do not feel like wearing makeup, I use moisturizer solo, which always blends nicely onto my skin. I spend a lot of time outside, and thus far, I have not suffered from extreme sun damage thanks to this and other SPF Juice Beauty products. Compared to other Juice Beauty products, $16 is not a bad price at all. Knowing that my skin is protected makes this product valuable to me. I highly recommend it, and I will continue to purchase this moisturizer as well as other JB products!

This is very heavy and high quality wasts can. I love its simple and clean design and the strong built quality. It looks very nice in my black and white toned bathroom and it just fits really well in the overall bathroom design. I am really satisfied with this waste can and I would buy another one for my second bathroom. Highly recommended !

Installing this router did not take long, and there was nothing complicated. Since my computers (laptops) don't take the mini CD that came in the box for installation, I just followed `method #2' on the `Quick Installation Guide' which was web based.First, connect this router to the cable modem, then power cycle the modem. And then connect to C2's WIFI on the computer (either 2.4 or 5 GHz) using the password that's on the bottom of the router. Then, finally, finish the setting up process by opening the web based setup page at tplinklogin.net. From the setup page, I could change the settings I wanted to have for the router.Once connected and finished setting up, I tested speed and range of 5 GHz band non-scientifically. With the Airport Extreme (AC version, and I know these two are not in the same class, but I am just comparing for reference purpose only), I was getting the link speed at 450 Mbit/s on my Mac and 234 on my PC at the same location and distance from the router. And with this C2 model, I was getting 150 Mbit/s on my mac and 58 on the PC. While the link speed was ok on my Mac and had no issues watching videos and doing normal web surfing, it was suffering to load some video clips on the pc side( btw, my pc supports AC band.)Overall, this is pretty basic router that offers mediocre AC connection range and speed at a reasonable price. If this used in a small space, it would do its job well and efficiently. However, if you're looking for a better wireless range and speed, C7 would be a great option for just $30 more, in my opinion. The C7 model is ranked at #1 in AC1750 class where same class Apple Airport Extreme is ranked at #6 for twice the cost of C7 according to the smallnetbuilder rankers.

I attached this led strip under my kid's bunkbed and I have to say it's fun to have this. My kid loved that fact he could change colors and do a little party lighting as well. The strip was long enough to go around (almost) the twin sized bed, but the double sided tape simply did not work after a couple of days. I then used some zip ties and the problem solved.The light strip has been working great without any issue for over two months now and I am thinking adding extra strips to the existing one. Highly recommended!

I love this awesome Metrokane Houdini wine tool kit! I have to admit that I have never owned a chilling carafe, and after having a blast with this kit, I do not know why I never thought about having one. Since I cannot compare to other brands, I will solely focus on my experience thus far. First of all, the kit includes a corkscrew, carafe, aerator, and preserver with two stoppers, which come in handy! Based on a few (responsible) evenings of wine “testing,” my wine remains chilled for at least a couple of hours. It took about half an hour to get the wine kindly chilled with the stainless steel rod filled with ice cubes. It was nicely chilled in my opinion. It wasn’t abrupt and shockingly chilling, but naturally and satisfyingly chilled. The vacuum pump and the stoppers worked ok, but, unlike the quality of the crystal carafe, the vacuum pump and the stoppers seemed a little bit cheap and the built quality seemed generic. The corkscrew did its job well, except the hinge that holds the blade was wobbly. Lastly, the aerator is my favorite from this set; it worked really well;  I could tell the slight difference in tasting with and without the aerator. I also liked how it just flows and pours nicely and leaves no spillage on the bottle. Attaching and detaching the aerator was easy and simple, but it was tight enough to stay attached and make no mess.The overall design of the set appears nice and classy, but the stopper is my only criticism, which just does not seem to fit the rest of the presentation. Despite this small undesirable feature, the product is great and does its job. Considering all the one gets upon purchase, I believe the price is beyond “right,” and I think the whole set would be a great choice as a gift item as well.

If you have owned Thomas Train wooden railway sets, this set will not disappoint your child. If you are unfamiliar with these beautiful trains and wooden accessories and are considering purchasing your first set for a child, this is a perfect starter set. The set comes with Percy, reg vehicle, cargo car and cargo, and if you have other Thomas Train accessories, such as trains and tracks, your child can easily add more fun to this set. Setting up this toy takes seconds, and your little one can assemble the set one his/her own, without a grownup’s assistance.  All pieces save for the trains themselves, are wooden but do not feel cheap. Two perks about this set: promotes fine motor skills development and allows children to explore magnetic properties. Although the price for this set is somewhat high, the quality of the toy and the amount of time children spend playing with this toy justifies the price. Overall, a wonderful set for any child!

This is a very sleek, but expensive, set of bluetooth stylus and ruler for iPad and Adobe apps. The design of this set is very stylish and goes well with the iPad’s design formula. The built quality is also above the standard with a minimal inconvenience.First, I charged the stylus for several hours, and it was ready to use on Adobe’s Line and Sketch app. Paring the stylus and switching between the two apps was easy and smooth. Both the stylus and the ruler worked well most of the time as they intended to. However, I quickly realized that these products were somewhat disappointing. The apps were fantastic, and I love both of them. They are wonderful sketching apps, and it works well most of the times, except one thing: The palm rejection. That’s one of the key feature from this stylus, yet it just doesn’t work well. Especially with the ipad’s multitasking gestures turned on normally, my palm and the stylus drove the Line app crazy. Simply to say, palm rejection feature is not working and not useful and the Multitasking Gestures should be off when using these tools and Adobe apps. This happened to other sketching apps and stylus I have, but this time seemed slightly more frustrating.On the other hand, pressure sensing worked well, and it was useful for me compare to other non pressure sensitive ones. The shortcut button was also helpful when needed to access some features quickly without looking for the buttons on the screen.The slide is something new, and I found it was quite useful to my surprise. It is somewhat limited what the slide can do at this time, but I see more features and options can be added easily in the future by Adobe (if they want to). I found that iPad’s 9.7” screen size is yet too small for both tools to be used in drawing. If I have an iPad that has 15” screen size, then the slide tool could be used much more freely than on the tiny 9.7” space. Hopefully, in the near future, Apple would make something bigger than the current size iPad. In the mean time, for the 9.7” iPad screen, the slide is somewhat big and wide.Overall, I think the idea was good and the set have some potential in the future. However, I don’t think it was easy to make the stylus that recognizes and rejects the palm perfectly yet because of the nature of touch screen. I do think the set still need some improvement and rethinking about pricing. In my opinion, if this set sold with some kind of free subscription of Creative Cloud, the current price might be justified. But for now, for the price, I would recommend other alternatives such as Jot Touch or investing in Wacom tablet.

What’s inside the boxThis phone reminds me of Google’s Nexus 4 in many ways. Here’s another very affordable and capable smartphone from BLU. Design and package is well made with recyclable materials. Inside the box, a charger, usb cable, earphone, manuals, plastic case, battery, and a screen protector are included. On the Amazon product Details page, it says 2 Lithium ion batteries required (included), but only one battery is required just like any other smart phone, and only one battery is in the box (extra battery could have been nice, however.) And of course, before the initial use, the battery needs to be fully charged.First, my favorite feature from this phone was unlocked dual sim slot. It doesn’t just have two sim slot, but I could actually activate two sim cards simultaneously. Then I could assign data service to sim1 and voice service to sim 2 or vice versa. This is the feature I always wanted since cellphone carriers keep raising the fee. Now I can finally have voice and data separately from two different carriers. I tried Cricket sim and T-mobile sim together and all worked great without an issue. I noticed, however, when both sim cards are active, battery seemed to run quicker. The sim slot #1 is micro-sim and slot #2 standard sized. Both of my Cricket and T-mobile sims are nano sized, so I just used a couple of adapters. http://amzn.com/B009GB6DBOScreen is the part that I look at all the time, so I think having a good (color, brightness, touch sensitivity) screen is critical when choosing a smartphone. And to my surprise, the screen on this phone looked no different from most of the recent smartphones. I checked again the resolution and it stated 540x960. Because my eyes are used to high resolution display devices these days, I was able to tell the resolution difference between this phone and my iPhone 6; however, I just couldn’t complain that this is lower resolution phone because it just looked perfectly good. Reading a news article, watching a HD video, and playing with the photos I took with this phone, all these screen intensified activities looked perfectly fine. If you’re worried this has lower resolution than other recently launched phones, please worry not. I’ve seen some worse screens on the phone, and this one has a very nice one, unlike other budget phones. Other than the lower number of pixels, the screen itself is very bright, clear, and sharp. The factory default color temperature runs slightly cooler than my iPhone, but I prefer to have cooler screen than a warmer one. Touch sensitivity was also very responsive and prompt; I didn’t feel or see anything lagging or delaying on the screen.Processing speed is one thing I noticed that lacks from my expectation. I felt it was little slow,  but it was nothing like buggy or laggy. Because I had a faster phone before, I felt this one was slightly slow. When web browsing in chrome, pages open little slow, but once loaded, it browses normally. Other apps such as Google maps, Camera, Skype, etc..work really well and fine including receiving the GPS signals. This phone might not offer fastest processing speed, but considering the cost of this device, this would beat any competitors’. Also, using google maps’ navigation worked really well and faster than others.Internal onboard storage is 8GB, but I had no problem adding a 32GB microSD card with full of media files. Different video files,such as .mkv, avi, mp4, all worked fine, and I was surprised actually the phone didn’t even get hot when watching a movie. With my 32GB microSD card added, I have more than enough storage to shoot HD videos with this phone (approximately, 22 hours of shooting time).Most frequently used hardwares parts, such as front/back camera, battery, led flash, speaker, headphone port, and all the buttons work well as they expected. I especially like the massive 8 megapixel camera in the back. Photos look wonderful and sharp, and video recording did a good job as well. Since this is a budget phone, there’s no image stabilization or slow motion video recording, but it does perfectly well on the fundamental features of smartphone. Speaker volume is loud enough if turned all the way up, led flash is bright enough to find key holes at night. Everything worked so well and smooth, I am really satisfied with this low cost, but very capable, phone.Overall, this is a excellent smart phone with the android 4.4 kitkat at a greatly reasonable price ($145). The price might give you an impression of low specs budget phone, but don’t get fooled by that. This phone is very capable running all the apps I need and does the job well. The build quality is excellent, and again, the phone doesn’t feel cheap at all (it feels like Nexus 4 for me) and weighs (5 oz) slightly more than iPhone 5S (4 oz). 4.7” screen size is very nice and big. I can still operate using only one hand and anything bigger than 4.7” needs both hands. I’ve never heard of this BLU brand and their phones, but after trying this phone for a week and looking at their smartphone lines, I am very satisfied with the phone. Along with other Chinese underdog brands such as Huawei, Oppo, ZTE, Xioami, and etc, BLU’s Life 2 is surely another good competitor to those major brands’ smartphones, and we, the consumers, are getting much wider pricing and device options. Competition is good and major brands will eventually compete against these off brands in current and somewhat inflated retail pricing.If you want little more speed, Studio 5.0 LTE version might work well for only $20 more. I am seriously considering getting the Studio 5.0 LTE version, and combined with the prepaid unlimited plans such as Cricket, $45/mon/line, I could ultimately save lots of money in the long run. Fyi, at my location, I get around 4 Mbps down and 2 Mbps up at 4~5 bars of HSPA+ on Cricket network (AT&T).

This body wash has minimum to medium strength scent and left my skin feeling a little less moisturized than other moisturizing body washes. I like the fact that the scent is not too strong, but when I finished drying myself, I could barely smell the scent. This scent is semi-similar to Old Spice's men's body wash, but it is slightly soft. It also worked well on my short hair as a shampoo and a conditioner. Basically it is very convenient to use one body wash from top to bottom to clean everything. Compared to other brands’ mens body wash, it is definitely more moisturizing on my skin and have to shower felt good and soft. Overall, it feels good, smells nice, and is convenient, but I wish the scent lasted little bit longer.
It fits perfect and works really well on my '12 outback rear window

This handheld smoker allows home cooks to provide a light smoke flavor to a wide range of foods. So far I have smoked eggs, butter, cooked spaghetti, cooked shrimp, mayonnaise and cooked rice. Setup is about as simple as you can get and there isn't much maintenance or cleanup required. This product was attractive to me because I live in an apartment and cannot have a full-size smoker. I also enjoy the ability to smoke cold products, such as butter.

I am currently using this quad lock adapter with my iPhone 6s Plus Battery Case, MFI Certified i-Blason Apple iPhone 6 Plus 5.5 Inch External Battery Case Charger Lightning Connector (Black/Gray). After making sure that I cleaned the surface of the battery case, and allowing lots of time for the adhesive to set, I have found that this mount is reliable enough for me to trust my iPhone 6+ across a range of activities.I have ridden about 200 miles on bumpy roads with this mount holding my phone to my handle bars. No problems. Same goes for using it with my Quad lock belt clip and car mount.

Bright and beautiful with an almost 3D effect. This curtain actually looks like a painting, allowing you to see the paint strokes in such detail that you will be surprised to find that you cannot feel the depth of the paint when you run your fingers across them. This shower curtain has brightened up our bathroom.

First I was surprised that these things really develop a vacuum seal when used with a range of containers. I was even able to use the medium sized lid to lift a 2 quart saucepan (unfilled) off of the stove. The lids bond to a range of materials I tested including steel, glass, ceramic and rigid plastic.I keep them by the microwave and pot rack now to use when covering food I warm up in the microwave. Splatter is eliminated and I don't waste paper towels.I used the small lid to cover miso soup in a ceramic bowl that my wife had to leave to take a call. It was still quite warm when the call was done 15 minutes later.These lids have a lot of uses and would be at home in any kitchen.

All of the silicone pieces in this set are of very good quality. I have been using the same silicone spatulas from Le Creuset for 12 years and expect a similar lifespan from this batch.The stainless steel vessel also seems solidly made. It can be used as a holder for the spoons and spatulas, but I prefer to use these types of containers for sauces, to collect vegetable peelings, etc.Overall this is a good package deal at a very good price.
Very good alternative to high priced bike jerseys for visibility and comfort while biking.

This is a great way to relieve stress on your feet and joints while using a standing desk or engaged in other profession where you have to be on your feet all day. I have tried a range of products from SPRI and AIREX pads to inexpensive ones you can buy from Costco. These pads from Imprint strike a nice middle ground in features, such as:1 - Comfort: The thickness of this pad is sufficient to eliminate a lot of stress. It's not going to be soft and spongy like an Airex pad, but lots of folks in my office thought that the 2" and thicker pads are too much. There are thicker Imprint pads - .75" for example - that offer a bit more cushioning. You may want to consider one of those for more padding.2 - Durability: Imprints stand up to shoes much better than softer pads. They also clean up much easier than open foam pads.3 - Color - These go very well with a range of standard corporate carpet patterns.Overall these are a solid option for folks looking for less achy feet at the end of the day. They get a solid recommend rating.

I only use this around the office and gym with my iPhone 6 plus. It saves me from having a giant phone in my pocket. It is very secure and you get accustomed to using it one-handed after a few tries. It is very secure and will hold your phone securely.

Most rolls of parchment paper have a problem - after cutting a few sheets you end up with the rest of the sheets not laying flat. These sheets from Reynolds are as good as any other type of parchment paper I have used over the years, but also always lay flat.

These Creative earphones offer a satisfying combination of noise isolation and high quality audio. Keep in mind that these are not noise-cancelling, and sell at a price well below the high end noise cancelling offerings from Bose and others. Noise isolation means that the ear buds do a fairly good job of keeping outside sound from getting into your ears. If you are on a plane or train though you will continue to hear a certain amount of background noise as there is only so much that isolating sound can accomplish.The earphones are small, lightweight but seem solidly made. They come with the standard small, medium and large sized ear buds. These earphones remain comfortably in place but tend to slip out during exercise.Overall these are a solid performer and audiophiles will appreciate the audio quality.

I bike commute a couple of days each week for 6-7 months a year. I have been using a combination of Topeak bags including the Topeak MTX Trunk Bag EXP Bicycle Trunk Bag with Rigid Molded Panels, the MTX Trunk Bag EX with rigid molded panels as well as some inexpensive Bontrager panniers. The Topeak MTX has been by standard commuter bag/pannier combo as I can roll up the panniers when they are not needed. It has been very durable and impossible to lose while riding on even the most pothole cratered roads that New York can offer up.I was pumped to try out these Thule panniers. I have been a big fan of Thule, having used many of their accessories including a bike roof rack. A few things of note about these bags:1 - Construction: These things are built to take all sorts of abuse. You can probably use them on your next dog sled trip through Alaska if you can figure out a way to attach them to your sled.2 - Reflective: I have the black bags and they are amazingly reflective. I used a bright headlamp that puts out a significantly less amount of light than a car headlight and the panniers pretty much lit up like a reflective highway sign.3 - Waterproof - there are by far and away the most watertight panniers I have seen. To me they seem to be almost at the point where they could be considered for use as a dry bag. I don't ride often in the rain, and therefore I have always found my Topeak bags to be sufficient but I would definitely prefer to use the Thule bags when waterproofing matters.4 - Attachment - Thule advertises these panniers as being usable on most commercial bike racks. This may be true but it took me some trial and error to get them to work with my Topeak rack and a couple of others that I had around. I ended up borrowing a Thule rack from a co-worker and found that the Thule bags worked flawlessly with that. If there is one complaint I have it is that the bag tended to bounce around a bit more than the Topeak MX. A couple of times there were some fairly jarring bumps that make me wonder if it's a good idea to put a laptop in the pannier. On this one point I think that Topeak's system is better.5 - Aesthetics - these bags look good. The carry straps allow you to sling it over your shoulder or across your chest with no problem. If style is your thing, these are probably the best looking waterproof panniers in this price range you will find.Overall this is a superior product that is priced a bit above other brands/models. I like them and will probably use them in wet weather or when I need to take a run to the grocery store. I will keep using my Topeak MX for normal riding as I like the flexibility to use the trunk and/or panniers as needed, and because I trust Topeak's stability to better protect my electronics.

I was given samples of two new products from Pure Protein. I have been buying their products for a couple of years after testing several brands of traditional protein bars and finding them to be the best tasting, as well as reasonably priced. I have canceled my subscription to the old-style bars as a result of trying the new version out.There are the second best tasting protein bar I have ever tried. The fruit and nut variety is the best tasting. Period. These taste as good as any granola, oatmeal or cookie-like bar out there but have a lot more protein and a lot less sugar. Whereas traditional protein bars are usually a "I eat them because it's what I'm supposed to do" type of food, these new versions will have you looking forward to your mid-bike break.Yes - there are always tradeoffs in life. Traditional Pure Protein bars also have 200 calories but have 20g of protein and 2-3g of sugar. With that you get a chalky, dense and (for most) a tolerable taste and mouth feel. These bars have the same number of calories but 18g of protein and 9g of sugar with great taste. If you are on a hyper-low sugar diet, you are probably going to give these the heave-ho. For those of us who are looking to power up during or after exercise, these are a much more pleasing option. To be honest though I wish this flavor bar was just a bit less sweet. That's why I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5.

I was given samples of two new products from Pure Protein. I have been buying their products for a couple of years after testing several brands of traditional protein bars and finding them to be the best tasting, as well as reasonably priced. I have canceled my subscription to the old-style bars as a result of trying these out.There are the best tasting protein bar I have ever tried. Period. These taste as good as any granola, oatmeal or cookie-like bar out there but have a lot more protein and a lot less sugar. Whereas traditional protein bars are usually a "I eat them because it's what I'm supposed to do" type of food, these new Nut Bar versions will have you looking forward to your mid-bike break.Yes - there are always tradeoffs in life. Traditional Pure Protein bars also have 200 calories but have 20g of protein and 2-3g of sugar. With that you get a chalky, dense and (for most) a tolerable taste and mouth feel. These bars have the same number of calories but 18g of protein and 7g of sugar with great taste. If you are on a hyper-low sugar diet, you are probably going to give these the heave-ho. For those of us who are looking to power up during or after exercise, these are a much more pleasing option.I also tried a second version - Pure Protein Fruit and Nut Bar, Tropical Fruit Macadamia Value Pack, 6 Count. These too were far superior to standard protein bars, albeit not quite as good as the fruit and nut version.
VERY cushioned, comfortable and not bad looking for this type of sandals. There are probably the best I have ever worn over the last 30 years and will likely continue to buy them in the future.

A product like this has to grow on you over time so I am giving it a 4-star rating after having used it for the past week. I'll update my review as I get more experience with it.I have tried a bunch of products that help you with self-quantification. For the most part I use them for a few weeks to a couple of months and then give up on them because of their inevitable shortcomings. Each device I have tried has had problems with comfort, limited functionality, unreliable readings, limited battery life, lack of integration with other tools, durability, waterproofing or style. Over time though the devices have become better, with progressively better ways of ingratiating themselves into your life.I have been using two types of devices consistently - my Polar watch and bike computer for several years and my Apple Watch for the past 6 weeks. I find them both to be exceptional at what they do, though they too have limitations. I have been wearing the UP3 by Jawbone daily alongside my Apple Watch and base my review on their competing approaches.Price - UP3 wins, as it is half the price of the cheapest Apple Watch.Compatibility - UP3 wins again - it will sync with both Apple and Android devicesStyle - This goes to the Apple watch. The UP3 is okay - it's not going to detract from and add to your outfit. It comes in a few colors but that's the limit of its options. The Apple Watch can be customized in far more ways than it makes sense to discuss. Plus the overall design of the Apple Watch is more appealing in general.Comfort - this one surprised me a bit. I find the UP3 to be less comfortable than the Apple Watch in two ways. First the narrow band means that more pressure is applied to any given area when you rest your wrist/arm on a surface. Since the Apple Watch band is more than twice as wide, the weight of your arm is almost completely unnoticeable while with the UP3 I was constantly aware of the pressure. Also, and again this was a surprise, I found that the narrower UP3 band actually trapped more moisture underneath than the Apple sports band. I am left to assume this is due to the material.Battery life - no competition here. The UP3 will go for 7 days with a full charge. At the end of the day I have perhaps 35% battery left on my Apple Watch if I have worked out for an hour. At most I can go 36 hours with my Apple Watch, assuming no workouts.Sleep tracking - This too goes to the UP3. The Apple Watch cannot effectively be used to track sleep as you are going to be charging it over night. The UP3 has provided me with great feedback on sleep and has native tools in its app to give you reports every morning.Alerts - The Apple Watch wins. Without a screen the UP3 can only alert you that you have a message. You have to open the app on your phone to see what it's alerting you about. Alerts are limited to internal app notices - drink water, stand up, etc. The Apple Watch offers a huge assortment of alert options that you can read right on the watch itself.Standing alerts - UP3 wins - you can customize the frequency of your alerts. The Apple Watch offers two choices currently - hourly alerts or no alerts. The UP3 can be customized in 5 minute intervals.Exercise tracking - neither device is perfect in this category though I'll give the nod to the Apple Watch. I don't appreciate the fact that the Apple Watch doesn't have options for weightlifting, kickboxing, and many other popular forms of exercise. That said, the UP3 only has a stopwatch function that is activated from your phone. Furthermore the UP3 requires integration with a third party app to report most data while the Apple Watch uses the Apple Watch and Health apps built right into your iPhone. The Apple Watch has room for improvement but it seems far ahead of the UP3 at this point.Syncing - Apple Watch wins though battery life is part of the tradeoff. My Watch syncs constantly with the phone. With the UP3 you have to open the app to manually sync data. That is more energy efficient but means more manual intervention.Other functionality - It's perhaps not a fair comparison - the UP3 is a purpose driven device while the Apple Watch has the benefits of being a platform upon which designers can layer their own apps.Charging - no advantage to either. I will point out though that the UP3 is a significant upgrade over previous generations of UP products. No more annoying caps to lose. It does require a custom charger, but so does the Apple Watch and many other wearables.Integration - both integrate with a wide range of cloud-based apps. Most of the apps are available across Apple and Android phones and across a wide variety of wearables. It's interesting though that the UP3 DOES NOT INTEGRATE with Apple Health. I'm sure this is a conscious choice on the part of one of the vendors. It's a shame though because the Apple Health app is really, really, good and I'm not in the mood to start using multiple apps.So on balance I will probably end up using both my Apple Watch and the UP3 for the next several weeks. In one sense the outcome is partially decided already - I'm not going to be giving up my Apple Watch. It's a key part of my daily activities and is very good at a wide range of functions. The question though is whether I will continue to use the UP3 for anything other than sleep tracking.I'll update my review over time.

This is a great kit at an absurdly low price. It comes with multiple lenses for different riding/light conditions, adjustable nose bridge pads and a sturdy carrying case. My wife who is of Japanese descent greatly appreciates the adjustable nose pads as most sunglasses in the U.S. are designed for people with more prominent noses.The frames and lenses are not the sturdiest ever made but you get multiple sets, and at this price, you cannot beat this deal.

It seems to me that this product was rushed to market without taking the time to take care of the details. For example it appears that the pieces have been stamped or plasma cut and that no effort was made to chamfer the edges, leading some edges sharp enough to scratch your iPhone or watch, and in one or two places, sharp enough to scratch deeply into your skin.I would have also appreciated something to keep the cords in place - an oversight that left me to have to improvise a solution.As far as fit, I have the Apple Watch (steel) with the sport band. The watch and band fit nicely in place for overnight charging. The overall look is very nice and it doesn't take all that much space on my nightstand.I have a feeling that future versions of this product will be better as they fulfill their backorder and have a chance to focus more on product quality.

At maximum heat my wife's hair responded well with curls in her normally pin-straight hair lasting throughout the day. She appreciated that there was no crimp as is the case with other curling irons she has used.
Completely original and totally entertaining. This book is unlike anything I have come across and continues Sanderson's tradition of radically different worlds and characters.

I travel 2-3 weeks out of every month and therefore wear out travel gear on a frequent basis. Well-made carry-on spinner suitcases tend to last me 3 years or so before some part fails, which means that I have gone through probably 3 of them and another 2-3 older-type roller carry-ons. When I say that I know carry-on bags, believe me - I know them probably too well for my own good.Up until this product from Hartmann I have not tried small hard cases. I have a couple of bigger ones that my wife and I sometimes take on multi-week trips as they are useful for bringing home souvenirs that aren't allowed in carry-on bags such as bottles of oil, vinegar, etc. The hard cases have protected all of this stuff very well over the years and I have not yet lost a bottle of scotch or locally made Italian oil to the hazards of checked luggage.I just took this Hartmann bag on two round trips to Houston, with connections in Atlanta. It performed admirably. Here are my thoughts as they relate to specific aspects:-Storage: The internal compartments kept my luggage well sorted. There is more than enough room for 4 days worth of clothing and toiletries.-Spinner wheels: These are the smoothest spinner wheels I have ever used and were a pleasure on both tiled and carpeted airport surfaces. The wheels are VERY quiet - a big plus.-Weight: I'm not sure how they did it but this suitcase is significantly lighter than the Samsonite carry-on suitcase that I usually take with me.-Durability: It's a bit early to reliably predict how long this suitcase will last, but all signs are positive so far. There aren't any of the usual telltale signs of problems to come - loose screws, sticky zippers or poorly designed wheels. I'll update this post at a later date to note any changes.-Overhead fit: This bag easily fits inside regional jet overhead bins. In the unfortunate event that I had to check it, the blue color and distinctive design would make it easy to pick out among the piles of black roll aboard suitcases everybody uses.-Integrated locks - I don't usually lock my carry-on but will lock suitcases that I check. With integrated TSA-approved locks, there is one less thing that you have to worry about.Unfortunately I am resigned to the fact that my wife is going to end up claiming this suitcase as her own. She has been asking me about it each time I have come back from recent trips and we have an upcoming trip to San Francisco in a few weeks. I'll most likely be using my Samsonite for that one.

Let me start by saying that I have not eaten much popcorn over the past 10-15 years because I HATE the way that the husks end up stuck in my teeth. I even ended up going to the dentist a couple of years back after making an exception to my general rule and had popcorn husks do deeply embedded in my gums that it took a professional to dig it out.This popcorn varietal was of obvious interest to me.In fact, the description of it being almost hull-less is absolutely true. After sharing the first packet with my wife we were both sold. That leads to the next big plus.My wife was a huge fan of the ingredient list. Until this product she had given up on microwave popcorn due to artificial ingredients. She was VERY excited to give this a try.Fast forward a week and all of our first order of this popcorn is gone. Considering the fact that we haven't had microwave popcorn in the house for a decade and that should earn this product five stars.I am going to withhold one star though because I hope they can improve on one issue. At a movie theater, or with other brands of microwave popcorn, every bit of popcorn is going to taste pretty much like the last one. With this heirloom product, there is a larger range of difference in taste from one kernel to the next. Sometimes you get a standard tasting handful. With the next it is more earthy - almost mushroom like.To be clear - some folks may consider this a big plus. I found it a bit distracting during a movie when I didn't want to be thinking about the taste of the popcorn. On the other hand, I ordered another batch of this popcorn and, after some more hands on tasting, I may end up deciding that that variety in in fact a good thing.

This is my favorite modern fantasy series, with the possible exception of The Iron Druid. This book was a fantastic bridge between the Hellequin's past and present. Power is one thing. The willingness to use it in pursuit of a purpose is another thing entirely.Read this series, from the beginning. You will appreciate the experience.

This shower curtain was a huge improvement over the dark, patterned, one that we replaced. Shower curtains don't often get long reviews and I'll keep this one brief.-A shower liner is required - this isn't waterproof. We use a transparent one and they look great together-It is a full 72" long (some curtains end up a little shorter when they sew the hem)-It's as solidly constructed as a lace curtain could be - no loose strings and the holes for the hooks are solid-It is a bright white - our bathroom is significantly brighter now than before-The fact that it is not solid allows more light to penetrate the curtain meaning you get better lighting in the shower

This is one heckuva debut novel for Scott Hawkins. Set in a modern day America, The Library will keep you guessing and turning pages long after your clock says that you should be heading off to bed.The three primary POV characters are about as different as can be - a demigod, a reluctantly-famous Medal of Honor awardee turned Homeland Security special investigator, and a only slightly reformed burglar. They all have their roles to play in a plot of multi-dimensional ramifications. I have seen novels with similarly grandiose ambitions go seriously off the track but, with a sense of humor, often witty dialogue and characters that take their share of abuse and keep coming back for more, Hawkins keeps this story moving forward and keeps the story mostly free of patently ridiculous plot twists and decisions by characters that are clearly not in keeping with their dispositions.There is a healthy amount of hand-to-hand violence dished out by a tutu-wearing fellow demigod to special forces units, some nukes, a walking glacier and a bunch of unique elements to this story that keep things fresh and compelling. I'm looking forward to reading more books from Scott Hawkins and hope that he can keep up the good work after such an impressive initial effort.

This air filter gets full points for effectiveness, usability, ease of operation and noise. It's not as pretty as some other filters on the market but it's advanced user-centric design makes up for that.I have written a number of reviews for small to mid-sized room air filters from Honeywell, Delonghi (DeLonghi AC230 Energy Star Air Purifier with Ionizer, 220 Square Feet), Winix (Winix U300 Signature Large Room Air Cleaner with True HEPA 5-Stage Filtration, PlasmaWave Technology and AOC Carbon and Winix U450 Signature Large Room Air Cleaner with True HEPA 5-Stage Filtration, PlasmaWave Technology and AOC Carbon) and Coway (Coway AP-1012GH Smart Air Purifier with HEPA Filter). Generally speaking the Coway was the most attractive, the Winix the best at cleaning the air and the Winix my least favorite.This Honeywell HPA250B is equally good at air filtering and minimizing noise as any of the other brands (most HEPA filters do a great job right out of the box as filtering the air, and home users would be hard pressed to notice differences without resorting to highly accurate lab tests of air quality). What I really liked though about this Honeywell is the cool usability options that bluetooth connectivity provides. For example you can set the device to turn on when you arrive home - it picks up the presence of your phone and turns on. That sort of energy efficiency would be a great addition to inexpensive window-mounted air conditioners and hope to see it soon.You can also turn it on and off manually via bluetooth, tweak speed settings, etc. The iPhone app was as simple an install as any other app, and pairing via bluetooth was bulletproof.If you are in the market for a small room air filter that will offer you great user-centered controls, this is the right one for you.

Kevin Hearne adds humor and great writing chops to what is sometimes an uneven genre👍. Luke starts to understand the power and danger of the force as he moves from a simple pilot to an operative essential to the alliance.

I use this fan at work in a large room - 14' x 21' - and it is ok at moving air through the space buy really shines as a personal fan for those folks who run hotter than average. This is an upgrade from a different Vornado fan - a larger, gray, plastic fan - and I have been very happy with the changeover for the following reasons:1 - Aesthetics - this fan looks great. The fire engine red is a nice accent color for the room. It's a good looking, retro, design that will make a great addition to any room where you need a splash of good design.2 - It's solid: The metal construction is sturdy but still light weight. It weighs in at a significant discount to the larger plastic Vornado I am trading it in for.3 - Size - it's great that a small fan like this can pack so much power.Overall this is a great fan option for you to consider for your office.
