There are a lot of warnings to be careful to not damage the non-stick finish of the main bowl's interior. There's a short spatula and short spoon included for loosening the rice.The warming mode is a major plus-- you don't have to time the rice to other dishes you might be making, and don't have to worry about the rice made in advance getting soggy, or cold and clumpy (though the instructions suggest loosening the rice as soon as it finishes cooking in the rice cooker, for optimal texture). And an even bigger plus, is not tying up a stovetop burner!My only quibbles are minor:* Small steaming tray* Some dripping from the lid, so you have to keep a towel handyThe unit draws a little more than 600W while running (measured at the wall), and periodically uses less than 100W during "keep warm" usage. Build seems solid, and the design is pleasing to the eye. The power-cord is a little longer than typical counter-top appliances.While I prefer the flavor and intensity of South Asian rice dishes (cooked with generous amounts of fat and spice), this Japanese-origin steamer is perfect for making lightweight steamed rice, without using much power. And more importantly, without needing attention. Recommended.

A USB battery with a sleek, clean design, and a lot of capacity.The hefty battery is contained in modern-looking white casing, with light-grey sides. There's the usual 2 outputs (1A and 2.1A), one input, 4 LEDs, and a power button (which doesn't affect charging the battery, but does affect charging any loads).It takes a while to charge-up a powerbank this size, but a power meter showed the battery drawing the full capacity from the 1.2A wall charger I was using. Similarly, my LG Nexus 5, which has a native 1.2A charger, charged as fast from this URPOWER's 2.1A outlet, as it would from the wall charger. At 12,000mAh, even with the expected 15-20% efficiency loss inherent in this battery technology, I should be able to recharge my Nexus5's 2300mAh battery about 4-5 times over.Quibbles:* A short USB-to-MicroUSB cable is included, but nothing for newer Lightning or USB-C connectors. Those cables aren't in the majority yet, but all of the variety has led some vendors to provide "octopus" multi-end cables with their USB products.* Only one USB output on this battery is 2.1A (the other is 1A). Since most newer devices accept charging rates over 1A (even my almost-2-year old LG Nexus 5 has a native 1.2A charger), it would be nice to have both outputs be 2A or greater.* I'd like more than 4 LEDs for a more granular display of capacity.But, my quibbles are true of most USB products I've seen recently, so I don't mark this URPOWER down for such minor nits.[ A free sample was provided to me in exchange for an honest review. ]I keep a decent USB battery in all of my bags (laptop, travel, camera, etc) and at all of my workspaces, and this one fits the "decent" billing for both design and capacity. Recommended.

Appreciation of or attraction to a certain scent is a subjective and relative experience. But there are certain scents that seem to have a near universal appeal.  Those include vanilla, citrus. cinnamon and musk.  But perhaps the most universally agreed upon agreeable scent is the floral group.  The delivery of a gift bouquet of flowers will always create the desired swoon to the recipient both for the delicate natural shapes and colors of nature, but also for the delicious scents they emanate.  The perfumers at Burberry have engineered a scent in this Brit Rhythm Floral that captures the subtle and sensuous tones of nature in just the right blend and strength to produce a near intoxicating effect.  Subtle but confident it conveys the same satisfying and pleasurable emotional response of inhaling a bouquet of roses and lavender. Light, pure, sensual, clean and natural are some adjectives that come to mind. Pretty and feminine are the next words that come to mind.  This is a scent that isn't reserved for a special niche as in a young business woman, or an evening scent or a mature scent.  It has a universal appeal that any age can wear in any circumstance.  It's neither sweet nor heavy but light and playful. It could easily become a woman's signature scent that a woman could appreciate on herself and her partner would immediately relate to and react to from walks past  gardens and ornate displays in high end hotel lobbies.  The scent is packaged in a bottle with an equally subtle design; a simple rectangular glass with a cut glass textured pattern on the surface and a background pink tint.  Like the scent itself, the bottle isn't overpowering or pretentiously trying to make a loud statement. It perfectly compliments this soft sensuous feminine scent.  Hopefully my description hasn't itself been too flowery, but as a male, I really like this scent and would notice and positively react to any woman that passed wearing it.  Honestly my favorite scent I've encountered in a long time. Again, scent and reactions are relative and subjective, but this is definitely a scent to get you subtly noticed and seen as a feminine, soft and positive female.

This Nuyu Sleep System is based on a simple idea and simple principles brought together to create a product that's completely new and innovative. Sleep isn't just a state of passive, unconscious inactivity. The body undergoes alternate states including fluctuating temperatures. Complicating that is the design of many modern mattresses made of dense foam that is comfortable and conforms to the body but often traps the body's heat, causing a sleeper to wake up to throw off sheets or even contributes to dehydration.  This NuYu System consists of a relatively small tank unit that's filled with water which is pumped through connecting tubing which is woven into a fabric pad. The fabric pad is to be placed under the bed sheets where your body rests.  The design principle is that your body heat is absorbed into the circulating water, the heat is carried away to the boxed tank under the bed where a fan cools the water before it is returned to the pad.  Theoretically, you control the unit via an app you download to your smartphone and instructions are exchanged via bluetooth.  I was impressed with everything from the packaging, the presentation during unboxing, the quality of the materials, and the simple directions.  The problem, at least with the unit I was shipped, is that the unit refused to pair with my Android phone. It wasn't a defect with my phone because bluetooth recognized the unit and identified it, it just said the unit would not communicate with it. I deleted the app and reloaded it several times. Before you actually are even allowed to attempt the pairing you are asked a number of questions to create a profile, gender, height, weight, age as well as email address and password, so it takes a bit of time. I wound up inputting this information dozens of time and it consumed several hours over the course of 3 days of attempts, hoping something had changed, to no avail.  I went to the product website and wrote of my difficulty asking for some direction.  The instructions promised that there would be a response within 3 business days. Those days came and went with no response which was surprising especially when I conveyed and that I had been sent this unit for evaluation purposes and was impressed with the initial materials, design and concept.  Perhaps they will still contact me, in which case I will update these comments. But for a product that is not inexpensive, to not be ready for prime time at least on the software and connectivity side, and then to not have a timely response with technical help, does not bode well for potential customers. I give it only one star at this point, although it's total lack of function really gives it zero functionality and value.  Perhaps I was sent a defective unit, but until there is some resolution I would warn potential purchasers from committing their money.

The extensive role and importance of bacteria and microbia living in and on our bodies is just beginning to be understood. One science writer suggested that rather than the monolithic block of body cells that we identify as "ourself", we seem to more closely resemble a coral reef with symbiotic relationships existing throughout our systems. Bacteria help digest foods, manufacture vitamins used internally and even help produce neurotransmitters  like serotonin, so if they're absent or don't exist in an optimal balance it could result in a host of wellness issues including depression.  There are thousands of strains of bacteria that exist just in our gut, but evidently the role of a few are understood best and exist in greatest proportions. This product offers several of the most important strains and in great abundance. As in most things, it's better to receive living cultures in food products, but supplementation, at least short term, seems to be a good idea.  I have tried and used Probiotics from several companies in the past and it is, of course nearly impossible to verify their efficacy.  It makes sense that this product has a shielding mechanism to get the capsule past the stomach and it's powerful acids that effectively kills bacteria introduced.  Most people fail to realize that stomach acid plays a key roll in our immune defense system because it kills invasive bacteria hitchhiking on our food. Another reason why taking antacids is usually a bad idea. Neutralizing the acid allows harmful bacteria to get past the defense mechanism. I plan to test the product the only way I know how; to open a capsule and use it as a seed culture to make fresh yogurt. I used a different brand in the past in home made yogurt and it was hit or miss. Sometimes yogurt was produced and other times the milk never changed indicating the cultures in that pill were not alive.  I'll report the results after I perform that test, but this brand seems to offer more value than some competitors if it really does have so many live cultures in each capsule and the mechanism to deliver them into your gut where they can help set up an optimal balance again.

I recently purchased a small scale to measure coffee grounds and recipes calling for weight measures. The scale had great reviews but I realized that if it were off a bit, every measurement would be consistently off so looked for a way to assure it's calibration. Also, I'd been buying some expensive cuts of beef and just out of curiosity wanted to check the honesty of the butcher.  Lo-and-behold my 9 oz. fillet turned out to weigh only 7.2 oz.!  I alerted the store manager and hope to avoid this perhaps unintentional overcharge as a result in the future. These are convenient, well made and packaged and highly accurate. A peace of mind one time purchase.

After a neighbor had their door kicked in and house robbed I wanted to put up some deterrent pronto so ordered a fake dome camera with a flashing LED until I could order a real system and have time to install it, and looked for some convincing stickers. There's a number of them out there but they seemed either humongous to stick on a front door or too amateurish. This was an acceptable size, printing is quality and finish is very good. I've since ordered some real cameras and a DVR to put some teeth into the threat, but these should give a potential thief pause whether you have cameras installed or not. Well worth a few dollar investment.

I've always balked at "fake" anything, but after a recent neighbor had their door kicked in and were robbed, I wanted something asap to make a potential thief at lest think twice about an unexpected visit. I didn't have the time to research, no less install a real security system, so looked for something as a quick stopgap security measure.  This plastic unit looked promising from all the positive reviews, but the price seemed to guarantee disappointment. It arrived a few days later and lo-and-behold it's design and build are pretty convincing. It's all assembled, just open the small "door" on top and insert the 9v battery. The red LED immediately begins it's regular pulsing and behind the smoked glass it really is tough to detect if that's a real camera inside or not. It comes with two plastic anchors that you push into the ceiling after drilling the two mounting holes. Insert the two supplied screws leaving a few millimeters raised above level. Then put the housing onto the screw heads and give a slight turn to mount in place. Total installation took just a few minutes. That's all there is to it. If I had just one suggestion for the manufacturer it would be to include a mounting paper template showing the location of the screws. Since one is not included just put the dome on top of a piece of paper and draw a circle around the perimeter. Flip the paper over and locate the hole openings and make a mark or just punch your pencil through. Now hold the template you just made against the ceiling and mark the hole locations to assure correct spacing.  To make things more convincing I also ordered Security Decal - 4 Pack #204 here on Amazon. Also looks menacing and serious. I've since ordered a real wireless camera system which will take the place of this fake one, but to be honest, I think just the fear of being observed and taped would have been enough to stick with the fake only.  If the real camera system that cost hundreds proves disappointing and needs to be returned, I'll keep this dome at the ready. Highly recommended!

The past few years I've pared back taking supplements preferring to work harder at eating a healthy balanced diet. But when a product seems to "make sense" I opt to give it a try and see if any difference is detectible in my wellbeing. Vitamin D is a great example since medical authorities all seem to agree most of us are woefully deficient. I imagined I was fairly well informed about health issues but magnesium was never even remotely on my radar screen, being a trace mineral. I also was aware that minerals often have an issue being bioavailable, as is most notably the case with calcium supplements. Anyway, after learning that magnesium is deficient in many of our diets and what functions it plays a roll in, (for me as an insomniac, sleep regulation was key) I decided to give this product a try especially since it's chelated and claims to be more bioavailable.  The results of use can be a tricky thing to quantify since there are so many variables in our diet, stress levels and day to day activities, plus there's the placebo effect to skew actual results.  All that being said, I seemed to notice a difference especially in my sleep immediately. My sleep seemed natural and even and I woke up refreshed. Perhaps it's coincidence, but I tried to see results in a somewhat scientific way by not altering any other variables or introducing any new lifestyle changes. As of now, I feel enthusiastic about the product from what seems to be noticeable results. the only factor worth mentioning si that the pills are very large, in fact the largest of any I've ever taken except perhaps for fish oil capsules. If you have trouble swallowing larger pills, this will be something to consider. At the moment, I'm rating this with five stars. I'll update longer term observations in a month to see if the positive results have been consistent.

Every dermatologist I've ever talked to agrees that the starting point of maintaining more youthful skin is protecting it from sun damage. Broad spectrum SPF of at least 30 is recommended, which this happily contains. It spread over my skin very easily without any uneven chalkiness and was absorbed remarkably quickly without leaving any greasy residue. But many other products do the same thing. What attracted me to this cream was the claim of helping to erase dark spot discolorations. Looking over the ingredient list as a nonscientist, I still noticed there were no ingredients specifically designed to dye or lighten the skin. That's a good thing as I've read cautionary warnings about those chemicals.  What's the science behind this product then? From my unprofessional eye, it seems to lie in a twofold approach. First I noticed two types of mild acid, especially salicylic . These help loosen upper layer dead skin sells for exfoliation.  The other most notable ingredient being niacinamide, (vitamin B3). Past reading of scientific research on B3 supports the claim of it's ability to rejuvenate skin to a more healthy youthful appearance.  On the minus side, the second ingredient listed is alcohol, which universally is considered a drying agent for skin that can cause irritation and flaking. All that being said, did I find any difference after a few weeks of daily use. Though a few weeks is a brief time, I can report seeing a subtle difference in my skin and perhaps the beginnings of sun spot lightening. From my brief usage, can I recommend this cream/ serum? Despite the alcohol I would say yes, due to it's protective SPF, ease of absorption and noticeable results. Why just 4 start and not 5? The price is a bit high, and I believe the main results are attributable to the Niacinamide. Do a search on Niacinamide creams on Amazon and you will find several offerings that come in higher concentrations in larger quantities at a fraction of the price. I won't recommend any in particular though I have tried several and found the results they produced remarkable. Of course, if you choose to buy one of those instead, you still need to purchase a high quality broad spectrum SPF of 30 or more for protection. Everyone's skin and sensitivity is different, of course, so the results of any product vary widely. As an all in one solution, albeit a bit expensive it's worth purchasing to see your particular results. For those who want to experiment, I would also encourage trying other Niacinamide creams to see how they react with your skin. Additionally, I personally have found remarkable results with night creams containing glycolic acid, my present favorite being Glycolix 20% facial cream, which has been very effective in encouraging exfoliation, though, always start with a milder percentage and work higher to build a tolerance and note your individual reaction.

Sometimes it's just impossible to put the controller down and I've found myself pulling all nighter gaming sessions. Unless your system is setup in some isolated setting, you're going to disturb sleeping family members and neighbors, if you're a compulsive gamer, so thank goodness for wireless headsets. Previously I've had to settle for using a headset with a ridiculously long cable connection, so the Afterglow AG9 really is an incredible increase in freedom for me. Setup is really a no brainer. While the headset had a partial charge out of the box I preferred to charge it overnight before I set anything up. The Mic is detachable so can be left uninstalled when playing solo. Simply plug in the USB connector into the PS4. A small led will blink and then turn solid when it is paired with the headset. It's pre-paired out of the box, though you can re-pair it with the simple push of a button on the side of the USB connector. That's really all there is to it!  You can go into settings on your console to adjust the volume of the mic if you want and I did to experiment but it's preset to 3 out of 5 and is sufficient as is.  Range was more than adequate and it worked anywhere I moved in the area of my console. As to sound, it's crisp and clear without cutouts or static. You have the choice of the sound as is or if you press the mode button on the headset for a few seconds you'll hear an ascending tone indicating you've chosen the base enhanced mode. It doesn't make it overly boomy, just a variation according to your personal taste.  Battery life is reported to be 16 hours and from my use so far that seems like it should hold to be true.  The AG 9 is designed to work with your laptop as well so I plugged it into my Macbook Pro and again it worked lawlessly.  One caveat and disappointment is that I had hoped it would also work with my PS3 system as well. I searched all the documentation I could find and no mention was made of that compatibility. After frustrating try and system tweaks, I can report, no it is not compatible with PS3. If another reviewer or the manufacturer disagrees with this then I would love to learn how to make it function. But after endless tries, I could not get it to work and as the box says, it's for the PS4. I gave it 5 stars because for the price I think it's a good value and functions well.  As for comfort, it's not featherweight, but I adapted and didn't mind the feel. The ear cups are supple and are actually larger then the Bose Noise canceling headset I have so they fit over my hears without binding or pinching. So for the price point, ease of setup, sound quality and relative comfort, I believe it's a good buy and will help keep the peace on those late night gaming sessions.

Backup power packs are almost a necessity to keep close at hand with all the portable devices we've all come to rely on.  The only thing worse than discovering that you left the house without your smartphone is to notice your battery is at 10% and you're about to be cut off from civilization! It's become a competitive segment with dozens of choices in all sides and shapes, so how does this HP stack up in it's utility? Size wise, it's optimal at about 4 1/4" x 2 1/2" x 1" or so, slightly smaller than a playing card, so it fits comfortably in your bag or even your pocket. It's covered in a non slip vinyl jacket that's pleasant to touch  and is a neutral gray color. The end caps are flat on both ends which is nice because there are no complicated indentations that might trap dust or debris. The top end cap has two USB openings to charge up to two devices simultaneously. Between them is a micro usb port to plug in a charger, which is not included, but likely your phone charger will suffice to fill that roll. There's a hairline thin led light strip that indicates how much charge the pack has left, and illuminates when you push the single button on it's broad side. It's rated at 7600 mAH and the HP says that's enough power to recharge most any smart phone 3 times. I waited until my Note 4 battery was completely empty and charged it back up with this Pack and afterward the pack indicated it was still 3/4 full, so plenty of utility to get through the day.  At the price on Amazon it's very affordable especially considering the price of buying spare OE batteries for your phone, plus these packs aren't device specific so, of course you can charge your tablet or other device as well.  I've accumulated several of these packs and all have functioned well.  One other device worth considering that I like even better than this HP is the iFrogz Golite Traveler, 9000mAh Portable Charger and FlashlightI like the materials and construction a bit better, it has a higher capacity and it even includes a small LED flashlight bulb if you need some discrete illumination in a pinch. That model is however about a dozen dollars more.  The HP in conclusion is solidly built with a functional albeit plain design, has sufficient go power to recharge your phone 3-4 times and comes at an attractive price. Highly recommended.

No mater how many pairs of reading glasses I own, I never seem to have any close at hand when I need them. The very small footprint of these makes it more likely that I'll keep them in a pocket or throw them in my luggage when traveling. The glasses have hinges allowing the arms to fold in half as well as a hinge on the nose bridge. Construction isn't robust, so constantly folding and unfolding them, especially in a hurry worries me that I might break them, but keeping them light and portable is the whole point of their design so I can't deduct points for that. The lenses aren't as narrow as some compact models but you're still likely to wear them perched lower on your nose. The case is very sturdy  and should endure the abuse of being tossed in bags and entombed in pockets containing keys and change.  These aren't my go to glasses, but rather my second string choice when I cant locate the ones I really want to use. But for the few dollars they cost they have proved to be handy and lifesavers in a pinch.

This is a comprehensive program that provides a framework for establishing a fitness regimen, including both diet and exercise information and instruction. Kettle balls have been around for a long time but were largely neglected in favor or conventional barbells and dumbbells. Their resurgence is a owed to their ergonomic design and ease of use without causing undue stress especially on joints. The set includes dvd's for a variety of routines and fitness levels.  It's ideal for a busy person who doesn't have the time to drive to a gym or simply prefers to exercise in the privacy of their own home. The set also includes a strap for stretching muscles especially during warmup and warm down and a styrofoam roller to massage muscles and back. The strap is adequate as is the roller although I found the roller to be extremely rudimentary and would suggest purchasing one that is more sturdy. All in all, this is s good basic program that will work up a sweat and improve flexibility and muscle tone if followed over time.

I've turned to Brother for most of my printing needs and have found their products rock solid, mostly intuitive and generally good values. So I had high expectations for this Wireless Label Maker. It's use was intended for home organizational applications and not an office environment, so mainly I was looking for convenience; keeping it plugged in and accessing my network for a quickly produced label without dragging out one of the label makers I have stored away.  The unit itself is solidly constructed and has a small footprint, roughly 3"  by 6" by 5 1/2" high. It can be used with 4 AA batteries or plugged in. Label tape cartridges can be inserted by a side door in the unit. Connecting it to my network actually went very smoothly. The problem, at least in my interaction, was using the software to print a label from my Macbook. Many reviewers made mention as to the learning curve, but my initial usage left me baffled. When connected via USB cable or wirelessly, and I select this as the printer to use, none of the settings seem to allow me to print from a tape cartridge and the size of the cartridge tape doesn't seem to be automatically recognized. On the plus column, once you download an app for, I'm my case, an Android device, the unit functioned very well, including automatically knowing what size tape cartridge was inserted. I hated to give such a lack luster rating of 3 stars, but used in conjunction with my laptop the results were abysmal and the software is extremely unintuitive. Used with my Android phone, it worked brilliantly and should be a 5 star device. For the average person looking for a label printer, I feel much more comfortable recommending the brilliant Brother PTD400AD. It's half the price, though not a wi-fi model. the interface and operation are extremely to use and the labels are great. If you insist you need something wireless and plan to use your portable device with an app, then you should be fairly happy purchasing this. If the wireless feature isn't imperative, why not save some money and look at the Brother PTD400AD.

I remember as a child, riding a broom stick with a horse head and imagining I was galloping in the old west. Toys have gotten light years more sophisticated as these Ironman gloves attest to. Very well made with a silicone-like material so should be durable. Turn on the slider switch on one glove, press the center button to activate and your little super hero is ready to go. It has some kind of motion detector inside so when he raises his arm and points his open hand, a charging sound begins. When it reaches it's peak. he can fire with hand thrusts and hear the laser pulses. Lowering his arm turns out the center light until his next encounter with a bad guy and need to defend the universe. Operates on just one battery that's included. Uncertain how long that lasts yet. But I do know, giving these to a five year old creates as much excitement as if someone handed me keys to a new car. Only one glove has the mechanism, but that seems to be enough to transport a child into his imaginary word and opens up countless adventures. Your....son / nephew / grandson, will thank you  endlessly for granting him superpowers. Highly recommended and kid tested.

This is a small, effective, basic fan. The term "industrial" is curious since the construction might better be described as petite, though durable if handled with care. The frame and base are a light gauge metal which make the unit light weight for transport and storage. The motor does seem solid, which is the heart of a fan and it seems balanced because there is no vibration and it's very quiet. The housing can be angled though there is no tightening mechanism to lock it in place though it seems to stay put. The 3 speed adjustment is on the back of the fan and is well made since that's the part you'll be twisting each time it's used. The fan does move an impressive amount of air for its small size. I'm a fan of this unit as a basic inexpensive solution to move air in a dorm room or hot bedroom.

I was intrigued by this product because I had never heard of cleansing oil. I googled "cleansing with oil" and read some unbiased articles and opinions to get a sense of the logic involved here. Light oils applied to the face combine with the sebum naturally produced and maybe now hardened in your pores to help dilute and loosen them. When you then wipe or rinse all that off, dirt and impurities trapped there are removed but your skin, the largest organ in your body isn't left devoid of oil. If it detects oil is gone completely, as happens with severe scrubbing or using soaps or chemicals that dissolve oils, the skin sometimes overcompensates and exacerbates the problem. Leaving a layer of clean oil coating the skin eliminates that problem. So cleansing oil isn't the latest sales gimmick, but actually makes a lot of sense. Generations of cultures did this with especially olive oil for centuries. Getting back to this L'Occitan product, the label lists the first ingredient as sunflower oil. At first that seemed disappointing since the label emphasizes the word Shea. But sunflower oil is lighter with less fatty acids and so feels silkier and makes a better carrier oil to penetrate into the pores and dissolve/combine with the skin's sebum impacted there. Shea is listed lower in the ingredients but at just 5% is enough to offer it's lubricating and softening properties. As far as the mechanics, you're instructed to put perhaps a quarter's sized amount in your palms and rub your hands together, this warms the oil, and apply it to the face. Massage it into the skin. Add some water and the surface becomes a thin milky film. Massage a bit more then rinse off. My skin felt silky smooth and very clean without feeling oily at all. Some websites recommended using this cleansing method perhaps 3 times a week as opposed to every day. Cost and value wise, since you use such a small amount of product each use, it should last a very long time, several months, so while not cheap seems reasonable. Several oils are mentioned in the articles as good choices for oil cleansing with sunflower being recommended as the main ingredient and either castor oil or shea highly recommended at smaller proportions. You can buy those oils separately for about a dollar an ounce and experiment with your own concoctions at a considerable savings. But seeing how long lasting this product should be, I think I'll just leave the mixing to L'Occitane. I'm impressed with this new product and method that evidently is the new rage in facial cleansing based on the buzz I saw online.

Since I discovered Dr. Bronner's Magic Soaps, it's become the only soap I imagine I'll ever use again! I appreciate the philosophy and business practices of the company. But the products themselves are wonderful. The pure castile soap is fairly long lasting, has a wonderful peppermint aroma that wakes me up in the morning and is also very stimulating to the skin. It rinses off seemingly without leaving any residue and my skin feels squeaky clean but without chemical harshness or stripping natural oils. If you've never tried these soaps, do yourself a favor and buy a bar. I buy the six packs now so I don't get caught in short supply.

It seems that there are endless choices when you're looking for phone cover these days. My last Galaxy Note, I opted for the book style cover with the clear window that allows you to access certain features with the cover still closed. It was expensive and there were several things I didn't care for. Most of all, the window always seemed cloudy and so dirty. It offered some protection around the perimeter and I did have some small falls damage free, but it always seemed under protected. I didn't want some massive case like an Otterbox that offers great protection but makes phones seem massive. I love the Note because it is so elegant and slim and I didn't want to destroy that esthetic. This case is made by Samsung so I knew fitment would be perfect and it seemed to add very little bulk to the phone. I received it and have to say that I couldn't be happier with it. I love the design change of the phone having a metal edge now, but oddly, I found it uncomfortable to grip and was always afraid I might from it. This cover has a very grippy feel that gives me hugely greater confidence in holding it. The back has an understated pattern that likewise gives it some frictional holding power if you lay it on a hard surface, so there's less chance of it sliding off if the surface shifts. The fitment is indeed perfect and although the edges are much more protected now it isn't at the cost of making it appear bulky at all. I still can see and appreciate almost the entire face of the phone and it's esthetic. The side adjustment buttons are very flexible and don't impede the functions of those buttons. The cutouts around the openings are very generous so inserting the micro USB cable to charge is very accessible and never clumsy. Likewise, it's very easy to pull out the Note's pen and never a wrestling match.There are small details I appreciate, as in a tiny lip below the speaker opening in the back so if you lay the phone down the opening is slightly raised not to impede sound. The same with the opening around the camera lens, there's a raised ridge so you won't accidentally damage the lens or get it wet when you lay the phone down.  I bought a second, much more expensive leather, book style case which I love for it's style, frontal protection and luxurious leather smell.  But I find myself using this case maybe 90% of the time. If you're debating which case to get for your Note, features and taste are relative. But for me, at least, I can't recommend it highly enough. Extremely satisfied.

Everyone has several Micro USB cables stashed around for charging and connecting their phones and devices and it's often a hated cable for several reasons. One of the complaints with this kind of cable is how fragile the small plug can be and is frequently damaged. Likewise, the wires themselves can be flimsy and prone to break internally since they're usually handled roughly, thrown into bags and pockets. I've often found Anker cables to be much higher quality than some other brands so sent for this 3 foot cable to use in conjunction with my Samsung Galaxy Note phone. I like the relatively short length to use when charging on a night stand and not having say, and extra few feet dangling, waiting to be snagged and knocked over. Also, those times I'm running low on power and want to charge the phone using an external battery, and likewise don't want a long cable. This cable is very heavy duty and I suspect will be much less prone to damage or breakage. It's .9mm diameter also makes it less prone to tangling into itself which is a huge plus. At only about $5, it's also cheaper than OEM cables, but offers the same or superior build quality. If you're shopping for a shorter Micro USB to USB cable, you can buy this one with confidence. Highly recommended!

I looked for a portable hanger to use in three places. First, to hang my jacket in my car while driving to work instead of just throwing it on a seat. Second, because I'm on airplanes weekly and likewise like to hang my jacket as well. For some reason, especially in winter months when everyone has protective clothing with them, airplanes seem to never have enough hangers. And third, most hotels have reverted to those weird antitheft hangers in their closets. If I want to have a suit wrinkle free by hanging it on a shower curtain rod to get steamed, those weird hangers in the closet just don't work. There really weren't many options out there but I saw this on on Amazon so decided to give it a try. When it arrived in the mail, I imagined they sent the wrong item since the package was so small. but there it was. It's amazingly compact, so that I can just leave it in my inside jacket pocket between uses and I hardly know it's there. It's well made and though folds instantly, it isn't flimsy or fragile so I expect to get years of service out of it. The one negative was that it was shipped from Japan and took something like a month to be delivered!  I suppose I just wasn't paying attention and ordered from the wrong vendor on Amazon, so take notice before ordering as to how long it says until delivery.  All in all, it's a terrific little innovation and I couldn't be happier with it's construction, tiny folded size, an utility. If you need something like this for the same reasons I did, you should can buy this with confidence.

In October 2013, nine-year-old Amira Willighagen amazed and delighted classical music fans with her performance of “O mio babbino caro” in Holland’s Got Talent.  The video of her performance on Youtube received more than 35 million hits worldwide to-date.  Her first album Amira, published on March 2014, was a resounding success, reaching number 7 on the US Billboard Classical Chart.Her latest CD “Merry Christmas” is her second album, released on November 13 this year in the US just in time for the holiday season.  Besides the familiar Christmas carols, Amira sings several well-known arias and sacred hymns:Ave verum corpus (Hail True Body) (Mozart) –  an Eucharistic hymn in Latin to celebrate the feast of Corpus Christi (Body of Christ), set to music by Wolfgang Amadeus MozartBist du bei mir (If you are with me) – an aria attributed to Johann Sebastian Bach.  It is from Bach’s “Notebook for Anna Magdalena Bach”, a manuscript of keyboard music and a few arias presented by the German composer to his second wife Anna MagdalenaNulla in mundo pax (In this world there is no honest peace) – a sacred motet (choral music) in Latin composed by Antonio VivaldiAve Maria (Hail Mary) (Vavilov/Caccini)– a Catholic prayer in Latin to the Virgin Mary, set to music by the Russian composer Vladimir Vavilov around 1970.  Some music historians attribute the music to the 17th century Italian composer Giulio CacciniPie Jesu (Pious Jesus) (Fauré) – a Latin hymn in Gabriel Fauré's Requiem (Mass for the Dead)Panis angelicus (Angelic Bread) (Franck) – a Latin hymn written by St. Thomus Aquinas for the feast of Corpus Christi, set to music by the Belgium composer César FranckSancta Maria (Holy Mary) (Mascagni) – a prayer to the Holy Mother, set to music by the Italian composer Pietro MascagniLittle Amira Willighagen has an amazing singing voice. Even more amazing is that she was singing opera arias by the age of nine without having any formal training. She is a natural, but she does need professional training for further development. As far as I know, Maike van de Wiel was her singing coach in 2014, in preparation of and during the production of her first CD Amira.  As gifted a singer as she is, Amira is still a child.  Her classical singing style places tremendous stress on her immature vocal cord and larynx. I surely hope that the adults around her have the wisdom to guide her on the proper technique so that she will grow up to be a successful classical singer.

Wana Baraka is a Christian spiritual song from Kenya, Africa.  It is sung in Swahili.  This arrangement starts with a simple melody a cappella, alternating between male and female voices, while supported by a simple harmony.  The song slowly builds to a crescendo where the entire choir sings the word “aleluja”.  I find the song joyous and uplifting.The Cape Town Youth Choir was found in 1997 as the Pro Cantu Youth Choir.  It is based in Jan Van Riebeeck High School in Cape Town, South Africa. The current conductor is Leon Starker.  Through the years, the choir has toured extensively in South Africa as well as internationally, and won many awards.  See my comment below for an approximate translation of the lyrics.

Gigliola Cinquetti's "I Grandi Successi (The Greatest Hits)" is a nice collection of songs performed by the Italian pop singer over the years.  It consists of twenty four songs in two CDs and comes with three well-known hits - "Non ho l'età (I'm not old enough)", "Dio, come ti amo (God, how I love you), and "Si (Yes)""Non ho l'età" was the song that launched the career of the renowned Italian singer, who, at the age of sixteen, won the first place in the 1964 Eurovision Song Contest at the Tivoli Concert Hall in Copenhagen, Denmark with it.  The song became an international hit and placed no. 1 on the Italy Musica e Dischi and 17 on the UK Singles charts.  "Non ho l'età" was composed by Mario Panzeri and the lyrics written by Nicola Salerno in Italian. Gigliola Cinquetti also recorded an English version of the song titled "This is My Prayer", but it is the Italian lyrics in Non ho l'età that bring out the beauty of the song."Dio, come ti amo" was recorded in 1966 and placed no. 1 on the Italy Musica e Dischi chart.  In 1974, Gigliola Cinquetti entered the Eurovison Song Contest for the second time and won second place with "Si".  See my comment below for the Italian lyrics and the English translation of  "Non ho l'età".

"Non ho l'età (I'm not old enough)" was the song that launched the career of the renowned Italian singer Gigliola Cinquetti, who, at the age of sixteen, won the first place in the 1964 Eurovision Song Contest with it. The song became an international hit and placed no. 1 on the Italy Musica e Dischi and 17 on the UK Singles charts.  The cover art shows the 16-year-old Gigliola in the Eurovision Song Contest at the Tivoli Concert Hall in Copenhagen, Denmark in 1964.Non ho l'età was composed by Mario Panzeri and the lyrics written by Nicola Salerno in Italian. Gigliola Cinquetti also recorded an English version of the song titled "This is My Prayer", but it is the Italian lyrics in Non ho l'età that bring out the beauty of the song. See my comment below for the Italian lyrics and the English translation.

Ave Maria by Anita Bryant is the English version of La Novia (The Bride), written in 1958 by the Chilean musician Joaquin Prieto with Spanish lyrics. The English lyrics were written by Fred Lay. Many recordings of La Novia were made, both in Spanish and English.  Among the English recordings, Ave Maria by Anita Bryant is one of the most successful ones, the most popular being The Wedding by Julie Rogers.  However, artistically, Anita Bryant's Ave Maria rivals Julie Rogers' The Wedding.  Anita Bryant is a powerful singer.  Her rendition of Ave Maria embodies the joy and elation of the bride whose dream of walking down the aisle with the man she loves finally comes true (See Note). See my comment below for the lyrics of this beautiful song.Note: The lyrics of the English version and the original Spanish version of this song are very different in content. In many articles, Fred Lay is listed as the translator of the lyrics, but the truth is that he re-wrote the lyrics, giving them entirely different meaning. While the English lyrics show the joy and elation of the bride in her wedding, the original Spanish lyrics express the sorrow and regret of a failed suitor of the bride in her wedding. It is terribly depressing. I like the English version better.

The Wedding by Julie Rogers is the English version of La Novia (The Bride), written in 1958 by the Chilean musician Joaquin Prieto with Spanish lyrics. The English lyrics were written by Fred Lay. Many recordings of La Novia were made, both in Spanish and English, but, in my opinion, this 1964 Julie Rogers version The Wedding is the definitive recording that put the song on the chart and in the consciousness of music lovers of the world. Julie Rogers' powerful rendition of the song embraces the joy and elation of the bride whose dream of walking down the aisle with the man she loves finally comes true (See Note). See my comment below for the lyrics of this beautiful song.Note: The lyrics of the English version and the original Spanish version of this song are very different in content. In many articles, Fred Lay is listed as the translator of the lyrics, but the truth is that he re-wrote the lyrics, giving them entirely different meaning.  While the English lyrics show the joy and elation of the bride in her wedding, the original Spanish lyrics express the sorrow and regret of a failed suitor of the bride in her wedding.  It is terribly depressing.  I like the English version better.

This Scotch 414/DC Extreme Mounting Tape works well outdoors.  More than a month ago, I used this tape to mount two 7 x 11-inch plastic signs on the exterior of my house, one on a block wall and one on a stucco wall.  I lined the entire perimeter of each sign with the tape to afford the signs plenty of holding power. The signs are holding fast so far. The tape stood up to the desert sun and a couple of monsoons with no problem.

BIG, HEAVY, AND LOADED WITH FEATURESThis Pioneer VSX-90 Receiver is big, measuring 17 inches long, 12-3/4 inches deep, and 6-1/2 inches high and takes up the lion's share of shelf space.  It is also heavy, weighing about 20 pounds. It takes a strong back to move it around.  It is loaded with features.  It will take some time for a new user to explore all of them and make all the necessary connections.  It can be intimating to an average user like myself.THE VIDEOI don't have a home theater.  I use the VSX-90 in my game room/home office to connect a Dell computer, a Samsung BD/DVD player, a PS3, a PS4, and a Xbox 360 game console to a Dell 24-inch 1920 X 1200 Ultra Sharp monitor.  The VSX 90 comes with 6 HDMI sockets on the back panel and a single HDMI socket in front, which are perfect for connecting my equipment, since they all came with HDMI connections.  HDMI carries not only video but audio as well, thus eliminating the need of audio input cables.  The VSX-90 supposedly supports 4K2K Ultra HD video, which translates into 4096 x 2160 pixels or 4 times the resolution of the 2048 x 1080 Full HD.  Ultra HD is necessary for monitors or HDTVs with screens larger than 55 inches.  In my case, Ultra HD is not going to make any difference on my 24-inch monitor.The VSX-90 is compatible with the newest HDCP 2.2 protocol, which stands for High-bandwidth Digital Content Protection. At the VSX-90 back panel, the HDMI sockets labeled BD, DVD, SAT/CBL and HDMI OUT are HDCP 2.2 compliant. HDCP compliance is necessary to play the newest Blu-Ray discs and other protected digital contents.For connecting a DVD player or other equipment with no HDMI outputs, there are RCA and component video inputs, RCA audio inputs, as well as optical and coaxial digital audio inputs at the VSX-90 back panel.THE AUDIOI am currently using a pair of inexpensive bookshelf speakers.  With the VSX-90, I might upgrade my sound equipment to a modest 5.1-channel home theater speaker system.  For the uninitiated, a 5.1-channel system consists of 5 speakers and 1 subwoofer.  The VSX-90 supports 5.1, 5.2, 7.1, and 7.2-channel systems with up to 7 speakers and 2 subwoofers.  The passive un-powered speakers are connected to the VSX-90 back panel via twisted speaker wires or banana plugs.  The powered subwoofers with their own built-in amplifiers are connected to the two subwoofer pre-outs with RCA connectors.  The VSX-90 supports 6 to 16-ohm passive speakers, with 100 watts per channel at 8 ohms or 165 watts at 6 ohms.  It will not support 4-ohm speakers.The VSX-90 comes with the newest Dolby ATMOS sound technology.  In a commercial setting, Dolby ATMOS accommodates up to 128 audio tracks and the associated pan metadata to simulate 3-dimensional static and dynamic sound.  In a commercial cinema equipped with Dolby ATMOS, the sound equipment sends audio signals to various pre-positioned speakers in rapid successions to simulate sound traveling across 3-D space, for example, the roar of a jet whizzing by.  To take advantage of the VSX-90 Dolby ATMOS technology in a home environment, the user must deploy Dolby ATMOS enabled speakers, which have the ability to project sound to the ceiling.  These speakers are way beyond my means.  They are for people in the top pay grades.iPOD, iPHONE, and HEADPHONEFor those users who own iPods or iPhones, there is an iPod/iPhone terminal at the front panel for audio playback.  I connected my iPod Classic G7 to the terminal via the iPod USB cable and it sounded great.  There is also a standard phone jack at the front panel for headphone connection.THE FRONT PANEL CONTROLS AND THE REMOTEThe front panel controls look simple enough.  There are two large knobs on the sides, with the left knob for input selection and the right knob for volume control.  At the upper center is a digital display.  Below are buttons for speaker selection, multi-zone control, tuner control etc.  An infrared line-of-sight remote comes with the purchase.  It duplicated front panel functions.OTHER FEATURESThere are other features of the VSX-90 I have yet to explore and am unlikely to use in the near future.  The more prominent ones are described below briefly:(1) Multi-zones--There is the multi-zone option, in which the VSX-90 sends video and audio signals via connecting cables to audio/video equipment in two other rooms. With the multi-zone option, the same source can be played simultaneously in the main zone and the subzones, with certain restrictions.  This can be done with different sources as well.(2) AM & FM antennae--There are connections for an external FM radio antenna and an AM radio loop antenna.(3) Networking--The VSX-90 can be connected to a home network via an Ethernet cable or Wi-Fi with dual antennae for extended range.(4) MCACC Technology--MCACC stands for Multi-Channel Acoustic Calibration System.  This technology is unique to Pioneer sound equipment.  A microphone monitors the sound environment of the user's room and an equalizer automatically adjusts the sound parameters.  The microphone comes with the purchase and plugs into a 3.5mm socket at the front panel.  The exact procedure is described in the manual.(5) MHL compatibility--MHL stands for Mobile High-Definition Link.  It is a industry standard that enable consumers to connect mobile phones, tablets, and other portable consumer electrons to HDTVs to display 3D/Full-HD videos, HD multi-channel audio and HD photos.  There is a HDMI socket at the back panel of the VSX-90 labeled 6 MHL for connection to a mobile device via a MHL cable.(6) HMDI ARC--ARC stands for Audio Return Channel.  Some TVs come with this feature.  When the TV is connected to the VSX-90 via a HDMI cable, the audio of the TV can be sent back to the receiver via the connecting HDMI cable through the VSX-90 HDMI OUT 1 terminal.  To activate this function, the user must set ARC to ON during HDMI setup at the VSX-90.(7)  Bluetooth and Airplay--These are handy functions for wireless connections to the VSX-90.(8)  Internet radio and music--The VSX-90 is vTune, Pandora, and Spotify ready.ONLINE MANUALA VSX-90 manual in pdf format is available for download.  Read it up before ordering:http://www.pioneerelectronics.com/StaticFiles/Manuals/Home/VSX-90_OperatingInstructions032715.pdfVIDEO AND AUDIO QUALITYThe video quality on my Dell 24-inch Ultra-sharp monitor is superb. The audio sounds good in my inexpensive bookshelf speakers.  I cannot say how good the video looks in a 75" Ultra HD TV monitor or how good the audio sounds in a 7.2 channel home theater system.  Nor can I comment on the quality of the VSX-90 Dolby ATOMS technology.  I don't have the equipment to do so.  I have to leave them to other reviewers.

The Miele Complete C2 vacuum is small and light for a full function vacuum. It measures 19 inches long, 10 inches wide, and 8-1/2 inches tall, weighing about 11 pounds without any attachment.The purchase includes a metallic telescopic wand, a flexible air hose, and a curved plastic handle in between. The length of the telescopic wand can be adjusted by holding down the release button on the wand and pulling or retracting the extension. There is an air-vent on the wand to temporarily decrease the suction during vacuuming.The Miele Complete C2 also comes with two large floor brushes. One of them has a rotating brush and is powered by air, not an electric motor, thus making it light and maneuverable. There is an air vent on top of this powered brush, which can be open to improve airflow for deep pile carpet. The other brush is unpowered and has stiff bristles around the perimeter at the bottom. They can be retracted or lowered by a foot switch on top of the floor brush. Retract the bristles for carpets and rugs, and lower them for hard floors.The power cord assembly has a power-retract feature. The cord assembly automatically locks when the user pulls the cord out and retracts upon a push of the power-retract bar on top the vacuum. Opposite to the power-retract bar is the power ON-OFF bar. A dial switch regulates the speed of the motor, with various settings for curtains, upholstery, deep pile carpets, etc. as indicated by line symbols on top of the vacuum.The filter compartment can be accessed by lifting a release bar. Besides the usual filter bag, there is an exhaust air filter as well. The manual states that the bag and air filter should last for a year with normal use. On top of the filter compartment is the accessory compartment, with a crevice nozzle, an upholstery nozzle, and a dusting brush.When the job is done, the brush with the wand attached can be parked at the side of the canister.  There are two parking slots, one on each side, which the brush with the wand can latch onto.  It is a thoughtful design.The Miele Complete C2 is powerful at its maximum setting. I can hear the clicking of dirt particles hitting the inside of the metal wand as they are vacuumed up. It is small and light for what it can do. I was especially impressed by the air-powered brush. It is light and much more maneuverable than one powered by an electric motor. I am very pleased with the product.

**This review is on the Tasty Bite Jasmine rice.  Amazon is putting reviews of all eleven varieties of Tasty Bite rice together.  It can be confusing to shoppers**This Tasty Bite Jasmine Rice is delicious.  It is un-favored.  It is almost as good as rice cooked from scratch in a rice-cooker, and much better than "instant rice" prepared by steeping in hot water.  In fact, it is easier to prepare  than instant rice - just cut an opening in the pouch for venting and heat the entire pouch for 90 seconds in a microwave oven for a steaming hot rice meal.

This Plus Guard Roller Stamp does the job of hiding your ID by camouflage.  The user rolls the stamp on the document, which prints small letters over the characters, thus making them unreadable.  The smaller the type the document is in, the more effective the stamp is.  For large types, repeated rolling is necessary to cover up the characters.This stamp works well on absorbent bond paper but fails when used on glossy or coated paper like the address labels on Amazon boxes, contrary to the product description on the web page.  The letters on the glossy address label stand out against the thin ink of the stamp.  Furthermore, the stamp is about ½ inch wide.  It may be too wide for documents with small types, if the user wants to leave the document readable except for an occasional word or sentence.  For glossy and coated paper and for the purpose of redacting, I recommend a redacting pen.  Click on the product link below:Permanent Black Marker Blackout Artline Secure Marker Redacting Pen

These Fleur De Lis Jacquard Dishtowels are big for what they are, measuring 18-1/2 x 28 inches.  For drying dishes, I prefer a smaller size, just slightly bigger than a dinner plate, for easier handling.  Furthermore, they are not particularly good for drying dishes because they are thin and not very absorbent.  However, they do have attractive designs and brighten up the kitchen.

From a distance, this UDC4 fake camera looks reasonably real, but upon close inspection, it is betrayed by its flimsy plastic construction.  Furthermore, the plastic integral mount has very limited movement, making the camera difficult to aim.  The title on the web page touts "30 Illuminating LEDs" and the picture shows a circle of red LEDs, but the camera I received on 4/25/15 has only one red blinking light, which makes it look fake.  A newer batch may have "30 illuminating LEDs" but I cannot confirm that.  Before making this purchase, I urge Amazon shoppers to check out another fake camera, which I purchased at Amazon recently.  I think it is a better choice.  See the address below:Swann Dummy ADS-180 Imitation Security Camera

It is hard to tell that this Swann ADS-180 Camera is a fake without prior knowledge or the user connecting it to power and a TV. This is so for one simple reason: this camera is the actual body of a functional ADS-180 camera, minus a real lens and the electronic. Kids looking for trouble on their way home from school wouldn't be able to tell that it is fake.  An experienced prowler at night, on the other hand, may realize it because the fake infrared LEDs do not light up.This dummy ADS-180 camera is made of metal, measuring approximately 3-1/4 inches long and 2-3/8 inches across, excluding the mount. The wires and the two connectors are real. A metallic camera mount comes with the purchase, together with three screws, three plastic anchors, and four 2-1/2 x 2-1/2 inch decals. This Swann Dummy ADS-180 camera will be perfect if the manufacturer would incorporate working low level red LEDs, visible only in the dark, to simulate infrared illumination.

Unlike the nail clipper sets bought in discount stores, which are mostly made of chrome plated ferrous metal, this Zwilling J.A. Henckels Nail Clipper appears to be constructed of polished stainless steel.  It is small, designed for use with fingernails.  It looks good.  It is also sharp and makes clean cuts consistently.  It comes with a plastic sleeve, which serves as a clipping holder.  The clipper slides in and out of the sleeve smoothly.  Personally, I prefer to use the clipper without the sleeve.  The price at twenty-two dollars for a fingernail clipper is a tad steep.  I wish it came down some.

This Lipton Liquid Iced Tea Mix is surprising delicious.  The iced tea made from this mix is almost as good as store-bought pre-mixed iced tea of the same brand. It is also convenient. Instead of storing numerous 2-liter bottles in the pantry, one only has to keep one small 2-1/2-oz bottle in the fridge (refrigeration optional). I put four generous squirts of this Lipton Liquid Iced Tea Mix into a chilled 500-milliliter bottle of Kirkland drinking water, and voila, I got iced tea to go.  The price at over 9 dollars per 2-1/2-oz bottle is kind of steep.  I wish it comes down a little.

Parallels is a 2015 digital film made by writer/director Christopher Leone for Fox Digital Studios.  It was first released through Netflix around March 2015.It is the story of a group of people traveling to alternate earths through a mysterious portal called “The Building”.  The idea is apparently based on the theory of Many Worlds Interpretation in quantum mechanics, which states that all possible timelines that can exist do, each representing a different world with its own history and future, and that all possible outcomes of an event are realized in these worlds.Unlike the big budget Hollywood sci-fi movies with eye-popping special effects, Parallels holds the viewers’ interest through its intriguing story.  The film has the look a television pilot, with many threads and few answers, which leaves the viewers wanting.  Some reviewers mistook the film as a “failed pilot” but it is not – Fox Digital is not a TV studio.  However, the filmmaker obviously is hoping that a TV studio may pick up the story of Parallels and turn it into a TV series.  I love to see that happen.  Stay tuned and keep your fingers crossed.

The salient features of this Tekton Tape Measure are the auto-lock and the dual scales.  The tape automatically locks when the user pulls it out.  It retracts upon the press of a button. It is convenient. The tape is graduated in inches on one side and centimeters on the other. It is versatile.This case is made of metal with rubber grips on both the top and bottom.  It is comfortable to hold and should last for a long time on account of its metal construction. The tape is 16 feet long and ¾ inch wide, and made of metal. It is covered with a mat-finish film, most likely Mylar, to minimize corrosion.  The front hook slides freely to compensate for its thickness.  This Tekton Tape Measure is one of the best I own.  I highly recommend it to Amazon shoppers.

This Worry Easters Saggo doll is small, about 10-1/2 inches tall and 6 inches wide, excluding the “hair” and “arms and legs”.  It has a zipper for a mouth.  Unzip its mouth and there is a pocket about 3 inches deep.  The doll is smooth and soft.  Children love to cuddle with it.A Worry Easters doll is a good way to talk to a small child about his/her fears and worries.  If the child is old enough to write, have him/her write them down, unzip the doll, and stuff their fears and worries into the doll.  If the child is too young to write, the parent can write them down for him/her.  The symbolism is strong.  It is soothing to a child to see that their fears and worries are properly stored away.  Furthermore, parents will get a chance to do something to alleviate the child’s fears or worries.  For example, if the child says there is monster under his/her bed, put a night light on an extension cord under the bed and tell the child that monsters are afraid of light.  These Worry Eaters dolls come in different versions. They are so clever.

This grill cover with a length of 68 inches is designed to fit a Char-Broil grill but I actually purchased it for my MoJack 36” Pitmaster wood pellet grill.  It fits perfectly because my MoJack grill has the same profile as the Char-Broil grill the cover is for. The thick vinyl material appears to be sturdy enough to stand up to the elements.  There is a drawstring at the bottom of the cover such that the cover can be secured on the grill in the wind.  Additional tie-down may be a good idea in strong wind gusts.

These 3 x 5 School Smart Scratch Pads with gum tops are handy for jotting down notes or compiling a list.  The gum adhesive on top of the pads is a tad thin but sufficient to hold the sheets together. The problem is that three out of the twelve pads I received came with missing adhesive along the left front edge.  As a result, some top sheets are falling off.  So buyers beware.

This Quartet Dry-Erase Board looks and feels sturdy. It is hefty for its size of 11" x 14". It is attractive with an aluminum and plastic frame. A Quartet dry-erase marker comes with the purchase. The writing surface of the boards is smooth and even and works well with the marker to produce good legible notes, which can be erased easily with a dry paper towel or facial tissue. This board is also magnetic. Two round plastic-coated magnets are provided for holding paper notes on the board. Some marker residue does build up over time. I clean the board occasionally with rubbing alcohol to restore the board to its original condition.A variety of mounting options is available. The board comes with mounting hardware for dry walls or the fabric walls of a typical office cubical. It can also be mounted with the included 3M foam tapes and magnetic strips on a metal surface. To avoid drilling holes, I mounted my board on dry wall with a Duck Brand Removable Mounting Poster Putty (See Note).  I applied the putty along the entire perimeter on all four sides.  It is holding fast so far.  The magnetic strips included may be too small to hold the heavy board on a vertical metallic surface.  They may work with additional adhesive back magnetic strips on all four sides.  Adhesive back magnetic strips are available for purchase here at Amazon.  All in all, this Quartet dry-erase board is good buy.Note:  Duck Brand Removable Mounting Poster Putty, 2 oz., White (1436912)

Most Americans are aware of the high cost of medical care in this country.  The most cited reasons are: (1) the high administrative cost of the health care system based on third party payers, namely the multitude of insurance companies, versus the single payer system of other countries, (2) the high cost of drugs due to the lack of leverage of U.S. consumers on the pharmaceutical industry, and (3) the large amount of medical care consumed by U.S. patients, some of which is probably unnecessary.In this book "Less Medicine More Health", the author Dr. H. Gilbert Welch explores the topic of excessive use of medical procedures in America.  He lists and describes in detail "7 Assumptions That Drive Too much Medical Care".  I find this book enlightening.  Furthermore, this book is written in a colloquial style, which makes it eminently readable, in addition to being informative.  The author is uniquely qualified on the topic of excessive medical care.  He is a primary care physician certified in internal medicine, a medical care epidemiologist, and a teacher.  I recommend this book to Amazon readers.

This Nature program is a moving story of naturalist Joe Hutto who spent 6 years living intimately with a herd of mule deer at Deadman Gulch near his homestead in Wyoming and got to know many deer individually.  For the first two years, he was out every day with the herd and eventually gained the trust of a doe and leader of the herd, whom he called Raggedy Anne.  He was then able to move freely in the herd.  He discovered that his deer knew sorrow and love just like people. He saw how the family of Raggedy Anne stayed at her side as she lay dying, and a fawn he called Molly ran around in great distraught looking for her mother Red Tag who just died.In spite of what he would have hoped, Joe Hutto couldn't protect his deer from predators.  He expressed sorrow on the deer kills in the snow, on which he lamented, "...they're quintessential death by a thousand cuts....They (the deer) don't cling less desperately to their lives than we do; they do not experience death with less fear than we do.  Their agony and their horror is absolutely real.  And this is an individual that you know.... you can't look at it and say, "well, this is the natural order of things, this is the way it should be....."  Joe Hutto was telling something most of us already know - that Nature is cruel and uncaring, and that she has no regard for individuals."Animals are not the only predators that Molly will encounter..." Joe Hutto commented, as he was petting the fawn he befriended.  He meant the "orange vests" who "arrive at every direction" when the hunting season began.  He witnessed the killing of Babe.  As he was helping the hunters lift the buck into their vehicle, one of them asked, "Do you have any idea how old this deer might be?" He answered with great sorrow, "Yeah, I know exactly how old this deer is.  I've known him since he was a spotted fawn.  And I know, because I have all his other shed antlers in my house...."Befriending wildlife exacts a price, as Joe Hutto found out.  He said, "They (the deer) are under assault from so many different directions, and I see it in their eyes. I have come to know the lives of these wild creatures, I've become a member of the herd, but I don't know how long I'll be able to continue, because the sorrow that I observe in these animals is just simply exhausting..." I know what he was saying.After thought:  Mule deer as a species are not threatened currently, but their number has declined dramatically in recent years in the American West.  In the state of Wyoming, mule deer population had plummeted 36% from 578,000 in 1991 to 369,000 in late 2012.  Among other factors, the loss of habitat, oil and gas development, aggressive wild fire suppression, predation, harsh winters, and drought are responsible.  But this video is not about wildlife statistic; it is about one man's connection to wild animals.  Animals are not dumb.  They have feelings and emotions.  They have an inner life.  Any pet parent of cats and dogs can testify to that.  They feel love, joy, and sorrow.  They fear death as much as any human being.  The terror and agony of slaughter are as real and vivid to them as to people.  But in a world plagued with war, terrorism, disease, poverty, and assorted human miseries, animal right is probably the furthest thing from anybody's mind.  That much I know.

These microfiber cleaning cloths are silky smooth.  They are good for cleaning eyeglasses, lenses, computer screens, and such without noticeable scratches.  The large 12 x 12 inch size makes them easy to handle.  They come in five different colors such that I can delegate a different color to a specific task.  Occasionally, I hand wash and air-dry them.  At twenty-five dollars for a pack of twenty, it is a good value.  I recommend these microfiber cloths to Amazon shoppers.

This SABRE Pepper Spray measures 3-3/4 inches high and 1-1/4 inches across at the widest points. It fits a small hand well. There is a flip-top to prevent accidental release. It is a good alternative to firearm for personal protection when firearm is undesirable due to philosophical and/or legal reasons, but be sure keep it away from children and pets.While it is indeed legal in all 50 states, the shopper should nevertheless check out the legality, restrictions, and liabilities of pepper spray at his/her location before purchase (See Note below).  In some states, e.g. California, pepper spray is legal for self-defense, but the use of it in anger or as a practical joke is a felony punishable by $1,000 fine and/or up to 3 years in state prison. Some states have registration or licensing requirements. Most states prohibit the sale of pepper spray to minors. In the city of Chicago, pepper spray is illegal. Furthermore, it is a federal crime to carry pepper spray in a commercial airliner where it is accessible to the person. Pepper spray is prohibited in most state and federal buildings.Note: Check out the legality, restrictions, and liabilities of pepper spray @http://www.cabelas.com/assets/product_files/pdf/pepperspray_lawsregulation.pdf

This SABRE Motion Sensor Alarm works on three AAA batteries (not included). The user can mount the alarm permanently on a wall using the included wall-bracket with a swivel for flexible directional adjustment, or it can mounted on a single screw slot, which I prefer because the swivel is too loose to hold the alarm securely.  The alarm can be easily removed from the bracket or the wall screw and deployed freestanding. This means that this motion alarm is portable. It can be quickly set up in a hotel room for early warning of unexpected entry. I wish there is a back stand to secure it on tabletop but there isn't. The alarm is armed or disarmed with a 4-digit code of the user's choice. It can be set to chime or sound an ear-splitting alarm. At fifteen dollars, this SABRE motion alarm is a good value.

The White Queen is a British 10-part television series based on the historical novel series The Cousin's War by the award winning British writer Philippa Gregory.  It is the story of the struggle for the throne of England between two rival royal factions, the house of Lancaster and the house of York, in the Wars of the Roses between 1455 and 1487, as seen through the eyes of the female characters Elizabeth Woodville, The White Queen (Rebecca Ferguson), Margaret Beaufort, The Red Queen (Amanda Hale), & Anne Neville, The Kingmaker's Daughter (Faye Marsay).The film is engrossing, with beautiful cinematography and excellent acting. The plot is fast moving, full of political intrigue and family feud with grave consequences.  There are some criticisms of historical inaccuracies of the scenery, stage sets, and the chronology of events.  To avoid confusing fictions with facts, the viewers should remember that the film is a historical novel, not a history documentary (See my comment below).  Two versions were made.  The BBC version, first aired on June 2013 in the UK, is more conservative, followed by the steamy Starz version, aired in the US on August 2013.  This Amazon Prime video is the Starz version, with male and female nudity, explicit sex acts, and graphic childbirth footage.  So parents beware.

The SABRE Home Security Alarms system comes with one door unit and three window units. The product is labeled as "Wireless Alarm Kit" on the package, but the word "Wireless" can be misleading to some shoppers, who may think that the door and window units are interconnected or operated remotely by radio wave. This is not so. "Wireless" here means that the alarms are operated on batteries without the use of external wires.The door unit runs on three AAA batteries (not included). The user enters a 4-digit code of his choice by pressing the "LEARN" button in the battery compartment. This 4-digit code is used to arm or disarm the door alarm upon exit or entry. The user can choose a gentle door chime or a loud alarm by moving a switch in the battery compartment.The window units run on 4-button batteries (included) and operate independently of the door unit and each other. The user arms or disarms the alarm or a chime via a switch inside the battery compartment. The 4-digit code is not used here.Installation is simple: just mount the door or window unit on the door or window and the corresponding magnet on the door or window frame adjacent to each other.  Separation of the alarm unit from the magnet will sound the alarm.  Three sets of screw and drywall anchor are included for the installation of the door unit. The window units are installed with the use of two sided adhesive foam tapes (included).This SABRE home alarm system is suitable as an entry-level alarm for homeowners or apartment renters. It will not qualify the user for a discount in his homeowner or renter insurance, which requires central-monitored alarm system. But it does provide some rudimentary home protection and for the price of fifteen dollars, it is a great value. I highly recommend this product to shoppers who are looking for a low price but fairly effective home alarm system.

This Wicker Woven Utensil Caddy Picnic Basket measures approximately 10-7/8 inches long, 9 inches wide, and 6-1/2 inches high at the exterior. The web page states the size as 10 x 7 x 6. It is incorrect, either measured externally or internally. The single large wooden handle is about 5-5/8 inches tall. It is foldable and feels secured. The rim of the basket is reinforced with small strips of wood.The interior of the basket is divided into one large compartment and three small compartments with wood panels held down by small nails. The large compartment is about 10 x 3-3/8 inches and the small ones 3 x 3-7/8 inches. The small panels dividing the small compartments are not properly positioned at 90 degrees and are noticeably crooked. I bought two more of these baskets after the initial purchase. The crookedness of the small panels varies from basket to basket.  The bottom of the basket needs reinforcement. Pointed objects like metal knives and forks may penetrate the wicker material. I reinforced the bottom inside with corrugated cardboard and paper towels.In spite of the flaws, I find this wicker picnic basket practical and aesthetically pleasing. It is reasonably sturdy for a hand-made wicker basket. With some care, it should last a while.

This Stanley Powerlock Pocket Tape is small, measuring 2 x 2 x ¼ inch thick. It is very light. It is ideal to carry in one's pocket or waist-pack while shopping in a home improvement store.  It comes in handy for measuring lumber, base board, fence post, and such.  The tape measure itself is 10 feet long and ¼ inch wide and covered with a thin Mylar film for durability.  The spring-loaded retract system and the lock button work well.  There is no belt-clip.  I wish there is one.  Recommended.

Among many uses in school or office, a label maker is good for organizing household items.  Aside from the usual stuff like jars and containers in the pantry, I used it to label the tangle of cables at the back of my computers and game consoles, so in the event that I have to disconnect something, I know where to plug the cables back in.I owned a Brother PT-300 for close to ten years until the cutter stopped cutting and the printout faded.  So I can say right off the bat that Brother did make durable label makers.  This Brother PTD400AD measures 7-3/8 x 7-3/8 x 3 inches high.  It runs on AC with an AC adapter (included) rated at 100-240V 50-60 Hz 0.6A input and 12V 2A output.  It will fit most electrical grids, foreign or domestic.  The PTD400AD also runs on 6 AA batteries so it can be used anywhere, although it may be a tad too big to go into a brief case.This Brother PTD400AD comes with many fonts, sizes, styles, frames, and symbols and prints up to 5 lines on one label.  It will take a long time for the user to learn to take advantage of the many features.  So keep the manual close by for quick reference.  The user can save up to 50 labels in the memory and recall them for later use.  This PTD400AD can even create bar codes like those found on supermarket items. To use them, one needs a bar code reader.  Bar codes are a wonderful way to organize and track large number of items, like in school or office, although I don't see much use in a household setting.Tapes of various widths from 6mm to 36mm are available.  In addition, there is a "supper narrow" non-laminated tape with 3.5mm width.  The tapes come in a variety of materials including fabric iron-on, extra-strength adhesive, acid-free adhesive, flexible I.D. laminate, and tamper evident laminate.  Many text and background colors in a variety of combinations are available: text in black, white, blue, red, and gold, and background in white, black, clear, yellow, orange, red, pink, blue, green, silver, and gold.  The user has a rainbow of choices.  This Brother PTD400AD is a good buy.

This is my first Gran Turismo game, so I am not going to compare it with the previous games in the series.  Gran Turismo 6 is quite exciting by itself. The graphics is awesome and the racing mechanics is as close to fast driving as I can tell.  I was especially impressed by the playback after each race, which is presented as a well-edited video, with constant changing camera angles and cut-in/cut-out effect.The player is first given a Honda Fit at the beginning of the game.
