Little form factor with a larger than expected sound ... which degrades at lower volumes over full blast.I'm giving it 4-stars because it will certainly fit a need and the form factor is cool.  I was provided a free sample to test to review purposes and it definitely outdoes my expectations.  If looking for ultra compact sound, this Mengo Mini Drum speaker can fulfill a need.

This is a wonderful and heavy duty bar mat (much like the promotional ones provided by liquor suppliers to bars and restaurants).  Having been in the family restaurant business, I wanted to compare the quality and this 18x12" mat matched up.The directions provided with the mat said that there might be an odor upon opening and recommendation to clean and rinse the mat ... but I didn't notice any particular odor at all.Sharp looking bar mat that is thick and durable and certainly does the trick.I received a free sample of the Shacke 18 x 12 Service Mat in order to test and provide honest feedback.  I like the mat, it does the trick.

I live in Southwest Florida where the humidity is high but I can BBQ all year long without a hitch.  I use a Weber Genesis grill that has a thicker handle.  I was concerned at first that this light would not fit the circumference of my BBQ handle ... not a problem at all.  The adjustable bracket on the light is easily adjusted just right to fit the handle at whatever angle I choose to mount it.  The bracket allows for a lot of variability and this is definitely a great thing.There is a small screwdriver included with the light ... this is simply to open up a screw on the battery compartment (which takes 3 AA batteries).  It was a nice add-on in the package.The light is turned on through touch and shines bright at 100 lumens.  Just enough to focus on the job at hand.  The switch is sensitive to touch and responds easily.  The light has some heat resistance but optimally, the instructions say to keep it dry and a half meter away from the "bbq station" - I think the handle is the perfect place but will need to be assessed if you are using the light with the top closed.It mounts easily and does a nice job in circumstances that do not have optimal light.  It definitely has a lot of flexibility and functionality.  I like the light and have it mounted on my Weber.  It works great with no complaints.I received a sample of this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

These are absolutely one of the best pair of tweezers that I have ever used for eyebrows!  I've gone for the bigger names like "Tweezerman" and although these are not a brand you may recognize, they are a hidden gem.  I would not ordinarily go for a pink set of tweezers ... but I was asked to review them and provide an honest review in exchange for the sample.  I expected to be underwhelmed and to provide a so-so review based on use.  I was very pleasantly surprised.Don't let the lack of known branding or the pink color fool you (like it did me).  These are great tweezers and they have the ability to be so precise because of the sharp edges.  I have multiple tweezers in my makeup kit but these are my favorites when it comes to tweezing eyebrows.  One word describes them:  precision!A hidden gem.

These are now my favorite "go-to" stands for my various ukuleles.  The stand folds up nice and small and fits in most of my Uke cases (except not my hard case for a concert sized uke).  Foldable, portable and extremely light.Perfect for ukuleles.

I really love a product that solves a simple problem and does it elegantly.  Such is the case with Captive Cables!We probably all have them.  Those tangled cable messes that result from so much technology and so many different ways to plug in.  Gadget after gadget is added to a power strip or USB plug in adapter and before too long ... a mess of phone cables and device wires and a feeling of frustration.  Along comes Captive Cables to solve the problem with a nifty 4 pack of Neopreme zip-up jackets.  The fact that they come with 4 to a pack makes them extra valuable.  I am not sure about you, but I have several messy cable "bird's nests" in my house.  These do a wonderfully, elegant job of straightening cables out and keeping them all in line.A solution for a very common problem and I love this product.  They are made extremely well with neoprene and a quality zipper that works well.  The zippers on these sleeves could have been cheap and frustrating and a potential point of failure.  But they aren't ... they are of good quality and provide the kind of closure a solution like this calls for.I was provided a sample of Captive Cables in exchange for an honest review.  Just because I receive a product for review does not mean I am not 100% honest (not afraid to dock stars because people are relying on honesty - and I will give it).  These are worth 5 stars and definitely worth purchasing if you need to clean up some cable messes.  Great product!  Very pleased with it.

I am a photography hobbyist who is having a blast getting into the hobby.  There are always a lot of accessories that can be added to any camera bag and some classic star filters are no exception.  These filters are made of HD Glass and a black almite (a coating that adds some durability) frame.  The pack of three filters are a great value and can add a sparkle to pictures taken of bright objects.  I am finding them a lot of fun to experiment with.A great value, they come packaged in plastic cassette cases which make for good, protective storage.  Lots of fun and very versatile filters.  I was offered these filters as a free sample in order to test and review

This urine THC test strip works.  It's good to use if you think you may have been exposed to THC in any environment and need to verify if you are positive or negative.  Since THC stays in the system for weeks, this is a good way to see if your system is free and clear.It takes about 5 minutes to really work but it works and can be easily read.I recommend this test if it is something you think you need to have handy.

Doesn't work all that well and item is marked for single use.  I was using it with a tiny pill and that may have been the problem (1/4 grain Phenobarbital for a cat with seizures).  Did not work no matter how I tried to manipulate it.  The pill did not "shoot" anywhere ... just fell out of the end.There has to be a better piller than this one.  I don't recommend it at all

I was offered a sample of this product to try in exchange for an honest review.I love this Ocean Facial Toner by COUI because it is very very gentle on the skin.  I've used several of the big name toners like Clinique and this one is definitely less astringent and has a light rose scent to it that comes from the rose water.  The scent is not overpowering and you can feel the ingredients at work without the astringency of added alcohol.  The no alcohol is probably one of my favorite things about this Toner.The spray bottle is a great method of delivery and the spray is a pump versus an aerosol.I use the toner along with the COUI Nourishing Oil for soft and radiant feeling skin.  I think that this toner product offers a nice way to rejuvenate my complexion and keep my face feeling fresh.  I'm really enjoying it!

A 42DD is the size I typically wear so when Amazon wanted me to test this, I was able to get the size I am accustomed to.This is a pretty bra with no extra frills - but it does have a feminine texture and pattern on the material without an extra lace.  Playtex is a trusted brand so I was happy to try this bra out.  A little lengthening of the shoulder straps for me made this a better fit (so that the underwires fell a little lower).  When I made the adjustment, it took care of wrinkles at the top of the cup where the shoulder strap starts.  For me, this is a problem area.This is a good bra for rounder, fuller breast and is not particularly pointy ... I'll try bras on that are more pointy and they never work.  This is NOT one of those bras.I am not sure I would order more of these given the underwire ... but it is pretty and it works as a non-padded bra with a good solid backstrap and 4 hooks versus 3 hooks.  I think this is a better bra for a rounder, fuller breasted woman.

Bought a pack of two of these Snark SN-8 Super Tight tuners for my Ukuleles.  I have multiple ukes and needed a simple tuner to clip on the headstock and pack in the case.  This tuner does a great job of helping me find the sweet spot on each string.  The display is bright and it just works.  I like the included metronome too.  But my favorite is the transpose tuning feature which can be adjusted to whatever fret I have my capo on.  That is a very neat feature.The other great thing that makes this such a nice and easy tuner is that a simple click of the yellow button gets the unit on and the unit turns off too with a simple push.  No having to hold any buttons or wait long for a display to warm up.It just works.I wouldn't hesitate to get more of these as needed.  The clip works and for now, I have one on my Firefly soprano Banjolele and my KoAloha Concert uke.  Very happy with them.

I always loved At-a-Glance products.  Always so well thought out.  For this planner, I have struggled with a rating between 3 and 4 stars.  I opted for 4 stars in the end.This Weekly planner is a great option for teachers, professors or older students.  Although I cannot imagine NOT using my smartphone for the things that this planner provides ... this is a great option for those people who are still the pencil and paper type.  Some of the classic stuff in this weekly planner make it useful:  A 3-year reference calendar, contacts, notes pages, an event calendar, 4-year holiday list, and a U.S. time zone and area code page.  A smartphone can make this obsolete in a second ... but there are those people who will never go with technology.  For those people, this is a nice option that steers away from the black covers that scream traditional.  For someone not ready to go purely digital but who wants to veer away from the black covers.  This is a cool option.The one thing I did not like (on my unit at least) was the spirals on this spiral bound book.  I found the spiral a little bendy and flimsy.  I can see this being a problem over time as this notebook gets jostled in my briefcase, backpack or book bag.  Other than that, it seems like a nice option that is priced like it's competitors.

Having finished Fairest, a novella of the Lunar Chronicles, I do feel as though I have more insight into Lunar Queen Levana's behavior as we see it in the other books. Fairest follows her from the time she's sixteen and has just lost her parents to assassins; her sister Channary has been named queen. That's less problematic to Levana than the fact that her crush, palace guard Evret Hayle, is married and unavailable. When his wife dies, Levana uses her gifts to ensnare him, but obviously that's not the way to make a happy relationship. The relationship between the two is the main focus of Fairest; the way Levana chooses to ensure that she becomes queen and remains that way is the second, lesser sub-plot. In a short novel, it's easy to see where the plot is going but it's the insight into Levana's thoughts that make this more than just a throwaway story.All that said, I really wasn't all that thrilled with Fairest. Levana is, of course, the villain in the Lunar Chronicles, but her own self-delusion is really pitiful and her mistreatment of others places her on the same level as the sister she dislikes. I'm aware that I'm not supposed to like her (and I don't) but there was almost a time when I felt sorry for her. It seems whatever she wants, she cannot have, and she takes all this out on the situations and people around her. By the time I was done with the book, I definitely wanted to see her destroyed, not just redeemed (not that I think that's possible). This is a fast read, but not really one that made me think, "Wow, so there's a whole, well-rounded backstory to Levana." I wish it had given me a more multi-dimensional feeling for Levana, because that would certainly have made for a conflicted, exciting next installment.  Instead, it simply reinforces my low opinion and makes me ready to get to Winter...which, I suppose, was the author's intent all along.

Received this item today and have already put it through its paces. It's heavy duty; I'm pretty impressed with the weight of it. It's solid and handled my stapling jobs well. I also am a fan of the colors! It arrived with a small box of staples so you will definitely need to pick up a pack. But overall,  I'm thrilled to recommend this item.

Anya's Ghost is a good graphic novel that pulls the reader into the story quickly, and keeps you turning the pages to find out just what is up with this ghost...Is she really just a friendly ghost who wants out of the well where she's been stuck for nearly a hundred years? Or is there something slightly more sinister going on?Built around Anya, a teenager whose mother emigrated from Russia to America when Anya was a child, we follow her through a normal, teen-angsty type day, wherein the boy she likes has no clue she's alive and school is such a bore. Then she trips and falls into an old well, and unable to make herself heard, she realizes she's not alone--there's a skeleton in there, with its ghost still attached. Turns out the ghost belongs to Emily, who died nearly a century ago, and now wants to experience more than her hole in the ground. When Anya is rescued, she finds that somehow she's brought Emily's finger bone home with her, thus enabling Emily to leave the well. The thing is, Emily is pretty handy, helping out in school and giving advice on how to make Sean take notice. But Anya wants to help solve the mystery of Emily's murder, and it's this fact that changes everything.The story itself is good, and the characterizations are spot on. I really enjoyed the artwork; Emily's pupil-less eyes give a definite creepiness to her appearance, and the black and white theme adds to the ambiance. This graphic novel would most definitely appeal to teens who feel isolated in social situations, and it's got enough depth to the story to make even a reluctant reader want to keep going. I wasn't such a fan of Anya's friend Siobahn (still not really sure what her purpose was, to be truthful), but I loved the way Anya's confidence grew over the course of the story, and I liked the idea that she had difficulty fitting in because she came from another country.  This is one graphic novel with a good story that can easily be recommended to anyone who wants to escape for a bit.

The 19th Wife by David Ebershoff is really two stories, something I didn't realize when I initially began reading. Not that that turned out to be a bad thing, but going in I thought I was just getting the story of Ann Eliza Young and I ended up with that and more. I'm still not sure the present-day story was needed, or even all that good, really. But interesting? Yes, indeed.So...This is the story of Ann Eliza, who became the nineteenth wife of LDS leader Brigham Young and later divorced him amid much public turmoil and sensation in the 1870s. We follow the story of her mother, Elizabeth Webb, who was the first wife of Chauncey Webb, and whose faith is strongly shown in her life and the way she raised her children. Ann Eliza is very headstrong, however, and quickly marries James Dee once she's an adult; that marriage, though disastrous and ending in divorce, produces Ann Eliza's two sons. Interwoven with Ann Eliza's problems are those of her brother, Gideon, who ends up at the mercy of Brigham and convinces his sister to marry the leader, even when she does not want to. All of these stories are told from differing points of view, some in several chapters and some in only one, and we even have Brigham's voice telling us his doubts and desires. It's obvious Ebershoff did his research thoroughly and well in the way he illuminates the tenets of the LDS Church and the problems and interests of polygamy.Bouncing in and out of this story is the present-day mystery of Jordan Scott, whose mother (Number Nineteen in her own marriage) is accused of the murder of her polygamous husband. Jordan doesn't buy this story because he knows his mom; she's not unhappy with her conservative, fundamentalist lot and there are other wives/people with more motive than she has. Jordan, traveling with his dog, Elektra, goes to the town of Mesaville to see what he can discover and finds out that not only is he unwelcome, he's not wrong, either. While he investigates, he also becomes involved with a new boyfriend, Tom, and a fellow runaway/former "First" child, Johnny.The story of Ann Eliza is well done, and the focal point for most of the book. I loved how we moved among the important people in these events. Ebershoff uses a variety of methods, including newspaper clippings, narratives, and even a wikipedia entry to get his points across, all to good effect. He's brought Ann Eliza to life and given us a fairly accurate (or as accurate as can be) portrait of a woman who had finally had enough and wished to be more than just a number in her husband's harem. She wasn't always likable, and she had her own issues, to be sure, but without her interference, polygamy might have taken much longer to not be recognized in the LDS.The modern day story is good, in that it points out that there are still sects that practice polygamy and the subjugation of women, and the children of those unions often turn out disenfranchised and forsaken. I just never really liked Jordan all that much, and didn't get very involved in the overall story. There were too many characters I didn't really care about, and maybe the intention of alerting the  reader to the continuing problem should have been the focus rather than a murder story. It's not bad, and I did find myself trying to figure out what happened. I just don't think it was a necessary component to the overall success of the novel.If you don't know much about the history of polygamy in the United States, this book will do a pretty fair turn at informing you in such a way as to give several sides to the story and making you think about how/why it happened. It's well written and engaging, and will probably have you looking up more information once you close the last page. I'll be thinking about this one for a while.

The Curel Itch Defense Body Wash is very creamy and smells like a dream. The only small issue I have is that it does feel as though it's not completely rinsing off, even though I'm sure it is. So far, it is definitely helping with my constantly dry skin, so that's a win. Give it a try!

While the LED light isn't going to make grilling in the dark much clearer, this stainless steel set of tongs is still a good value. We grill a lot and my husband is enjoying the grip on the tongs. The LED is fairly light and doesn't shed much extra light but is a fun feature nonetheless.

Okay, yes, I admit it:  I am addicted to these fun novels about the Rat Pack! This time, our Eddie G. is asked to help a friend of Dean's...one Marilyn Monroe. What red-blooded male of the early 60s would turn down such a gig? Not our favorite pit boss. Marilyn feels someone has been following her, so Eddie agrees to look into it. Unfortunately, he receives word of the passing of his mother back in New Jersey, so Eddie turns the job over temporarily to detective buddy, Danny Bardini. Things take a turn for the worse when the funeral doesn't go well and Danny disappears. Along with sidekick Jerry, Eddie becomes determined to discover what happened to his friend and also to keep Marilyn safe. Suffice it say, nothing goes as planned and someone ends up injured and someone ends up...dead.The portrayal of Marilyn in this mystery is handled sensitively yet realistically; it's great to see Eddie react with care and concern for Marilyn's worries, and to see her portrayed as sexy yet vulnerable. Along with Marilyn, Frank comes off particularly well in this installment, agreeing to help Eddie G out more than once. I can feel the relationships developing here, deepening into true friendship. Jerry is a delight as usual, and it's great to see Eddie relying more on his friend, and realizing just how important Jerry is to him. The story does go off in an unexpected way, but more icons of the 60s are involved and it's easy to see how seamlessly Randisi weaves personalities into his story. Particularly poignant is the ending; you'll start to believe it all truly happened this way. And that is the true beauty and fun of this novel. So much fun!

I love Princess Mia, and I've loved all the Princess Diaries books. Yes, I even love the movies though the changes didn't make me very happy. So, after years of having read all about Mia's insecurities and foibles, I was a little apprehensive to dive into this one. Was the magic still there? Could she possibly come across well as an adult? I'm very relieved to say YES, this is just as much fun as the other titles, and I'm just as happy with the story.It's been five years since Mia last wrote, and in that time she's graduated college and moved into an apartment in the Genovian Consulate. She's still with Michael and still balancing her princess duties with her real life; she's involved in causes she's always espoused but is also waiting for Michael to pop the question (even though they'd agreed they'd wait until life calmed down for both). Mia has a stalker so it's even more important that she watches where she goes, and her grandmother is as obnoxious as ever. She keeps an eye on her Rate the Royals rating and the stress of her father running for office in Genovia has caused her eye to twitch. Just when she thinks she's going to lose it, Michael whisks her off to a private island and...well, you can guess the rest. Enter Grandmeré, who wants to take everything over, but also has a major announcement about Mia's father that will impact all their lives.There's so much more--there always is with Mia--but it's so much fun to visit with her and hear her thoughts as her world goes haywire. I liked that while it's still basically the same Mia, there's a more adult edge to the story, in both situations and language. If there's some parts that work out a little too conveniently, that's all right because hey, it's Mia, and it's a fantasy. I love how it worked out and I'm hopeful we haven't seen or heard the last of the POG.

I'm a Lord John fan. I admit it and embrace it. So I was thrilled to find this novella about his adventures into the Canadian wilderness to stand up for his friend (but also to get out of England for a bit following a duel that went awry). It was nearly the perfect length for a recent flight, and took me right into the Outlander universe as well.I won't waste time recounting the entire plot, other than to say Lord John finds it expedient to get out of town and when he's asked to stand up for his friend, he takes it. Once he's made it to Canada, however, he finds his cousin's husband has disappeared...after creating his own second family with a Native American woman. Lord John is nothing if not a beacon of integrity, and he does his best to set things right in this regard, and ends up taking part in a British raid on a French fort (which also involves Simon Fraser). If you are looking for a happy, upbeat slice of Lord John's life, this isn't it, but it is gritty and real.There's a lot packed into the novella, and while it doesn't really illuminate more of the overall story, it's an excellent glimpse into what Lord John stands for and it strengthens the backstory of his life in general. I love how Gabaldon has given us a hero, although one with many secrets, who stays true to himself as best he can in any circumstance in which he finds himself. This novella will keep you engrossed with its wry humor and believable twists. Recommended.

By the time you get to the third book in the Rat Pack Mysteries, you pretty much know what you're going to get: a Rat Pack member (or two) with an issue that our hero, Eddie G., can help discreetly, but things go awry and bullets fly. This time it's Sammy Davis Jr., who has the problem: a roll of film has disappeared from Sammy's home and it contains some photos Sammy would prefer not be made public. Of course the situation calls for the utmost care and discretion, and Eddie G., pit boss at the Sands in the 1960s, is called upon to act as a go-between for Sammy and the blackmailers holding the photo. It doesn't take long for the incident to take a deadly turn and soon Eddie finds himself, along with his buddy Jerry Epstein, into things much, much deeper than an embarrassing photo for Sammy. Indeed, it becomes clear that there is something else on that roll of film that people in very high places need to make sure does not get out. But can Eddie maneuver his way through the obstacles and stay alive?It's no secret that I love these books, and this one is no exception. When I think I have things figured out (and I did feel pretty smug about this one), I find out that I'm not as smart as I thought I was. Randisi does an admirable job of weaving people and events of the times throughout his novels, and  he evokes the era clearly in his descriptions. I'm totally hooked on this series and highly recommend it to anyone, but especially those with an interest in the heyday of Frank, Deano, Sammy, and the gang.

These child safety locks work beautifully for preventing and/or limiting access to almost any drawer. This is my favorite self tanner by far!! Ive been using them for years, and have had some pretty strange and interesting results. Once, even a doctor of mine had wanted to refer me to a dermatologist because he said that something is wrong with the way my skin tans (he didn't know it was a self tanner I had used). See, I live in Florida where EVERYBODY has gorgeously tan skin; everybody BUT me! I will burn a million times over before getting tan, which is why I use self tanners. The tanners I used prior to this would rub off on areas like my elbows and knees, and usually, as they were fading my skin would just look so splotchy it was ridiculous and/or disgusting. It's no wonder my doctors was concerned. There were so many other things that would go wrong, too. And each experience I'm referring to are with big name-brand products!!Not with Thermalabs!! I've had nothing but a completely positive experience with this tanner!!! For 2 primary reasons:1. It allows for gradual tanning, while still giving you an instant, all-over glow on first use.2. It comes with an extremely thorough ebook that tells you everything you've ever done wrong with self-tanning, how to fix it, and how to get it right the first time. No other tanning product has offered directions as clear as Thermalabs- which are eye-opening, and explain some (but not all) of the problems I had with other tanners.Of course, when it arrived I didn't so much bother with the book. I immediately went straight to my normal routine (assuming I knew everything having done it for so long). The application was consistent and easy. As a precaution, since I did not know what to expect, I mixed it with lotion before rubbing it all over my body. While the immediate result was not super dark bronze (which I didn't expect anyway), there was a noticeable difference. My skin tone was even all over, and had a gorgeous sunkissed glow.I watched for signs of discoloration as the days passed and it slowly began to fade. I didn't want to reapply it again just yet, because I really was curious if it would turn me into looking like a leper as almost every other self-tanner had. Over the course of a week, it faded as evenly as it applied- with no splotches, unevenness, or streaks.I applied it the second time without a base lotion, and followed the tips and suggestions (many of which I was completely unaware of!) in the included "Self Tan Secrets". Oh- I should mention that this ebook is very easy to read, understand, and follow.The second go around, my tan was FLAWLESS! It was streak-free and completely even all over. I purchased an applicator mitt which I also think helped a lot. But really, I think that what really makes this so much more effective than other products is that it uses all natural and organic ingredients. Based on the results of my second tan, I expect this product to last for some time, as a little does go a long way. By all means- I LOVE this self tanner, and highly recommend it for all skin types!Disclosure: I received a discount to purchase this product, to evaluate and provide my honest and unbiased review. I hope my observations and experience can help you with making a better buying decision.

I live in Florida. High, and frequent, sun exposure is a given unless you're a total recluse. But even IF I were, as a single mom of two boys: I have to be in the sun, a lot.As a result, we keep sunscreen with us at all times. It's in the car, my kids backpacks, and even a small bottle I keep in my purse. For me, personally, I find it important to keep sunscreen on my face at all times due to the damage that can be caused with frequent sun exposure, such as accelerating premature aging.It seems harder and harder to find foundation that contains sunscreen. And when I do, it isn't long before the heat melts it completely off of my face. I've tried to use other brands of sunscreen to use when I moisturize, but they always clog my pores causing breakouts.That's where this sunscreen works beautifully! Especially since I use vitamin C and other face serums that require an SPF moisturizer. Now, when applying moisturizer, I mix equal parts of this sunscreen and let it do its work as a moisturizer. It absorbs fast and deep adding essential antioxidants and nutrients in addition to sun protection. Plus, with mixing it with my moisturizing cream, it is guaranteed to last quite some time. Still, I make sure to apply it generously to my neck, since that is the most overlooked area but often shows aging much faster than the face.Then, I add a little to my liquid foundation. Even though my foundation might melt right off, due to the Florida heat, with this absorbed into my skin I'm still protected from sun damage.Since doing this, I haven't experienced any burning or breakouts- which to me, is a complete life changer for me. Not only do I feel comfortable being outdoors more often, but I AM outdoors more often! By all means, I highly recommend this sunscreen.Disclosure: I received a discount to purchase this product, to evaluate and provide my honest and unbiased review. I hope my observations and experience can help you with making a better buying decision.

There is nothing I can say about this coffee and tea press that does it justice. Seriously. But that seems to be the norm, I'm learning, with Bruntmor products in general.I had recently purchased a press for my boyfriend that was still practically brand new, but when I was offered this one at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review, I figured since he works offshore, that he could use another to keep on the job. This is by far one of, if not THE MOST, impressive RFID wallets I've ever seen! The fact that the wallet itself is crafted of a beautiful high-quality, grain leather- which appears to be rather strong, and quite durable, really sets it apart from other RFID wallets.But this is so much more than a wallet alone, with RFID capabilities: this is an ENTIRE KIT that will fully and extensively secure each and every possible card from potential fraud. In fact, this kit is expansive enough to protect an entire family!I've bought quite a few RFID wallets for myself, family, and friends, over time, but all have been "plain-Jane" in appearance being plastic or stainless steel. None have looked like a REAL wallet. Nor have they been exhaustive enough to provide ample security for ALL of my cards-- especially my children's! So I was quite excited when I received a discount to purchase this kit, in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.The leather of the wallet is especially soft, nice, durable, well made, and constructed of good quality materials. The stitching is reinforced all around. It's also easy to open and close, doesn't seem to have any significant bulk, allowing quick access to your cards. There doesn't appear to be any "break-in" period either, as with most leather wallets.The interior is impressive! It has a total of 6 regular sized card holder pockets (3 on each side), with extra "side" pockets to neatly store cards (receipts, etc...) beneath the card pockets, on each side. In addition to having a deep and wide "bill holder" section- for keeping cash, and like size materials- there is a second "bill holder" section just beneath it.In every way, this wallet looks and functions as any regular wallet should- but with more pockets; having BUILT-IN RFID blocking protection; and being real, top-quality, high-grain leather. In addition to its ability to hold cards,  securely in place inside of the RFID casing (which is invisible to the naked eye), the inside card openings also have a sufficient space and openings to keep cards, cash, receipts, tickets, and misc. papers completely separate aiding in quick access to each as needed.As IF the wallet want enough, this kit takes it to the extreme by including an additional: 10 separate, individual, RFID blocking credit card sleeves;  and 2 RFID blocking passport sleeves. These are AWESOME for giving to family members, protecting cards that are kept at home, and/or when carrying a wallet isn't really practical and it's easier to just bring along a card or two.All-in-all, this is an excellent wallet (loaded down with essential accessories )that is functional, practical, constructed of good-quality leather, and protective from card scanning thieves. I expect this wallet to last for some time, and it has done a wonderful job holding up for the few months I've been using it.  If you're looking for a luxurious, protective, roomy, and overall great quality passport  wallet - I feel fully comfortable with giving this case a high recommendation.Disclosure: I received this product at a discount, to evaluate and in exchange for providing my honest and unbiased review. I hope my observations and experience can help you with making a better buying decision.

First of all- this is a beautiful corkscrew! It's constructed of a high-polished, high-grade, stainless steel that's got an absolutely gorgeous handle with an ebony wood inlay. It screams "quality" in every aspect.Other than just being outright gorgeous, what I really like about this corkscrew is that it is more of an all-in-one multipurpose wine tool. As far as the corkscrew alone is concerned, the handle allows it to be easily screwed right into the cork,  without any breakage. Literally, within 5 turns or less, using the handle and double-hinged fulcrum for leverage, the cork can be quickly and easily removed, fully intact.Just above the fulcrum is a bottle opener, and at the opposing end of the handle is a serrated knife, which has the intended purpose of a foil cutter, that neatly folds into the handle. Having every tool needed, effectively and functionally designed into one gadget makes this an exceptional wine accessory!Overall, this is a highly functional, essential utility tool for any wine connoisseur - novice or expert. The quality is unmatched, which is further backed by a 100% no questions asked, lifetime refund/replacement warranty. With a company willing to stand so strongly behind their products, says a lot. Their confidence gives me full faith that this product will last an incredibly long time. On that note: I most certainly recommend it!Disclosure: I received a discount for my honest review and hope my observations and experience can help you make a better buying decision.

For years I've been desperately seeking solutions to problems such as: aging, fine lines/wrinkles, acne scars, acne, scars, and discoloration. I even considered using a deep chemical peel, to just shed the whole first layer of skin, when this product was offered to me at a discounted price, in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.I've suffered some major breakouts over the past few years, which ultimately spread into patches. I couldn't help but pick at them, which had resulted in scarring, leaving dark splotches all over my face. Attempting to lighten them, without any guidance, I picked up a bottle of Hydroquinone awhile back, spot treated, and ended up lightening the scars rather quickly. The problem is that while the scars themselves lightened significantly, the result of using Hydroquinone left my face full of much lighter splotches that look like "rings" from doing targeted treatments. I was afraid this might do the same, or exaggerate the problem- but I had to give it a try as I desperately need a solution.It's been about a week now, since first use, and I have not experienced a single breakout since. I noticed my discoloration is becoming less visible, but subtly. I like that it won't result in more blotching, but instead, evenly lighten and brighten my whole skin tone. Still- to be most effective, and see the permanent elimination of old scars, I believe this product will take some time, but in the end will work beautifully!However, I'm quite impressed with the results, just as a moisturizer. It doesn't take much to apply for it to provide thorough coverage that is quick to absorb, and deeply so. On that note: I do recommend this product.Disclosure: I received a discount to purchase this product, to evaluate and provide my honest and unbiased review. I hope my observations and experience can help you with making a better buying decision.

This is an great, fast charging, portable, user-friendly, 2-port USB wall charger! I really like this feature because with its Smart IQ technology, it knows what you're charging and does it at the maximum speed and/or amperage possible for that particular device.Now I don't know much about "tech" stuff, but I can tell you that I plug my 10ft lightening cable into it, and my iphone charges pretty dang fast. Oh- and another important thing: in ones that I've used in the past, I've has issues with being able to use my phone while it's charging (my phone will just start going crazy on me).  I've been using this one for some time and haven't experienced a single issue. It's perfectly compatible with my iPhone 6 and my ipad. Even when charging them both at once! Plus, I'm not limited to charging my iOS devices, because I often charge my kindle simultaneously with my phone, too.I really like how portable it is!  For travel, the prongs easily fold in for packing or really anytime when it's being stored and not in use. What I really like about its size, though, is that unlike most other adapters I've used, it doesn't take up so much space that it covers both sockets- so I still have an open socket to use as I wish, without either interfering with the other.Also, the color is very nice. I chose the green and white, which is high gloss black, and has grooves along the side which help with grip when unplugging it.If you're looking for an all-in-all excellent USB fast-charging wall charger, for any purpose, you cannot go wrong with this one. I am completely comfortable giving it a 5-star rating and full recommendation!Disclosure: I received a discount to purchase  this product, in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. There are a lot of great things about this no-bark collar, with the first being that IT WORKS!! With first use, literally straight out of the box, I put it on my dog - It wasn't long before the first bark came, and immediately stopped. Lord only knows what was going through her head!In just the first day, the barking dramatically decreased. Of course, this is not something I intend to leave on her at all times, but to use as a training aid. I plan to take it off after 3 days time and see if she even realized it's off. If she does, I like that I can just put it back on her. Eventually, she'll get the point!I like that this collar is adjustable, because it gave me plenty of room to put in around her neck. I just cut off the excess. It's not heavy, either, but she could tell it was on her initially. I also like that there is a battery included, and when it runs out, I can easily  and quickly replace it at my local hardware store- or order it via Prime shipping.It has two prongs which can feel the vibration when the dog is about to bark. It alerts her with a beep, which gets louder with each consequence bark. Should she keep it up, it omits a vibration along with a beep, which also increases with intensity. But it never really "shocks" her, like most people believe.This is certainly an effective collar for training, or even for travel when you need something to keep the barking under control. To me, it's much more humane than any muzzle. I highly recommend this bark collar!Disclosure: I received a discount for my honest review and hope my observations and experience can help you make a better buying decision.

Let me first begin by saying that this is by far, unlike ANY backseat car organizer I've ever seen! It's way above par, and truly has got to have them all beat in terms of space, quality, design, etc...by a long shot. So it's really hard to write a fully comparative review, but I'll do my best by highlighting what makes this one so very special. First, though, I must say that I love that it includes a safety hammer- which is a must have for any driver.Overall, this is an high quality organizer that is great for just about anything!  It has an incredibly strong hold, and out of the box it is obvious that it is made of high quality material. The stitching is strong, the straps are strong, and I have no doubt that it will hold quite well with all of the things my kids will be stuffing into it! It doesn't sag either, no matter how much it's stuffed.Installation is easy, and is only a matter of: strapping the top band on and under the headrest, the bottom band around the front seat, and the elastic hooks underneath the seat in the rear. What I like about this design is that it keeps the organizer super secure, and by tucking the bottom band (that one that straps around the front) into the seat- it's completely comfortable (and undetectable) by the front seat passenger. Often being the front seat passenger myself, I can tell you that disregard for this is a critical design flaw in other organizers which make the strap (and buckle) a huge discomfort for any passenger seated in front of the organizer.I have a minivan, and this organizer does exactly what it says- by literally covering the entire back of the seat. The pockets are plentiful, and just the right size, too. I especially like the depth of the various compartments, because it gives my kids ample space to put their larger, essential items; while the pockets also keep organized thinks such as their sunglasses, toys, etc... Well, I'm kind of wrong there because no matter what I do, they just stick the weirdest stuff wherever they can. But that's kids! And at least with this bag, I can always dump it out, throw it in the washing machine, and start over fresh  :)Back to the pockets, though: they are deep, so that they so hold a good bit. But at the same time, they aren't so deep that you have to dump the whole thing out to see its contents. That's what makes the mesh pockets so great. I also really like that it has space for their sports bottles, because all too often I find them under seats and such from rolling around in my van.I also like that with so many separate pockets, and various sized pockets, each of my two kids can store their phone cords, chargers, dirty socks, or whatever in designated "spots" of their own, and the arguments over whose stuff is whose is eliminated, for the most part at least.But it certainly does make cleanup a lot easier for me, being able to stash things in their proper places when on the road. It's especially suitable for snacks and drinks. That, and when we take trips that require specific items (like sunscreen), they are easily accessible, being within reach when stored in any of the pockets, and like items are kept together. The fact that I can also use it to hold my ipad so that they can watch movies and such, is a great plus.And while my kids aren't little anymore, it still comes in extremely handy with them as pre-teens. In all regards, as an organizer in general, this is really a great product for anyone. It's an essential part of our daily lives, in our vehicle housing our essentials.  On that note- I highly recommend this organization bag, for anyone who might ever have the need to organize anything, which pretty much covers everybody. This organizer does the job quite well!Disclosure: I received a discount to purchase this product, to evaluate and provide my honest and unbiased review. I've been on various prescribed medications for years, and have suffered from a weak immune system equally as long. Plus I'm a smoker. That whole combination has me with chronic fatigue and depression. Only recently, when I read up on body wraps and mud baths, did I realize that I'm in serious need of detoxifying my body.Although I've noticed a subtle difference in the way I feel, with my body being on toxic overload, I don't expect any product to be an instant full body cleanser. But this one is a great start. Especially since I have problems with swelling pills, this one makes it easy to take being in the form of liquid drops.My biggest struggle involves drinking water - which is most likely one of the reasons body body stays fatigued and me, chronically ill. Water is essential for cleansing the body no matter which way you look at it, and this product gives it the boost to expedite the detoxification process in a safe, natural way.But I assume that most people with toxin buildup are in the same position: lacking sufficient water intake. So yes- drinking a full liter of water is hard when you're not used to it; and/or if your like me and drink soda all day long. How can this product work, then, if you don't drink water?First, I believe in baby steps. I began with drinking about 2 cups of water with this product. It's tasteless and doesn't change that your still drinking water. Needless to say, I had to figure out a workaround. And putting it into my Coca-Cola isn't an option.For me, to actually get the full benefit of this product with the appropriate amount of water, I bought an infuser bottle and stocked up on fruit. Now, my water doesn't taste like water and I'm getting all the benefits of fruit while detoxifying with this product. Hint: another fun way to mix it up using an infuser bottle is to use sparking water. It's just like soda!Once I got that all figured out, I'm now consuming the recommended dosage. Which is precisely why I'm beginning to feel better, and getting more active each day. Not once have I experienced any side effects with this product either (i.e. frequent bathroom breaks, etc...)!Lastly, I like that the bottle is small enough that it's travel friendly. I just put it in my purse if I know I'm going to be away from home for lunch and/or dinner. That's the thing I don't like about the detox teas I've tried: I can't really take them along as easy as I can these drops.Overall, I expect this product to perform exactly as described, making it a wonderful, natural way to detoxify your body. By all means: I do recommend it!Disclosure: I received a discount to purchase this product, to evaluate and provide my honest and unbiased review. I hope my observations and experience can help you with making a better buying decision.
