As the household’s resident cook these days, I make use of practically everything I can in the kitchen to get the job done … and – as a man – there’s nothing I appreciate more than a set of sharp knives.  (Pfft: call me old-fashioned!)  I’ll cut, chop, and dice anything until either it’s ready for the stove OR my heart’s content, and that means I always need something ready in the drawer when I’m in the mood to create dinner.This 3-Piece Knife Set from Livin’ Well is pretty spiffy.  You get 3 blades – a paring knife, a Santoku one, and a general purpose one (with a serrated edge) – so you’re really prepared for practically anything you might need to accomplish.  Each comes with its own storing sheath (that way you can keep in the drawer in full confidence you won’t cut yourself when reaching for it), and just exercise an amount of care when taking it out or placing it back in the groove.  Also, there’s a soft grip material built into the handle of the two larger knives which serves to give you a better hold on them when using them in meal preparation.  (The paring knife – for some reason – doesn’t have the same material and is a routing plastic mold.)  Excellent set, especially if you’re just starting out in the kitchen and needing something to get the job done.In the interests of fairness, I’m pleased to disclose that the fine folks at Livin’ Well provided me with sample testing product of their Pure Komachi HD 3pc Knife Set by request for the expressed purposes of completing this review; and their contribution to me in no way, shape, or form influenced my opinion of it.

As I’ve mentioned before, I’m still relatively new to this whole world of oils and aromas.  My wife has been a user of them (pretty religiously) for a few years now, but I honestly put it off thinking it was little more than some ‘quackery’ on those looking to make a quick buck.  I have to say that – for the most part – I’ve been proven wrong as I have found several different products to work quite well in what they’ve been advertised for … and I’ve even found one that helps provide a wonderfully relaxing ‘aura’ to our family room while we enjoy TV in the evening (used in a diffuser).My family has a history of developing mild arthritis in the joints of our hands (mostly), and – within the last few years as I’ve grown older – I’ve noticed more than a bit of the symptoms starting to plague me as well.  The greatest personal downside to this is that I spend a good portion of my day slaving over a hot keyboard, so anything (and I do mean ANYTHING) I can do to alleviate even a small amount of the discomfort actually goes a long way.  I received a bottle of Prime Natural’s Muscle Relief Blend last week, and I’ve been using it (daily) ever since.Immediately upon applying it to the skin, I do feel what I’d call a very mild ‘warming’ sensation, not unlike what one experiences with menthol-type salves or medicated rubs.  After a while (about an hour), the effect seems to dissipate fairly quickly, which usually encourages me to try another application.  To my benefit, I have noticed a mild decrease in pain … and, wow, if I take a quick sniff of the area boy does it open my sinuses!  (A secondary plus!)  I suspect I’ll have to experiment a bit more with the amount I apply in order to see if I can a longer positive effect but for now I’m perfectly happy using it situationally to help ease my ol’ bones through another day on the keys.Recommended.  I’ve only been using this for about a week now, but I’ve found that I honestly achieve a bit of what I’d call ‘short term relief’ from the mild arthritis in my left knuckles with this Muscle Relief Blend.  I’m interested in seeing what the long-term potential could be; though I suspect it won’t be the ultimate cure-all, I’m certainly hoping it’ll continue to help me get through the day when I need a bit of extra help with the pain.In the interests of fairness, I’m pleased to disclose that the fine folks at Prime Natural provided me with sample testing product of their Muscle Relief Blend by request for the expressed purposes of completing this review; and their contribution to me in no way, shape, or form influenced my opinion of it.

Confession time: I’m not a big user of oils of any type.  Now, I don’t mean that to imply that I’ve no experience in reviewing them; rather, it’s just that my list of reasons for using them tends to be fairly limited.  Generally speaking, I only tend to use them seasonally (like so many I get terrible itching and flaking skin on my shins during the chillier seasons of the year) OR whenever my skin may be feeling particularly abrasive as a result of too much time in the sun.  Although my needs may not match most, I’d still argue I’m more than aware of what it is I’m looking for in such a product, and this Olive and Jojoba Body Oil is really close to the thing.As a guy, I’m prone to definitely rub a bit of this onto my legs and forearms during the cooler season, and it definitely helps keep skin in good condition so that it isn’t cracking and/or peeling from the cold.  Also, body oil of this type tends to work some soft wonders on my whiskers; they tend to also get a bit brittle seasonally, and I’ve found I can rub a bit of oil (or even shampoo conditioner) in at bedtime (which washes out in the morning shower); this helps keep the hair vibrant soft (which my wife appreciates!) and also helps the skin underneath.  (Ladies do the same on their heads of hair, from what I’ve been told.)  That’s the kind of trick I wish someone had shared with me earlier in my life, and I could’ve benefitted more from it.  However, don’t apply too much as it can do a number on your pores (at least, that’s my experience).The only drawback so far as I’m concerned is that this does leave a very mild fragrance on my person.  I’m never a big fan of that; I prefer to be more of an odor-neutral guy, if there is such a thing.  I don’t mind a little bit of a clean odor, and thankfully this one does stop well short of seeming like a perfume.  Again, this could be because my nose tends to be fairly sensitive to certain smells.In the interests of fairness, I’m pleased to disclose that the fine folks at Luseta Beauty provided me with sample testing product of their Olive and Jojoba Body Oil by request for the expressed purposes of completing this review; and their contribution to me in no way, shape, or form influenced my opinion of it.

True story: I actually have had and used a competitor’s version of this sort of backseat covering for several years, but now I’ll be throwing that one out and making use of this one instead.  Why?  That’s because the BarksBar version is superior in that it affixes both to the back seats AND the front seats.  The version I’ve used before didn’t connect to the front, and difficulty that has also posed is my little guy loves to prop himself up on the middle console between the seats, making it occasionally difficult for me to safely drive the car (he’s always ‘nosing’ me for attention).Otherwise, the basic trick to operating this seat cover safely is to essentially make certain you clearly get it affixed both front and back so that it isn’t sliding down, creating something for the knuckleheaded beast to either play with OR decide he can slip around.  I’ve done that before, and it gets really inconvenient when you have to pull over and make adjustments.Also, the big plus with this version (as compared to the other I’ve used) is that it feels a bit more heavyweight; stains wipe up very easily but it isn’t so heavy that I’d be fearful of pitching it into the washing machine from time-to-time in order to really get it clean.  Some of these tend to feel more ‘foamy’ that actual material, but that’s not the case here: excellent quality construction makes this a superior choice for those of us who do travel with our canine children in tow.Also – because this is more durable material than I’ve seen used in the past – I’ll be far more inclined to keep this thing IN my vehicle for the duration as opposed to taking it out, folding it up, and storing it away.  Instead, I’ll probably unhook the back seat straps and allow this to simply drape on the floor (in the back) where it’ll be ready for me to install for that quick trip to either the pet store or the bark park.  Kudos on making it durable!Highly recommended.In the interests of fairness, I’m pleased to disclose that the fine folks at BarksBar provided me with sample testing product of their Pet Car Seat Cover by request for the expressed purposes of completing this review; and their contribution to me in no way, shape, or form influenced my opinion of it.

Every now and then, I (as a reviewer) am offered a product that doesn’t fit with my particular life needs but can definitely be of use in my household; and such was the case with this Luseta Argan Oil Hair Mask.  In short, I don’t have nearly enough hair on my head to make use of it, but my wife definitely does: she agreed to give this a go and share her results with me so that I could provide some feedback.She maintains what I’d christen as a pretty full head of hair.  As a business professional, she’s in front of people all day long, so it’s important that she provide a solid impression.  She’s used this mask twice now, and she’s only had good things to say about it.  As hair products go, she tends to prefer ones that don’t offer any overpowering odor (she tends to find that annoying and/or distracting); while Luseta’s definitely is noticeable, she found it relatively light by comparison to other products she’s used in the past.  I noticed that it does have a floral scent, but I agree with her: it isn’t ‘bold’ in the way many over-the-counter shampoos, conditioners, and the like can be.  In many ways, I’d liken it to an after-effect – light and airy – with just a hint of fruit.But she insists the effect on her hair is definitely pronounced.  She insists that there’s a mild tingling sensation with the application.  After leaving in for a few minutes, she’s surprised how easily it washes out, and afterward she says that her hair feels very soft and silky to the touch.  I’ve checked it out in the evenings, and it definitely retains what I’d call a ‘fresh look,’ though I’m not sure how that directly translates to other folks’ experience with it.Also, she’s told me that she finds her hair easier to style for a few days with those effects pretty much wearing off my week’s end.  As this is a once-a-week application, she’s definitely ready for next Monday to come quicker than it does.In the interests of fairness, I’m pleased to disclose that the fine folks at Komar Beauty provided me with sample testing product of their Luseta Argan Oil Deep Repair & Moisture Hair Mask 8.5oz by request for the expressed purposes of completing this review; and their contribution to me in no way, shape, or form influenced my opinion of it.

I have a houseful of animals.  At present, we’re blessed to have one dog and nine (you read that right) cats.  Like many houses with that many little monsters, we didn’t start out that way intending to have as much as we do, but it is what it is.  And – as pet lovers – we’ve made several small investments over the years in beds, blankets, and whatnot to give the creatures more than a fair share of comforts, so we’re proud to consider them our experts when it comes to what works and what doesn’t for their needs.The Blueberry Pet Bed honestly wasn’t of much interest to our sole pooch.  He tried it – stepped around on it a few times, mostly, before lying down in it – but we could tell right away it just wasn’t for him.  Now that doesn’t mean that your canine won’t like it: ours has always been a bit dismissive of mats and mattresses, and he tends to prefer to hop up on the couch and snuggle with us when we’re in the family room during the evening hours.  At best, he’ll begrudgingly stretch out on an area rug from time-to-time.As for our cats?  They’re totally in love with it.In particular, our oldest (Ashley) will practically not abandon it except for meal times.  Since I took it out of the box and plastic, she’s pretty much parked herself in it daily for good measure, allowing the others to check it out only briefly before once again assuming the roost as the oldest cats are wont to do.  She’s always loved baskets, and I suspect this particular bed captures some of the same aura as the high, plush walls do surround her as she’s curled up in there wasting away the day.  Two of our youngest cats have ventured into the bed when it’s been available, and both enjoyed it briefly but they were more inclined to drape themselves over those subtle walls with their hindquarters resting within.It’s definitely a well-made bed.  There’s obviously just the right amount of cushion for Ashley, and I suspect you’ll probably have a like-minded feline in your house who’ll be smitten with this as she has been.  Recommended.In the interests of fairness, I’m pleased to disclose that the fine folks at Blueberry Pet provided me with sample testing product of their Blueberry Pet Bed (Brilliant Blue & Champagne Beige) by request for the expressed purposes of completing this review; and their contribution to me in no way, shape, or form influenced my opinion of it.

In all seriousness, I love a good psychological thriller as much as the next viewer.  Tales of borderline dementia or the pursuits of those potentially suffering one can be an excellent way to vicariously experience events from a somewhat jaundiced perspective, but – if I’m also being perfectly honest – it can be a fine line between legitimately exploring some psychosis AND distinguishing between a director, a screenwriter, and a cast’s cinematic trickery.  More often than not, visual storytellers take the easy way out, opting for chills instead of bold originality.In short, methinks that’s exactly what plagues AMNESIAC.  At no time did it seem all that original.  At no time did it feel all that compelling.  Instead, the film delivers up easy pickings with little more than a clever twist here or there … but not one intelligent enough in its big finish to make you believe it’s worth a second thought (or viewing).(NOTE: The following review will contain minor spoilers necessary solely for the discussion of plot and/or characters.  If you’re the type of reader who prefers a review entirely spoiler-free, then I’d encourage you to skip down to the last three paragraphs for my final assessment.  If, however, you’re accepting of a few modest hints at ‘things to come,’ then read on …)From the product packaging: “Kate Bosworth and Wes Bentley star in this twisted psycho-thriller about a man who wakes up in bed after an accident, suffering from memory loss.  He begins to suspect his wife isn’t really his real wife and soon finds himself a prisoner in the house.”There used to be an old canard about promoting a flick that went something like this: “If all you can boast about are your big name actors, then you’ve really nothing to boast about at all.”  See, the dirty little secret of filmmaking is that there’s so often not enough originality in it, which is why after DIE HARD studios starting searching for ‘Die Hard On A Train’ and ‘Die Hard On A Train’ and so on.  The same affliction strikes casting-types when another trending-setting feature film – say 1990’s MISERY – kinda/sorta stumbled through James Caan’s acting prowess; you could almost hear them say, “How much better would this have been had it headlined Jeff Bridges?”Essentially, that’s much of the impression left from AMNESIAC: you end up with a man (Bentley) being trapped, tortured, and tormented by a curiously low-key Bosworth (constantly attired like a MAD MEN castaway), and no doubt everyone involved predicted they were somehow chasing cinema gold.  Don’t get me wrong: the story isn’t exactly the same, and what transpires certainly involves a few more twists and turns … but the film lacks a freshness – much like Bentley’s flawed memories – that this story just can’t quite overcome.The script by Mike Le and Amy Kolquist never quite tells you where these people come from, or perhaps it’s more apropos to say it never tells you enough to care about them or the plight they suffer.  Instead, director Michael Polish left out any polish that would allow anyone to rise to the level of “interesting,” and you’ll likely ask more questions about this, that, and the other when everyone involved thought you’d be captivated.AMNESIAC (2015) is produced by XLRator Media, Infra-Red Pictures, and Jeff Rice Films.  DVD distribution is being handled via the reliable XLRator Media.  As for the technical specifications?  Meh.  At times, AMNESIAC uses some interesting cinematography to transport the audiences into this otherworldly environment (director Michael Polish seems to have wanted to pull signature elements from out of time so as to keep everyone guessing what’s up), but it isn’t as effective a device as I’ve seen used in other films; also, Bosworth and Bentley spend far too much time speaking in hushed tones to always be perfectly audible.  Lastly, if you’re looking for special features?  Well, I hope you find a theatrical trailer ‘special.’  (Note: no closed captioning OR English-assisted subtitles that I could find.)(MILDLY) RECOMMENDED.  AMNESIAC feels more like the bloated episode of an old TV anthology series than it does an original motion picture that can stand on its own two legs.  Still, it wasn’t a bad way to spend less-than-ninety minutes, but – in the end – it raised more questions (via plot holes and circular logic) than it ever answered … and don’t audiences deserve smarter thrillers than this these days?In the interests of fairness, I’m pleased to disclose that the fine folks at XLRator Media provided me with a copy of AMNESIAC by request for the expressed purposes of completing this review; and their contribution to me in no way, shape, or form influenced my opinion of it.

The American Southwest can be brutal on Smart Devices.  Oh, I’m not just talking about the sun and the heat (and, yes, it’s a dry heat); rather I’m talking about the fact that in certain pockets of our rugged terrain cell towers can be few and far between.  For that very reason, many of us in this ‘other land down under’ have to make regular use of batteries and car chargers in order to have enough juice to get a job done right, and that’s precisely why it’s easy to give these a solid thumbs up.HAWEEL’s latest version is a two-port 3.4 Amp charger, the kind that convenient hooks into your automobile’s cigarette lighter or similar power port.  The face is conveniently marked with which slot the manufacturer intended to be used for Smart phones and iPads or tablets.  (A reasonable plus, but nothing all that special.)  And this particular model is outfitted with an adjustable swing that allows you to point the charger in a specific direction, a tremendous advantage over competitors’ models that simply go straight and occasionally don’t give you enough space to easily plug a cable into the port as some auto interiors have taken to placing this lighter in really obscure locations.However, what may appeal to those of us in the Southwest in particular is the fact that this charger is equipped with an LED screen that shows the car’s battery voltage.  There’s even an alarm built into the device that sounds if the voltage falls or rises out of the optimum range.  This can be a huge advantage over other models as you do NOT want to find yourself stranded out in the boondocks in the middle of that ‘dry heat’ with not enough power in your battery to get back home.  That, my friends, is perhaps the best selling point to this version.Highly recommended.  Seriously, you probably won’t find a bigger fan of secondary power sources than me on the World Wide Web these days, and that’s largely because I’m unfortunately shackled to a low-cost cellular/wireless provider whose coverage in my living area leads a lot to be desired; consequently, I’m almost daily forced to make use of such products as external batteries and these USB car chargers in order to get enough juice to do my job.  This dual model from HAWEEL is very solid; it may offer more bells and whistles than some folks need, but my honest reaction is always, “I’d rather have MORE than not enough.”  Kudos!In the interests of fairness, I’m pleased to disclose that the fine folks at HAWEEL provided me with sample testing product of their Led Dual USB Car Charger by request for the expressed purposes of completing this review; and their contribution to me in no way, shape, or form influenced my opinion of it.

As I’ve mentioned many times, I don’t travel as much for business as I used to.  Nowadays, I’m fortunate enough to have to get around more for personal and/or family occasions.  But when I do travel, I’ve always preferred making the best use of the kind of satchels and bags that give me more than a single option AND provide protection to my belongings; I’ve had more than my fair share of knicks, dings, and bangs that anyone should have to experience in a single lifetime, so I tend to shield my PC and SmartDevices with better-than-average protection against damage from others, not so much my own clumsiness.Ecosusi’s Laptop Bag is exactly the kind of pack I’m talking about.  For starters, it’s constructed out of a relatively lightweight polyester ‘canvas’ style material which means that it generally resists stains and scuffing but also cleans up easily if marked.  Essentially, it’s built to resemble the standard run-of-the-mill black briefcase (the traditional office worker ‘look’), but it’s also smartly adapted to go on your back as a rear zippered compartment conceals lightly padded back-straps should you with to make use of them.  (Big plus: when you’re not making use, then you can still use that space to store items such as magazines, books, etc. as the compartment does offer modest protection.)  Want another option?  It even comes with the basic shoulder sling so that you can carry it ‘purse-style’ should you choose.There are two interior areas, both with a good amount of padding to protect ones delicate electronics.  The PC pouch measures 16 inches long, and there’s even an additional Velcro sleeve to hold your laptop in place once secured within; and the other pouch offers a variety of smaller areas to secure practically anything else you’d want to take with.  The front exterior includes one open sleeve (shaped about the size of those oversized paperbacks as well as two zippered ones perfect for items such as cell phones, wallets, passports, etc.Really, this is a terrific travel bag.  Even if you don’t have a PC and you want to take a large tablet or the like, it’s exceptional.Highly recommended.  While some may think Ecosusi’s 3-Ways Travel Laptop Bag might not be the ‘best first impression’ to make around the office, I’d argue that it’s definitely what casual and business travels could use when toting a PC with when on-the-road for business or pleasure.  It has an ample assortment of pockets with which to help you keep organized; it has the added flexibility of being carried by hand or over the shoulders; and it’s constructed in such a way as to insure one’s prized possession isn’t being ‘roughed up’ while on-the-go.  Excellent addition to my assortment of options when jetting about the country.In the interests of fairness, I’m pleased to disclose that the fine folks at Ecosusi provided me with sample testing product of their 3 Ways Travel Laptop Bag/ Business Briefcase (Black) by request for the expressed purposes of completing this review; and their contribution to me in no way, shape, or form influenced my opinion of it.

True dat: I’ve been listening to music for well over four decades.  Having even worked in amateur radio for a short time, I’ve always been a big fan of mainstream music, and I swear by proven technology every chance I get.  These cable headphones from SoundPEATS are exactly the kind of thing I love; they produce a wonderfully sharp listening experience, and the fact that this particular version is outfitted with a modest noise-cancelling technology only makes it easier to give them my ringing endorsement.Because this is the modern era when some users want to enjoy their tracks as well as use their Smart Phone in conjunction with making and receiving telephone calls, the manufacturer has outfitted these with a small microphone built into a small ‘nub’ that hangs fairly close to where your mouth is.  I rarely (if ever) make use of such tech, but it’s nice to know the option is available to me should I require it.Highly recommended.  Over the past several months, I’ve had the good fortune to test and review several different incarnations of sound devices from SoundPEATS, and I’ve quickly become one of their biggest fans on Amazon.  I realize that in some respects this technology might seem a bit ‘outdated’ to some of you, but why mess with the classics?  These M-10 earphones are terrific for my needs, and I give ‘em an easy thumbs up.In the interests of fairness, I’m pleased to disclose that the fine folks at SoundPEATS provided me with sample testing product of their M-10 Stereo Metal Earphones by request for the expressed purposes of completing this review; and their contribution to me in no way, shape, or form influenced my opinion of it.

These days, there are a handful of products I swear by, and one of the greatest are external battery packs.  As I’ve relayed several times, I live and commute throughout the American Southwest, sometimes in territories where cell towers can be few and far between and my phone tends to burn through power as it roams for signal.  Consequently, I rarely go anywhere without a handful of chargers and batteries in tow, and I’ve had very good luck with several different brands.  Aukey’s is one of them.The battery is relatively thin but still puts out a great charge when I’m in need, and the fact that this model is equipped with twin USB ports – meaning I can get juice to not only my Smart Phone but a second device as well – is a huge plus.  Granted, I don’t use it as much as I might a car charger, but having a backup power source is essential: Aukey’s 12000mAh has proven to be fast and reliable up to this point, so it’s pretty easy to give this handle little device a thumbs up.In the interests of fairness, I’m pleased to disclose that the fine folks at Aukey provided me with sample testing product of their 12000mAh Portable Power Bank Charger External Battery Pack by request for the expressed purposes of completing this review; and their contribution to me in no way, shape, or form influenced my opinion of it.

A few years back, I developed some issues with my knee, and doctors eventually discovered that I had a relatively minor tear in my meniscus.  Anyway who’s suffered such an injury can probably assure you that even a minor tear can bring with it some pretty major discomfort, so eventually it was something that had to be mended by surgery.  Recovery was a bit slow, but one of the things the surgeon assured me is that my knee would never be in the shape it was before the tear, though there wouldn’t be that much cause to ‘change’ my lifestyle to something less mobile.In any event, what I’ve learned is that – from time to time – the knee still needs a bit of ‘babying’ in order to get through things like extended hiking and the sort, and I’ve had to try a variety of products to carry me through some of the newfound aches and pain, and support sleeves like this one from FireFit are terrific for that very reason.  They certainly help reduce fatigue, and they can even help to reduce some of the modest swelling that tends to follow some of my more extreme hiking excursions.  FireFit’s is a bit thicker than what I’m used to wearing (in fact, I found it a bit difficult to have on under clothing, though it’s definitely possible), but it’s certainly soft and supportive in the way I’ve grown accustomed.Now, even though I’m not a medical expert of any estimation, I can say that my experiences have made me aware of what works best for my tired knees; in that respect I think this is definitely a good sleeve best used in conjunction with other ongoing care programs.  While I’ll admit it’s not the favorite of ones I’ve used, I can say that it works very well as intended.  Overall, sleeves used in concert with oils and salves that help reduce pain are great tools for those of us who need them; this one’s just a bit bulky compared to what I prefer.Highly recommended.In the interests of fairness, I’m pleased to disclose that the fine folks at FireFit provided me with sample testing product of their Knee Support Sleeve by request for the expressed purposes of completing this review; and their contribution to me in no way, shape, or form influenced my opinion of it.

Back in the days of my wild youth, you had to have a cabled set of earphones in order to enjoy music privately, so maybe there’s a little something that’s somehow written into my DNA which makes me believe tunes sound better via your grandfather’s technology.  Still, when I’ve had folks over and had them compare, they all tend to think the sound is a bit purer as well, so maybe it’s not just me after all.In any event, today I’m listening to what’s up and coming on my iPhone (4) compliments of this set of earphones from MAXROCK, and I’m totally digging them.  The ear pieces fit into my ear canal very nice, and they use that usually noise-cancelling tech which blocks out the greater world outside so that all I have is the music and me.  Fantastic.Also – for those of you who can’t go five minutes without receiving or making a telephone call – MAXROCK has provided the tech, as well: there’s a handle little contraption built into one of the cords leading up to the bud that allows you to stop the music and make a call on your SmartPhone.  I rarely (if ever) use those little gadgets, but I did give it a go for the purposes of testing this item, and it worked just fine.  (But I’ll probably never use it again.)Highest recommendation possible.  I’m a huge fan of the old school, so you’ll always find me using a tried-and-true set of earbuds with the cable before I resort to my Bluetooth ones.  It isn’t that I dislike the wireless stuff; it’s more likely a psychological thing – that I think the music sounds better via the cables – and I’ll stand by that ‘til I’m finished.In the interests of fairness, I’m pleased to disclose that the fine folks at MAXROCK provided me with sample testing product of their Slim Flat Cable 3.5mm Metal Headphones with Mic and Remote Control by request for the expressed purposes of completing this review; and their contribution to me in no way, shape, or form influenced my opinion of it.

It's so nice to find an Avengers item with the full team! Not only am I ecstatic that it features Black Widow, who is rarely on anything, but also Hawkeye!  Though this is an Age of Ultron lunch bag, it doesn't feature any of the new characters.The bag itself is very nice, with a long strap that can go over a child's or adult's shoulder (I'm 39 and I regret nothing).  The bag is soft, brightly colored and of good quality.  Yes, it costs more than a similar item in Wal Mart or Target - but I prefer not braving crowds and having it delivered to my door. That is worth a premium.  Overall, I am very pleased with the purchase. Highly recommended for any Marvel or Avengers fan.

I had high hopes for Original Sin, especially after the non-event collection of issues that was Inhumanity.  And while it was definitely a better, more cohesive story, it didn't live up to the hype. Mainly because the "wow" stuff doesn't happen here.The main plot of Original Sin is a murder mystery to determine who robbed and killed Uatu, The Watcher.  All the excitement of Captain America learning what the Illuminati did to him, of Iron Man maybe being connected to Bruce Banner's accident, etc. - none of that is explored here.  When Cap learns of the death, he takes Nick Fury and few others to the moon to investigate.  Nick subsequently sends a few different groups tracking down leads, including who took the Watcher's eyes and much of his arsenal.  I actually liked the story a lot. It gives a deeper look into Fury's life, with some unexpected revelations. And, when one of the Watcher's eyes goes off like a bomb, people suddenly learn secrets, and not always about themselves.  However, as a Marvel event, it's not that impressive (like Civil War, even without tie-ins that was EPIC!)  To truly get to the consequences, readers will have to go to the individual series (or the Original Sin Companion, as I intend to).In addition to Original Sin #0-8, this collection also includes "Original Sins #1-5." I found these to be mostly a waste of time, with a couple stand outs.  The artwork is generally poor, and in a couple instances downright hideous.  Included are:1) "Hidden in Plain Sight" a Young Avengers story about a confrontation with Red Hood. Boring.2) "Terminus" a Deathlok story about him killing some poor sap who knows who he is thanks to the eyeball explosion. Over quick, and forgotten as quickly.3) "Buried Memory" about Black Bolt's dog searching for a lost dog bone. I KID YOU NOT.4)"Black Knight in Black Legacy" about a writer who learns Black Knight isn't immune to the curse after all. This was almost enough to interest me in the character. Almost.5) "Before Your Eyes" two pages of Howard the Duck. Meh.6) "Whispers of War" This story was actually worth the read. Lineage has the souls of his ancestors inside him, ready to tell him secrets. A new arrival has some interesting news about Black Bolt.  I foresee consequences for this story.7) "Bury the Lead" J Jonah Jameson once wrote a positive story about Spidey. Another quickie over in 2 pages.8) "Checkmate" was the best story of the lot BY FAR and made the inclusion of the entire Original Sins worth it.  Some nobody has learned a secret about Doctor Doom. And he's foolish enough to consider blackmailing the villain.  Perfection in every way: the art, the writing, the ending.9) "Catharsis" Marvel should have to refund me some money for these two pages.  Any artist who manages to make Captain America look like Pete the villain from a Mickey Mouse cartoon should find a new line of work.10) "How the World Works" was the second best story of this lot. Dum Dum Dugan confronts Fury about his extreme methods, with a very sad outcome.11) "The No-Sin Situation" is two pages of various characters revealing ridiculous secrets (e.g. She Hulk never passed the bar, etc.) Filler.12) "Original Sin: Secret Avengers" was a fun, if useless, little adventure for Agents Fury and Coulson. I love Phil Coulson, so this worked for me. It was inconsequential, but entertaining.Overall, this collection is definitely worth reading. Plus, I recommend the beautiful, high quality hardcover edition. I just hope the OS Companion delivers on the hype. I wanna see what sins the main Avengers are hiding!

I've had great experiences with the Amazon Collection of jewelry; I've purchased many of their created sapphire and ruby pieces and been very pleased.  The stones has gorgeous color and the silver is great quality.  When this bracelet popped up on Vine I decided to request it. I've been wary of simulated opals because they can be iffy.  This piece was a nice surprise.The bracelet has a good weight to it and the rhodium plating on sterling has a brilliant shine.  The opals are nice. Though to me they obviously look created (when compared to real opals I've seen in jewelry stores), they're still very pretty.  Overall, if you're looking for created opals that are indiscernible from real ones, this probably won't satisfy.  However, if you just want a beautiful bracelet, this one certainly qualifies. For the price, this bracelet is an excellent value.

During the Infinity event, Black Bolt released the Terrigen Mists worldwide in order to protect Thanos’ part-Inhuman son from being identified and killed.  As a result, people all over are emerging from cocoons as newly-powered Inhumans. I was eager to get to this event after reading Infinity to see how such a global “crisis” unfolds and impacts the Marvel Universe.After finishing Inhumanity, it’s apparent that this isn’t really an event at all (in the usual Marvel sense). This is more like one of those aftermath or companion collections – there is no “core” story.  This is a collection of stories, across various Marvel titles, about people emerging from the cocoons, factions fighting over what to do with the cocoons, or Avengers responding to emergencies arising from the Terrigenesis.  Some of the issues are also included in the Infinity Companion.The individual stories were interesting, with a lot of action and some really cool new powers, but I was a little disappointed that there isn’t much done with Medusa and the “original” Inhumans.  Queen Medusa is now ruling the Inhumans (Black Bolt is MIA) and she shows up here and there among the stories to collect her new “subjects”. But, readers don’t get much more than that. Did the Inhumans just accept Medusa’s rule without question? Where are they headquartered now that Attilan has crashed into the Hudson? These and a lot of other questions are never addressed.Overall, this collection is definitely worth buying for some fun stories (I loved Spider-Girl’s section) and, of course, the artwork. The hardcover is a great value, and it was very satisfying to see the consequences of the Infinity event.  I just wish it had delved into Medusa and her crew more. Highly recommended.

I love the look of these sandals, which is why I took a chance ordering them online without trying them on. They run very small. I usually wear a size seven, however, these were so tight in width and length I think I would need to go up a full size for them to be wearable. Also, the leather has no give at all. So if you prefer wide width shoes, do not buy these even at a larger size.Bottom line, they're going back. I don't want to take a chance on trying an 8 as going up a size from your usual can present new problems. Fortunately, Amazon has an excellent return policy.

When I first put these on, I thought they were great. Though they are a bit narrow, the straps adjusted enough to compensate.  However, it only took a few steps for me to realize something was wrong.  The up curve of the arch is too far back, rather than close to the center.  So the show was forcing some of my heel up. It was like having a small round rock under my foot in the shoe. It does not curve naturally with the foot.Though these are really cute, I highly recommend trying them on in a store before buying online (as I should have). Sadly, they're going back. Fortunately, Amazon has an excellent return policy.

I wanted a rose gold watch to go with some of my jewelry that is neither gold nor silver.  And at first, I was delighted with this watch. It is beautiful and elegant; a lustrous rose gold color and the face is clear and easy to read.  However, a week after I got it I went on vacation to New Orleans. It's hot and muggy in New Orleans and I soon discovered that the finish wears off with even a little sweat. As soon as I noticed the links discoloring, I stopped wearing it.I know it's not real gold, but I expected it to last more than a week before it started losing color.  I got this watch on a lightning deal for $30, so overall, I'll keep it for special occasions, or wearing it in the winter. However, if I had paid the $60 it's is currently listed at, I'd be very upset. Not recommended at the current price.

I have encountered Black Bolt across several stories due to his role in the Illuminati, but had never read the Inhumans before. With the announcement of a film, and the recent Inhumanity event, I decided to move this to the top of my reading pile. It started off very strong, lost a lot of steam in the middle, and ended with a solid finish.Though this is a good introduction to the Inhumans, it is not strictly an origin story. When the story opens, Black Bolt and Medusa are King and Queen and have been for some time.  New readers are given entry to the world by a group of teens who are about to undergo Terrigenesis, whereby they transform into super-powered beings.  We also meet Black Bolt's insane brother, who is currently plotting his escape and the conquering of Attilan. He orchestrates humans into attacking Attilan and Black Bolt categorically refuses to respond with aggression; his inner circle begins to question his lack of action.Black Bolt is unable to speak, as his merest whisper can level a mountain, so aside from some dialog between secondary characters, the story unfolds mostly via exposition in dialog boxes.  Very often, the exposition asks a question like "Imagine you were given one chance to speak. What would you say?" At first this was fine, but it quickly grew tiresome.  The middle of the book became so bogged down by telling and not showing that I actually set the book aside for a couple weeks before going back to it. Once I got to the point where Black Bolt's plan unfolds, the book picked up speed again and finished with a satisfying conclusion.Overall, this was a solid story with some intriguing themes.  Attilan congratulates itself for its diversity, but the people are prejudiced against one another regardless. Some gifts are more highly desired than others, such as flight, and a class system is based upon this.  It's a good introduction to the characters, I just wish it hadn't relied so heavily on exposition. Recommended.

I usually buy ZipLock brand, but honestly it's just out of habit; and Ziplock is available under Amazon's Subscribe and Save. When these popped up under Vine, I decided to try them.Bottom line, I didn't find them to be any better or worse than Ziplock.  But just like Ziplock, they ARE better than store brands tend to be (more durable plastic).  So, I'd only recommend them (and will only buy them) when the price is comparable to Ziplock.

I've tried a few of the Fiber One and Special K bars/snacks that are at or just around 100 calories.  These brownies are very good, but are also quite small, even compared to other such products. One just wasn't satisfying, even as a snack (two bites and it's gone!).  However, I found they are a lot more satisfying with a half a cup, or even whole cup, of skim milk. Or as a side for a Greek yogurt at breakfast.Overall, these taste great and if you are a chocolate fan trying to watch what you eat, these are a great alternative to candy. As a a snack to keep you going between meals, these aren't my first choice (the Special K Chocolate Peanut Butter protein bars are) but I do recommend them.

0:49 Mins This Remote Control Robot is so fun to play with. My husband, son, and I have been playing with it regularly. It is so cool how it says "greetings master." Its control allows you to make the robot move, shoot discs, and lift its gun. It lets you know it is going to fire at you, and then lifts up the gun which has a red light that glows. We moved into this house last year and I scrubbed it clean. The only places that never came clean no matter what I used was the bathroom and some of the carpet. I was really hoping that this would help me with the mold problem in the corner of the shower. I have bleached it, scrubbed it hard, and now tried this steamer, nothing works! We will be stripping the entire molding since the hot steam didn't work but I was a little disappointed since the description said it removed mold. That being said it did do a good job on the carpet I couldn't get clean. They had kids that left gum in a couple places and I was able to get most of it out.This steamer is pretty easy to use you just fill it up, put your attachment on, plug it in, and wait. The wait time for the steam to heat was 2 minutes for me. It might depend on how hot the water is when you put it in. The cord is very long, 9.5 feet. I was able to reach all around my bathroom with it and into the hall way. The steam was steady for about 10 minutes then started to lessen a bit. At the 20 minute mark it needed a refill. It was honestly just as much work to use this in the bathroom as it was just to hand scrub it down. I would not buy this to clean mold at all or really target a shower. If you are looking to use this for carpet or furniture it seems to work much better. Also it does really well on mirrors and windows. Make sure you don't apply the hot steam to a cold window!Included in this package is:- Extended connecting spray nozzle- This helps so much with me being short. I can reach without straining.- Long spray nozzle- This reached well behind the toilet. I have a small space to work with and this helped.- General spray nozzle- I used this to clean the walls of the shower. It works fairly well to steam them up and then I wiped them clean.- Spray nozzle for doors and windows- I really loved this attachment it does work fabulous on windows.- Round brush- This bends very easily and doesn't hold up well.- Bent nozzle- I like how this targets the steam into one place.- Brush plate and a microfiber towel- couch, floor!Overall it isn't bad for the price. Again, I would not buy it to clean mold or solely for the shower. It works well on windows and fabric. I was sent this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

0:37 MinsI am really loving this Kinga Nano Ionic Facial Steamer. It is like having a spa treatment at home. I have been having horrible issues with the skin on my face. No matter what I do it always looks dry and is flaky. Between stress and the weather changing I felt completely hopeless. I have used this three times now and it has made my skin look great. It is kind of like having a mini sauna for your face right at home. I have never been to a spa and have never used anything quite like this. Instead of using my normal chemicals I tried this for a week and WOW. I can't believe how smooth, healthy, and filled in my skin looks. I make sure to moisturize my lips and face after using this steamer to prevent dryness.It is very easy to use and you can get started minutes after opening it. You need to make sure you are using it on a flat surface. Take out the water compartment and fill it up. I used a purified bottle water as it suggested not to use tap. I put the cap on tight and put it back in. I then plugged the steamer in, turned it on, and waited for it to steam. I don't even think it took a minute for the steam to start rolling out. I stayed about 6-8 inches away from the steam because it was super hot. At first it made me cough a bit because I was not used to it. I think breathing in through your nose and out of your mouth works best. My face begin to produce sweat and just melted all the bad away. I stayed in front of the steamer for 5-7 minutes. I patted my face dry and then applied my moisturizer. It is as easy as that. Your skin will thank you for it. I was sent this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Whelp let me start off by saying this kennel was purchased with the intent of housing my miniture potbelly pig, yes, I said potbelly pig. He has learned how to escape from absolutely everything that I have ever put him in from day one, and he is now about 9 months old and weighs close to 70lbs. This kennel by PetSafe was extremely simple for me to assemble by myself in about an hour or less, however I do have some suggestions for anyone thinking of purchasing this item:1. Have someone handy when you are putting on the fencing "fabric" it is a pain in the butt to unroll a bunch of fencing while securing it at the same time because the moment you let go of the fencing roll it gets tangled in itself.2. Make sure all poles are completely vertical and square before installing the door otherwise it will drag and get caught on the bottom pole.3. Skip the tie wires all together and invest in a huge stack of *ZIP TIES* I swear zip ties are the only thing that made this cage even workable for my needs. Read why below:I used the included tie wires and they are a major pain in the butt as well because it's not easy to get them to stay securely on the bar or the fencing. My pig would nudge his way right through the fencing fabric and be roaming around freely. Actually the very first time that I put him in this cage BEFORE I could even latch the hinge on the door he nudged through the fence and was out the other side, literally, within about 2.5 seconds! I was so mad I thought I was going to have to dissassemble the whole cage and have to return it but that night before bed the true savior came to me...ZIP TIES and I swear they work wonders!I bought a huge stack of zip ties and tied the fencing fabric to the bottom pole probably about 2-3 inches apart on the bottom, and I even used a few to anchor the fencing to the vertical poles and some to anchor the fencing to the top poles and since then my pig hasn't been able to escape the cage at all! I am beyond happy because like I said above he has escaped from everything I put him in previously.I am still only giving this cage 3 stars because the cage itself and the contents that came with it completely didn't serve my needs whatsoever because my pig escaped within 2.5 seconds, but with adding the zip ties it made the cage fort knox as far as I am concerned.If you purchase this cage, or even if you have purchased it in the past just plan on getting some Zip Ties and I can guarantee you this cage will serve any needs you may have!

I have been searching high and low for a reasonably priced safe to store my items in and this one has met all of my expectations. This Ivation Electronic Biometric Safe is not only sturdy, it's very responsive and secure as well.One of the things I love most about this safe is, obviously, the security! I have tried other so called Biometric (finger print reading) safes and they all have failed because they just sensed the warmth of a finger and opened, even when it wasn't supposed to. This Ivation safe is secure in the fact that it ONLY opens when it scans one of the fingerprints that were stored in the device. This safe can store up to 32 different fingerprints! I tested the security of this feature by registering all of the fingerprints on my right hand, but then trying to access the safe using my left hand, it wouldn't open! I absolutely love that. It also has a keypad for you to store a key code if preferred, and it even comes with fail safe keys for you to use in case the battery dies, or just for quick access.The safe also features two adjustable shelves with padding that protects your items inside. The safe is made of very heavy metals and none of the hinges are visible on the outside, so it is pry-resistant.I really enjoy the added security that this safe offers, and I believe it would be a good asset in any home, it's amazing what you find you may want to put inside a safe when you have one, I've even started keeping my social security card in there just for safe keeping! I received this product for free in exchange for my unbiased review.

One of my most favorite things in life is chewable ice, I know it's terrible for your teeth but somehow I just can't help but love it. Well this Ivation Portable High Capacity Ice Maker w/LCD Display - 2.8-Liter Water Reservoir, 3 Selectable Cube Sizes - Yield of up to 26.5 Pounds of Ice Daily produces the most perfectly chewable ice and I couldn't be happier!This portable Ice Maker is crazy simple to use, I simply plugged it in added water to the reservoir and selected the ice size. Within 10 minutes it was producing medium sized ice. This was completely astonishing to me because my package had been sitting on my hot porch all day, but that didn't bother this ice maker one bit! There is a backlit LCD display that allows you to set the time, choose your ice size, and even set an auto produce allowing your ice machine to make ice during the hours that you select. You can easily choose between small, medium, and large ice cube sizes.There is a water reservoir with a max fill line, all you do is fill water up to that line and turn the machine on and it's good to go. No hooking it up to the water line in your home making it perfectly portable or great for a household with no ice machine! There is a "catch basket" that will catch your ice once it's made. Personally I like to use my ice directly from the catch basket because I find that if I take the ice and store it in my own freezer, my freezer makes the ice really hard and not so "chewable" as I love, a random and unimportant fact I'm sure. Another fact is that you will need to remove or use the ice in a somewhat timely fashion. If you don't the ice in the basket will re-melt and drain into the water reservoir and be recycled, also it needs to be emptied so that it can actually produce it's maximum of 26.5lbs a day.This machine has been so much fun for me to have around the house and I can't even think of a reason you shouldn't own it also. **UPDATE** Took my dog to the vet today because I thought he had an ear infection, turn out he has a GIANT sore on his neck from this collar malfunctioning and shocking him. If you read my original review below you will notice that I NEVER use the shock or even the vibrate function at all on my dog to begin with, I only used the beep function and still this collar was apparently shocking my poor dog without my knowledge for the course of three days.  I had one of the collars on him for about a week with no issues, changed the collar when the first one needed to be charged. I changed the collar to the second one 3 days ago and in the course of 3 days this collar has made a gaping hole in my dogs neck and he lost all of his fur around the collar. He is still at the vet being treated. Please do not do this to your animal. I feel like the most horrible person in the planet because I allowed this collar on my dog. I had no idea that this collar was doing this to my dog because the remote didn't signal that it was doing anything and he never cried. The wound on my dogs neck from this collar is infected so badly in the course of 3 days that it smells when he walks by (why I thought he had an ear infection) I will update my review once again with pictures of the damage when my dog is finally home to deter all of you from doing this to your dog. Please do not buy this product. I am leaving my original review below so that you can see my original thoughts before all of this was brought to my attention.I live in an apartment with a 9 year old dog that has unfortunately gotten used to barking at absolutely nothing. He is one of those dogs that thinks “test barks” are great and even worse than that every time someone enters or exits their apartment he barks when he hears the doors shut. I have lived in this apartment for 1 year so imagine my stress whenever this happens! I have tried every sort of training to get him to stop and he normally responds well for about a week or so and goes back to his old ways.  I got the opportunity to test out this Petrainer Remote Training E-Collar for review and of course I couldn’t pass up this chance! This collar has worked wonders and is absolutely my favorite thing I’ve ever had the chance to review, and I’ve reviewed THOUSANDS of items, so that says a lot!What are the features?• Advanced RF 434Mhz Technology boosts a range up to 330 yards• Rechargeable and waterproof transmitter and collar receivers• Convenient and easy to read backlit LCD screen that shows the stimulation level• 4 modes; Static shock, vibration, beep, and light• 1 year free replacement warrantyMy experience with training collars:Okay, so as I said before my dog is 9 years old and has always been a very vocal dog, I’m talking barking at leaves flying in the wind, birds, squirrels, the whole nine yards. It drives everyone insane because these are things he sees multiple times a day yet he chooses to bark, nonetheless I’ve tried countless different training collars. These collars have probably cost me upwards of $1,000 in the past because I have never seen any that cost any less than $100. The training collars I’ve used in the past have been the automatic type that will deliver the vibration, shock, etc automatically without the owner of the dog having a remote. This sounds nice except for the fact that the dog has to bark at a certain level for it to register on the collar, then the collar will deliver the training. My 9 year old dog has gotten wise to this and decided that if he barks quietly nothing will happen to him, so you can see how this is frustrating because it’s still loud enough for other people to hear.My opinions:This Petrainer collar is 100 times better than any of the other pet training collars I’ve had, because the owner of the dog has a transmitter remote that they can use at their own discretion to deliver the training to the dog wearing the collar. I absolutely love this fact because not only is it great for barking dogs, but it can also be great for training your dog not to go potty in the house, not to get on furniture, really it’s great for any sort of training you can think of.The remote is wonderful as well because not only does it have two channels to control the two different collars, but it has 4 different modes of training. It includes Static shock, vibration, beep, and light, and there are different levels of static shock and vibration as well for the most stubborn of dogs!How this collar worked with my dog:I tried all of the different methods on my dog. I had tried different shock collars in the past that didn’t even phase my dog so right off the bat when I put this collar on my dog I had it on the static shock mode only at LEVEL 1, the LOWEST level available for the shock setting. My dog started barking and I pressed the button on the remote and zapped him, he yelped. I felt like the worst dog owner ever because I had never had that happen to me before my dog normally doesn’t even get phased by shock collars. I felt so bad I changed it to the beep setting. To my absolute surprise the beep setting works wonders! For whatever reason my dog despises this beep, and it’s not even loud!  I’ve tested this in every setting I get the chance to, now my dog can be in the presence of squirrels, strangers, children, anything and he doesn’t even try to bark I can’t express how surprised and happy I am. My life is so much easier having a dog that isn’t a crazy barking psycho at all hours of the day.How I use this collar:I keep my remote transmitter actually clipped to my clothing at all hours of the day when I’m home with the clip that is attached to the back. This has worked great for me because I am a firm believer that you have to stick with training, you can’t be lazy about it otherwise your dog will never learn. Honestly in the time I’ve had the collar (about 2-3 weeks) he doesn't even try to bark anymore but I still keep the remote on me at all times just in case he forgets. I also keep the remote on the charger at night so I am never without it.This Petrainer Remote Training E Collar is an absolute life saver and I would recommend it to anyone, even with the worst dog. This collar is amazing and has turned my dog from a vocal barking psycho to a very obedient dog, even just with the beep setting! For the price of this training collar, you can’t pass it up!

I love listening to music and I make it part of my daily life whenever I’m doing mundane things such as waiting in the car, jogging etc, however I have very small ears so traditional ear buds tend to hurt. I have been searching everywhere for quality over-the-ear headphones that won’t hurt and have great sound quality, and I believe I have found them with this AUDSOM Bluetooth Headphone set. The cord has also been great and hasn’t frayed or broken down in any way.My opinions:These AUSDOM Bluetooth Headphones are amazing quality for a very inexpensive price tag.  First off, these headphones are extremely comfortable to wear they have quite a bit of padding not only on the ears, but also on the band that goes over your head as well making them comfortable to wear even lying down. The fact that these headphones have a built in mic makes them versatile and easy to use with your cell phone. If you get a phone call you can answer it with ease and you don’t have to worry about switching things over. The Bluetooth functionality is nice as well and paired quickly with my Android, 4 different tablets, an iPad, and my T.V.!These headphones have superior sound quality offering rich deep bass that makes any listening just that little bit better. I would recommend these headphones to anyone looking for a nice headset at an affordable price!

I have recently been getting in to deep cleaning of my teeth and keeping that going while at home as well, so I stumbled upon this XTech Ultrasonic Toothbrush. Cooking is one of my favorite things to do, however I live alone so it is very difficult to find meat packaged perfectly for just myself. I find that I wind up wasting quite a bit because I end up cooking all of it and throwing away half before I’m able to eat it, or I keep half in the packaging and it ends up with freezer burn. With the VonShef Premium Vacuum Food Saver and Sealer System I am able to vacuum seal my unused food items and keep them stored perfectly for as long as I want to. This system is so easy to use that even a kitchen novice can use it with ease!What are the features?·  Seal food in seconds retaining it’s freshness and nutrients for longer·  Allows for both a vacuum seal, or regular seal only·  Prepare meals with a Sous Vide·  Protects food from bacteria and prevents freezer burn·  Pulse function to control vacuuming in small stages which is ideal for soft food packagesUsage tips:This VonShef Food Sealer System is a breeze to use, it isn’t difficult at all, but one word of advice to people just getting started is to take your time. This product does the job and does it well and that’s all that matters to me. I have been a sealing fool I actually went through my entire freezer and sealed products that I had in different packaging. One of the things I really enjoy is having all of your food sealed because then it looks nice and uniform in your freezer and you can actually fit more in there when you don’t have the big bulky packaging on it any longer.This VonShef Food Sealer System would be great for anyone from a single person such as me to a large family! It is my dream that within my lifetime, we will make contact with intelligent alien life.  (Or more likely, they will make contact with us.)  Sure, I’d like for them to treat us nicely and go easy on the anal probes, but all things considered, death by alien invasion wouldn’t be a bad way to go.  I’m happy to read any author’s take on what human interaction with aliens might look like, and Michel Faber presents a story that is incredibly unique.  In The Book of Strange New Things, there is no alien invasion.  Instead, when the story opens, we have already made contact with aliens on a planet we’ve named Oasis.  A  U.S. corporation has set up a settlement and and engages in trade with the aliens: our drugs for their food.  But the aliens now have a new request.  They want a Christian minister to replace the one who mysteriously disappeared.  Yes, these aliens are Christians.  Peter accepts the mission, even though it will mean leaving his wife, Bea, behind on Earth.I read this book about two weeks after Faber’s earlier book, Under the Skin.  Because of my experience with that book, I kept waiting for something “Under the Skin-ish” to happen.  (If you’ve read the book, you’ll know what I mean.  If you haven’t, I won’t spoil you.)  I labeled the book as science fiction, because with a setting on another planet populated by aliens, it seemed unavoidable.  But this story is really more about Peter’s marriage, his faith, and his desire to share his faith with the aliens, who happen to be very eager sponges.  This is one of the most religion-heavy books I’ve read, but as someone who is not at all religious, it managed to not be off-putting.But as Peter becomes more focused, and possibly obsessive, on his mission, his marriage to Bea is faltering.  Their only method of communication is via a form of email, and as Bea becomes increasingly distressed by things that are happening in her world, Peter is finding it harder to tear himself away from his alien congregation.  I found so much beauty, at least initially, in Peter’s relationships with some of the individual aliens.  They are gentle and kind, and for a minister, they are perfect pupils.  But I began to question whether Peter’s dedication to his mission had more to do with serving his congregation or with something a little less altruistic.  And even if he is not self-serving, how can I respect this man when he seems to content to sit back while his wife’s life seems to be falling apart?  Peter struggles with these questions, too, and even if he doesn’t always do the right thing, he at least has the ability to ask himself the difficult questions.I didn’t get nearly as many answers as I would have liked, but the story was written so beautifully, it was hard to mind.Note: This review is based on a finished copy provided by the publisher.

This lightweight iPhone 6 case is designed for minimal scratch protection, rather than for heavy duty protection against drops.  Unlike most cases on the market, this one is bendable.  It's made of a clear, polyurethane material, and the case can be bent into quarters, and it immediately snaps back into shape. I wasn't sure how my two cats (one short-hair and one medium-hair) would take to this brush. I had only used one of those "brush mitts," and this particular brush could not have been any more different. But after they both gave it an initial skeptical glare, they are now hooked. I thought the mitt had been doing an adequate job, but now that I see how much hair this brush removes, I know that the mitt just wasn't doing enough. The needles on the brush are quite sharp, so the first two times I used it, I applied just a tiny bit of pressure. Even then, the brush removed a great deal of hair. I've been gradually increasing the pressure (the instructions stating to watch out for redness and irritation made me cautious), and the results have been increasing, too. My cats love it, and I think I could make a coat out of the hair I've removed over the past couple of weeks.Note: I received a sample of the product in exchange for an honest review.

Even though I hate the term selfie and all of the ideas that the word connotes, this "monopod" is actually a useful product.  For people who like to take photos of themselves in the bathroom mirror to tweet and instagram around the world, they are free to carry on as usual.  But for others who, for example, are traveling and finding it necessary to stop strangers to ask, "Could you take a picture of us with these Mayan ruins/Bellagio fountains/whatever in the background," they will find this device very useful.When fully compacted, the monopod is just over 9 inches long, and it extends to about 3 feet.  It pairs with a variety of phones, so check to make sure your model is included.  The clamp holds my iPhone 5 securely, and when the pole is extended, it is easy to snap photos from the handle.Considering the size, this is a very lightweight product and it won't weigh you down while you're out traveling.  It's not something you can stick in your pocket, but a larger bag or a backpack would work great.

So, I was excited to get a chance to start drying food on my own.I did a bit of research after I received the dehydrator to understand the main differences between the two primary types of dehydrators.  (If you are already educated on this topic, skip on down to the next paragraph.)  Dehydrators typically come in one of two forms: 1) A higher-end type with a fan and a side-mounted or top-mounted heating element; or 2) a lower-end type with no fan and the heating element on the bottom.  This Homeleader dehydrator is the latter.Having no fan means that food takes much longer to dry.  I first experimented with one tray of cherry tomatoes sliced in half, and they took about 20 hours to dry. From what I researched, a fan could cut that time down to about 4-6 hours.  I've since started cutting my cherry tomatoes down to thirds and quarters, and I've got the drying time down to about about 12 hours.The other drawback I mentioned is the bottom-mounted heating element.  Food and juices will always drip to the bottom, and as a result, this base is very difficult to keep clean.  The base is not dishwasher-safe, and it can't be immersed in water, so you have to reach in to try to clean around the coils.  (The trays ARE dishwasher-safe, but because they are so large, I can only get two in my dishwasher at a time.)The dehydrator is 13 inches in diameter, and with the five trays and the lid placed on top, the entire appliance is 12.5 inches tall.  In other words, it's very large.  While you can, of course, store the base, the trays, and the lid separately, none of the pieces nest, so you don't have the opportunity to save any space.  The 13 inch diameter means that I can't store any of the pieces in my wall cabinets.  Instead, I take it apart and store the pieces in a couple of deeper base cabinetsBottom line - if you are looking for a lower-end dehydrator, this works well.  Just keep in mind what you are giving up in order to get those savings.

2.5 starsNote: I received an ARC from the publisher in exchange for an honest review.WARNING: Contains some spoilers regarding events that occurred during Mia's kidnapping.I’ve mentioned before in a couple of reviews of new adult novels how much I hate when the female main character falls in love with with a stalker-ish, obsessive dbag. The Good Girl takes it to another level by having Mia fall in love with Colin, her kidnapper who abuses her and regularly threatens to kill her. It’s made clear that this is not an example of Stockholm Syndrome, and that Mia is genuinely in love with Colin. I hate these abuser/abusee “romances,” and had I known that The Good Girl featured one, I would never have read it.I know that not every reader feels as strongly as I do about this topic, and I can set aside my feelings to appreciate the positive aspects of the story. There are three POV's and three timelines in the story, and this works. They all help to tell Mia’s story before, during, and after her kidnapping. We can never fully get into Mia’s mind, but these characters help us to chip away at Mia’s barriers.The only character I really had any sympathy for was Mia’s mother. She was a neglectful parent to her two children and the very definition of trophy wife to her obnoxious, domineering, uncaring husband. I absolutely bought that her daughter’s kidnapping transformed her and made her determined to make up for her past mistakes. She has a lot to atone for, and she begins to do so with her relentless search to find out what happened to Mia.On the other end of the spectrum is Colin, the kidnapper. Even though his actions are despicable, we are supposed to begin to care for him, just as Mia does. Sorry, but it didn’t work for me. We are giving an incredibly lame and cliched excuse for his decision to engage in kidnapping and terrorizing people. Even though he abuses Mia, we are supposed to forgive him when he begins to treat her not quite so terribly. The relationship between the two is impossible to accept, and I thought it was more than a little disgusting.The Good Girl ends on a high note, though. If you’ve heard anything about this book, you’ve heard about its ending. Yes, it was shocking (to me, anyway), and when I reflected back on the story, I think it worked.If you don’t think you’d have the same problems with Mia and Colin that I did, this is a good mystery novel to check out.

The first thing I want to mention about these great little speakers, in case anyone is concerned about the apparent length of the cords as depicted in Arctic's third pic - objects are much larger than they appear.  The cord with the 3.5 mm jack is 32 inches long, and the cord connecting the two speakers is 28 inches.I love the design and function of Arctic's products, and these speakers are no exception.  These little cubes look great on a shelf or on a desk.  I've used them with my laptop, my iPhone 5, and my iPad Air, and these speakers provide a great enhancement to the sound versus my devices' included speakers.  No, the sound is not exceptional, but with the price and portability of the speakers, you can't expect that.Finally, I love the carrying case.  As I mentioned above, the included cords are rather long, and I wouldn't want to carry these without a case.Note: I received a sample of the product in exchange for an honest review.

I have not used this type of aerator before, and while I'm not a wine connoisseur, I could definitely appreciate the enhancement in the taste of the wine this product provided.  It's very simple to use, and the instructions are detailed and include images.  The aerator comes with two rods for use with either a full bottle or a glass of wine.  Push the button, and the wine is aerated is 30 seconds.  There is a certain "elegance" to a decanter, in my opinion, but when you don't want to wait, this aerator is a great option.Note: I received a saple of the product in exchange for an honest review.

I loved the beginning of The Girl in the Well, which introduced us to Okiku,a young girl who was thrown in a well and murdered. The story is based on popular Japanese folklore, and Okiku's spirit now roams Earth, avenging the murders of other children. Okiku can see the spirits of the dead children clinging to the backs of the people who murdered them. That's quite an image.We enter the world of the living when Tarquin and his cousin, Callie, come on the scene. Tarquin is haunted by another spirit, much more malevolent than Okiku. When it becomes clear that Tark's life is in danger, Callie is determined to learn the origins of his haunting, and even Okiku takes an interest in him.As much as I enjoyed the beginning of this story, as it progressed, it became more a recitation of Japanese folklore and less of a story. It's not that it wasn't interesting, but so much information was thrown at me that it was hard to keep up.While there was a decent amount of creepy imagery, I didn't find anything frightening, and that was a disappointment.Note: I received an ARC in exchange for an honest review.

I have several sound bars in this price range, and this Mocreo is comparable in terms of sound quality, with the addition of being water-RESISTANT.  (Note that the description says waterproof, but I would not rely upon that.)  The bass, in particular, is quite strong.A lot of sound bars go for a fully monochromatic look, but I actually like that this has large, well-marked controls for volume/next and previous and the microphone on top.  There are various designs, and mine is black with red control buttons.  Pairing with my iPhone and iPad was easy, and I got a range of about 35 feet.Note: I received a sample of the product in exchange for an honest review.

I have only tested this grinder set with pepper, due to many of the reviews noting that salt causes this to rust badly.  When I first took these out of the box, I noted how sturdy this felt, despite the size, with the exception of the spring.  The spring seems a bit flimsy and liable to get bent.When I tested the plunger without pepper, it depressed easily, with very little effort.  I thought: This is going to be a breeze to use.  The first problems occurred when I tried to put the pepper in.  Because these grinders are so small, more pepper was falling into my hand than going into the grinder.  I almost think you need to use a funnel.  And then, as more peppercorns are dropped in, the grinder piece kept getting shifted to the side, and I had to pour the pepper out and start over.  After several attempts, I finally got it sufficiently full.Now, the next problem.  It's not that easy to use this with just a thumb, as shown in the pictures.  Sometimes, it works.  Other times, the grinder piece gets stuck, and I have to hold it in one hand and press down hard with my other palm.  There is no way to adjust the coarseness (this produces very fine pieces), and each push produces just a bit of pepper.These aren't ideal for me, because I like coarse pepper, and I use quite a bit of it.  But if you use just a little pepper, you will probably like the look of these grinders on your table.Note: I received a sample of the product in exchange for an honest review.

It’s impossible to read The Last Policeman and not think about what you would do in the event of an impending, doomsday-level asteroid strike on earth.  I have to admit that I find the idea exciting, in the same way that I find the ideas of a zombie apocalypse or an alien invasion exciting.  (Yeah, I’m weird like that.)  While I’ve read and watched my share of post-apocalyptic books and films, pre-apocalyptic stories seem to be a bit harder to find.  The first book that comes to mind is The Age of Miracles by Karen Thompson Walker, which is about what happens when the speed of the Earth’s rotation begins to gradually slow down.  Answer – bad things.  As for films, we have the atrocious Armageddon, the somewhat better Deep Impact,  and the amazing Melancholia, which is on Netflix, if you haven’t seen it yet.  All three of those films depict versions of what happens in the last days leading up to an asteroid strike.The Last Policeman explores this topic in more depth.  The world has about six months left, and Earth’s inhabitants, who may be the last ones left before humans go extinct, respond in very different ways.  Some flee their families to fulfill their bucket lists.  Some spend their days hoarding guns, food, and building shelters that will likely prove useless.  Some commit suicide.  Some resolve to carry on as normally as possible until the end.  This is where we find Hank Palace.Hank is a newly promoted detective.  He was promoted out of necessity, since so much of the police force has abandoned their jobs.  Police departments around the country are not very interested in investigating crimes, focusing their attention instead on maintaining order.  When Hank comes upon what looks like one of the increasingly common suicides, it’s expected that he will rubber stamp it and move on to more important things.  But Hank sees some things that don’t fit a suicide.  Against the pressure and ridicule of his colleagues, he presses forward, determined to find out what happened to this man, even as Earth’s remaining days wind down.Hank has a quiet thoughtfulness about his job.  His doggedness under any other circumstances would be admirable, but when humanity has only a few months left, I think it’s fair to ask: Does this one man’s death matter?  Perhaps even more important: Is Hank making the best use of his remaining days?  At times, Hank seems blind to the impending apocalypse.  I can kind of appreciate someone who goes about his life with a business as usual attitude, but at the same time, I can’t understand why he’s not out fulfilling his bucket list, like many of the other characters in the book.  But…even as I write that, I have to question whether the dead man deserves some sort of justice, if he was, in fact, murdered.I love the questions The Last Policeman raises.
