It was easy to pair the controller and the Ominus.  I took the instruction sheet out with me so that I had something to refer to while I was getting the hang of the controls.  I got the hang of the basics pretty easily, but then I got a little over confident.  It is easy for the Ominus to get away from you if you are not experienced.  I wound up within 10 feet of the pond in my neighborhood before it went down hard.  What happened was I let the Ominus get too high, and I got disoriented with which direction it was facing.  Everything I did seemed to send it higher and further away from me.  The only reason I still have mine is luck.  After I retrieved it, I went back to the driveway, and I was much more conservative with it until the battery ran out.  It advertises about 15 minutes, and that’s roughly what I got out of it.With all that being said, this thing is flat out fun.  I still have a long way to go to master all the controls, but it is addictive.  I have the battery charging, and I can’t wait to take it out again.  That’s right - a grown man acting like a kid again.  Your teen may love it, and they might even be a better pilot.  However, you only have to be a kid at heart to enjoy the Ominus Quadcopter.  It is a great outdoor hobby that I expect to enjoy.

I had previously tried the Vega Chocolate Cherry Almond meal replacement bars, and I was curious when I saw that they had a separate line of protein bars targeted for workout recovery.  This is another Vega product with premium ingredients at a premium price.  While there is no price currently on the Amazon product page, the go for $2.50 per bar at my local Whole Foods.  That is a pretty steep per unit price, but the difference in ingredients over competitors such as Odwalla and Clif is substantial.The taste of these is OK.  I am not a huge fan of coconut, but the flavor is not very strong compared to the chocolate.  There are also not very many pieces of coconut in a bar, and it is nothing like a Mounds candy bar in that regard.  While the taste is not my favorite, I don’t mind it.  I do like the benefits that it has to offer as a post-workout recovery snack.  I also like that it gives the benefits without any weird chemicals.This is a product for gym rats who are serious about their nutrition and are willing to pay a premium price.  If that is you, this is a good candidate for you.  Given the relatively high price, I would recommend trying to get one at a local store first to try them.

The Philips Sonicare Powerup Battery Toothbrush is an entry level offering.  I have been using the Flexcare+ model with UV sanitizer for a number of years, but I was always hesitant to travel with it.  I was worried about either losing it or damaging it in my checked luggage.  However, I didn’t have the same reservations with this toothbrush that is about 10% of the retail price of my primary toothbrush.First off, it stood up to the rigors of being in my checked bag with no issues on a recent trip.  I did separate the brush head and take out the batteries when I packed them.  Risk, however, is not the only thing that decreases with this toothbrush from the Flexcare+.  The Flexcare+ and the Powerup both have two minute cycles, but that is where the similarities stop.  The more advanced model has signals to help you spend an even amount of time in each zone of your teeth based on top/bottom and front/back.  You are on your own with the Powerup.  The Flexcare+ also has five different modes including one that is slower for targeted gum care.  The Powerup is single mode.  The Flexcare+ is rechargeable, whereas the Powerup is battery powered.  The other major difference is that the Powerup is significantly more forceful.  To compare the difference, the Flexcare+ is like a tremor that barely registers while the Powerup is the most violent earthquake known to mankind.  Some may find it too strong.  It doesn’t bother me, but it is noticeably different.In the end, the Powerup does a good job of getting my teeth clean.  It is a bare bones, entry-level model that I like to use for travel purposes.  Others who should consider this are those who are looking to step up from manual toothbrushes.  If you are hoping for something more advanced, this isn’t the toothbrush for you.  You will need to invest more money to get more features.

The Vega Chocolate Cherry Almond bars establish a new benchmark for companies like Clif and Odwalla to strive toward.  I have used similar products from the other companies based on their preference for natural and organic ingredients.  I don’t use these as meal replacement bars per se.  These are typically my mid-afternoon or after workout recovery snack.So, why does Vega raise the “bar” as it were?  While Clif and Odwalla go out of their way to use good ingredients, Vega seems to take the approach of cramming as many of these as possible into a tasty bar that is under 300 calories.  There are things in these bars (such as broccoli) that I wouldn’t touch if you cooked them and put them on my plate.  However, they are nicely masked beneath the flavors of chocolate, oats, and almonds.  The only thing some may want to consider is that the cherry flavor is not very strong.  If you are looking for a subtle hint of cherry, this is what you need.  I find it more than satisfactory.There is one catch.  Based on current prices (please verify as time goes by), the Vega product is about twice as expensive as what you get from Clif or Odwalla.  Is the higher cost justified?  If you compare the ingredients, there is a definite difference.  If you want the best ingredients, you must expect to pay more.  Your decision comes down to how much you are willing to pay for the best of the best.  Hopefully, I’ve giving you some information to help make that choice.

I have tried a number of different K-Cup coffee varieties over the last couple of years, but the Sumatra is my first from Cafejo.  I was pleased with the results from these K-Cups.  While it isn’t the “best coffee ever”, they do achieve an above average flavor.  I have had plenty of K-Cups that fail miserably; therefore, do not underestimate the importance of this.  The flavor is rich, as one would expect from a dark roast, but it is never bitter.  The word that best describes the flavor to me is balanced.  As a bit of an aside, I had written off Sumatra coffee because I thought Starbucks (brewed in store, at home, or any other format) was just plain awful.  If you have similar thoughts, you should know that the taste of this coffee has nothing in common with the Starbucks variety - at least in my opinion.The quality is there with the Cafejo Sumatra K-Cups.  If you can find these in the $0.50 to $0.60 per K-Cup range, I would rate them a definite buy.  Those who enjoy a rich yet balanced dark roasted coffee will not be disappointed.

The Bissell Bolt Ion XRT is great to have for spot duty - especially on hard surfaces.  It also has a detachable hand vacuum reminiscent of a Dust Buster.  It is very easy to setup and use.  The pieces connect without issue as expected, and it took about 2 and  hours to reach a full change as my unit arrived fully charged.I found it easy to use for touch up duty in the kitchen and dining room.  We have a buffet that sits a few inches off the ground on its feet, and the bending hinge in the XRT was handy in being able to reach under there.  Previously, we had to move the buffet to clean under it.  The EdgeReach feature is also nice for cleaning along the baseboards in the kitchen.  I also like the easy access to the speed adjustment.  I was going over one of our throw rugs that tends to slide, and I needed to lower the speed of the XRT in order to keep from moving the rug.The hand vacuum is also very nice.  It has a good crevice attachment for getting down in furniture and other narrow areas.  I was using the brush attachment on the couch cushion, and I discovered quickly that there was a lot of dog hair on there.  I had to pull the dog hair out of the brush bristles by hand.  Overall, it performed well.Cleanup is pretty easy, but I was surprised at how much dirt and gunk there was from a test drive.  I took advantage of the fact that the filter is washable, and it everything went according to plan.The Bissell XRT is a nice unit to have around the house for spot jobs, but it will not serve as your primary vacuum.  It is too small, and I don’t expect its charge would last on a house of any size.  It would be great for dorm rooms.  It serves a distinct purpose, and it does it well.  I give it two thumbs up.

The Frigidaire Professional Convection Toaster Oven is my first convection oven.  I have had a series of four-slice models from Black & Decker, but I was intrigued by the claim of oven results at near microwave speeds.  My typical uses are toasting bread and cooking frozen pizzas.As a new convection oven user, I needed guidance on how convection ovens are different.  As of today, this is not on the product page.  It is also not included in the product manual, and the Frigidaire website doesn’t know about this product yet.  I turned to Google, and I found some general guidance that convection ovens typically require reducing the cooking temperature by 10-15%.  Timing adjusts were said to require some experimenting.  In other words, get ready for some good old trial and error.For regular toaster oven users, the main difference in controls is the inclusion of convection versions of bake, broil, and reheat.  When I made my morning toast, I used the normal bake/toast setting, and things worked as expected.  When I compared it to my old toaster oven, the bread toasted faster and more evenly.  This is a larger unit, and the faster toasting is not unexpected.  For pizza time, I did use convection bake.  The package says to cook at 425 for 12 minutes.  The magic formula in this oven is 375 for about 8 minutes.  For reference, my old toaster oven took about 20 minutes at 425 for the same product.  Those are great results!  How can you argue with less than half the time at a lower temperature?Granted, my use cases are not that advanced, but this unit shows a lot of promise.  I would like to see a little more guidance from the manufacturer, but that is the only complaint that I have.  I would recommend using some low risk meals to get the hang of cooking with a convection oven.  Also, don’t forget to complete the “burn-in” step prior to use.  This thing smells awful when you burn off the dust and oil from manufacturing, storing, and shipping.

I like the Seventh Generation hand soap.  I tried the Mandarin Orange and Grapefruit variety.  As I become more conscious of the chemicals that I come in contact with, I turn to Seventh Generation to provide natural alternatives.  I have used their kitchen sprays in the past, and I have been pleased with their results their too.  I can say that their hand soap is just as reliable of a product.  The scent is not overly strong, but I it is present enough to be pleasant.  It lathers just like you would expect soap to, and there really isn’t a lot that suggests this is a different kind of product from run-of-the-mill soap.  I see this as a neutral factor, but this soap is not quite as thick as something like Softsoap.  However, I don’t think it really matters.  It is not so thin that it will run between your fingers.  I give it two thumbs up.

Dark Spies is the second novel that I’ve read in Matthew Dunn’s series featuring Will Cochrane - the elite CIA/MI6 joint operative.  I am also a fan of the Cotton Malone series and the Sigma Force novels as well.  Let me say that this is quite possible the best novel I’ve read from any of these three spy novel series.  I won’t bore you with a rehashing of the basic plot points because you can get that from the product page.  For me, it is the combination of storytelling and pacing that is almost otherworldly.  The story was compelling and intense.  I thought I had it figured out, but the resolution chapter near the end threw me a curveball that I didn’t see coming.  Cochrane is now my favorite covert operative in fiction.  He takes it in the shorts in a major way in this novel, but Dunn did something that really made him over the top sympathetic to me.  As Will is off fighter for his very existence, his neighbors who have flats in the complex with his band together to replace his fairly expensive collectables after his place is completely trashed.  You will have to read the book to fully appreciate this, but Dark Spies is written in a way that I really connected with me.  It is more that just a wanting the “good guys” to win sort of thing.  Spy thrillers don’t usually make such a deep connection no matter how compelling the story is - and this story is also compelling.  I can’t recommend Dark Spies enough.  It is in a league of its own.Overall:  A+

Having tried and returned every similar product sold on Amazon, I became discouraged.  The technology solution to do this isn't too tough, so why were companies selling products with so many issues/limitations, or flat-out didn't work.  The Lutron solution, while not perfect for absolutely all circumstances, is a product that overcomes the vast majority of conditions.  We no longer use wired wall switches, I bought extra wall-mounted remotes, placed where we desire them to be.Yes, you pay more for Lutron -- I think it's well worth it, it simply works.  Make sure your targeted lighting is fully dimmable. I've used this product on LED, compact fluorescent, and incandescent lighting.  No issues whatsoever, installation & set-up is dirt-simple. While I could nit-pick this or that, I won't.  We are fully used to them now, and the minor irritants of switch shape, tactile feel,  have faded away.  We love them. I have them all over the house.  Think of it, you can put elegant, dimmable light switches virtually anywhere you desire!
This is an elegant bowl sink.  Forget the colored glass bowl sinks, this is the one to get.  It coordinates with any color(s), is very well made, and looks clean and stylish.  Perfect!

My expectations for an under $10 iPhone case were not high.  This case exceeded them.  The hard polycarbonate inner sleeve is average for all cases. The two card slots are tight, so cards stay in place.  The magnetic clasp that holds the case closed is twice as thick as some cases for 2x+ the price.  The exterior is no too slick, and the Union Jack pattern looks great.  Durability? Time will tell...

A superb center speaker.  I won't get into all the tech stuff, I'll let others do that.  I have 6 --  5.1 set-ups in 6 locations.  I have used an excellent BIC center in each of those, but that model has been recently discontinued, sadly -- it's the best center I've heard under $200.  Well, this JBL is an equal or better replacement.  No distortion at high volumes in a big room, great range, even sound.  Superb.

I don't know about you, but most of my roses are red (and my violets are blue too).  If I wanted a pink case, I would have looked for one.  Bright flaming pink is this case... Sorry, I never got past that.  The rest of the case is average for its price range, not great, not bad.  Decent clasp, very hard inner "protective" sleeve.  It's pink, even in the trash...
The best fake camera on the market.  It looks far better than the very cheap one being sold under a dozen names on Amazon.  This one looks real!

Update  9-29-15DREEM sent me a new, revised case.  It is vastly improved over the original.  I have never had a manufacturer respond to my critique by actually changing a product -- this is quite impressive.  The new case is slightly bigger, better protecting the iPhone, since the bottom and top of the inner sleeve is wide-open.  A big improvement.  It's also slightly wider, so you can store 3 CC's in the case and still close it!The biggest improvement however is the strength of the magnet holding the phone in the case. You will have to judge for yourself how useful it is to be able to remove the inner portion to take photos, and reattach via a magnet.  This is not a big deal for me, it takes perfect photos w/o being removed.  If you do remove the phone for any reason, you must reattach it to the case dead-center to fully protect it on all 4 sides, so please be aware of this.This is a beautifully made case, with quality materials and manufacturing. I had to add some stickers to the outside leather, only because it is slick.  It's too easy to drop simply by having it slip through your fingers. It rains a lot in Hawaii, so the outside of the case can easily get wet.Why did I give it 4 instead of 5 stars?  One reason, weight.  With the necessary stronger magnet, it is a bit heavier than before.  This is not a big deal for me, but my wife noticed.  I will leave that judgement to you.  In order to get the quick attach/detach feature, you need a strong magnet, it's that simple.  If you are wondering how it will affect CC's stored in the case, so far, I have not had any issues with this, but I will report back if I do!  UPDATE: After 2 weeks, all my CC's are fine, the stronger magnet has no effect on them at all.Original review:I really hate giving one star reviews. I rarely do it.  This is a very well made case -- quality materials and construction. The magnetic closing clasp is ingenious, and works 99% of the time.If you put more than 2 plastic credit cards in it, it's borderline too thick to close.  Add some cash and it won't close.  Why they didn't make it a tad thicker is beyond me, it's a wallet case. I also can't understand why the case itself is so close to the dimensions of the iPhone. A case is supposed to protect the phone, yet this case is just barely bigger, with the top and bottom of the phone completely unprotected, due to the inner "protective" sleeve being wide-open there.  Also, the inner sleeve is rock-hard polycarbonate.  While indestructible, it absorbs little shock.  Silicone sleeves are better.This brings me to my main point.  Everybody (ok, only men, my wife clarifies), drops their phone at some point, especially if the case is semi-glossy slippery like this one.  I've dropped this one twice in a week. Both times indoors, about  5' onto a carpeted floor.  Both times, the phone popped-out.  If this happened on a sidewalk?The iPhone attaches/detaches from the case via a magnetic strip inside the back flap of the case.  Neat idea, very poorly executed.1) The magnet isn't strong enough to hold the big iPhone 6+ in it's protective case if you drop it, defeating the purpose of a protective case. I've had the phone detach a few times from the case simply by opening it!  Do they test their products in the real world?2) Since the case is only slightly bigger than the iPhone, you better put it back perfectly within the case when it detaches, (intentionally or not), or else a part of the phone is exposed, thus defeating the purpose of a protective case. There is no guide, tab, whatever, to let you know it's re-attached dead-center.I really wanted to like the this gorgeous case, but after one week, I must replace it. No doubt it will result in a broken screen, it's only a matter of time...
I love this neck stash, it's the best one I've used.  Durable, well designed, shielded.  What more could you ask for?

All in all, this is a product to fool dumb crooks only, experienced house robbers will laugh at it... Process?  What kind of a name is that? You might as well put the name Fake up there.  It's hard to remove, but it can be done with lacquer thinner.  Secondly, modern cameras have no blinking light, don't put the batteries in! The Chinese manufacturers put it there to please you, not scare crooks.  Lastly, dome cameras have dark domes so you can't see which way the camera is facing!  Duh! This fake clearly shows the lense, making it easy to avoid if you thought it was real.  You can paint the inside of the dome easily which solves that problem too.

What a strange faucet.  The color won't match anything else in the bathroom.  Antique Copper?  Brass is common, but copper?  The color isn't so overpowering that you can't work with it, but it will not truly match anything else.  My sink is white, drain satin,  counter white marble, it looks fine.  If you have an above-counter bathroom sink, this is a worthy consideration. The height is perfect, the flow, amazing.  Certainly not a water saver, it pours into the sink at an amazing rate. Our pressure is nothing special.  It's noiseier than most, but not obnoxiously so.  This is common for all Chinese-designed waterfall faucets.  Psfter's excellent designs are silent, but more than double the price, I have both.It looks great, it's easy to install, and the components seem well made.  I bought top-of-the line water hoses, but I always do that.  Gripes?  Weak instructions.  I can only guess that I installed the joystick correctly.  Occasionally, when you turn it off, the small round metal cover that hides the valve top under the joystick, won't flop back down all the way.  Not that big a deal, but annoying.  A simple tap and it goes back down. I think I can resolve it one way or another....It is a very unique faucet design.  Its not for everyone, but we like it!
You better be BIG, or these suckers will fall off you.  Holy moly....

What a fantastic execution of a badly needed invention.  If you have a walk-in glass block shower, you need of of these sturdy caddies, it's that simple.  they do not rust, wobble or shake. Well designed and built, they make all the difference!

I love these faucets, I now have 7 in two houses.  Very quiet.  The water is not aerated, so it seems little water is flowing.  It is the same amount, minus the air!  They look great, everybody asks about them.  One negative?  They are so quiet you can't  hear them if you leave the room with the water left on.  I did it once for 2 hours!  Totally my fault, I got a cell call and forgot. Don't forget, because you won't hear the flow, they are that quiet!

I would have given it 5 stars except for one reason.  As others have said, it inhales water pressure. You better have plenty.  If you do, this is a FANTASTIC shower head.  Truly like standing in warm rain.  It gobbles water too, so you better not buy one in arid locales where water is scarce or expensive!

What a great drill/driver.  All you need to know, my contractor stopped using his $200 Robyi, and started using my Rockwell during a kitchen remodel. It was lighter, easier to control the torque, had a better trigger, and lasted just as long.  It's a good thing it came with 2 batteries, which charge quickly, because it was used all day long for weeks... The included bits are a nice touch, and because they're lime green, you can find them in the remodel mess. He bought one...
They work perfectly!! I have installed 20 in ceiling fans to convert them to LED.  Perfect!

As others have said, exceptionally well-packaged, a thick, quiet, superb quality sink.  No stainless steel sink is immune from scrathes.  That needs to be thoroughly undestood.  Not one.  The best protection is a mesh grid for the bottom, which this sink includes.  It is of high quality as well.  The included template made me smile, since it was very accurate.  If you desire a 32" single bowl stainless sink, find me a better one -- an excellent sink!
Great quality and a good price!  I'm so glad Amazon sells a wide selection of supplements !
I was looking for a low-key sign to give notice I've installed a video camera on a property.  This is the best I could find. They are small but easily seen!

There are many "fake alarm" signs available.  These signs look very professional, and seem durably made, but only 5 yrs. of tropical UV will tell. If they fade, I'll simply replace them.  The best signs I've found!

Simply the best ceiling fan I've ever owned, and I have a dozen.  From the moment you unpack the Minka, you realize this will be a different experience from Hampton Bay (Home Depot), or Hunter.The design, construction and installation is a cut above, maybe 2 or 3 cuts above.  The remote is superb.  I have nothing negative to say. It's worked perfectly from minute one.  The LED light w/dimmer works well.  This is the only brand I'll buy from now on....

Simply put,  this HD works with Xbox One. No need to but the X model which is more expensive. This HD includes the USB 3.0 data cable. Simply plug it to any spare port and start transferring games into it. You can also make it the default drive for all future game installations.

The following review has been copied and pasted from my review of the AM08 fan,  because they both performed equally.I hate writing reviews like this, specially for a brand I love. I've been using Dyson vacuums for a very long time, so I had very high hopes for this air multiplier, unfortunately, it didn't perform, in fact, a $40 Lasko fan beat it.I waited for a mild hot day, so when a 90 degree day finally arrived, I was excited to test this unit and see if it was worth the price. It does move a decent amount of air, but even at its highest setting (10) it barely cooled a small room, which forced me to use the much much cheaper Lasko, which moved a lot more air with just about the same amount of noise.So besides the below than average performance, it also a bit loud and using the remote can be very tricky, since the receiver is located at the very bottom of the unit, which means, if you're in bed, chances are, you won't be able to adjust the swivel or speed without having to sit up, lean forward and point the remote to the bottom of the unit.The fan is very cool looking and a lot easier to clean, but that alone didn't justify keeping it. I tried convincing myself to keep it, but after testing it, I simply couldn't.

The review is based on Amazon's description and lack of information about what you get with this item. The car itself is awesome, but be WARNED. It DOESN'T come with ANY batteries. No Lipos or regular. You have to buy them.
Compliments my 2013 Cooper S. Not much to say really. The badge is well made, hasn't chipped or faded from exposure to the elements or road grime. No complaints.

I actually bought this grip from Japan and it is well made and durable, but I can't really comment on its performance, because like some of you, I wasn't aware of the fact that Japan has 2 versions of the New 3DS, a regular size and a XL/LL, the latter one being the only version we got in the US. So I now have a grip I can't use, but it was my fault for not paying attention to what I was buying.I hope you guys don't mind me writing a review for an item I didn't use, but I wanted to warn you all about the different sizes, etc. Hope this helps.

I have a 10yr old lab and a 4 month old German Shepherd, walking them with separate leashes was frustrating to say the least. The pup would constantly cross paths with the Lab and I would find myself in the middle of a leash cluster trying no to trip and fall.But now that I'm using this leash, I am loving my daily walks with both my girls. Each end has length adjustments, which is great for keeping the eager pup in line; when she tries to wander off, she simply can't and falls back into the walking pace of the older, leading dog.The leash is surprisingly well made, I wasn't expecting much at this price, but I was wrong, it is well stitched and composed of quality nylon. The handle/loop is padded on the inside so handling to large dogs is not a strain on you and your hands.I honestly can't find anything wrong with this product, it is exactly as described and at an incredible price.If there's something I could change, it would be to add a second handle/loop at the base, for those moments when I need to restrain my dogs firmly, which I have needed when we encounter aggressive dogs and/or people who are afraid of dogs and don't feel comfortable walking by you unless your dogs are held very close to you. I wouldn't mind paying more for a double handle version of this leash.

These fit and work perfectly with the Braava 380t. I have read some reviews stating these don't work as good as the one included with the Braava, but after daily use (for a whole month) I can't tell the difference. They perform exactly the same.

Bought this as valentine's present for my wife and she loved it. Paired with these: B002AQSSVA  you can't go wrong. They are made of high quality silver and the flowers are simply beautiful. She's gotten a lot compliments and hasn't wore anything else since I gave them to her. As always, Amazon delivered it on time and without a hitch.

If you own a Roomba sweeping robot, then there's a few things you should know about the Braava, which I didn't until I got it.First and foremost, the Braava can NOT be programmed, meaning, you have to manually set it on the floor before each use, activate the GPS cube and turn the machine on for sweeping/mopping.This isn't a bad thing, but something to keep in mind before you buy the Braava.Now, here's what you get in the package: 1 Braava unit of course, 2 attachments; one used to attach dust mop cloths and one used for wet mopping with also has a reservoir for cleaning solutions; 1 base charging station, 1 AC power adapter, 2 dust mop cloths, 1 wet mop cloth, 1 GPS cube (won't interfere with other wireless devices in the house) and 2 instructions booklets. Now the review itself...I'll be honest, I only bought this unit for its mopping ability. Since I already own a Roomba, which does an excellent job at sweeping/vacuuming my dogs fur from off the floor, I wanted the next step, which is to keep my wood floors sparkling clean.The Braava does a good job at mopping, not excellent, but good enough to make a difference. You won't see a huge difference until you start using it on a daily basis, but let me explain. Before buying it (Braava), I would let the Roomba do its thing, and I would follow (not every time) with a Swiffer wet unit or similar product, achieving a clean result. But as a pet owner, unless I did this routinely, my floors would not always look their best, I mean, I wasn't always in the mood to mop the floor, but since my Roomba is programmed to sweep/vacuum everyday at the same time, at least my floors don't have fur all over.So the Braava is now my daily mopping routine, which makes a huge difference, again, the first time it didn't seem like it did a great job, but only because I hadn't mopped the floors in a couple of days, add that to hundreds of wet, dusty paws, dripping tongues, etc, the floors needed a good rubbing. After the second day of using the Braava, I noticed a huge difference, the Braava performs great.The way it works is this: you fill the included mopping base with your choice of cleaner and warm water (you can use cold), damp the mopping cloth and attach it to the mopping base, turn the Braava and GPS cube on and an hour later your floors are clean.The way the mopping functions is quite simple. The tank/reservoir has a "wick" which gets soaked with cleaning solution and in constant contact with the mopping cloth, thus transferring a decent amount of fluid onto the floors as it mops.Now, the dry mop or dust mop, is good for well, dusting floors, so do not expect it to lift/suction crumbs, etc. Think of it as a dust mop, it will drag whatever is encounters, so if your floors have intricate corners/spots, you may not see great results. Wet mopping on the other hand, won't be affected.So after owning this unit for 1 month, I can honestly say, it is a winner, even with the lack of programmability, I am now using this on a daily basis, which gives me time to do whatever I please, I can watch TV, play video games or simply enjoy my backyard with my dogs, while my floors are being cleaned. Now if they could only invent a unit that could dust my entire house, I would be set.I hope this review helps you at least a bit. Take care.

If you're on the fence between iGotTech and the "Bug-off" brand, let me describe how they differ from each other, since I have both.They are both made of the same mesh material, durable, strong yet flexible enough for easy opening.The iGo has a better closure, since it has magnets running the entire length of the screen. The Bug-Off has 2 sets of magnets, one at the very bottom and one at the middle, which can be problematic, specially if the magnets catch at an angle, leaving a small gap, increasing the chances of bugs getting in.Installation is pretty much straight forward with both brands, easy and done within 5 minutes. The iGo comes with a roll of Velcro which has adhesive tape underneath it, so to install it, you have to glue the Velcro to your door frame, the screen also has Velcro, which then attaches to the one installed on the frame.Here's where in my opinion, the Bug-Off has the upper hand, since is uses Velcro, but only at 3 spots which are attached to both sides of the door frame, the top section uses a spring loaded rod, which does a better job at holding the screen, since it uses pressure against the door frame to stay in place, and which after months of use, has withstood the brute force of 2 large dogs. Plus, if you ever want to use the screen on a different door, you can simply retract the rod and use it on a different frame.The iGo didn't fit my 36x80 door frame, let me rephrase that, it actually fit, but would not close entirely, it wasn't wide enough, so the screen was stretched out, making it impossible to have a sealed closure.So which should you get? I say, it depends on your needs. If you are planning to use this screen on a single door without ever moving it and have no large pets, then the iGo is for you. On the other hand, if you want to occasionally use the screen on a different door and have large pets, then the Bug-Off is for you.Another point noting, iGo carries only one frame style screen, single door opening. On the other hand,  Bug-Off has different styles, including French doors (for dual or single open doors).

The new version, does not include the adapter, which means you cannot longer charge your 3DS. The older version fit the 3DS and the adapter plugged into the game pad. Now it only fits the pad. The cable serves its purpose, but there's no way of knowing if you'll get the new or old version of this cable, but for some reason the item's page mentions both without saying which you'll be getting in the mail. So if you're looking for a cable for both the pad and 3DS, buy this cable knowing you may not be able to charge the 3DS.

Just so you know, this review is mostly about the outer design (Art) and not the lighter itself, which is of great quality as any Zippo lighter.For those of you considering this lighter for its  unique art, let me warn you, this is NOT an engraved image, but a 3D decal, which means it can easily peel off and completely disappear when used every day, specially if kept inside a pocket.I couldn't tell from the pictures, which do a poor job at showing the true nature of the art. If you're looking for an engraved style such as the "Jack Daniel's" version, then look elsewhere, 'cause this isn't one.Again, the 4 star review is for the deceiving pictures of the lighter, which make the art look engraved. Zippos are great lighters, I have a few and they never fail, even in high winds. Hope this helps.

This mouse is by far the nicest looking gaming mouse I've ever owned. The construction is that of Razer's standards, same materials with a very nice finish and overall, a sturdy peripheral.What's great about this mouse is the ability to accommodate right and left handed gamers, DPI switching can be done on the fly with the 2 middle buttons, side buttons assigned to your liking.Most of you, including myself, probably bought/will buy this mouse for the mechanical adjustments that will allow you to increase the mouse length and boom. The length can only be done with the included screwdriver and the boom with a small turning knob found at the very back of the mouse, right under the palm rest. It also includes  a set of side wings, which are great for reducing pad drag. I tested this during FPS sessions and it made a huge difference.The mouse uses a single AA rechargeable battery that can only be removed by first unscrewing the length adjustment (with the included screwdriver). So, I wouldn't recommend going through the trouble of swapping batteries, specially during online sessions. SIMPLY unplug the USB cable from the receiver base and plug it into the mouse itself for charging on the fly. BUT THIS IS WHERE TROUBLE STARTS, hence the low review score.Now that I've covered the basics, let me explain to you why this beautiful beast is now on its way back to Amazon. Two words...Razer Synapse. An extremely buggy piece of software that has been nothing but problems, at least for me. This is my THIRD razer mouse, the first 2 were Mambas, Yes, I bought two, the very first version, then the latest; both quit working after about a year..from the cursor not moving to the mouse simply not charging.So the Ouroboros Elite was working fine until I had to recharge it on the fly....which went fine, I was able to continue gaming without a problem, but once I went back to wireless mode, the cursor simply stopped working; the DPI adjustment and side buttons still worked, but NOT the cursor. I tried re-pairing it with the base, but nothing. I plugged the USB into the mouse again, and it started to work....so basically, I had bought a wireless mouse that didn't want to move on wireless mode. I restarted my PC twice and shut down the software, which seemed to solve the problem. All good right? Not really, I plugged the USB directly to the mouse, once again, to test and make sure the previous issue wasn't a one-time bug, but ended up with the same problem....So, after the bad experience with BOTH my Mambas, and now with the Ouroboros, I couldn't take any chances, specially since I only had it 4 DAYS! I didn't want to end up with a pretty & useless paper weight after the 30 day return period had ended. Quite honestly, at this point, I'm not even sure if it is the software, as I stated above, or the mouse itself, but either way, I'm not risking $100 of my hard earned cash.One more thing worth mentioning and for which I have to give props to Razer, I used the "Feedback" option, which can be done from the software interface and the very next day I had a rep email me, which was great. But having sent Razer my mouse (Mamba) once before in the past, which resulted in an endless exchange of emails, ranging from my mouse never arriving, to actually arriving, but not having an RMA to having one...and 3 months later finally getting it back and still not working properly, I have decided that at this point, I am officially giving up on Razer. I've been a PC gamer since the days of MOHAA and have never had so many issues with a brand. Third time's the charm though.

This travel bag is well made, from the stitching to the quality of the materials. The speaker fist perfectly, without wiggle. It can house the speaker by itself or with the official Bose soft cover. The front compartment holds the AC plug perfectly as well, it is deep enough so the wire won't stick out, the front pocket closes with a velcro.The locking mechanism is simple, yet effective. You simply place the cord around the Bose logo metal piece and you're done. I've thrown this travel bag inside my back pack and so far, the speaker and AC have remained inside the bag.If you're on the fence between this and the cheap version not made by Bose, let me at least give you my honest opinion, in this case, the $45 is well worth it. As I mentioned above, the quality of this bag is simply outstanding.

I probably spent close to 3 days reading reviews, tech specs and overall customer satisfaction about this speaker, so when I finally took the plunge, I was extremely satisfied and still am.The amount of power this speaker outputs is simply amazing and hard to believe. You get a deep, warmth sound, punchy bass and well balanced mids and highs. I tested it with a variety of sound genres, from rap to techno to acoustics; all sound amazing. (Lee Dewyze's "Black Bird Song" from TWD sounds amazing)At $250, you get the speaker of course, wall charger, cradle and travel bag; you can charge the speaker directly with the wall charger or plug the charger into the cradle and place the speaker on it. It also has a 3.5mm jack for devices that do not support blue tooth, at the bottom of the unit, you'll find a charging connector for the cradle and micro USB port, which is meant for and only for software updates.You can pair multiple Blue-Tooth enabled devices, but in order to switch from one to the other, you have to go to the device Blue-Tooth settings and ask it to connect to the Bose.Unlike other speakers at this price range, this one lacks NFC (Near Field Communication) which allows users to simply tap the devices with each other, for instant communication. But again, I listened to other speakers at this price range (yes the Pill as well) and none had near the sound clarity, bass and power the Bose has. At max volume levels, the Bose did not distort sound at all, which is something the competitors suffer from.The build quality is as good as its sound.The shell is made of aluminum, the buttons are rubber and very responsive, underneath the unit, you'll find a rubber pad, which works as a tiny stand, but also houses the battery. The uni has its weight, but it's not too heavy and only adds to its overall sturdy feel; this unit is built well and made to last.As for battery life, I've gotten about 7.5 hours at mid to high volume levels. Charging takes about 3 hours, but as I mentioned above, the wall charger fits perfectly in the front pocket of the travel bag, so charging the speaker on the go, shouldn't be a problem.Signal range is also amazing, rated at 30 feet, I did not experience any interference, even with walls.The travel bag is simply perfect; the front pocket is meant for the wall charger and does a great job at keeping it safe. The main compartment houses the speaker, which can be stored with or without the Bose official sleeve.Nothing more to say really, trust me when I say this, you won't be disappointed with this speaker. I did hours upon hours of research, demo testing, etc., and can honestly tell you, this is probably the best speaker you'll ever own.FINAL NOTE ABOUT AUTHORIZED RE-SELLERS.Be very careful when buying Bose or any other brand for that matter. They will NOT honor any warranty, unless you purchase the item directly from them or an AUTHORIZED re-seller. I bought mine from Huppin's (fulfilled by Amazon). Huppin's and Amazon are both AUTHORIZED dealers.The speaker measures:2.25" wide2" Height7" Long (a bit over)Hope this helps.

This is probably the best software/hardware combo you'll find at this price. I installed them both and have not had any issues. The seller was great and the item arrive promptly and just as described.You pretty much get everything needed to install the drive, from screws to the SATA cable. A+

Gave this to a co-worker whom just turned 50. We all had a good laugh. Nothing more to say, the item is well made and arrived promptly. Just make sure the person who you're buying this for, does have a good sense of humor ;)~

3.5 score.I have to fair and honest about this product and though it protects your Shield, to an extend, it does have a design flaw.Firs the good;Applying it onto the screen is actually pretty easy, just like any other screen protector, align, peel off the under wrap, place on the screen as you remove the wrap.The company includes 3 "dust removers" which are basically three thin film patches that you can wrap around your finger or place on the palm of your hand to remove dust particles left behind from the initial cleaning.They also include more than a handful of post installation dust removers that are basically stickers used to lift the screen protector and slide under it to remove dust particle left behind after installation.Now the bad;This is the MAIN reason why this product does not get a 5 star rating. IT DOESN'T cover the screen completely. You pretty much have to CENTER the screen protector to get the most of it. Mine has about 3 mm of unprotected screen surface on all sides. So, you pretty much have to be careful when storing the Shield so the unprotected areas are not scratched.Also, but not such a big deal, at least not to me, the included cleaning cloth, is not an actual cloth, I'm not even sure what it is, but I decided not to use it, 'cause I had the feeling it would damage my screen, it isn't soft at all.Finally, the bubble remover is simply a thick, but not thick enough, piece of cardboard, which is pretty useless at removing bubbles, since it quickly bends out of shape. I prefer to use a credit card.Summary,At this price, this isn't a bad deal, but it isn't perfect either. The fact that it doesn't fit the Shield to its true size, is quite a disappointment. I suggest you either keep looking or be aware that this won't protect your tablet completely.

I'll keep it short. I needed more memory on my 3ds, so I got this and it works great. You'll get about 250k blocks. Simply copy the files from your current card into your pc, then transfer it to the new card. Great purchase.

Just like the title of my review says, I've had these since 2009 and haven't had a single issue with them. Sony knew they hit the ball out the park with this model and have kept them in stock. What you get is a high quality set of head phones with a very durable coiled cord and a very convenient bag that has come with me to trips around Europe and back. While they're not the best for noise canceling for when flying (not really intended to) they do make up with great sound, a punchy bass, balanced mids and highs and all without the need for an amp, but don't get me wrong, using an amp is also a great option. The specs are:Impedance : 63 ohmsDriver Unit : 40mmSensitivity (db) : 106dB/mWFrequency Response : 5Hz - 30,000HzHope this helps.

I made the huge mistake of buying a cheap $2 trowel from my local HD, of course, it literally snapped at the handle while doing some light digging.The Fiskars trowel on the other hand, is built to last. I couldn't really tell from the pictures, but once I inspected and held it, I could feel the quality and after testing it, I noticed a huge difference, the way it handles dirt/soil and the little work it takes to dig, is simply great.What I like the most is the design, the handle is a  solid metal piece, thick and extremely durable. It didn't bend while digging and it felt very comfortable. The handle is wrapped in a rubberized sleeve which happens to be very ergonomic.Nothing much to say really. This is great gardening tool that I'm sure will last.

Let me start my saying that my needs for a Sweeper as a traditional home owner, are simply and realistic.This unit has just the right amount of power to blow debris, leafs and even mulch. After mowing my lawn, I take this puppy out and have no problem sweeping clippings and other debris off my driveway and various areas around my front and back yards. Wet leaves are a bit tougher and may require you getting really close with the sweeper; if the leaves are wet and stuck to the ground, then you may have to shake them off with your foot first and then sweep them with G-Max.This tool works uses very little power from the battery, even at full blast;I have the battery powered mower which uses the same battery and even after mowing both my yards, I'm able to use the sweeper on high power without the battery dying on me.It is light, but depending on which battery is used with it, you will feel a difference in weight, but nothing that will cause fatigue.It has a power switch and dial. The power switch starts the sweeper and the dial controls the different speeds/power.The main nozzle is removable and it also comes with a removable tip, which has a low and high settings, which directs the air at a different angle for a  higher/lower air flow.Again, as a home owner, I'm pleased with my purchase. If you are looking for something basic with enough power for  house chores, then look no further, this is it. On the other hand, if you are looking for a heavy duty sweeper/blower, then go for the gas models, they have a lot of kick for heavier work loads.

Gustaf's Dutch Licorice is probably THE best licorice I've had and you won't be disappointed by its flavor, texture and overall quality. The Firm and Slightly Salted are simply amazing, and so are the regular. I'm not a big fan of the double salt, IMO the extra salt overpowers the licorice flavor too much.Why the WARNING? well, here's what happened to me (May 2014)I ordered the Slightly Salted directly from Amazon, but I got the regular non salted flavor. This item "can not be returned" to Amazon, so after a quick phone call, and thanks to a very helpful CSR, I got a replacement shipment right away, which was delivered in two days time. BUT, once I opened the box, what did I find? The non salted flavor...AGAIN. So there's definitely something wrong going on at the Amazon warehouse, since the wrong item has been sent to me twice in a row.So as a WARNING to you, and specially if you're looking for the slightly salted flavor, hold on for a while before purchasing this item, at least until Amazon sorts things out, or you'll be on the same boat as me with a LOT of licorice on your hands.

Up until a few days ago, my biggest lawn enemy was the dreadful crabgrass, hard to kill and even harder to take out from its roots. I was using the painful method, on my knees, small crowbar and depending on the size of the crabgrass and how deep its roots are, it would take me from 5 to 10 minutes to take it out... each!!So I found the Fiskars Uproot Weed and Root Remover...I don't care how long this has been around, I just know one thing...it's what I've been looking for.As I mentioned above, my main pain on my butt has always been crabgrass, reason being, my neighbor doesn't take care of his lawn, and so it is covered with them, somehow they end up on my yard and each year is the same pain for me to get rid of them...UNTIL NOW. So let me give you a simple tip for removing crabgrass (trust me, this afternoon I removed about 20 of them):You want to make sure you know where the root ball is, so spread out any actual grass around the weed and follow the weed's branches; Crabgrass is tricky, you may think you have the Fiskars lined up to the center of the weed, but you may be wrong, crabgrass tends to flatten as it grows, and so the root ball is always off from what you may perceive as the "center" of the weed; after moths of being plagued by this pain in the butt weed, I've noticed that its roots are usually spread out, so even with this wonderful tool, you'll most likely have to go in twice or even three times to remove a single crabgrass bunch. However, the younger the weed is, the less roots it has and those usually take only one time with the Fiskars, again, if you first locate the root.Of course, not everything is perfect, and here are a couple of cons about this tool:First, a mix of plastic and metal construction. I heard and felt some straining on the tool when I was removing a very mature crabgrass, but luckily, the tool did not break.Second, and this is more of a WARNING than a con. Since you are removing the weed entirely with its roots, you will leave a HOLE in the ground, more even so when removing crabgrass, since its roots are a mix of curled up hardened roots (again, depending on maturity). So be ready to fill up the holes with dirt. If you have an infestation, I suggest you get some grass seed, some soil and patch up any big holes you leave behind.Other weeds such as dandelions and leafy weeds are easily taken out without much of an impact on the ground. Needles to say, those weeds don't have a prayer...but don't get me wrong, like the title of my review says, with Crabgrass, it is trickier, but does the job.All in all, I couldn't be happier, this is a wonderful invention and has saved me the huge pain of dealing with weeds, literal pain. My back thanks you Fiskars and my neighbors even more, 'cause I don't curse anymore...if anything, they now probably think I'm nuts, since I was literally laughing as I took each weed out! ha!

The title of my review says it all. My "DT-990-Pro-250" headphones fit perfectly. I almost go the XXL, but I'm glad I didn't. There's no wiggle room for the headphones to move or pressure on them. The case includes a nice Velcro strap which does a great job at keeping the headphone cord neatly wrapped, even with the coiled cord from the DT-990-Pro-250. Inside, you'll also find a sewn-in zippered side compartment, which I'm guessing, can be used to store USB cables for amps, etc. The case also includes a nice metal snap-hook, so it can be attached to the case's built-in hand-strap for carrying on or in a backpack, etc.The case itself is very well made. Hard shell, not flimsy at all. A great purchase. I don't regret it and neither will you. Hope this helps.

I'll be honest, I had below average expectations for this tiny speaker, but any doubts and or low expectations I had, have been blown right out of the water.I have tested this speaker with the Galaxy Note 3 and iPhone 5s and I must say, I am impressed. This has balanced highs and lows. At full volume, I didn't hear any distortion, music sounded just as good.The speaker opens with a counter clock-wise motion and closes the opposite way. It has 3 buttons (internal), volumex2 and power.It has two ports, both 3.5mm, one used for recharging the speaker and one for connecting other ZX100 units for a fuller, louder sound. It has a 5" cord with a 3.5mm connection, which is the standard for mobile devices. The cord itself rests under the speaker, inside a groove, which holds it tightly.It includes a carrying pouch.This is NOT a blue tooth speaker. It MUST be physically connected to your device at all times.In conclusion, I don't regret this purchase, it is a great little speaker with plenty of bass, highs, mids and without distortion.

I got this case for my wife's new iPhone 5s and so far she loves it. She's very picky about this sort of things, and her NOT complaining about it, is a great sign.She's told me so far the case holds her phone all day long, while holding it to view emails, in her purse, bag, etc. Placing and removing the phone from/into the case is very easy and stays in place. The credit card pockets are also a huge hit with my wife, she loves having everything in one location. The magnetic flap hold the case closed and so far it hasn't failed. The included stylus is not the greatest, but I wasn't expecting it to be anyway. The wrist strap is well made, holds the case and hasn't failed either. Something you should be aware of, the case is not made of real leather, it feels more like fake leather, but it has strong stitching and does not feel cheap at all.I bought this case directly from Pandamimi-The Great Case Company, here at Amazon, and even though shipping did not qualify for Prime, I had the case at my door step within 7 days. Great seller, fast shipping and brand new item.

Bought it for the PS4 to charge the controller and it works perfectly. At 10 feet, this cable provides more than enough room to comfortably charge your PS4 controller while playing on the couch. The rate of which it charges the controller is exactly the same as the stock PS4 cable. It fits into the controller without any wiggle room, I have accidentally yanked on it, and not once has it come off.I haven't tested it with other devices, but I doubt it won't perform as good as it does with my PS4.

These are well made, from the drivers housing to the cable, I have no complaints, BUT the fit isn't exactly for active sports such as mountain biking or running. I tested these puppies while biking on pavement, and they performed poorly, they kept slipping out of my ears. While on a trail, the result was even worse. I had to remove them all together. I think the mixture of sweat and vibrations is why these could not stay in place. I followed the instructions, tried different shapes with the memory wire, but none was able to hold them in place while in motion. Of course, if you stand still, they do hold on, but that defeats the purpose.As for sound, well, sadly, they don't sound great either. They sound like their price, cheap. Muddy highs, decent mids, but distorted bass and/or lacking, depending on the genre.After using these, I gave them away. I tested and bought these instead: Bose MIE2 Mobile Headset  which work better than any in-ear headphones I've used. They fit inside the ear bowl and sound AMAZING, but of course, cost more than 5 times than the Sport-Fi M6.

I'm not a contractor, I'm simply a home owner who needs an affordable, reliable tool to use from time to time when DIY projects come along. The JS515 fits the bill and more. For starters, this saw is well built; sturdy plastic contruction with a metal plate. It also has a built-in, magnetized blade compartment that truly comes in handy when doing projects. It accepts T & U Shank blades and has a dust blower out the back. It includes one T-shank blade.If you're thinking about this and an ORBITAL jigsaw, let me clarify something. If you are not a professional contractor or won't be cutting a LOT of wood, you DO NOT need an orbital saw. The orbital is meant for quick, NOT so clean cuts, meant for heavy volume.Here's another tip, the blade you see pictured, is a T-Shank blade, so try to buy T-Shank blades and DO NOT buy the one suggested by Amazon ( Black & Decker 75-626 Assorted Jigsaw Blades Set, Wood and Metal, 24-Pack )...those are U shank blades and so ARE SHORTER than the one included with this jigsaw. I made the mistake of buying them and ended up with blades that are almost an inch shorter than T-shank, which limits what you can and can not cut depending on thickness.BUY THESE instead: Bosch T10CHC 10 Piece Bosch Shank Jigsaw Blade Set With Pouch These come with a nice little nylon flat pouch and do a great job. Plus they fit exactly as the one pictured with the jigsaw.

I couldn't give this product a 5 star review, even if it is sturdy, but let me explain why.First, the good. The unit is well built, but to a degree (but more on that later). Setting up didnt' take long and after it was all put together, I didn't notice any wobble or loose ends.The coat hooks really compliment the overall look and give it a good finish.I calculate the weight to be around 50lbs.Now, here's what I didn't like about this unit.First, and I'm sure at this price it is a given, this piece is not made out of solid wood, it is compacted saw dust.Second, you will need to install it on at least 3 studs, due to its weight.This entire piece slides into a back piece (the one attached to the studs), but this back plate doesn't  include the hardware to hang it.So, you'll need to buy anchoring crews. NOT plastic or butterfly anchors. You need 2 1/2" anchor screws. I don't think Amazon sells that size screws, but you can check your local hardware store. Look for " The Hillman Group Wall Dog", which has a capacity of 250lbs (ON SOLID WOOD), you will also need a 3/16 wood drill bit.I also noticed that the back plate was not leveled, whoever cut it, did not do a straight cut (a few mm, but noticeable when checking with a level).All in all. The unit  looks great, but I wish they had included the hardware to mount it. After all, I was able to buy a 25pk of Wall Dogs for about $7 locally. Good luck.

Very few comics can grab my attention and keep glued to its pages and Hush managed to do so. You'll be getting into a great tale, perfectly written and illustrated. A Great twist will make your head spin, but will wrap it up nicely. This will be one of the best you've read. Dark, classic Batman.As for the quality of the Kindle version, it reads perfectly with a zoom in option for areas where the print is too small, which occurs mostly at spreads. But don't be worried, the Kindle team did a great job at porting this great book into a digital format.

UPDATE #2: [June 07/2013], after following the suggestions from the Asus tech, I put the router through some tests while trying different channels, but unfortunately, the results were the same; random speed drops; this seemed to be more of an issue when more than one device was connected on either channel. As I stated before, I see the speeds go from 65mbps to below 10mbps. The most drastic drop occurs in the 5GHz, where I can reach speeds of up to (on my alienware laptop) 207mbps to a sudden drop to 5mbps. Also, I noticed that the unit runs very hot, I know I said this before, but this time, after carefully inspecting the router, I noticed the ports were hot enough to burn one's finger.I'm not sure if I got a lemon, but this unit, together with the upgraded antennas that I bought, will go back to Amazon, I will try the non AC unit, since I've heard it performs a lot better than this.UPDATE: TODAY [June 05/2013] I also tried changing the channel, as suggested by the ASUS rep., so I'll run some tests and will update again with the results. I should mention though, I have tried changing channels before and had mixed results. Still, I'll run tests and update again.ORIGINAL REVIEW:I've had this router for about 3 weeks now and so far it has performed below average.Setting up the router is actually quite easy and the GUI interface is nice and easy to navigate, plus it has a lot of features that other routers I've owned, didn't have.But that's about all the good I can speak of about this router.It's signal is the worst I've seen. I live in a small 1000sqf home and this router fails to cover it, unless there's a straight line of sight between the router and the devices. At times the router's signal will simply drop for no reason, so I will see my connection speed at 65 mbps, then it drops to below 10 mbps. That's with the 2.4GHz, the 5GHz is even worse, but that's kind of expected with the 5GHz, since it is known for that, regardless of the brand of the router.I even bought, not ONE, BUT THREE Asus antennas (Asus WL-ANT-157 Antenna ), thinking it would solve my problem, but that didn't help at all. So, if you think the $25 antennas will help, let me tell you, they won't.I also tried changing the bandwith but no dice. I even bought a floating shelf for the router alone, so it would be higher, out of other frequencies, etc, but that also didn't help.At this point, I have two options, return the router and get the previous non AC model, or forget Asus all together. Any suggestions are welcome.I don't mean to put Asus down, I have other Asus products, mainly MBs, which work great, so I was expecting the same from this, but I've been sadly disappointed.Note: this router runs EXTREMELY HOT.Note 2: I'm currently using these cables: Tripp Lite N201-020-BK Cat6 Gigabit Black Snagless Molded Patch Cable RJ45M/M - 20 feet. CAT6 has a wider margin for signal strength over long distances and should be considered (and I strongly recommend), specially when positioning your router or any other device through long distances. The above link is for a 20 footer, but there's different lengths and ALL at a great price and awesome quality. None of that cheap crap that ships with this router or any other router for that matter.

I'm writing this review using the AmazonBasics Bluetooth Keyboard on my Kindle Fire HD.So far, this keyboard has exceeded my expectations; I was afraid that writing with it would somehow be cumbersome, but even with my big hands and chubby fingers, I'm able to write without much of an effort. The keys are spaced perfectly and are not flush, which in my opinion is what makes typing so easy.The keyboard is light, weighing mere ounces and compact enough to carry in my hand with my Kindle.I have not used it with any other android devices yet, but for those of you, whom own a Kindle Fire HD, this thing will be perfect. It has a "Home" icon that will take you back to your main Kindle screen, where you can navigate icons and options with the keyboard arrows. It also has a "Menu" icon to quickly access settings on your web browser. A search icon is also included and a "back" button to go back to the previous page. It also has volume buttons for when watching movies or listening to music.Pairing the keyboard to your kindle or other android device is very simple; the instructions are clear and easy to follow and I was able to pair it to my HD in just a few seconds. Which brings my next point, the range and connectivity are spot-on, and I have not encounter any issues.The keyboard measures:Just under 10.5" long, 4.5" wide and about 0.5" at it tallest point, since it sits at an angle for better, more comfortable typing.All in all, I'm extremely happy with this product, the pop up keyboard no longer appears on my screen when I'm searching or typing, giving me a full view of my browser and other applications.Travel Stand: simply put, sturdy, well made and snaps close. The Kindle fits perfectly on its own AND also with the official Amazon Kindle HD case Amazon Kindle Fire HD 8.9" Standing Leather Case, Onyx Black (will only fit Kindle Fire HD 8.9")

The title of the review pretty much says it all. The figure is great, very detailed and stable, but I had a less than satisfactory experience with the seller; the figure arrived OPENED, so no chance to keep it as a true collectible. I decided to keep it, because it was the last one being full-filled by Amazon and being a Prime member, I get free two day shipping.I still think the item is deserves a 5 star rating, the seller on the other hand, owes me a few stars.

I'll be honest, I wasn't expecting such good quality for such a low priced product, but any doubts I ever had, have been put to rest.The wallet, as described on the item's page, is a tri-fold wallet with 4 different compartments. 2 side, 1 middle and one for bills, PLUS the ID plastic holder.At first, the wallet feels stiff, so you'll need to break the leather in for more than a few days, before it gets nice and soft.It has single stitching, but it is very well stitched, so I can't see it falling apart.The wallet measures:When closed=3.25" long x 4.25" tall.When open= 9.25" long x 4.25" tall.The chain (by itself) measures 13.5" long, but with the leather strap 17".The leather strap itself measures 0.75" at its narrowest point and 1.25" at its widest and it's 3.5" long.This wallet does have a couple of cons:One of the compartments, the one where the top snaps are located, is shorter than the rest, due to snaps, which makes credit cards and such, stick out, but not by much, less than .25" compared to the opposite side.Also, the metal piece used to attach the chain to the leather strap has some nasty edges, that I recommend filling down with a dremmel or any metal file.Other than that, this wallet is top quality, well built and made to last. Even with those minor cons.

I use this stand for my TB X400 headset and couldn't ask for more. The stand's build is solid ands stable. I have not had my headset drop or slip off the unit. I also tested it using a pair of Sony MDR-V6 headset with the same great results.All in all, for $20, you get a high quality product that you won't regret buying.

I've been testing this unit for the past week, putting it through numerous test, but unfortunately, it didn't perform as I had expected.Let me start by mentioning the pros of this unit:First and foremost, customer service, I contacted them once and I was given top notch service and the staff was knowledgeable of the unit.The unit can be used as a bridge and as an extender at the same time, in my case, I was able to use it to extend my wifi signal and hard wire (plug) a Denon 1912 receiver at the same time.The touchscreen of course, a huge plus that makes configuration easy and pain free.Small footprint.But here are some facts that you should take into consideration before you buy this unit:No gigabit ports. The Almond has megabit ports and so speeds are bellow today's standards, even Netgear's cheap routers have gigabit ports.No dual chanel.When in range extender mode, you can't change channels, which can be problematic in areas where there are a lot of wifi signals and the speeds will not go above 65mbps when two or more units are receiving its signal. Also, while in extender mode, most of the units functions are not available.I also noticed its signal drop in range while in router mode, at times I would only get 1 bar and then full, back and forth.So after I tested this unit in a small house (about 1000sqf) with mixed results, I decided to return it, because it simply did not perform as promised.I suggest you wait for Securifi's Almond+Hope this helps.

I first heard this song while watching the end of Crazy Stupid Love, I liked the tempo and the artist's voice.It wasn't until a couple of days later that I was driving to work, when I had the chance to truly and carefuly "listen" to this song. The lyrics are like no other I've heard, at least in a while; they connected with me and may with some of you. They talk about things so real and so possible (some already lived by me) that it was chilling.A beautiful, meaningful song that you should not pass.

I jumped at the chance to review this item when a sample was offered for a fair evaluation.  My wife just loves things like this.  I guess it's a holdover from the old disco days.  But this really is a party in your hand.  Music and lights that you can use for virtually any occasion.  First  off the unit is surprisingly robust and well made for its small size. It's profile is: 5.5 x 4.5 x 4.5 inches and weighs just less than a pound.  You might not expect quality sound and lighting out of such a small package but the Erilgpowht really delivers!You can use it to get FM radio or connect your phone or MP3 player to play music stored on your device or from services like Pandora.  Like some of the other reviews I found the FM radio transmissions to be a little inconsistent.  Definitely worked better outside than inside.  But honestly this is something that I play my Pandora on.  The sound is good.  Not great but Good.  I mean for $20 you are not expecting Bose quality sound but this does out perform other more expensive blue-tooth speakers I have tried out.  Not the deepest bass...It won't rock your bones but it's fine for smaller gatherings.The LED lights combined with the rotating quality as well as the many faceted clear cover created a dazzling display of lights to let you put on your own disco light display or to set the right mood for specific parties like Christmas.  It can play for about 3 - 5 hours on a full charge which is OK but nothing to write home about.  But for $20 you really can't go wrong with this item.

Wait...what is this?  When I was expecting a lap top cooling pad i was naturally expecting to get the typical lap-top sized pad that your laptop rests on top of and cools with a couple of fans.  What is this thing?  It almost looks like some sort of external backup drive.  But Ahhh...it is not.  In reality this is the laptop cooling pad.  In fact this device from Opolar should not even be called a pad because it really isn't and they is what throws people off.  This device is only about 2" x 3" and attaches to your laptop via a USB cable.  you can set the item where ever your laptops vents are located...either side or rear.  It attaches fairly securely to the vent as long as your laptop is sitting on a table or desk.  It's not going to work all too well if you are literally using it on your lap where the surface is uneven.  if you move the laptop you have to reposition the cooler.What is does is attach to the vent and literally pulls the warm air out of your laptop.  Its claims are that it can cool your laptop anywhere from 10 to 40 degrees lower within just a minute.  I had nothing to measure my laptops internal temperature but i definitely noticed a difference.  The fan speed is adjustable and runs quietly although my traditional lap top pad is actually a little more quiet than this but not a big deal.  if you don;t like the regular pads because of their bulkiness, the Opoloar is definitely a viable option and is much more easy to transport since it can fit into a pocket of your laptop bag.I was provided a sample for a fair and honest review.

A Stuffed Snake!  well hey who can't love plush animals, right?  Sure you have your teddy bears and your puppies and things like that...but how about a stuffed plush snake.  this is made by the Peterpan shop and is perfect for young kids who think just a bit outside the box or even for a person who loves snakes.  The snake is 60" from end to end but what I love is the fact that you can coil it up and sit him on a bed or the sofa.  He sits in his coil and his head rises several feet above the center with his crazy eyes and forked tongue coming out of his mouth.The item seems to be quite durable to stand up to the kind of play abuse a young child will give it.  I love the bright green colors and spots.  Kind of reminds me of the snake from Disney's Jungle Book cartoon.  I actually got this guy and gave it to my 3 year old nephew.  He thought it was very funny.  quite a nice item.  Maybe a bit on the pricey side but its unique!

I am not sure if the peppermill craze is what it was 10 or 15 years ago but it is still a nice item to have around the house for fresh meals.  I love to use a variety mix of peppercorns and that is what I used my mill for as opposed to just standard black peppercorns.  I really love the stainless steel construction of this unit and its look. It looks like a very highly priced item but at around $25 it is quite reasonable think.  The unit operates on four AA batteries so you know it is fairly powerful for a pepper grinder.The mill is adjustable to get the courseness that you want.  Just push the button on tom and grind away! I found that it works quite well and there was no sticking of the grinding gears.  It really worked well!  The item is easy to take apart to clean and to change out the batteries.  The glass portion is made of acrylic shatter proof glass making this unit quite tough and durable. The grinding gears are made of ceramic and do a great job and will not rust.  I have ceramic knives that I love. iKoo also provides a lifetime warranty so that is another strong selling point to this item.Great item.  Must have for any kitchen.  Sample provided for a fair review

I only find that i need a meat thermometer maybe a half dozen times a year but they are always still nice to have.  fore years I have relied on the cheap manual ones that you cook with your meat or put in when you want to check.  but those seem to have a short life when exposed to heat so given the opportunity to try out this one I decided why not.  The probe itself is about 6" long so you can get it down inside the meat such as in the thick part of the thigh of a turkey.  Thanksgiving is coming up.The probe is attached to a steel braided wire that is 38" long and goes into the digital display readout.  This means you can monitor the temperature of your foot by running the thin wire outside of your stove and looking at the display without ever having to open the oven and loose the heat.  now that is very cool.  This is designed only to measure the temp of food, not the oven temperature but has a range from 32 degrees all the way to nearly 500 degrees so that is very impressive.  Especially helpful is that you can program the unit to send out an alert once the desired temperature is reached.  I tried this out and also tested against an old manual meat thermometer and found the accuracy just about right on...within a few degrees.  I really like this item.  every home cook needs to have this in their kitchen

I've noticed that my doctors and hospitals have been going back to the old manual blood pressure testers as opposed to the electronic ones.  when i inquired they said they felt them more accurate.  So I was unsure about testing this one out.  Luckily my sister in law is a nurse so when she came over recently i had her bring her manual gauge to test both side by side.  Not only on me, but my wife, kids and a few other people there.  Of course blood pressure can change within just a couple of minutes but I found that the LotFancy tester was surprisingly accurate.  the differences were merely about +/- 3 to 4 each time.  and we probably tried it out at least a dozen times and hours apart.  The pulse meter was also accurate.It runs on AA batteries but can run on DC power but you will need to supply your own adapter as it does not come with one.  the meter is comfortable to use and comes with easy to use instructional manual.  The unit comes with some neat little memory features although to be honest I have not toyed with any of those as of yet.  We all have pretty good blood pressures in our household but it is still a nice thing to have around and check occasionally.  A sample was provided for my review

I do most of my gaming on consoles as opposed to a PC but occasionally I will play a game that might not be available on consoles. this is a fantastic gaming mouse. Now understand I am not an expert at these types of peripherals but I know what I like and what works. First off the mouse is good sized. Regular mice are too small for intense gaming. However the mouse can even remember your hand. It features a Built-in memory storage chip, with a memory function while powered off and even permanent memory. The unit is adjustable and can be programmed to remember your particular hand fit and weight for optimal usage.The unit has multiple lighting functions providing 13 different types of colors and lighting styles for ultimate customization. furthermore it comes with buttons what allow you to program various functions such as play, pause, cut, paste. you can even program your own macros. and of course you can adjust the pointer acceleration and double clicking speed. I found that the mouse moves extremely smooth and easy giving you a comfortable and precision gaming device. It has a thumb-controlled control for fast scrolling which I just love. Hey even if you are not an avid computer gamer this mouse will still beat the heck out of your everyday ordinary mouse. the smooth rugger outer layer of the mouse makes it easy to grip.Maybe the only thing that could have been added would have been that it can recharge via USB but other than that this is a great item. Must have for gamers!

Washcloths are generally not an item you put a whole lot of thought when buying.  I suppose you find something to match your bathroom colors and then you buy them.  But trust me when I say these washcloths will change the way you think about such an everyday, mundane item.  These washcloths are made from 100% bamboo.  I know what you are thinking...bamboo is not known for being soft and pleasant to the touch.  well I don;t know how these do it but these washcloths are super soft.  They remind me a bit of the kind of soft cloths that you would use when washing your car.  They are absolutely incredible!  And being made of bamboo means they are eco-friendly.Despite the fact that they seem thin and don't have the sort of shag that premium wash cloths have these things are incredibly absorbent.  You really will not believe the amount of moisture that these things can absorb.  While these are great for everyday use, the makers have desinged them specifically for babies.  they are completely Hypoallergenic and contain no dyes or chemicals making them safe for use on your baby.
